In large skillet over medium heat, cook bratwursts until no longer pink. Drain. Add onion, garlic, and seasonings. Cook until onion is clear. Add tomatoes and picante. Simmer for 10 minutes. Drain spaghetti and add to mixture. Cook until heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve on plates.

Beat 1 egg in a shallow dish. Place flour in another shallow dish. Combine 1/4 cup milk and 1/2 cup of the breadcrumbs in a third shallow dish. Cut chicken into 4 equal pieces. Dip each piece of chicken first in flour, then in egg and then in bread crumb mixture. Place in a large skillet coated with vegetable oil. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Arrange in a greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Pour 1-1/2 cups of the spaghetti sauce over chicken. Layer with provolone and remaining bread crumb mixture. Top with remaining spaghetti sauce and Parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Season chicken with soy sauce and crushed red pepper flakes. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until browned, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer to a 6-quart slow cooker. Stir together pineapple juice, vinegar, ginger and garlic and pour over chicken. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours. Serve over rice.

Combine hominy and sour cream in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until hominy and sour cream are well mixed and heated through. In another saucepan saute sweet red pepper, green chilies and onion in oil until tender-crispstir in salt and pepper. Stir in chilies and onion mixture and cheese to hominy mixture in saucepan. Transfer mixture to a baking dishsprinkle with toppings and bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Serve hot as a vegetable side dish or appetizer. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place fruit in a 8-inch pie dish. In a medium bowl, beat together eggs, milk, flour, sugar and vanilla extract. Beat well. Stir in the rum. Pour batter over fruit. Bake for 40 minutes or until custard is set.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Season cod with salt and pepper. Beat 1 egg and 2 cups flour together in shallow bowl or pie plate. Dip each cod fillet into egg mixturedredge in panko breadcrumbs, tossing to coat. Spray baking sheet lightly with cooking spray. Arrange coated cod on baking sheetbake in preheated oven until fish is just opaque in center when tested with a knife (about 20 minutes). Remove from oventop each fillet with 1 teaspoon parsley and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 450f. Wash the shrimp and pat dry with paper towels. Place the shrimp on a cookie sheet and sprinkle with a little sea salt and pepper. Roast for 5-7 minutes, turning once. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the juice of 1/2 orange with the zest of the orange and the rosemary. Just before the shrimp are done cooking, pour the marinade over the shrimp and place back into the oven until the shrimp are done. The shrimp will be cooked through and just slightly charred on the outside. Serve hot with a green salad.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Butter a 2-quart casserole dish. Cut apples into 1-inch chunks and toss with sultanas. Melt butter in a large saute pan and add apples. Stir and cook over medium heat until apples start to soften-about 10 minutes. Stir in brown sugar and nutmeg. Cook until sugar melts and apples start to caramelize-about 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Scrape mixture into prepared casserole dish. Bake 20 to 30 minutes until apples are bubbly and apples are slightly soft. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.
In a small saucepan, heat the water, cocoa powder, stevia and vanilla for 5 minutes. Stir occasionally. Remove from heat and cool. Store in refrigerator.
Combine yogurt with egg white and cornstarch. Beat well with an electric beater. Stir in salt. Refrigerate for at least an hour. Serve with fruit.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Mix together milk, eggs, sugar, vanilla extract and salt. Combine dry ingredients. Slowly add dry ingredients to milk mixture. Spread into greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 35-40 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Fold in nuts. Spread over top of sweet potato mixture. Bake for 5 minutes more. Cool and serve.

In a large skillet, heat 2 teaspoons oil. Add chicken and cook over medium-high heat 3 minutes on each side or until done. Remove chicken from skillet. Add remaining 2 teaspoons oil and vegetables. Cook and stir 3 minutes. Stir in tapioca and chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Add marmalade and teriyaki sauce. Add chicken and ginger. Cook and stir 2 minutes or until heated through. Yield 4 servings.

In a large saucepan combine rice, water, orange peel, and salt. Bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 40 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in cranberry saucelet stand 15 minutes. In a small saucepan whisk together cornstarch and lemon juice. Stir into cranberry sauce mixturebring to boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. In a small bowl combine sugar, cornstarch and lemon juice until smoothstir into hot cranberry sauce mixture. Bring to boilcook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in orange sectionscook for 2 minutes or until orange sections are heated through. Spoon rice mixture into an ungreased 1-1/2 quart casserole dishtop with cranberry sauce mixture. Chill for 3 hours or until ready to serve. Serve with lettuce leaves for wraps.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Rub chops with 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce. Bake 30 minutes in a baking pan sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Remove from oven. In a saucepan, heat soup over medium heat. Add vinegar, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, and 1 teaspoon water. Stir. Pour over chops. Bake 10 minutes more. Serve with pasta salad.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Combine mayonnaise and Parmesan cheese in a bowl. Spread mayonnaise mixture evenly onto one side of salmon fillets. Sprinkle with green onions. Bake in preheated oven until fish is cooked through and firm, about 12 minutes. Remove fish from oven and drizzle with white wine Worcestershire sauceserve immediately.

Bring broth to boiling in medium saucepan. Add egg. Stirring constantly, cook until mixture is thick and bubbly. Add corn, flour, and salt. Cook over low heat 5 minutes or until mixture is thick. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Remove stems from mushrooms. Place mushrooms in a single layer on a baking sheet. Brush caps of mushrooms with olive oil. Bake caps for 20 minutes or until softened. Remove from oven. Place caps of mushrooms on a flat surface. Top each cap with a small amount of gouda cheese. Press a piece of bologna or turkey on top of each cap. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese has melted. Remove from oven. Slice bologna or turkey on bun. Spread light mayo on bottom of bun. Add a lettuce leaf. Add portabella burger. Top with aioli. Serve with mustard on side.

In a large bowl, mix together the couscous, chicken and snow peas. In a small bowl, mix together the orange juice and zest, vinegar and olive oil. Pour over the couscous and toss well. Toss in the green onions and almonds. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 24 hours. Makes 4 servings.

Cook onions in butter in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Cook and stir for about 3 minutes. Stir in flour. Cook for about 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Gradually stir in broth. Add milk, velveeta cheese, broccoli. Cook over low heat until velveeta is almost completely melted. Stir in black pepper. Serve hot. Serves 6.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, cook beef until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in picante sauce and beansbring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until beans are heated through, about 5 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, chili powder and garlic until well blended. Remove skillet from heat and stir in cranberry sauce. Serve with toppings and garnish with sour cream and sprinkle with chives if desired.

In small bowl, stir together cream cheese, milk, mayonnaise, mustard, worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper until smooth. Spoon into a 1-quart bowl or serving dish. Garnish with hard-boiled eggs, sweet peppers and chives. Serve with crackers or vegetable sticks for dipping.

Heat olive oil in a large ovenproof non-stick pan. Add the eggs and break them up. Stir in the black olives, parsley, caraway seed, cumin and seasonings. Cook for 2 minutes. Sprinkle the omelette with paprika. Turn the heat off. Place in oven for 2 minutes to finish cooking. Serve hot with freshly made bread.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic, basil, parsley, oats, TVP, peppers and onions. Saute 5 minutes. Cool slightly. Combine beef with vegetable mixture and shape into 4 patties. Coat patties evenly with ketchup. Place on a baking sheet and bake 20 minutes. Serve on whole wheat buns with lettuce, tomato and ketchup.

Combine onion and broth in 12-inch skillet. Cover. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir in sherry, nutmeg, cayenne. Cover. Reduce heat to lowsimmer 10 minutes. Add chicken. Cover. Cook 15 minutes or until chicken is done. Remove chicken from skillet. Stir in milk. Cook until thickened. Stir in flour. Cook over low heat until thick. Stir in parsley. Spoon over chicken. Yields 4 servings.

In a bowl mix beef mince, onions, garlic, carrots and tomato sauce until combined. Add the plum sauce and vegemite, egg and bread crumbs. Shape into loaf and place in a greased baking pan. Top with cheddar cheese slices and bake for 45 minutes at 200 c / 390 f. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Combine 1 1/2 cups fresh fruit and 2/3 cup low-fat vanilla yogurt in a medium bowl and stir to blend well. Fold in 1/4 cup part-skim ricotta cheese and 2 tbsp brown sugar. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or up to 2 days. Before serving, sprinkle fruit with 1 tbsp brown sugar and drizzle with 1/2 tsp water and heat for 1 minute or until bubbling. Serve over fruit. Serves 4-6.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add garlic and cook one minute. Stir in curry powder and cook 1 minute. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 2 minutes. Stir in mango chutney and simmer 1 minute. Serve over rice.
Heat rice and soymilk in a large saucepan. Stir in sugar, vanilla and cinnamon. Cook until thick. Stir in egg and return to heat. Cook till custard thickens. Remove from heat and serve.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown ground beef and onion. Drain. Stir in spaghetti sauce. In an 8 x 8 baking dish, spread 1/2 of the beef mixture. Top with 3 crescent rolls. Spread with 1 cup sour cream and sprinkle with 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese. Repeat. Bake at 375f for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese and parmesan. Bake 5 more minutes. Serve with more sour cream.

Pour 1 cup vegetable oil into a large heavy pot. Heat over medium-high heat to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine the garlic salt and chili powder. Dip the chicken in the oil and then into the seasoning. Place the chicken in the hot oil. Cook for 3 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy. Combine the lime juice and lemon juice. Dip the chicken in the juices and serve. Serve with jalapeno jelly on the side for dipping.

In saucepan over low heat, combine pumpkin, spice, milk and sugar. Stir until well blended. Beat eggs until fluffy. Gradually add egg mixture to pumpkin mixture. Stir well. Add cake mix. Stir until well blended. Spoon mixture into a greased 9-inch square baking pan. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake at 350 degrees until browned. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to broil. In small bowl, combine all dry mix ingredients. Stir in lemon juice and oil. Place fish fillets in shallow pan and pour dressing over each fillet. Baste fish with dressing and broil about 4 inches from heat until fish flakes easily. Serves 4.

Beat the egg whites and lemon juice until frothy. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff but not dry. Fold in lemon peel and cream cheese. Spread over warm cake or toast. Broil until lightly browned and bubbly. Makes 2 servings.

Sift all dry ingredients together in a large mixing bowl. Make a well in the center and add all of the liquid ingredients except for the lolly pops. Using a whisk combine the dry ingredients with the liquid until you have a smooth batter. You will probably need to add more milk as the batter is a little thick to begin with. Heat up a crepe pan or use a lightly oiled skillet. Pour in about a 1/4 cup of batter and swirl the pan until the bottom is covered. Cook for about 1 minute until the bottom is firm. Then flip the crepe over and cook for another minute or until golden brown. Repeat the process until all of the batter has been used up. Then take the lolly pops and dip them in the batter to cover them and place them on a plate or in a dish. When all of the crepes have been made and the lolly pops have been dipped into the batter place them in the fridge for an hour to set up. Then serve them as finger foods or use them as decorations for cakes or cupcakes.
Muddle lime wedges and mint leaves together in a glass. Add white rum and HPnotiQ liqueur. Top with ice. Stir and enjoy.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Cook hash browns according to the package directions. Remove from the oven when done and set aside in a large baking dish. In a small bowl mix together the bouillon cube, seasoning salt and pepper. Add the butter and stir until well blended. Pour mixture over the hash browns. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the liquid has been soaked up by the hash browns. Serve warm or hot.
Combine first 3 ingredients in small saucepan. Heat until smooth. Strain into blender. Blend until smooth. Add milk. Pour into mugs. Top each mug with 1 to 2 tablespoons espresso. Garnish if desired.

Soak the herring fillets in cold water for an hour or two to remove the salt. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Add the shallot and anchovy fillets and cook for a minute until soft. Add the kipper fillets and cook for a minute. Add the fresh lemon juice, cayenne pepper and a little of the kippers liquor. Cook for another minute. Add the scotch and cook until the scotch has been absorbed. Divide the herring among four small ceramic bowls. Top with a knob of butter, a sprig of fresh dill and a little freshly ground pepper.
Sift bread in bowl. Add beef egg and mix. Add onion rings, ketchup and mustard if using. Pour into greased muffin pan. Bake in 180 degree C for 30 minutes.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat, add the onion, curry powder, and flour, stirring until well mixed. Slowly add the chicken broth and mix well. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Reduce the heat to low, add the pumpkin, brown sugar, nutmeg and salt, stirring until well mixed. Cook for 30 to 45 minutes or until the soup is slightly thickened. Stir in the milk, then pour the soup into a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Return to the saucepan and reheat. Serve immediately. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a 9 inch pie pan or 9 inch round baking dish combine the broccoli with 2 T of olive oil. Spread the broccoli in the pan. In a blender combine the ham, 2 cups of the broccoli, eggs, heavy cream, cheese, and seasonings. Blend until smooth. Pour the filling into the pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until the center is firm. Let cool 5 minutes. Cut into wedges. Serve warm.

Place the pork shoulder in your crock pot. Sprinkle with your favorite barbecue rub. Cover with the frozen apple juice concentrate and enough water to cover. Add cider vinegar and stir well. Cook for 8-9 hours or until you can shred with your fingers. Serve on buns with your favorite barbecue sauce and coleslaw.

Combine cream cheese, cheese whiz, worcestershire sauce and garlic powder. Beat well. Add yellow cheese and nuts. Form into a ball and roll in nuts or crushed corn flakes. Refrigerate. Makes about 5 cups.

In a pot add olive oil and saute carrots and green onions until tender. Add oyster mushrooms and broth. Simmer until mushrooms are softened. Add quinoa and beans and cook until quinoa is done. Add salt and pepper to taste.

In a large bowl mix Bisquick, milk, Old Bay seasoning and cheese until dough forms. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Roll out dough to a thickness of 1/2-inch. Cut into squares and place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 12 minutes or until lightly golden. In a small bowl stir together the melted butter and garlic powder and parsley flakes until well combined. Spread mixture over biscuits and top with extra cheese. Bake for an additional 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta until tender but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally. Drain the pasta well and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the oil. Add the shallots and cook for 1 minute. Add the peppers, cook for 1 minute. Add the cherry tomatoes, cook for 1 minute. Stir in the red pepper flakes. Season the spaghetti with salt & pepper. Add it to the sauce & toss well. Toss in the basil. Serve immediately.

Beat yogurt until smooth. Mix in stevia. Stir in pumpkin puree, vanilla and eggs. Combine flour, salt and baking soda. Stir into pumpkin mixture. Stir in chocolate chips and vanilla extract. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden around the edges. Cool on wire rack.

Place roast in a large zip-top plastic bag. Combine remaining ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until sugar dissolves. Pour over roast. Seal bag. Turn bag several times to coat roast. Refrigerate overnight. Drain and discard marinade. Grill roast 15 minutes per side over medium heat. Turn often. Remove from heatlet stand 10 minutes. Slice and serve.

Peel pears, cut into small pieces, add lemon juice and rind, pineapple, honey, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, ginger, and raisins. Cook slowly until pears are soft, mashing slightly. Serve hot or cold. Serve pears topped with walnuts.

Core apples and place in a large saucepan. Pour in enough water to cover apples by about an inch. Bring to a boil and cook until apples are tender, about 30 minutes. Strain apples and reserve liquid. Add sugar to the liquid and stir until dissolved. Add cinnamon. Place apples in a bowl and pour liquid over them. Refrigerate overnight before serving.

1pound the pork chops to 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick. 2combine the water, soup and gravy. 3place the pork in a casserole dish. 4brown the pork chops in oil. 5sprinkle with flour. 6pour the gravy mixture over the pork. 7cover and bake 30 to 40 minutes or until no longer pink in the center. Serve over hot mashed potatoes.

Heat margarine in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onions and cook until tender, about 8 minutes. Combine flour, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Dip steaks in the mixture. Add steaks to pan and brown well on both sides. Transfer to a plate. Add paprika to pan. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Spoon water and onions over steaks. Top each steak with a tablespoon of sour cream. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Brown turkey in a skilletadd mixed vegetables and gravy. Spoon into greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with stuffing and turkey pieces. Top with mashed potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through. Garnish with pepper.

In a large skillet over medium heat, sauté the pork and onions in the oil for 5 minutes or until the pork is cooked through. Add the brandy and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Add the juices and stir well. Add the lemon juice and season with salt and white pepper. Place the pork and onions in a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. Combine the water and gelatin in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat and add the dried plums. Boil for 1 minute or until the mixture is translucent. Remove from the heat. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt and white pepper. Add the mixture to the pork and onions. Let cool. Cover the casserole and refrigerate for 30 minutes or until the mixture is firm. Serve warm.

In a large mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar and eggs, blending well. Pour into pie crust. Refrigerate for one hour or overnight to set. Remove from refrigerator 15 minutes before serving. Garnish with blueberry pie filling and whipped topping.
Bring the milk to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in the vermicelli. Let sit for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the butter and stir. Add the lemon juice and parmesan cheese. Serve warm.
In a small bowl combine the first 4 ingredients. Stir well. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the remaining 4 ingredients. Stir well. Drizzle over the first mixture. Serve with fresh cut vegetables.

Peel carrots and cut into small cubes. Peel potatoes and cut into small cubes. Place carrots and potatoes in a large pot of lightly boiling water and cook for 2 minutes. Drain. Mince the oregano. Peel the tomatoes and cut into small pieces. Cut the jalapeno in half and remove the seeds. Cut the orange into small cubes. In a medium bowl, combine the carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, jalapeno and oregano. Add the orange juice. Season to taste with the salt. Serve at room temperature.

Heat oil in large skillet. Stir in seasoning mix. Cook over medium-high heat for 1 minute. Stir in peanuts. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan for 1 minute. Spread peanuts in single layer on waxed paper to cool completely. Store in tightly covered container. Yield : 6 servings.

Bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Add potatoes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes wellreturn to saucepan. Add tofu sour creamstir gently until smooth. Season to taste with horseradish, sugar, salt, and white pepper. Garnish with chives before serving.

Combine margarine, chocolate chips, sugar and evaporated milk in heavy saucepan. Stir over low heat until chips are melted. Stir in orange liqueur. Remove from heatcool slightly. Chill until thickenedstir occasionally while chilling. Yield: About 3 cups.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Peel potatoes and cut into small cubes. Boil potatoes until tender and then mash them with the butter, cream cheese, and the onion powder until smooth and creamy. Add the salt and pepper to taste and pour into a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 20-30 minutes or until the potatoes are golden brown and bubbly on top. Serve hot.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and saute until golden brown. Add chard and saute 2-3 minutes. Add pinto beans and saute 2-3 more minutes. Add diced tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and squeeze lime over top. Serve hot.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add ginger and shallots and cook until just beginning to brown. Add prawns and cook until pink. Add honey and water. Simmer for a few minutes. Add sesame oil and sesame seeds and toss. Serve on hot cooked rice with green salad.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease a 9 inch pie plate. Slice the mushrooms, saute in a little vegetable oil or butter until lightly browned. Pour off the liquid. In a large mixing bowl, combine the milk, eggs and cheese. Whisk until smooth. Add the mushrooms, onions and Bisquick mix. Whisk until smooth. Pour into the pie plate and bake for 30 minutes. Reduce heat to 350f and bake for another 15-20 minutes until the quiche is set. Remove from oven and let cool. Serve warm or cold.

Cook hamburger and drain. Add onion and bell pepper and saute until tender. Stir in mushrooms and soup. Heat until hot. Spread noodles in casserole. Spoon hamburger mixture over noodles. Sprinkle with french fried onions. Bake at 350 degrees until heated through.
Brown ground beef with chopped garlic and onion in a heavy dutch oven. Add water and remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer for about 1 1/2 hours or until vegetables are tender. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the stuffing mix and soupstir in water to make a moist stuffing. Sprinkle the chicken breasts evenly with the stuffingspread evenly over the tops. Bake 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in the center. Cut each chicken breast in half to serve. Serve with steamed broccoli.

In a large skillet saute onion in butter until soft. Add zucchini, bell pepper and mushrooms. Cook until vegetables are done. Add soup and water. Stir in lemon juice. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in cooked pasta. Add the cheese and stir until melted.

In a large skillet over medium heat melt the butter and add garlic and saute until fragrant about 1 minute. Add asparagus and cook 2 minutes. Add lemon juice, balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Cook for another 2 minutes or until asparagus is tender. Stir in thyme and remove from heat. Serve immediately with lemon zest sprinkled on top.

Saute hamburger with taco seasoning. Drain liquid and add to crock pot. Add condensed soup, diced tomatoes with jalapenos and black beans. Cook on high 2 hours or low 4 hours. Add baked beans last hour of cooking. Serve with shredded cheese.
Brew coffee into a 12 oz cup. Add latte mix. Add cold milk. Stir. Add ice cream topping. Top with whipped cream. Serve.

Combine cider vinegar, brown sugar, and caraway seed. Add red cabbage and onion. Cover and marinate in refrigerator. Mix occasionally. Toss and marinate in refrigerator 24 hours. Just before serving, add salt and pepper. Toss and serve cold.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Toss the bok choy with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/8 teaspoon of the black pepper. Arrange the bok choy in a single layer on the baking sheet. Roast for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the bok choy is tender. Transfer the bok choy to a bowl and cover with aluminum foil to keep warm. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the red onion, garlic, raisins, and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt to the oilsaute 1 minute, or until the red onion is soft and translucent. Stir in the mustardcook 1 minute longer. Stir in the cashews. Remove the bowl of bok choy from the oven, and add the cashew mixture to the bowltoss to coat the bok choy with the must

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel potatoes and cut into small cubes or thin slices. Place potatoes in a large bowl and add milk and cream. Stir to cover potatoes completely. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spread potatoes in a casserole dish and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons of parsley. Bake for 20 minutes then remove from oven and sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons of parsley and remaining tablespoon of butter. Bake for another 15 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and golden brown. Serves 4-6.

In a medium bowl, combine arugula and avocado. In a small bowl, combine lemon juice, garlic clove, olive oil and salt and pepper and mix well. Add lemon vinaigrette to arugula mixture and toss well. Top with parmigiano-reggiano cheese and serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine pudding with milk and mix. Add condensed milk and mix. Refrigerate until set. Beat cool whip until soft peaks form. Fold in pudding mixture. Spoon half of the mixture into a 9x9 square pan. Spread with banana slices. Spoon remaining pudding mixture on top. Sprinkle with vanilla wafer crumbs. Chill for at least 4 hours.

Preheat the oven to 325 F. Grease and flour a tube or bundt pan. Whisk the eggs until frothy. Beat in the green tea powder, then beat in the flour and sugar alternately with the milk until smooth and well blended. Beat in the butter and baking powder until just incorporated. Pour into the pan and bake for 65 minutes or until the center is set and a skewer inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 15 minutes before turning out onto a rack and cooling completely.

Separate dinner rolls and place in 2 greased baking dishes. Sprinkle each dish with cheddar cheese and bacon bits. In saucepan combine milk, ranch mix and melted butter until well blended. Pour over rolls and sprinkle with additional bacon bits and cheese if desired. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes, until rolls are lightly browned and cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Sauté onion in butter until tender. Add beef and brown well. Add gravy and mix well. Place on half of the white bread. Fill up half of the bread with the mixture. Top off with the french fries. Top off with the rest of the white bread. Serve hot.

Combine brown sugar and butter. Add flour. Stir until blended. Press mixture into an ungreased 9x13 baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in peanut butterscotch chips. Return to oven. Bake for 10 minutes longer or until lightly browned. Cool completely. Break into bars.

In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise and mustard. Spread the mayonnaise mixture over one slice of the whole wheat bread. Top with one slice of the American Cheese and then the Swiss Cheese. On the other slice of the whole wheat bread, spread the mayonnaise mixture and then cover with the remaining American Cheese and Swiss Cheese. Place in a griddle or skillet over medium heat and place the sandwich between two heavy skillets. Cook until the bread is golden. Remove and slice. Serve immediately. Serves 2.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and place in a greased 11x7 inch baking dish. Arrange half of the noodles in bottom of pan. Sprinkle with half of the ham and cheese. Repeat layers. In a small bowl combine soup and milk. Pour over the top of the casserole. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake uncovered at 350f for 25 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

For each grape cluster, fold one grape leaf in half lengthwise and then in half widthwise. Secure the fold with toothpicks. Repeat with remaining leaves and grapes. Place on wax paper or foil-lined baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately dip each grape cluster into white baking chocolate. Place back on wax paper and sprinkle with nuts. Cool completely before serving. Makes about 5 dozen clusters.

In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter and add asparagus. Sprinkle with salt. Cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Add the lemon juice and stir. Add the basil and parmesan. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Cool to room temperature.

Heat oil in a small pot over medium high heat. Add garlic and stir until fragrant (2 minutes). Add mushrooms and stir until mushrooms start to turn brown. Add soy sauce and sugar and stir until soy sauce evaporates (3 minutes). Add salt and pepper to taste and serve with a sprinkling of cilantro and a drizzle of soy sauce. Serve hot over rice or noodles.

In a saucepan cook butter and sugar together. Add vanilla. Cook until it reaches 240 degrees on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat. Stir in flour and baking soda until dough is stiff. Let cool a bit. Line 2 cookie sheets with waxed paper. Take 1/4 of dough and form into a ball. Press into a 5 by 4-inch rectangle on waxed paper. Bake in 350-degree preheated oven until lightly browned, about 15 minutes. Cool. Cut into 1-inch squares. Melt milk chocolate over a double boiler. Dip each square into the melted chocolate. Place on waxed paper and top with pecans. Repeat until all squares are covered. Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

Cook cavatelli according to directions on package. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about a minute. Add broccoli and cook until bright green and tender, about 3 minutes. Pour in broth. Bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer until broccoli is tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in cavatelli until heated through. Top with parmesan cheese and serve hot.

Place pie crust in pie pan. Melt margarine in pan. Add onions and cook until clear. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add non-dairy milk substitute and cook for 1 minute. Pour into pie shell. Mix egg, flour and wine in a small bowl. Add salt and pepper. Beat lightly. Pour over vegetable mixture. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 375 and bake for 30 minutes longer or until firm. Let cool 1 hour and serve.

Peel avocadoes with a sharp knife. Cut avocadoes into 1/2 inch cubes. In a medium bowl, toss avocados with remaining ingredients. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Garnish with fresh lime wedges. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Wash chicken liver in cold water and pat dry. Melt the butter over medium high heat in a heavy skillet. Add the liver and cook until done on all sides about 15 minutes in all. Remove liver from the pan and chop finely or shred. Fry the bacon in the same pan until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Layer the bacon in the bottom of the serving dish and add the liver over the top. Season with pepper and serve hot with crackers or rolls.

Combine the flour, cornmeal, seasoning salt and black pepper in a shallow bowl. Place the light mayonnaise in a separate shallow bowl. Dip the fish fillets in the mayonnaise, then dredge in the seasoned flour mixture. Dip again in the mayonnaise mixture to coat. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the fish fillets and fry until golden brown, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Serve with lemon wedges. Makes 4 servings.

In small saucepan combine juice and sugar. Stir over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Bring just to a simmer. Remove from heat. Add butter. Cut pears into 1/2 inch slices. Arrange slices in one layer in a shallow baking pan. Pour juice mixture over pears. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Cut the breasts into thin strips and place them in a resealable plastic bag. Add the buttermilk and seal the bag. Put it in the fridge and leave for 30 minutes. When the time is up remove the strips and coat them in the dried breadcrumbs, making sure they are covered evenly. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet and fry the strips for 3 minutes on each side until they are browned and cooked through. Serve immediately on lettuce leaves with tomatoes and fresh cucumber slices, seasoned with garlic powder and chilli powder and salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, baking powder and salt. In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg whites and milkstir into the cornmeal mixture. Fold in the onion, parsley and pepper. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Use a large cookie scoop to drop the batter into the hot oil. Fry for 1 to 2 minutes per side, or until the puppies are lightly browned. Transfer to paper towel-lined plates to drain. Serve hot. Yields 10 to 12 hush puppies.

Mix together 1/2 cup olive oil, 1/2 cup water, 2 cloves garlic and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a baking dish. Add 4 salmon fillets (about 4-5 ounces each) to the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Preheat grill. Place fillets on grill with skin side up. Cook for about 10 minutes, turning once. When fillets are done, remove them from the grill. Serve with parsley, sliced sun-dried tomatoes, and remaining olive oil.

Peel and boil potatoes until very tender. Drain and mash together with sweet potatoes. Add onion, flour, baking powder and eggs. Mix well. Add salt and pepper to taste. Chill for at least an hour. Heat 1/2 inch of oil in a large skillet. Drop by teaspoon full into hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and chives. Serve with sour cream or applesauce.
Pour boiling water over tea bags in a teapot. Steep 5 minutes. Remove bags and discard. Add frozen lemonade concentrate and lemon slice. Stir well. Serve over ice. Garnish with mint.
Peel and boil potatoes until done. Drain and mash potatoes. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Reheat if desired. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c).Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.Sift flour, thyme, sugar and lemon zest into a large bowl. In another bowl, combine buttermilk and baking sodalet stand 5 minutes.Beat butter and baking powder at medium speed with an electric mixer until fluffygradually add flour mixture and beat until well blended. Add lemon juice and buttermilk mixturebeat at medium speed until blended.Drop batter by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes or until golden brown and puffed.Remove from ovenlet cool on baking sheet for 1 minute. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely.Store in an airtight container.Makes 40 biscuits.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Boil the potatoes in their jackets until tender. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise and squeeze out the insides into a large bowl. Set aside. Melt the butter in a small frying pan. Add the onion and saute until transparent. Sprinkle with flour and cook one minute. Whisk in the half-and-half and cream cheese. Bring to a boil and pour over the potatoes. Mix lightly. Pour into a 2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with the paprika. Bake uncovered until lightly browned.

Heat oil in a large frying pan. Add the onions, garlic & tomatoes. Fry until soft. Add the vegetable stock. Add the tomato puree & seasoning. Add the lardons & cook for a couple of minutes. Add the beans & simmer for about 10 minutes. Serve with crusty bread.

Cut each chicken breast into two equal pieces. Place chicken pieces on a plate. In a small bowl combine lime peel, juice and rosemary. Marinate chicken for 2 hours. Remove from marinade. Grill over medium high heat for 5 minutes each side until no longer pink. In a small bowl combine lime juice, peel and rosemary and 1/2 cup water. Bring to a boil and cook until thickened. Cut chicken into bite size pieces and serve with lime sauce. Serve with rice and vegetables.

In 12-inch skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add pork chops and brown on both sides. Add tomatoes and water to skilletcover and simmer 1 hour or until meat is tender. Add brown sugar, vinegar, garlic powder and onioncook 15 minutes longer or until sauce is thickened. Serve over rice.
Combine all salad ingredients except yogurt. Add yogurt just before serving. Toss lightly. Garnish with sunflower seeds.

Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet over medium heat. Season sirloin with herb seasoning mix. Add sirloin to skilletcook for 6 minutes or until browned on all sides. Remove beef from skillet. Add remaining butter to skillet. Add mushrooms to skilletsaute for 4 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Add beef broth to skilletstir to combine. Add hoisin sauce to skillet. Cook for 1 minute. Add beef to skilletcook for 1 minute or until heated through. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 1 loaf pan or 2 round cake pans. In a large bowl, cream together 1 cup shortening and 1 cup sugar until light and fluffy. Add 1 egg and beat until smooth. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla. In another bowl combine 3 cups flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, and 1 teaspoon salt. Sift together and add to mixture alternately with 2 cups milk, beginning and ending with flour mixture. Beat well after each addition. Stir in 2 cups chopped walnuts. Pour batter into prepared pan(s). Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean and bread springs back when touched lightly on top. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan(s) to wire racks to cool completely. Yield: 2 loaves or 12 servings.
Place a hot sausage in the center of each roll. Top with mozzarella cheese. Put dill pickles and tomatoes on top. Heat in microwave for 30 seconds.

Cook noodles in boiling water until just tender and drain. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic powder and peppercook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add beefcook and stir until no longer pink. Stir in tomato sauce and waterheat through. Add cottage cheese and sour creammix well. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered at 375f for 30 minutes or until bubbly and heated through.

Cream butter and shortening together until light and fluffy. Add sugar and blend well. Add vanilla and eggsmix well. Stir in flour and cinnamon to form doughroll to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into rounds with 2-inch cookie cutter and place 1 inch apart on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 12 minutes. Remove to wire rack to cool. Makes 2 dozen.

Heat 1 teaspoon oil in skillet over medium heat. Add 1/2 pound shrimp to skilletsaute until pink. Transfer shrimp to small bowl. Add remaining 1/2 cup oil to skillet. Add 1/2 cup mushrooms to skilletsaute until tender. Add garlic cloves to skilletcook 1 minute. Add tomatoes to skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until liquid evaporates, about 3 minutes. Add lemon juice to skilletsaute until heated through, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Divide cooked rice between 2 plates. Top each with shrimp mixturesprinkle with parsley.

Butter each fillet generously on both sides. Sprinkle the seasoning salt and pepper over each fillet. Mix the crushed crackers and the melted butter in a small bowl and place the mixture in a small dish. Roll each fillet in the cracker mixture and place in a shallow dish. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily. Serve hot and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 9-inch square baking pan. In a large bowl combine cornmeal, flour, baking powder and saltset aside. In a small bowl combine egg, buttermilk and oilmix well and stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Spread batter in pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack. In a small bowl combine honey and melted butterspread over cooled cornbread. Cut into squares to serve.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into 1 inch chunks. Place them in a medium pot. Cover with cold water by 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Drain the potatoes. Place them back into the pot. Mash the potatoes with the butter and milk. Add the manchego cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Line an 8x8 inch pan with aluminum foil. Spread peanut butter over the bottom of the pan. Top with marshmallows and walnuts. Melt the butterscotch chips with the butter and pour over the marshmallows. Chill until set. Remove from pan by lifting the foil with the chilled mixture attached to the foil. Cut into squares and serve.

Mash sweet potatoes with curry powder and salt. Add egg and sour cream. Mix well. Grease 9 by 13 casserole dish. Spoon mixture into dish and bake for 30 minutes. Top with banana slices. Bake for 20 more minutes.
Grandma s coleslaw is easy to make with fresh cabbage and green pepper, celery, onion, carrot, vinegar, sugar, salt, celery seed, mustard seeds.

Mix flour, sugar and coconut in a bowl. Add melted butter and mix well. Press mixture into a greased 8X8 baking pan. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 15 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack. Combine pudding mix with milk and stir for two minutes. Fold in lemon pie filling and spread evenly over crust. Freeze for at least two hours, or until firm. Serve cut into squares.

Boil 10 whole new red skin potatoes in water for 30 minutes. Drain water. Peel and slice into 1/4 inch rounds. Butter 9 x 13 baking dish. Layer half of slices in baking dish. Sprinkle with half the cheese. Layer the rest of the slices on top. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Remove from oven. Mix sour cream, green onion and salt/pepper to taste. Spread on top of baked potatoes. Bake additional 10 minutes. Serve with a green salad.

In a small bowl combine rosemary, thyme, garlic cloves, celery seed, pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, and broth. Place butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add tomato paste and broth mixture. Add shrimp. Cook until shrimp are cooked through (about 5 minutes). Add lemon juice. Remove from heat. Serve over hot pasta with a dash of hot pepper flakes. Garnish with parsley.

Cream butter and sugar. Add egg, vanilla and flour. Stir in farina. Chill for 30 minutes. Roll into balls. Place 2 inches apart on greased baking sheets. Flatten each to about 3 inches in diameter. Bake at 350f for 12 minutes. Remove from oven. Mix raisins and water. Spoon over cookies. Bake for 2 minutes. Cool completely before removing from pan.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, add the oil and onion and saute for 1 minute or until the onion is translucent. Add the orange juice and salt and bring the mixture to a boil. Add the quinoa and reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the quinoa is tender. Fluff the quinoa with a fork. Transfer the quinoa to a large serving bowl and stir in the parsley and mint. Add the currants and orange zest and stir well. Let cool slightly before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, stir together the egg yolks, buttermilk, cheese and pepper. Set aside. In another large bowl, beat together the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Stir about half of the egg whites into the cheese mixture. Fold in the rest of the egg whites. Fill a greased baking dish with the mixture. Bake in preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until set. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

In a tall glass filled with ice cubes, combine rum, lime juice, brown sugar, lime wedges and mint leaves. Stir well. Pour in carbonated lemon-lime beverage to fill glass. Garnish with lime wedges and mint sprigs if desired. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine soup and water. Bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute, stirring occasionally. Remove from heatstir in rice blend. Covercook 15 minutes. Fluff with fork. Add butter to rice mixture. Gently toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with pheasant breasts.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add carrots and season with salt and pepper. Cook until just tender and beginning to turn golden around the edges, about 8 minutes. Add ginger, garlic and shallot and cook until aromatic, about 1 minute. Add the honey and orange juice and cook until the carrots are coated and the liquid is almost completely evaporated, about 5 minutes more. Stir in soy sauce and water and cook until the liquid is completely evaporated and the carrots are glazed and shiny, about 1 minute more. Add mint and toss to combine and remove from heat. Serve immediately.

In a heavy saucepan combine orange juice & zest, water, sugar & curacao. Bring to boil & let simmer 5 minutes. Add figs & boil 3 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat & allow to cool. Serve at room temperature or chilled with vanilla ice cream or cake or bread.

Put onion and garlic in the skillet. Saut over medium high heat until the onion is tender and translucent. Add the beans and enough water to cover the beans. Cook for 10 minutes. Add cumin and seasonings. Continue to cook over medium heat until the beans are tender. Serve with chips.

Grease a 9-inch square pan. In a mixing bowl, combine the orange drink, sugar and vanilla chips. Stir in flour, baking powder, baking soda and vanilla. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake at 350 for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool. Cut into 12 pieces.

Brown turkey in oil. Add celery, onion. Cook until tender. Add soup. Combine mayonnaise, salt and pepper. Mix with turkey. Spoon into baking dish. Sprinkle with pimientos. Top with potato chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Scrub potatoes and prick them with a fork. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. While potatoes are baking, heat butter in a small nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. Add eggs and sprinkle with salt and white pepper. Cook until the white is firm but the yolk is still runny. Remove from heat. Slice potatoes in half. Top each half with a slice of egg. Return to the oven for 10 minutes more. Remove from oven and garnish with chopped parsley. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix flour, oats, bicarbonate of soda and allspice. Combine pecans and brown sugar. Add to flour mixture. Stir together egg and oil and add to flour mixture. Add apples. Spoon into greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake for 40-50 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Makes 9 servings.

Heat olive oil over medium high heat and add mushroom and saute 2 minutes until softened. Add curry powder, chilli pepper and saute 1 minute. Add potato, stirring to coat. Cook 10 minutes until potato is tender. Stir in yoghurt. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Makes 1 serving.

Melt butter and add brown sugar and cinnamonmix well. Add Banana Extract and rum extractmix well and add all other ingredients and mix well. Pour into a shallow dish and refrigerate for one hour or overnight for best results.

To make the crust, process vanilla wafers in a food processor until crumbly. Add orange zest and melted butterprocess to combine. Press crumb mixture onto bottom of 9-inch pie plate. Cover bottom of pie plate with foilfreeze 30 minutes or until firm.To make filling, stir together orange sorbet and frozen yogurt in a large bowl until well blended. Spread mixture over crustfreeze 1 hour or until firm.To make topping, combine corn syrup and 1/4 cup water in a small saucepan over medium heatbring to a boil. Add orange zest and vanillastir until smooth. Remove from heatcool completely. Pour over cakefreeze 3 hours or until firm.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly spray 13x9 baking pan with cooking spray. Mix Bisquick, milk, onion and ham. Add cheddar cheese. Blend sour cream and egg together. Add to bisquick mixture. Stir in parmesan cheese. Spoon into the pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Cut into bars. Serve warm.

Peel and slice cucumbers. Place in a large saucepan. Add the rest of the ingredients except vinegar. Bring to a boil and simmer for 1 hour. Add vinegar and return to a boil. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Pack pickles in sterile jars. Makes about 12 cups.

Lightly spray a shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Crush bread into a coarse mixture (do not process in food processor). Stir together the bread mixture, parsley, orange zest and red pepper. Combine the egg whites with orange juice in a small bowl until smooth. Add the bread mixture to the egg whites and mix until just blended. Arrange the fillets in the baking dishsprinkle with the bread mixture. Bake at 375 until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork, about 25 minutes. Serve with the lemon wedges.

Cut lemon in half lengthwise. Scoop out 4 lemon segments from one half of the lemon. Thinly slice remaining lemon half. Add lemon segments to small bowlcover. Set aside. In small bowl, combine 2 tbsp olive oil, lemon peel and lemon juice. Set aside. Thread shrimp onto skewerbrush with lemon oil mixture. Thread lemon slices on remaining skewers. Preheat grill to medium. Grill shrimp 4 to 6 minutes per side or until done.

Beat together cream cheese, sour cream, bacon and green onions until creamy. Mix in blue cheese and walnuts. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving. Serve with crackers, fresh vegetables or pita bread.

Cut chorizo into bite sized pieces and fry in a large frying pan for 10 minutes until browned. Add onion and garlic and cook for 5 minutes more. Add potato and cook for 10 minutes until soft. Add chicken stock and bring to the boil. Add kale and cook for another 5 minutes. Season with pepper and salt and serve.

Cut off both ends of beans. Place beans in a 1 qt. saucepan. Add butter and water. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook beans for 5 minutes or until tender. Drain beans. In a small bowl, combine butter, garlic, and pepper. Pour over beans. Mix well. Serve hot.

Cook rotini pasta according to package instructions. Drain and cool slightly. In a large bowl combine mayonnaise, honey, mustard and onion powder and mix well. Add pasta, ham and celery and mix well. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve on a bed of lettuce and sprinkle with gouda cheese.

Mix crab meat with mayonnaise and water until crab meat is moist. Mix in old bay seasoning and mustard. In a separate bowl combine cracker crumbs and parsley. Form mixture into patties and cover with cracker crumb mixture. Melt butter in a large fry pan over med-high heat. Fry crab cakes until golden brown on each side. Serve with your favorite tartar sauce.
Make pudding according to box instructions. When pudding is done, pour into a 9 x 13 pan. Place bananas on top. Add wafer crumbs. Refrigerate.

Boil potatoes with salt until tender about 25-30 min. Drain and mash with a potato masher. Stir in boursin cheese. Stir in sour cream. Stir in milk, salt and pepper to taste. Butter a baking dish and pour potatoes in. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 min or until golden brown. Serve with a light dusting of paprika and crumbled bacon bits on top if desired.

Pat beef with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef in batches. Cook 2 minutes per side. Remove beef from skillet to a plate. Return skillet to medium-high heatadd onion. Cook 5 minutes or until golden. Stir in ginger and garliccook 1 minute. Add curry powder and coriandercook 1 minute. Stir in tomatoescook 1 minute more. Return beef to skilletcook 1 minute more or until beef is done to your liking. Serve over cooked rice with yogurt on the side.

Wash and hull strawberries and cut in half. Place in a saucepan with water and sugar and let simmer for 10 minutes. Melt gelatin in boiling water and stir in strawberry mixture. Chill until mixture starts to thicken. In a large bowl, beat cream with lemon juice until soft peaks form. Fold in gelatin mixture and refrigerate until ready to use. Place one layer of cookies in the bottom of a 9 inch pie plate. Pour half of the strawberry mixture over the cookies. Repeat layers. Chill. Top with whipped cream and strawberries. Store in the refrigerator.

Place all ingredients in a large crock pot and turn it on high for 2 hours. Turn it down to low and cook for another hour or two, until it is very hot and the cinnamon sticks and whole cloves are fragrant and flavorful. Serve hot or cold in mugs.

In a small bowl, combine the beans, onion, parsley and dressingtoss to coat well. Refrigerate up to 1 day ahead. To serve, place lettuce leaves on a serving plate or in a bowltop with bean mixture, sprinkling with sugar and parsley if desired. Toss well before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine flour, baking soda and salt. In another bowl combine yogurt, stevia and eggs. Add bananas and mix well. Pour banana mixture into flour mixture and mix just until combined. Pour into two 8x4x3 loaf pans. Bake 45 minutes or until done. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely.

Mix flour and oats. Cut butter into mixture with two knives. Add brown sugar and cinnamon. Toss well. Arrange apples in a baking dish. Top with topping and bake at 375 for 25 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream.

Spread each piece of bread with a little butter on one side of each slice. Arrange on a baking sheet and bake until toasted on that side. While cheese is melting, put the bread on the grill, buttered side facing up. Place the cheese on top of the bread, sprinkle with the cayenne pepper and top with the other bread slice. Cook until the cheese is melted and the bread is lightly browned on both sides. Serve hot, with sliced tomatoes if desired.

Mix together the peanut butter and sugars. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the baking powder and baking soda. Mix well. Drop by teaspoons on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for about 10 minutes. Let cool on cookie sheet for 5 minutes before removing.

The night before: Soak challah in half-and-half overnight in a large bowl, turning to coat evenly. The next day: Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Stir in half-and-half mixture, cream, 1/2 cup sugar, vanilla, and nutmeg until well blended. Soak bread in mixture for 1 minute per side. Melt butter in large nonstick skillet or electric skillet over medium heat. Add bread, turning to coat with butter. Cook until golden brown on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar mixture. Serve with strawberry sauce. Make Ahead Strawberry Sauce: Mix strawberry preserves with 1/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until smooth. Serve warm or refrigerate until ready to use. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oven to 325f. Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add potatoes, onions and carrot, stirring until coated with the melted butter. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook over medium-low heat for 10-12 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Transfer vegetables to a large baking dish. In a small saucepan whisk the stock with the flour and bring to a boil over medium heat until thickened slightly and smooth, about 2 minutes. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake until the cheese is melted and the sauce is bubbly around the edges, about 30 minutes.

Heat oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and garlic and saute until onion is translucent. Add cumin and oregano. Sprinkle with black pepper. Stir in potatoes. Add the chicken broth. Bring to boil. Add the green chilies. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for about 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat. Stir in half of the Monterey jack cheese. Spoon the soup into bowls. Top with the remaining cheese.

Soak beans in cold water overnight. Cook on low heat in pressure cooker 35-40 minutes or until tender. Mash with garlic, onion, chili powder, cumin, lime juice, salt & freshly ground black pepper. Set aside. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly oil baking sheet with vegetable oil or spray with cooking spray. Spread corn tortillas on baking sheet. Place mozzarella cheese on tortillas and top with black bean puree. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven, spread cabbage on top. Sprinkle with fresh cilantro.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine red onion and garlic. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add lamb and toss to coat evenly with the onions and garlic. Place a piece of bread on a baking sheet. Place a large spoonful of meat mixture on each bread piece and top with another piece of bread. Repeat with remaining pieces of bread. Drizzle with a little olive oil and bake until the bread is golden and the meat is no longer pink in the center, 30 to 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and let the stuffed bread rest for 5 minutes. Cut the stuffed bread into wedges and serve with tzatziki and roma tomatoes.

Melt butter in a medium-size heavy skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until garlic is brown. Whisk in cream and season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Stir in parmesan cheese. Pour over spaghetti.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown rib eye on both sides. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, white wine, vinegar, brown sugar and sesame oil. Pour mixture over rib eye and add the ginger and crushed red pepper flakes. Cover and transfer pan to the slow cooker. Add broccoli. Cook on low for 6 hours or high for 3 hours. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Spray 15x10x1-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Heat margarine over medium-high heat in medium saucepan until melted. Cook corn in the margarine until tender. Stir together corn, onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and green chilies in baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika, and bake for 15 minutes.

Cream shortening and butter together. Gradually beat in sugar. Beat well and add eggs one at a time. Beat well after each addition. Add flour and mix well. Add coconut and nuts. Divide and roll into balls. Put on ungreased cookie sheet and press with fork to flatten out cookies. Bake 10 minutes at 375 degrees F.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Toss together vegetables in large bowl. Heat oven to 400 degrees. Spray large baking sheet lightly with cooking spray. Add vegetables to baking sheet and toss to coat evenly. Roast vegetables 20 minutes or until tender, stirring once after 10 minutes of cooking. Place vegetables in food processor and puree until smooth. Stir in beans until well combined. Season with lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crusty bread or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Season the breasts with salt and pepper. Heat the butter and olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat until the fat is hot (not smoking). Add the breasts and brown for 3-4 minutes on each side, until just cooked through (they will cook more while baking). Transfer the breasts to an ovenproof dish, sprinkle with garlic cloves, and pour in the bouillon cube and hot water. Bake uncovered for 20-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the breasts from the oven and drizzle with lime juiceset aside until ready to serve. Meanwhile, make the sauce: In a small skillet over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil and add the capers and cook for about 1 minute until the capers have wilted downremove from heat and add the parsley and lime juicestir to combine. To serve: Spoon the sauce on the chicken breasts and serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl combine ground beef, salt, pork and beans and barbecue sauce. Mix well and spoon into a 2-quart baking dish. Bake 25 minutes. Mix biscuits with melted margarine. Sprinkle over top of beef mixture. Bake 10 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake 1 minute. Serve with salad.

Heat tortilla according to package directions. Spread mayo on both sides of tortilla. Top with 2 slices of bologna and American cheese. Top with another tortilla, buttered side down. Broil for 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately on a platter with ketchup or mustard.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into quarters. Put them in a large pot of boiling salted water and cook them until tender. Drain the potatoes and mash them in the pot with a potato masher or large fork until they are smooth but retain some texture. Stir in the butter, milk, blue cheese, rosemary and pepper until well mixed. Serve immediately.

Prepare the gelatin according to directions and add sugar. When cool add boiling water and stir until well dissolved. Add nectar and juice and stir until well blended. Chill until very cold. Add ginger ale. Serve with ice cubes floating in the punch. Garnish with orange wedges or orange slices. Makes 12 servings.

In a large bowl, combine ground beef, dried blueberries, salt and pepper. Divide mixture evenly into 4 patties and place them on a baking sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes, or until cooked through. Grill for an additional 5 minutes on each side. Spread cheese evenly over bun bottoms. Top with burger, bun tops and lettuce leaves. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix breadcrumbs with cheese. Salt and pepper the inside of the chicken breasts. Lay out one slice of cheese and breadcrumb mixture. Put a slice of apple inside the breast. Fold the breast over the stuffing to enclose. Press edges together to seal. Melt a small amount of butter in a non stick frying pan over meduim high heat. When the butter is hot add the chicken breasts to the pan. Brown the breasts 3-4 minutes per side. Bake the breasts in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes. Remove the breasts from the pan and cover with the apple juice. Stir in green onion. Cook until tender. Serves 4.

Mix together the milk, sugar and vanilla. Add the egg yolks and beat well. Add the biscuits. Let the mixture sit for 15 minutes. Spray 9 inch pie plate with non-stick cooking spray. Add the mixture. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Let cool completely. Mix the topping ingredients in a small bowl. Spread topping over the pie. Refrigerate overnight or freeze. Serve cold.

Place a pot of salted water to boil. Boil orzo and rice separately until tender but firm (about 12 minutes). In a pan, heat olive oil and butter together and saute the onions and garlic until transparent. Add tomato paste and cook for a couple of minutes. Add the rice and orzo and stir so they are well coated with the tomato sauce. Add the vegetable stock and cook over low heat for a couple of minutes until the rice and orzo are soft but not mushy. Add the cheese and stir until melted and well combined. Add salt and pepper and serve immediately while warm. This dish is often served with some sort of meat like chicken or lamb.

Prepare bacon according to package directions. Drain on paper towel-lined platecool slightly. Dice bacon and set aside. Melt butter in a large stockpot over medium-low heatwhisk in onion and mustard until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in molasses, sugar, chutney, and 1/2 cup waterbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, uncovered, until liquid has reduced by half, about 15 minutes. Add beans and brothbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-lowcook until beans are tender, about 30 minutes. Stir in bourboncook until heated through, about 1 minute. Remove from heatstir in bacon and black pepper. Serve warm. Serves 8.

Cream cheese is one of my favorite things to mix with different flavors. These are super easy to make and very delicious. Beat cream cheese in large bowl with electric mixer until smooth. Add cheddar cheese and beat until well blended. Add parsley, paprika and beer. Mix well. Refrigerate until firm. Roll into 1 inch logs. Wrap each log with almond slices. Serve with crackers.

Bring water to a boil and add macaroni. Cook for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a large bowl combine macaroni, cabbage, celery, green pepper and onions. Combine the remaining ingredients in a separate bowl and pour over the macaroni mixture. Toss to blend. Chill for at least one hour before serving.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Spray grill with cooking spray. Sprinkle pork chops with brown sugar, paprika, coriander, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, ginger and garlic. Grill for 3 to 4 minutes per side or til cooked through. Serve with steamed rice and garnish with green onion.

Heat oil over medium heat in a wok or heavy pan. Stir-fry garlic and onion until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add chile, tamarind paste, fish sauce and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved, then lower heat to simmer for 15 minutes. Serve warm as condiment to meats or as a sandwich spread.

Combine water and rice in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 20-25 minutes. Stir in curry powder. Add chicken broth and raisins. Cover and simmer 5 minutes more or until liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with almonds. Serve.

In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese and cheddar cheese. Add cinnamon stick and bay leaf. Blend together well. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until firm. Gently mix dried apple into cheese mixture with a wooden spoon. Shape into a ball and roll in nuts. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Cook chicken with mixed salad greens. Cut avocado and chicken into cubes. Mix with lettuce, mayonnaise and sweet chili sauce. Roll into flour tortillas. Garnish with basil. Serve.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in carrots and cook until tender. Add the broth and tomato paste. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer for about 1 hour or until the carrots are tender and the soup is thickened. Stir in the rice and cook for another minute or so. Add the salt and pepperstir in the heavy cream and heat through. Garnish with carrot curls and serve immediately.

Toss together the celery, pineapple tidbits, apple slices, mayonnaise and powdered sugar in a large bowl. Refrigerate until serving time. Then fold in the whipping cream and vanilla extract. Garnish with chopped walnuts if desired. Makes 12 servings.

Heat wok until hot. Add oil, swirl to coat pan. Add eggs. Beat for 1 minute. Add tomatoes. Cook, stirring constantly until tomatoes are heated through. Stir in rice. Add soy sauce, chili sauce, salt, pepper. Stir until well blended.

Mix together broccoli, yellow bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, southwest seasoning, salt and pepper. Cook on medium-high in a skillet for 7-8 minutes. Turn broccoli mixture halfway through cooking time.

Mix together 1 1/2 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon of baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon of oil. Make a well in the center and pour in 1/2 cup of milk. Stir gently until dough is moistened. Knead into a ball. Pat into a 6-8 inch circle. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Spread sauce to within 1 inch of edges. Sprinkle cheese over sauce. Top with pepperoni. Bake 5 minutes more. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve.

Put chives in a large bowl. Add cognac and bring to a boil. Cook over medium heat for about 4 minutes. Add parsley, dijon mustard, worcestershire sauce and beef broth. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add butter. Cool for 1 hour. Strain before serving. Makes about 2 cups. Serve with steak.

In a large bowl whip topping until soft peaks form, set aside. Beat cream cheese until fluffy, then beat in milk and vanilla. Pour into bottom of 9-inch pie plate. Layer on 3 cups of the whipped topping, then crumble half of the cookies over the topping. Add another layer of topping and cookies, then top with remaining topping. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 3 days. Serves 16

Mix together the dry ingredients in a large bowl. Add the carrot and mix well. Add the wet ingredients and mix well until just combined. Spoon into cupcake or muffin tins and bake at 400f for about 20 minutes or until the muffins are golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack and then frost with cream cheese frosting. Decorate with chives.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Season turkey breast with garlic powder. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Place the turkey breast on the baking sheet. In a small bowl mix together tequila and lime juice. Brush the turkey breast with the tequila mixture. Bake the turkey breast uncovered for 1 hour. Turn the turkey breast over and brush with the tequila mixture. Continue baking for 1 hour. Remove the turkey breast from the baking sheet. In a small bowl stir together 2 tablespoons of the tequila mixture, and the lime zest. Brush the turkey breast with the mixture. Place the turkey breast on a cutting board and cut into thin slices. Sprinkle with lime juice.

In a large bowl, beat butter and granulated sugar with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Add milk and corn syrupbeat on medium speed until well blended. Gradually beat in powdered sugar. Beat on medium speed until well blended and light and fluffy. Stir in vanilla. Spread frosting between layers and on sides of cake. Top with pecans.

Cut venison tenderloin in half and place each half between a slice of bacon and secure with toothpicks. Combine all other ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 2 minutes. Add the portabella mushrooms and simmer for another 5 to 10 minutes. Place the mushrooms and sauce in a shallow baking dish. Arrange the bacon wrapped tenderloins in the baking dish and bake for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, remove and sprinkle the cheese over the tenderloins and return to the oven for another 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Place crackers in a small bowl and pour melted margarine over them. Mix well. Press crackers firmly into the bottom of a greased 8-in. square baking dish. Sprinkle with 2 cups of cheese. In a medium saucepan, combine tuna and soup. Heat to boiling. Add milk. Stir in seasonings. Pour over crackers. Sprinkle with remaining 1 cup of cheese. Bake uncovered for 25-30 minutes or until heated through.

Peel and chop onion finely, or put through a food processor. In large pan, saute the onion in butter for a few minutes until it is translucent but not brown. Whisk together the cream and egg yolks until well-blended. Season with salt and pepper and add the onion and parmesan cheese. Pour into an ungreased 1-quart casserole or shallow gratin dish. Bake in a pre-heated 400 degree oven for about half an hour or until the top is golden brown and puffed up a bit, and the custard is set and starting to turn a little brown on the edges. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan, combine all but the cranberries. Add 3 c water to the mix. Bring to a boil over high heat until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the cranberries and reduce the heat to medium low. Cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Add the lemon juice and cinnamon stick. Cook until the juice is thickened, about 5 minutes more. Remove from heat and allow to cool completely. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Slice onions and garlic finely. Fry in a pan in olive oil until soft. Add potatoes. Pour over some of the chicken broth. Add a pinch of salt and some cayenne pepper. Let simmer for about 20 minutes. Add some more broth if necessary. Remove potatoes from pan. Add the fresh coriander leaves to the soup and blend to a purée. Return potatoes to pan. Simmer for another 15 minutes. Stir well.

Pulse the garlic in a food processor until finely minced. Add parsley. Pulse again until finely chopped. Add the other ingredients. Process until smooth. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with grilled meats.

In large skillet saute onion and flour until golden brown. Stir in margarine and mix well. Add mixed vegetables and cook. Stirring often. Add chicken broth and let boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in milk. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add cooked chicken and mix well. Pour mixture into pie shell. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Let cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Butter an eight by eight baking dish. Arrange apricots in the baking dish and sprinkle with almonds. Combine honey and ginger in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for two minutes, stirring constantly. Pour honey mixture over the apricots and bake for thirty minutes, stirring once or twice during baking. Serve warm or cold with ice cream.

Drain pineapple and cut into cubes. In a large mixing bowl combine pineapple and pudding mix. Beat Cool Whip in another bowl until soft peaks form. Fold Cool Whip into pineapple mixture. Chill. Just before serving top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkling of nuts. Add a small bowl of nuts to serve on the side.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease the bottom and sides of an 8x8 inch square baking dish with butter. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, sugar, and saltset aside. In another bowl, beat together the butter and milk until smooth. Add the eggs, one at a timemix well after each addition. Stir the milk mixture into the flour mixture just until combinedstir in the bacon and cheddar cheese. Pour into the prepared dish. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes in the preheated oven, until the casserole is golden brown and the center is firm to the touch.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Drain pork and beans into a 2-1/2 qt. baking dish. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir in onion and cook until softened. Stir in mustard. Cook 1 minute. Stir in maple syrup and brown sugar. Cook until sugar dissolves. Stir in ketchup and worcestershire. Pour over beans. Bake 30 minutes. Stir in bacon and bake 10 minutes. Stir in beans and bake until heated through. Serve.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook gnocchi according to package directions. Drain. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic. Cook 1 minute. Add frozen spinach. Cook for 2 minutes. Add diced tomatoes. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in gnocchi, Italian seasoning and salt and pepper. Spoon 1/2 cup gnocchi mixture into each of 6 shallow bowls. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 5 to 6 minutes. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Wash and scrub sweet potatoes. Prick all over with a fork. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until soft. Remove from oven and brush with ketchup mixture. Bake for another 20 minutes or until browned.
In a shaker full of ice combine gin, lemon juice & sugar. Shake vigorously. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice. Top off with club soda. Garnish with cherry.

In a heavy dutch oven or saucepan, heat oil over med-high heat. Add onion, potatoes and beef stock. Cook covered on low heat for about an hour, or until potatoes are tender. Add beef stew meat and buttercover and cook for about 15 minutes longer or until pot roast is tender. Serve with parsley sprinkled on top. Serve with mashed potatoes, noodles or rice.

In a large bowl combine water and sugar. Stir until sugar has dissolved. Add red-hot candies. Pour punch into a punch bowl or pitcher. Add pineapple juice and frozen lemonade. Serve over ice in stemmed glasses. Serve ginger ale separately for guests to add themselves.
Toss lettuce with dressing and spread evenly on a serving plate. Arrange beans in rows next. Top with remaining layers. Garnish with cheese.

In a nonmetal bowl combine all the ingredients and mix well. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove the chicken from the marinade. Thread the chicken on skewers and grill over medium heat for about 6 minutes per side. Serve on toasted french bread with fresh salad.

Heat the sesame oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the leek and fry for 2 minutes. Add the bok choy and fry for 1 minute. Add the fish and fry for 2 minutes. Add the lime juice, chilli and sugar. Fry for 1 minute. Add the soy and coriander and fry for 1 minute. Remove from heat and serve with rice or noodles.

Combine the sugar, eggs, and dates in a saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the sugar is dissolved. Add the vanilla and cook for 1 more minute. Remove from the heat. Stir in the krispies. Pour mixture onto waxed paper and let stand for 1 minute. Quickly stir in the nuts and coconut. Quickly shape into 1 inch balls. Makes about 3 dozen balls. Store in the refrigerator.

Soak the beans for 12 hours. Drain and rinse them well. Add them to a saucepan with the water and salt and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and cover the pan and cook until the beans are tender. Drain the beans and set aside. Preheat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the oil and when it is hot, crack the eggs into the pan. When the eggs are almost cooked through, sprinkle the beans over the top and cover the pan again for 30 seconds, until the eggs are just cooked through and the beans are hot. Sprinkle the green onions and lemon over the top and serve immediately with the flatbread.

Preheat the oven to 400f. In a large bowl combine the cheese and flour. Add the butter and work in with a fork until it is crumbly. Sprinkle in the paprika and the salt.
