Cut cabbage into bite size pieces. Heat oil over medium high heat. Saute onion & garlic for 3 minutes until onions are softened. Add cabbage and salt & pepper to taste. Cover & cook for 1 minute on medium-high heat stirring constantly. Add water & cover & cook for 5 minutes until tender stirring occasionally. Drain off excess liquid. Stir in shrimp, soy sauce & crushed red pepper flakes. Cover & cook for 5 minutes stirring occasionally until shrimp are cooked through. Remove from heat & stir in fresh cilantro. Serve over hot cooked brown or white rice or ramen noodles. Serve with hot sauce if desired.

Place garlic in a small food processor or blenderprocess until finely chopped. Add next 5 ingredientsblend until smooth. Remove and stir in 2 tablespoons water. Place pork in a zip-top plastic bagadd 1/2 cup sauceturn to coat. Marinate in refrigerator 8 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 400f. Arrange pork in a single layer in a shallow 13x9x2-inch baking dishpour remaining sauce evenly over pork. Bake 1 hour 30 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 150f (about 1 1/2 inches from bone). Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into 1/2-inch-thick slices and serving.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the water, vinegar, salt, black pepper, worcestershire sauce and bring to a boil. Add the chicken pieces and reduce the heat to medium. Cover the skillet and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened. Remove the chicken from the sauce, reserving the sauce. Serve the chicken on buns with the sauce on top.
Mix cocoa mix into boiling water. Add cinnamon and vanilla. Stir until dissolved. Add milk. Add powdered coffee. Pour into cups. Top with whipped cream.

Combine cabbage, turnips, carrot and celery in a large bowl and toss gently. Combine sugar, vinegar and oil in a large bowl and whisk to blend. Stir in mustard and celery seed. Pour dressing over slaw and toss gently to coat. Cover and chill at least two hours to blend flavors. Toss before serving.

Place ground beef in bottom of slow cooker. Add onion. Sprinkle au gratin potato mix on top. Stir in cream of celery soup. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook on low for 6 hours. Top with ketchup and mustard. Serve with hot french bread.

Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add butter. When it is melted, add the onions and bell pepper. Cook for about 10 minutes until they are tender. Place a small amount of the onion mixture on each half of the sandwich buns. Top with slices of roast beef and Swiss cheese. Add the beef broth and serve.

In saucepan over medium heat cook ground beef and onion until browned. Drain. In separate saucepan over medium heat saute garlic for 30 seconds or until tender. Add beef mixture and pepper and continue cooking until meat is cooked through. Stir in soup and sauce, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 2-3 minutes. Stir in shredded cheese and jalapeno pepper. Pour into baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until they are fork tender, about 20 minutes. Drain potatoes and let them cool. While potatoes are cooling, place eggs in a pan with enough boiling water to cover the eggs by about 1 inch. Boil for 12 minutes. Drain and cool. Peel the eggs and slice them in half. Slice the hard-boiled eggs and potatoes. In a bowl mix together the potatoes and eggs. In a separate bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, sour cream, and celery seed. Add the mayonnaise mixture to the potatoes and eggs. Fold in the pickles and add salt and pepper to taste. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine the flour, oats, brown sugar, and baking soda. In a saucepan combine 1/2 cup of water, butter, and brown sugar. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add the marshmallows. Stir until the marshmallows are melted and the mixture is smooth. Pour this mixture over the dry ingredients. Spray a 13x9x2 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Spread the batter into the pan. Place the apples and caramels in the batter. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool completely and cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Layer 1/2 of the hash browns in the dish. Sprinkle 1/4 of the colby cheese evenly over the top. Layer 1/2 of the remaining shredded hash browns on top. Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 of the colby cheese evenly over the top. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the onion. Repeat the layering with the remaining 1/2 of the shredded hash browns and remaining 1/4 of the colby cheese. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the remaining onion. Sprinkle the milk evenly over the top. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the beef stock. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the garlic powder. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the salt. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the pepper. Cover with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil. Sprinkle the remaining beef stock evenly over the

Heat oil in pan and add garlic. Cook 1 minute. Add ground beef and cook until browned. Drain. Stir in tomatoes and green onion. Heat through. Place chips on serving plate and top with cheesy beef mixture. Sprinkle with salsa and top with cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven for 3 minutes.

Peel and slice the potatoes. Place the potatoes in a large pot, add cold water to cover and add 1 teaspoon of salt. Bring water to a boil and cook the potatoes until they are tender. Drain potatoes and let them cool. In a large mixing bowl add the potatoes and add the sour cream. Mix with an electric mixer until well blended. Stir in the cream cheese. Add the butter, chives and the salt and pepper. Place mixture into a greased slow cooker and cover. Cook on high 2 hours. Serve with paprika.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and rinse in cold water to stop the cooking process. In a small bowl, combine dressing and hot sauce. In a large bowl, add potatoes and dressing mixture. Toss to combine. In a large skillet over medium heat, add vegetable oil and garlic. Cook and stir until garlic is golden brown. Sprinkle with italian seasoning and season with kosher salt and pepper. Add celery and blue cheese. Cook and stir until heated through. Serve over potatoes.

Preheat broiler and line baking sheet with foil. Arrange cheese on prepared baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil and season with red pepper flakes and black pepper. Broil until lightly browned on top, about 2-3 minutes. Garnish with chopped parsley. Serve warm.

Lightly grease a baking tray. Prepare the fish by cutting it into a number of fillets. Cut up the apple into small pieces. Melt the margarine and mix in the apple and pecans. Add the raisins and cinnamon and mix well. Add the flour and stir until well blended. Add the apple juice and mix until well combined. Spread this mixture onto the fish fillets and bake in the oven for 15 minutes. Serve with mashed potato and vegetables.

Make coffee as directed in your machine. Add 6-8 strawberries and frozen strawberries to the coffee. Serve with vanilla ice cream and strawberry preserves or syrup. Place 1 scoop of ice cream in coffee mug and pour coffee over it. Top with 2 strawberries. Place 4 ice cubes in coffee mug. Mash berries with spoon and serve with strawberry preserves or syrup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel the beefsteak tomatoes. Cut into 1/2 inch pieces. Chop onion. In a large bowl, combine all the remaining ingredients. Toss well. Transfer to a baking dish. Roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes until the tomatoes are tender and the oil is bubbling around the edges. In the meantime, cook the pasta according to the package directions. Add the pasta and the roasted tomatoes to the same bowl. Toss to combine and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl stir together the corn flakes and nuts. Beat the egg whites and 2 tablespoons water in a small bowl until frothy. Dip the fish into the egg white mixture. Coat the fish with the corn flake mixture. Place fish on a cookie sheet sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Mix the soy sauce and honey and drizzle over the fish. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with lemon slices.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheets.In a large bowl, stir together brown sugar, white sugar, applesauce, and vanilla. In a separate bowl, mix together whole wheat flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Combine flour mixture into applesauce mixture with a spoon. Mix well. Fold in rolled oats. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto prepared baking sheets. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes. Cool 2 minutes before removing from pan. Store in airtight container. Makes about 24 cookies.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash potatoes but do not peel. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Cut each half in half again lengthwise. Toss potatoes in olive oil. Arrange in a single layer in baking pan. Roast in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with frozen artichokes. Drizzle with lemon juice and zest. Toss to mix well. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Salt and pepper to taste. Continue baking until potatoes are tender and artichokes are heated through. Serve hot or room temperature. Serves 6 to 8.

Peel and thinly slice the potatoes (about 1/4 inch thick). Melt the butter in a heavy-bottomed 3-quart saucepan or pot and add the sliced potatoes. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes begin to soften and become translucent (about 5 minutes). Add the oil and the onions and season with salt and pepper. Add the thyme. Add the stock and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Cook for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife (the amount of time will depend on the thickness of the potatoes). Remove the potatoes from the stock and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the heavy cream (or milk) and mash the potatoes with a potato masher or fork. Serve immediately with some stock in the center (or use the stock to make gravy).

In medium bowl combine yolks, milk and lime juice until smooth. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually add 1/2 cup of sugar while beating. Fold into lime mixture until just combined. Pour into graham cracker crust. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool completely before refrigerating 4 hours or overnight. Garnish with whipped cream and fresh lime slices.

Prepare the dough and roll it out on a floured surface. Cut into 9 x 5 inch strips. Place one strip of dough in the bottom of an 8 x 12 inch glass baking dish. Spread with 1/2 cup of the blueberry preserves and top with half of the blueberries and pecans. Top with another strip of dough and repeat the layering process with remaining ingredients. In a small bowl mix together the lemon peel, powdered sugar and water until the glaze is of drizzling consistency. Drizzle the glaze over the top of the baking dish. Bake for 40 minutes or until the rolls are golden brown. Cool slightly before cutting and serving.

Slice daikon radish into thin matchstick pieces and blanch in boiling water for about 1 minute. Drain and set aside. Cook the noodles according to the package directions. Drain and set aside. In a small skillet over medium heat, fry the ham in a little butter until crisp. Drain and set aside. Beat the eggs and the daikon sprouts with salt and pepper. Pour into a 10-inch skillet and add the daikon radish and ham. Cook over medium heat until the eggs are set. Add the pasta and sprinkle with parmesan. Serve hot.

Brown beef and mushrooms in skillet. Add potatoes and water. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add milk and butterheat through. Stir in seasonings. Spoon into greased 2-qt casserole. Top with cheese. Bake 350f for 20 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and golden brown. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the oil over medium heat in a large saucepan or Dutch oven and cook the onion and garlic, stirring for 2 minutes until soft. Add the turmeric and stir for 1 minute, then add the lentils and stir for about 1 minute until the lentils begin to brown on the surface. Pour over the stock and crushed tomatoes, then stir and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes until the lentils are soft and the soup is creamy, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat and stir in the coconut milk and ginger and season with freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately.

Season tuna steaks by rubbing them with old bay seasoning on both sides, and let sit while you prepare the sauce. Heat up light olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Place tuna steaks in skillet and sear them on both sides for 2 minutes per side. After 4 minutes, turn tuna steaks over again and add 1 tbsp honey and 1 tbsp lime juice to skillet. Turn tuna steaks over once again and add 1 tbsp honey and 1 tbsp lime juice to the other side of the tuna. Once tuna steaks are cooked to your desired doneness, remove them from the skillet, top them with 3 fresh basil leaves and drizzle the sauce from the skillet all over them. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Divide the pizza sauce into 2 bowls. Sprinkle 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese over the bottom half of each French roll. Sprinkle 1/2 of the pepperoni over the cheese. Spread a thin layer of pizza sauce over the pepperoni. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the sauce. Top each pizza with the remaining pepperoni. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Mix together the first four ingredients in a small bowl. Coat the salmon with half of the mixture. Reserve the other half of the glaze. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes. Remove and brush with the remaining glaze. Return to the oven for 2 minutes. Serve with rice.

Cream together the butter and sugar. Add the milk and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Add the flour and the cocoa. Mix well. Add the oats and the coconut. Mix well. Divide the dough into three equal pieces. Take one piece and roll into 1-inch balls. Place about 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Let cool for 2 minutes. Makes 24 cookies.

Grease a 13x9-inch pan. Mix first 5 ingredients. Spread in pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Stir. Cool. Cut into 1-1/2 inch bars. Top with mini chocolate chip and skor English toffee bit. Cool. Wrap individually. Yield: 48 bars.

Steam the cauliflower over medium heat for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Drain well. Place the cauliflower in a large bowl. Add celery, hard-boiled egg, green onion, bacon, and garlic. Toss well. Combine sour cream, mayonnaise, buttermilk, vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper in another bowl. Add to the vegetables, and stir well. Chill. Yields 8 servings.

Trim the asparagus ends. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high. Add the asparagus and cook, stirring frequently, until it begins to brown around the edges. Add the peppers, onion and garlic and cook, stirring frequently until the peppers begin to soften and brown. Drizzle with roast garlic vinaigrette dressing and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Cook over low heat. Stir until smooth. Serve hot over fish or chicken.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Cut the squash in half and place on a cookie sheet cut side down and bake for 45 minutes. In a large pot melt butter and saute leeks until tender. Add curry powder and cumin and cook for 1 minute. Add chicken stock and sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until squash is tender 45 minutes. Working in batches, puree soup in a blender or food processor. Stir in whipping cream and season with salt and white pepper. Serve hot or cold garnished with fresh herbs and serve with toasted bread for dipping.

Cook penne in boiling water until just tender. Drain pasta reserving 1/2 cup pasta water. Meanwhile, in a non-reactive skillet over medium high heat, cook sun-dried tomatoes in 1 tablespoon oil until tomatoes are softened and liquid is evaporated, about 10 minutes. Stir in basil and garlic, cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Stir in pasta, 1/2 cup reserved pasta water, and red pepper flakes. Season with salt to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature topped with Parmesan cheese.

Cut avocado into wedges. Mix celery with mayonnaise, hot sauce, pepper, salt and lemon juice. Arrange avocado and lettuce on bottom of plate. Place cooked chicken on top. Drizzle dressing over top. Serve with egg slices.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the mashed potatoes and cheese. Stir in egg until moist. Sprinkle in bacon. With moistened hands, shape potato mixture into 12 patties. Roll in bread crumbs. Place in an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until browned and crisp. Serve immediately.

Mix together chicken broth, orange juice, honey, teriyaki sauce, mustard and the remaining ingredients. Place the chicken breasts in a slow cooker. Pour the orange juice mixture over the breasts. Cover the slow cooker and cook on high for four hours.

In a large skillet brown hamburger and drain. Add taco seasoning and sour cream. In a large bowl combine the meat mixture with the dressing mix. Transfer to a serving dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with lettuce, tomato and sour cream.

Boil noodles until done, drain and set aside. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet. Add ginger and scallions and stir fry for 1-2 minutes. Add noodles and oyster sauce. Stir fry for a few minutes more and then add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
In a small bowl, combine the cilantro, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, white onion, red pepper, lime juice, salt, and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare crust by combining carrots with butter and cooking over low heat until soft. Mix carrots with onion and cook until soft and translucent. Add curry powder and cook until well mixed. Beat eggs. Stir in milk and add to carrot mixture. Add cheese and paprika to taste. Pour into an 8-inch pie plate and bake for 35 minutes or until set.

Place all the beans and their liquid in a large saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Cover and reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the beans are very tender and the liquid has reduced by about half, about 40 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and season to taste with salt and black pepper. Let cool a bit and then puree with a hand held blender until smooth. Serve warm or cold with kalamata olives or green olives and extra virgin olive oil.

Mix ham with pork and beef. Add eggs and milk to mixture and mix well. Add 3 T. of graham cracker crumbs. Divide into 16 balls and roll in crumb mixture. Brown in butter. Combine remaining cracker crumbs with tomato soup. Pour 3 T. of the sauce over the meatballs. Combine vinegar and brown sugar. Pour over top and sprinkle with mustard.

Beat the eggs in a large bowl with the cream, salt and cracked black pepper until smooth. Melt the butter in a large heavy-based frying pan. Add the eggs to the pan. Fry for 2 minutes or until the eggs begin to set. Add the herbs. Fold gently. Pour into a warm serving dish. Serve on toasted bagels with smoked salmon. Serves 4.

Crush oreo cookies in a food processor until they are fine crumbs. Combine crumbs with melted butter in a medium mixing bowl. Press mixture into bottom of 9 inch spring form pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 C) for 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Beat cream cheese and granulated sugar in a mixer until smooth and creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time, making sure to scrape down sides of bowl after each egg. Stir in vanilla extract and orange zest. Pour filling over cooled crust. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 C) for 30 to 35 minutes or until filling is set. Cool in pan on wire rack. Combine white chocolate and orange juice in a small saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally until melted. Cool slightly, and pour over cheesecake. Refrigerate overnight. Top with cranberries.

In a blender combine 1 cup water, 2 cups ice, lime juice and 1 cup frozen limeade concentrate. Add tequila and triple sec. Cover and blend until smooth. Pour into 2-quart pitcher. Add salt and serve with lime wedges.

Mix together dry ingredients and place in large bowl. Cut butter into dry mixture using a pastry blender or two knives until mixture looks like coarse crumbs. In small bowl, mix blueberries and apples togetherstir in flour mixture until well combined. Spread mixture into an 8-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with topping and bake at 375 degrees for 50 minutes or until topping is lightly browned and fruit is bubbly. Remove from oven and let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In medium skillet, saute pepperoni, onion and peppers until crisp-tender. In small bowl mix eggs, rice, salt and pepper. In 9-inch pie plate or heavy skillet coated with nonstick cooking spray, pour egg mixture. Cook over medium heat until set. Cut into 4 wedges or squares.

In large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in rice and cook until rice is coated with butter. Stir in broth. Bring to boil, reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 18-20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with fork. Stir in raisins and almonds. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle cornstarch into a blender. Add the shallot. Cover and process until smooth. Add champagne and lemon juice. Cover and process until smooth. Add the cheeses. Cover and process until smooth. Transfer mixture to a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture coats the back of a spoon. Stir in nutmeg and pepper. Serve with baguette slices.

Spread hummus over pizza crust. Top with chicken, all purpose seasoning, diced tomato, onions. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Bake at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) for 12 minutes. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake an additional 3 minutes. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Arrange wings on a cookie sheet. Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Stir well to dissolve the sugar. Pour over wingstoss to coat thoroughly. Bake for 40 minutes or until the wings are cooked through. Serve with blue cheese or ranch dressing.

Saute mushrooms and garlic in the vegetable oil until the mushrooms are well-browned. Stir in the Tamari soy sauce and pepper and cook for a minute longer. Add the water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the cornstarch dissolved in water and cook for another minute or two until the gravy thickens. Serve over rice or noodles and add some chopped parsley as a garnish if you like. Serves about four.

Place the warm water in the pan of your bread machine. Add yeast and salt. Select dough settingstart machine. When machine has completed first rise, remove dough from pan to floured surfacedivide into four equal parts. Roll each part into a rectangle about 1/4 inch thick. Stack on a baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap or with a damp tea towel and set aside. Roll remaining dough into four rectanglesstack on baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap or damp tea towel and set aside. Bake rolls at 400 degrees Fahrenheit for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Makes four 9 x 5 loaves.

Cook pasta according to package directions until tender. Drain. Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat until hot. Add onion and mushroomscook for about 5 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Add chicken to skilletcook for about 5 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Stir in frozen vegetablescook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in dressingcook for 1 minute. Stir in pastacook for 2 minutes or until heated through, tossing occasionally. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving. Makes 6 main-dish servings or 8 side-dish servings.

Cook potatoes according to package directions. Drain and return to pot. Melt butter. Stir mashed potatoes with butter. Add cream cheese, egg, onions, pimiento, garlic, salt and pepper. Spoon into lightly greased 8x8x2 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until lightly browned. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into 4 rows by 4 rows. Makes 16 servings.
In a large serving bowl combine lettuce, oranges and almonds. In another bowl whisk together oil, vinegar, black pepper and salt. Drizzle over salad before serving.
Mix all ingredients. Roll into 4 patties. Fry in skillet until done. Serve on toast.

Cook fettuccine according to directions on package. Drain and set aside. In a saucepan, melt butter and add cream cheese. Cook over medium heat until melted and well combined, stirring constantly. Stir in milk and cook until smooth and thickened. Add vegetables and parsley and heat through. Serve over fettuccine pasta. Top with shredded parmesan cheese if desired.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Remove the rind and the white pith from the oranges with a sharp knife. Cut the oranges into wedges, reserving the juice. In a large baking dish arrange the orange wedges in a single layer. In a small bowl combine the Grand Marnier, ice cream and the orange juice. Spread the orange slices with the mixture. Sprinkle with the cinnamon. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with the mint. Serve immediately.

Slice bread in half horizontally and spread with mayonnaise. Add lettuce to one half and bacon to the other half. Place the lettuce half on a plate and add pineapple to the bacon half. Top with cheese and place on lettuce half. Press together to make a sandwich and serve.
Blend onion with yoghurt. Add remaining ingredients. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve cold with crackers.

Add all the ingredients to the bread pan in the order recommended by the manufacturer of your bread machine. Select the dough cycle on your machine. When the cycle is complete, remove the dough from the machine, and shape it into two loaves. Place the loaves on the baking sheet. Let the loaves rise until doubled. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until bread is browned.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spread 1/2 tablespoon olive oil on both sides of each chicken. In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, oregano and both salts until well blended. Rub each chicken with half of the mixture. Place chickens in a roasting pan with sides and bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until the chickens are done. Remove from oven and let rest for 5 minutes. Serve with lemon slices.

In a large skillet cook ground beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain fat. Return meat to skillet and stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve on toasted buns. Makes 6 servings.

In a food processor, combine bread with 1/4 cup butter. Process until fine crumbs form. Add yogurt or sour cream. Process until moistened. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. Top with fruit. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Cover ham bone with cold water, bring to boiling and cook for 5 minutes. Drain and cool bone. Pick meat off bone and return bone to pot with beans and cover with water. Bring to boiling and cook about an hour or until tender. Remove bone and add onion, mustard, vinegar, molasses and chili sauce. Simmer 15 minutes and serve hot. Serves 8.

Brown ground beef. Add onion. Add green beans & mushrooms. Stir. Add cream of mushroom soup & milk. Bring to a boil. Add tater tots. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover with brown gravy mix. Bake 350 for 35 minutes.

Cook macaroni according to package directions for al dente. Drain and rinse under cold running water. In a large bowl, stir together cheese and milk until smooth and creamy. Add macaroni, black pepper and green chilies. Stir until thoroughly combined. Divide macaroni mixture into an ungreased 13 x 9-inch baking pan or shallow 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle evenly with corn chips. Bake at 350 degrees f for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine chutney, rum, cinnamon, allspice, and salt. Rub over both sides of pork tenderloinset aside. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heatbrown pork tenderloin on both sides. Place tenderloin in a shallow baking dish. Bake 12 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 155 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer. Remove tenderloin from ovencover with foil. Brush both sides of tenderloin with chutney mixturebake 10 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 170 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer. Remove from ovenlet stand 5 minutes.

In a heavy-bottom skillet over medium-low heat, add oil. When oil is hot, add shallots and cook for about 5 minutes or until they are softened. Add garlic and cook for another minute or so. Add cabbage to the skillet. Add 2 tbsps water, horseradish and salt and pepper. Cover the skillet and let it cook for about 30 minutes or until the cabbage is soft. Add wine vinegar, lemon juice and cook uncovered for another 5 minutes or so. Transfer the cabbage to a serving dish and sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving.

Combine butter, water and sugar in a large saucepan over low heat until the butter has melted. Add the chocolate morsels and stir until melted. Cool for 5 minutes. Add the vanilla and beat until smooth. Beat in the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir in the eggs and mix until combined. Stir in the nuts and pour into a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Drizzle the glaze over the brownies. Let cool for 15 minutes before cutting.

Rhubarb, cut into pieces. Put rhubarb into a large stainless steel pot. Add water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil rhubarb until tender. Drain rhubarb. Add sugar and mix well. Bring to a boil. Boil until thick. Add blueberry pie filling and mix well. Add red jello. Mix well. Pour into jars. Put lids on jars. Seal jars. Process in a hot water bath canner for 10 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 350F. In a small bowl stir together the soup and sour cream. In another small bowl combine the biscuits and parsley. Divide the soup mixture among four miniature muffin cups. Top with chicken and biscuit mixture. Bake for 15 minutes or until biscuits are golden. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Beat egg whites in a shallow bowl until foamy. Combine spices in a second shallow bowl. Dip cheerios in egg whites then coat in spices. Spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Spread cheerios out on baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Turn oven off. Leave cheerios in oven until cool. Store in an airtight container.

Remove outer leaves of the cabbage and set aside. Slice remaining leaves into very thin strips. In a skillet over medium heat, saute the cabbage strips in the bacon drippings until tender, about 5 minutes. Add onion, garlic and seasonings and saute for another minute. Add the beef stock. Simmer for another few minutes until liquid has reduced by half. Remove the skillet from heat and stir in tomato soup until combined. Pour into the casserole dish. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20 minutes until browned and bubbly. Serve with rice or noodles.

Mix ground beef, basil leaves, mayonnaise and garlic in medium bowl until well blended. Divide into 8 portions and form into patties. Spread five cheese blend over each pattytop with more basil leaves and bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Serve on hamburger buns with sliced tomatoes, pepperoncini peppers and lettuce.

In a large bowl, whisk together eggs. Season well. Add the spinach leaves to the eggs. Mix well. Spray a nonstick frying pan or skillet with cooking spray. Heat over medium heat. Pour the egg mixture into the pan. Cook for a few minutes. When the edges start to set, add the onions. Cook for a few minutes more. Add the cheese. Cook until the omelet is set and the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place the potatoes in a saucepan and cover with water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil over high heatreduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and set aside. Meanwhile, heat oil in heavy medium skillet over medium heat. Add onions, season with salt and pepper. Cook onions, stirring occasionally, until soft and golden brown, 30 to 40 minutes. Stir in potatoes and creme fraiche. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Transfer to an ovenproof dishsprinkle with parsley. Bake until potatoes are heated through, about 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Spread crackers in bottom of 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Melt butter in microwave oven on high 1 minute. Stir in brown sugar. Cook over high heat, stirring constantly, until mixture boils. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Add chocolate chipsstir until completely melted. Pour over crackers. Spread evenly. Let stand until set, about 1 hour. Cut into 24 bars. Store in airtight container.

Brown ground meat, onion and tomato paste. Drain meat mixture and set aside. In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine macaroni with the soups. Add the ground meat mixture. Stir in the Velveeta cheese. Pour into a 2-qt. casserole. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Slice salami and layer with American cheese on bottom half of buns. Top with onions. Top with remaining half of buns. Slice buns diagonally in half. Spread barbecue sauce on cut sides of buns. Serve with extra barbecue sauce.

Slice the mushrooms into very thin slices. Heat up 4 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil. Saute the mushrooms for 2 minutes and add the sea salt. Add the sherry wine and cook until the liquid is reduced. Remove from heat. Put the mayonnaise in a small bowl and add the sherry wine and the juice of half a lime. Serve the tapas in 4 toast bread slices. Cut the slices of bread into quarters. Place a piece of toast bread on the serving plate and top with a slice of mushrooms. Drizzle the top with the alioli. Sprinkle with the sea salt and serve. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 180C. Heat oil in large non-stick frypan and add onions and red capsicum until tender. Stir in the soup, water and season with salt and pepper. Add the sweetcorn to the pan and stir through. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Lay the chicken breasts on a lightly floured surface. Take each breast and place it between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and beat with mallet until flat and even. Lay a piece of smoked salmon lengthways along the centre of each chicken breast and then roll up into a tight cylinder shape. Place the chicken in the baking dish and pour the soup mixture over the top of the breasts. Bake for 25 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Serve with the soup mixture spooned over the chicken breasts.

In a small bowl or liquid measuring cup combine 2 cups of long-grain rice and 3 cups of water. Set aside.In a large skillet or wok over high heat, cook bacon until evenly browned and crisp, stirring occasionally. Drain on paper towels. In same skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over high heat. Add onion and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Add rice and stir to coat. Pour in egg and mix well. Cook until egg is set and no liquid remains. Stir in bacon. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve sprinkled with scallions and sesame oil.

Combine crushed cookies with butter and press into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. Prepare lemon pudding mix according to package directions and pour over the cookie crust. Chill until set. Fold together the cool whip and lemon drop candy and spread over the top of the pie. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before cutting and serving.

In a heavy-bottomed kettle over medium heat, combine the molasses and water. Stirring constantly, bring to a rolling boil. Add the licorice root. Stir well and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain into a bowl. Remove any grit that has settled on the bottom of the bowl. Add the anise and stir well. In a small bowl, combine the flour and icing sugar. Add to the molasses mixture and stir until smooth. Pour into an 8 x 8-inch pan. Chill for at least 3 hours before cutting into 1-inch squares. Makes 2 pounds.

In a small bowl combine mustard, horseradish and worcestershire sauce. Spread over both sides of ribs and tenderize. Let stand for 30 minutes. Grill ribs over hot coals until done to taste. Makes 4 servings.

Cook sausage in a large dutch oven over medium-high heat until no longer pinkdrain. Add broth. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in spinach until wilted. Add italian dressing mixstir. Serve immediately. Garnish with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Cut the ends off the zucchini. Slice the rest of the zucchini into 1/2 inch thick rounds. Beat the egg and parmesan cheese together. Coat the zucchini with the egg mixture. Sprinkle with the herb and garlic seasoning. Bake on a greased baking sheet at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes or until browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Pierce potatoes several times with fork, place in baking dish with 1/2-inch water in bottom of pan. Bake 1 hour or until tender. Remove from water and cool slightly. Peel skin off potatoes. Mash potatoes and add remaining ingredients. Mix until well blended and creamy.

With a paring knife, cut out the tops of the tomatoes and scoop out and discard seeds and juice. Place tomato halves in a baking dish and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle each tomato with fresh herbs and parmesan cheese. In a small bowl, combine garlic and olive oil and spread over tomatoes. Sprinkle with pepper and bake uncovered until cheese is bubbly and tomatoes are tender, about one hour.

Peel and finely chop onions. Heat oil and fry onions for 5 minutes. Add garlic and fry for a further 3 minutes. Add vinegar and rosemary. Cook for 5 more minutes. Season to taste. Serve at room temperature with a pinch of black pepper sprinkled over. Serves 4 as an appetizer or side dish.

Cut 1lb beef into 2x4 pieces and combine with 1/4 cup stuffing. Form into 12 meatballs and place on baking sheet or cookie sheet (they will be frozen). Combine 1/2 cup stuffing, 2 eggs and 1/2 cup buttermilk in a bowlstir well. Pour over meatballscover and refrigerate overnight or freeze up to 1 month. Cook in 350f oven for 20-25 minutes or until stuffing is browned and cooked through. Serve with ketchup.

Cut tenderloin into 1-inch cubes. Combine paprika, cumin and cayenne in a small bowl. Rub into tenderloin. Let stand 10 minutes. Thread meat onto skewers. Heat grill pan over medium-high heat until hot. Brush both sides of skewers with oil. Grill 6 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Mix graham cracker crumbs and butter in a medium sized bowl until well blended. Press mixture into an ungreased 9x13 inch pan. Bake in preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until crust is light brown. Cool completely on wire rack. Combine brown sugar and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring mixture to boil and boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in pecans until evenly coated with caramel mixture. Pour caramel mixture over graham cracker crust and cool completely on wire rack. Cut into squares. Makes about 2 dozen

For the crusts, combine the clam juice and potato and carrot in a saucepan over medium heat. Boil for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Cream together the clams and clam juice. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Add the cream and simmer until thickened. Add the salt and pepper. Pour into the pie crusts. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, cook butter and garlic until garlic is golden brown, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in parsley and seasoning salt and white pepper until well blended. Add spaghetti and whipping cream and mix well. Add parmesan cheese and mix well. Serve immediately, garnished with bacon pieces.

Cream together crisco, brown sugar and granulated sugar. Beat in eggs one at a time. Combine flour with baking soda and salt. Add to creamed mixture slowly. Mix well. Add vanilla extract. Drop by spoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack. Melt peanut butter chips with shortening or butter. Add nuts if desired. Drizzle on top of cookies when cool.

Mix reduced-fat cream cheese with yogurt until smooth. Add sun-dried tomato. Add chili sauce. Stir in green bell pepper and green onion. Add garlic clove. Add celery seed. Add ground red pepper. Chill. Serve with celery sticks.

Season trout with salt and white pepper. Lay trout in a baking dish and sprinkle with dill. Bake trout in oven for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. In the meantime, combine cream and lemon juice. When the fish has cooked, pour cream mixture over the fish. Cover and bake until fish is flaky and tender. Serve fish over toast or crackers.

Put the flour in a large mixing bowl. Make a well in the centre. Add the yeast, sugar, butter, warm water. Mix together until a smooth dough is formed. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Place in a lightly oiled bowl, cover with cling film and leave to rise for 1 hour in a warm place. Pre-heat the oven to 200 degrees C/gas mark 6. Knock back the dough on a lightly floured surface and divide into 4 pieces. Shape each piece into a ball. Place on a baking tray lined with baking parchment. Leave to prove for a further 30-40 minutes in a warm place. Bake for 20-25 minutes in the pre-heated oven until well risen. Remove from the oven and leave to cool on a wire rack.

In a large mixing bowl combine the water with the oil, honey, salt, sugar and yeast. Let sit for 5 minutes to activate the yeast. Add the bread flour and whole wheat flour. Mix with a wooden spoon or electric mixer to form a soft dough. Place the dough in a bowl coated with olive oil. Cover with plastic wrap and let sit in a warm place until doubled in size. This can take up to 2 hours. Punch down the dough. Divide the dough into 8 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and place onto a lightly floured surface. Place 2 balls of dough together. Roll the dough out into a long rectangle. Cut the dough into 1 inch wide strips. Twist the strips into a braid. Place the braid onto a lightly floured baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap. Let rise for another hour. Preheat the oven to 350. Bake the bread for 20 minutes. Cool the bread completely before serving.
Combine all ingredients except the carrot and green beans in a slow cooker. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Add green beans and carrot to slow cooker and cook for 1 hour more. Serve with toasted bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease or line 12 muffin cups.Combine squash, wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, brown sugar, and pumpkin pie spice in a large bowl. In another bowl, stir together milk and egg. Add milk mixture to squash mixture and stir just until moistened. Spoon into prepared muffin cups.Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 20 minutes.

Cook meatballs in a small amount of water until they are no longer pink (or follow your package directions for cooking). Drain and return to pot or pan you cooked them in. Stir in gravy mix until completely dissolved and meatballs are coated. Stir in soup until completely dissolved. Stir in sour cream until well mixed and heated through (I just add it all at once). Serve immediately over noodles or on crackers or with whatever you like with it. Can also be used as a base for spaghetti sauce or as a dip for veggies. Serves 4-6.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two baking sheets. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla extract. Sift together the flour and baking sodagradually stir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the almonds and candied orange peel. Divide the dough in halfshape each half into a long log. Wrap the logs in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). On a lightly floured surface, roll the logs to 1/2-inch thickness. Use a sharp knife to cut the logs crosswise into 1/2-inch slices. Place the cookies 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool on wire racks.

In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, combine butter, salt, pepper and garlic powder and onion powder and cook for about 5 minutes until butter is melted and liquid has reduced by half. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, combine cabbage, liquid from melted butter, salt and pepper and cook for about 1 hour until cabbage is tender and liquid has evaporated. Stir occasionally. Serve hot.

In saucepan, combine the ketchup, brown sugar, mustard and worcestershire sauce. Bring to boil over med-high heat. Reduce heat to med-low. Cook until thickened to the consistency of bar b q sauce. Store in an air tight container in fridge.

Preheat oven to 350f. Boil potatoes until fork tender. Rinse with cold water to stop cooking. In large bowl toss potatoes with olive oil, vinegar, mustard, and salt and pepper to taste. Lay bacon strips in a single layer on a foil lined cookie sheet. Bake until crisp about 20 minutes. Chop and toss with potatoes. Add parsley before serving.

Wash the rice well under running water to remove any dust and impurities. Soak the rice in water for 20 minutes. Add the rice and water to a large pot and bring to a boil. Turn down the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add milk and bring to a boil. Turn down the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add sugar and stir to dissolve. Add the cardamom pods and turn off the heat. Let it cool for about 15 minutes. Add the cardamom seeds and rose water. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Serve the kheer with some blanched slivered almonds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season chicken with garlic powder and salt and pepper. Place the chicken in an oven-proof dish. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove chicken from oven and set aside. Pour the sour cream into a small bowl and add the soup. Mix until smooth. Pour the mixture over the top of the chicken. Sprinkle the bacon over the top. Return to the oven and bake for about another 20 minutes or until the top is bubbly and the bacon is crispy. Serve over rice.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat and add the tomatoes and basil and cook until the tomatoes are soft and the basil wilts, about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and serve immediately or at room temperature.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add mushroom caps and saut until browned on both sides and slightly softened. Turn heat down and add butter and thyme leaves, turn heat down again and cook until mushroom is very tender and browned, about 10 minutes. Turn off heat and spoon out the mushroom filling onto one side of each slice of bread. Spread on the pesto and top with the cheese. Grill in skillet over medium heat until cheese melts and bubbles.

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat oil in nonstick skillet on med-high heat. Cook chicken breasts 3 min on each side or until done. Remove from skillet and let chicken cool. Slice chicken into strips. Add green onions and garlic to the pan and saute for 2 min. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 min. Add the chicken and cook for another 5 min.

Divide dough into four equal balls. Shape each ball into a 4" circle. Press each circle onto a greased baking sheet. Sprinkle each circle with the flour and wheat flakes. Place a cherry in the middle of each circle. Bake at 350 degrees F for 8 minutes. Cool completely.

Combine rice chex, pretzels, onion crackers, peanuts and butter in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine remaining ingredientspour over the cereal mixture and stir well until cereal is coated. Store in an air tight container for up to 2 weeks.
In a 9x13 inch baking dish, mix together all the ingredients until blended. Bake 30-40 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Lightly toast pita bread in the microwave for about 15 seconds. Peel and cut bananas into chunks. Mash bananas in small bowl with Cottage Cheese, Splenda and cinnamon. Spread mixture evenly over each pita.

Heat the butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until softened and browned, about 10 minutes. Add the apples and cook until just softened. Add the cabbage and cook until tender and just slightly browned. Add the apple cider vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss in the honey and cook for about 1 minute until the cabbage is glazed and the liquid has reduced. Serve hot.

Bring the water and oil to a boil in a large pot. Add the lentils and swiss chard. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat, and let the soup cool for about 5 minutes. In a food processor, puree the soup until smooth. Season with salt, pepper and lemon juice. Garnish with cilantro and lemon wedges for serving. Serve with warm pita bread.

In a large saute pan, heat butter and oil until melted. Add mushrooms and cook until golden brown. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Season with salt and pepper. Serve on toast.

Combine egg whites and salt. Beat at high speed of electric mixer until soft peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar, 1/2 cup at a time. Continue beating until stiff peaks form. Fold in vanilla and nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 18-20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Melt chocolate as directed on package. Dip each cookie halfway into melted chocolate. Let stand until set. Roll in coconut. Store in tightly covered container.
Peel apples and slice thinly. Toss apples with lemon juice and brown sugar. Mix with celery and pecans. Add mayonnaise. Chill until ready to serve.

In a medium size saucepan combine the gelatin with the cold water. Cook over medium low heat for about 3 to 4 minutes, stirring constantly with a whisk. Continue to cook over medium low heat for about another 4 to 6 minutes, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens. Remove from the heat and allow to cool for about a few minutes. Then stir in the sugar. Then pour the mixture into popsicle molds. Place popsicle sticks into each mold and place in the freezer for about 4 hours or overnight. Remove from the freezer and pull out the popsicle sticks. Put the popsicle sticks back into the molds and return to the freezer. When the popsicles are frozen solid you can remove them from the freezer. Take the popsicles out of the molds. They will pop out of the molds easily. If the popsicles stick to the sides of the popsicle molds run some hot tap water over the popsicles for a few seconds to loosen them. Then just pull the popsicles out of the molds. You can store the popsicles in the freezer for about

Heat oil in nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and peppercook until tender. Add beefcook until no longer pink. Add tomatoes with juicecook 1 minute stirring constantly. Stir in thymecook 1 minute more or until peas are crisp-tender. Stir in peascook 1 minute more or until heated through. Serve with hot sauce if desired.

In a small bowl, combine the taco seasoning and butter. Spread the potato sticks evenly in a single layer over a cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes until golden. When the potato sticks are done, sprinkle with the spanish peanuts and french-fried onions. Serve.

Melt butter in 8-inch skillet over medium heat. Add flour and stir until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Boil and stir 1 minute. Add cheese and dry mustard. Cook and stir until cheese is melted. Pour over toast and sprinkle with paprika. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

In a small bowl stir together 2 tablespoons sesame oil and dried red pepper flakes. Rub the mixture evenly over both sides of the chicken. In a medium bowl stir together teriyaki sauce and remaining 2 tablespoons sesame oil. Add the vegetables and toss to coat. Arrange the vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake until crisp-tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Meanwhile heat a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned and no longer pink in the middle, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Stir the vegetables and sauce and serve immediately. Serves 2.

Heat a large skillet over med-high heat. Add oil, jalapeno peppers, garlic, salt, Worcestershire sauce, cinnamon, and red wine. Cook for 3 minutes or until liquid evaporates and mushrooms are tender. Remove mushrooms from skillet and set aside. Add steaks and cook on each side for about 3 minutes or until desired doneness is reached. Remove steaks from skillet and set aside. Add mushrooms back to skillet and saute until mushrooms are coated well with sauce. Top steaks with mushroom sauce and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a loaf pan with cooking spray, or oil. In a large bowl, combine the meat, breadcrumbs, eggs, onion, milk, sauerkraut, mustard, caraway seed, salt, and pepper until well blended. Pour mixture into prepared panspread out evenly. Bake for 60 to 70 minutes until the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Allow to cool for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with cranberry sauce if desired. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Boil potatoes until tender, drain, return to pot and add butter. Mash until smooth. Heat tomatoes in microwave for a few minutes, drain. Add tomatoes to potatoes and mix well. Heat onion in butter until tender. Add to potatoes with chili sauce and green onion. Add salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with cheddar cheese.

Heat oven to 350f. Brown ground chuck in a large skillet. Drain fatstir in onions and cook until tender. Add cream of chicken soup, tomatoes with green chilies, ranch style beans, and 1/3 cup water. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until thickenedabout 5 minutes. Spoon mixture into a 2 qt casserole dish. Layer tortillas in 3 rows over meat mixturecover with cheese. Bake, uncovered 15 minutes or until heated through. Serves 6.

In a medium saucepan, combine rice and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer 20 minutes. Stir in eggnog. Bring to a boil. Add cranberries and nutmeg. Simmer for 10 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat butter until melted. Add onion and cook until tender, about 8 minutes. Stir in rice. Add water until it reaches 1/2 inch from top. Bring to a boil. Cover tightly and reduce heat. Simmer until all liquid is absorbed, about 18 minutes. Meanwhile cook ground beef in large skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. Stir in sauerkraut. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon beef mixture over rice in skillet, sprinkle with cheese and cover. Bake uncovered for about 10 minutes more or until cheese is melted and rice is tender. Serve with sour cream if desired.

In a large bowl, combine the yogurt, substitute, lemon juice, peanut butter and half the marshmallows. Chill until ready to serve. Just before serving, fold in the fruit and remaining marshmallows. Serve chilled.

Place wings in a large ziplock bag with 1/4 cup of the barbecue sauce. Close bag and let sit for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375°F. In a small bowl, mix honey and lime. Set aside. In another small bowl mix 1/4 cup flour and 1/8 cup cornstarch. In a large skillet or pan cook wings in remaining barbecue sauce for 10 minutes. Remove wings from pan and drain. Sprinkle wings with flour mixture and return to pan. Cook 3 minutes. Remove wings from pan and toss with lime mixture. Place wings on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes or until crispy. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. Serve hot with remaining sauce.

Cook spaghetti according to directions. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan. Saute black olives, red onion, green pepper, plum tomato until tender. Add chicken breasts and cook until cooked through. Remove from heat. Drain spaghetti reserving 1/3 cup liquid. Add spaghetti to chicken mixture and add feta cheese. Add vinaigrette to taste. Serve immediately.

In a large pot over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and cook until it is tender. Add the vegetable broth, pasta, diced tomatoes with their juice, kidney beans, peas, fresh basil and cheese. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook until it begins to crumble. Add the onion and cook about 2 minutes until tender. Add the eggs and baking powder and cook until the eggs are set. Turn the omelette out onto a platter and sprinkle with the cheese. Top with the spinach, roll up the omelette and place seam side down on the platter. Reheat in the microwave for a few seconds. Garnish with tomato wedges and serve.

Cream margarine until soft. Beat in brown sugar and egg until fluffy. Combine flour, baking powder, and saltstir into margarine mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheetsbake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Beat together butter and marzipan. Beat in the egg yolks. Blend in the flour and baking powder. Beat in the almond extract. Add the egg whites and beat until stiff. Pour batter into a greased 10-inch tube pan and bake in a pre-heated oven for 50-60 minutes at 350 degrees F.

In a skillet saute onion and green bell pepper in margarine until tender. In a small bowl beat together egg yolks, milk and picante saucestir into onion mixture. Add canadian baconheat through. Spread pizza crust with margarinesprinkle with half of the cheese. Arrange canadian bacon mixture over cheese. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 375 degrees F. for 20 minutes or until crust is done. Sprinkle with cilantro. Makes 1 serving.

In a large bowl, combine apples, brown sugar blend, cinnamon, salt and water. Add butter and mix. Spread apple mixture into a 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 375f for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners. Stir together oats and 1 cup buttermilk in large bowl. Let stand 10 minutes. Add eggs and brown sugarstir until combined. Stir in butter, flour, baking powder and salt. Stir in baking sodastir just until dry ingredients are moistened. Add raisins and nuts. Fill cups two-thirds full. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until tops are golden and wooden pick inserted in centers comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Serving.
Combine all ingredients except gelatin in a large bowl. Pour into 9×13-inch pan. Sprinkle gelatin over mixture. Add hot water. Refrigerate 2 hours.

In large pot add all ingredients except bananas and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Peel bananas and slice lengthwise in halves or quarters depending on size of bananas. Place bananas in jars leaving 1/2 inch headspace, pour hot syrup over bananas, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Seal jars with lids. Process 10 minutes in a boiling water canner. Makes approximately 6 pints.
Mix bananas and sugar together. Add beaten eggs and margarine. Add cake flour and salt. Add baking soda. Mix well. Pour into a greased bread pan. Bake at 350F for 1 hour or until done. Let cool.

In a bowl combine milk and water. Add pudding mix and stir for 2 minutes. Let set for 5 minutes. Fold in cool whip. Spoon into serving glasses or bowls. Top with mini chips. Sprinkle on wafer crumbs. Refrigerate. Serves 6.

Preheat the grill or broiler, while it is heating up slice the vegetables in 1/2 inch slices, I use a mandolin slicer and it makes it very easy. In a shallow bowl whisk the lemon juice, mustard, worcestershire sauce, seasoning, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp pepper and the garlic together until well blended. Add the vegetables to the bowl and coat them well with the marinade, cover and let them marinate while the grill is heating up. When the grill is ready brush the grill with the oil and place the vegetables on the grill cut side down. Grill until the vegetables are tender. They will take about 30 minutes depending on the size of the vegetables. Serve with a green salad tossed with a balsamic dressing.

Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente. Drain well. In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the heavy cream until smooth. Add the fettuccine, 2 cups at a time, stirring well. Add the smoked salmon and toss well. Add the Parmesan cheese. Add the salt and black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
Place all in crock pot. Cover and cook for 8 hours. Serve over pasta.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add tomatoes and green pepper and cook until softened. Add eggs and feta. Cook until eggs are scrambled. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with crusty bread.

In a large bowl combine the graham cracker crumbs with the cinnamon and the sugar. Press the mixture into the bottom of 8 paper-lined muffin cups. Bake until set. In the meantime make the lemon layer by combining the yogurt with the cocoa. Beat until well blended. Pour over the cooled crust and freeze. Make the chocolate layer by combining the yogurt with the cocoa and the sugar. Beat until well blended. Pour over the frozen lemon layer and freeze until firm. Sprinkle with toasted coconut if desired. Serve chilled.

Cook noodles according to package directions for al dente. Drain. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger. Cook until fragrant. Stir in soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil and water chestnuts. Cook for about 1 minute. Stir in noodles and green onions. Cook for about another minute. Serve.

Place all of the ingredients into a bread pan in the order recommended by your bread machine manufacturer. Select the basic cycle and start the machine. When the cycle is complete, remove the bread from the pan. Allow to cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Remove the bread from the pan and place it on a wire rack to cool completely. Slice and serve.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and garlic clove. Cook about 5 minutes. Add lamb and stir over medium heat 6 minutes. Add bouillon and water. Bring to a boil over high heat then reduce heat to low. Simmer 10 minutes or until meat is tender, stirring occasionally. Add spinach and oregano. Cover. Heat through stirring occasionally until spinach is wilted and tender. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice and feta cheese. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Heat margarine in skillet on medium high heat. Mix bread crumbs, egg and parsley together in small bowl. Dip each chicken breast half into egg mixture and then coat with bread crumb mixture. Place in skillet and brown on both sides. Spoon spaghetti sauce on top of each breast half and sprinkle with cheese. Place in oven and bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and chicken is no longer pink in center when checked with knife. Serve on top of cooked spaghetti.

Brown the ground beef in a large skillet. Drain fat. Add the onion and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the tomato sauce, oregano, garlic, corn and water. Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 10 minutes. Remove 1 cup of the mixture to a small bowl. Add the mashed potatoes to the remaining mixture and stir until well mixed. Pour the mixture into a 2-quart baking dish. Spread the topping evenly over the potato mixture. Bake in 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 25 minutes.

Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat and add onion and spices. Cook until soft. Add rice and cook until golden, about 5 minutes. Add water, cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce to a low simmer and cook for 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender but firm. Remove from heat and add raisins and season with salt and pepper to taste. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

Peel lemons and oranges. Cut into thin slices and remove seeds. Bring 2 cups water and 2 cups sugar to the boil and dissolve the sugar. Add the citric and tartaric acid and lemon and orange peel and cook for 10 minutes. Then add the fruit and cook a further 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Strain through muslin and pour into sterilized bottles or jars and seal.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper or silicone cupcake liners. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking soda. Set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs and sugar. Add the cooking oil and whisk until well blended. Add the pumpkin puree and whisk until smooth. Stir in the flour mixture just until blended. Fold in the cranberries. Fill the muffin cups two-thirds full. Sprinkle the muffin tops with pumpkin pie spice. Bake until the muffins are golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Cool the muffins in the pan for 5 minutes and then remove them from the pan and cool on a wire rack. These are best served the day they are made. Yield 12 muffins.

Heat butter and olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add tilapia and cook 1 minute on each side. Sprinkle with flour and toss in pan. Cook and stir until fish is browned and coated with flour. Stir in wine. Cook 2 minutes or until liquid is reduced to about 1/2 cup. Stir in lime juice and green onions. Serve with lime wedges.

In a small saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Add flour and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add milk slowly to avoid lumps. Bring to a simmer and cook over medium-low heat until thickened. Stir in nutmeg and remove from heat. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg to taste. Peel potatoes, then cut them into 1/2-inch slices. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Drain well. Add potatoes to a medium skillet with the butter. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in the sauce and continue to cook until sauce thickens slightly. Stir in Parmesan until well blended. Serve immediately.

Prepare miso sauce by mixing together mirin, seasoned rice vinegar, soy sauce and water in a medium size bowl. Stir in green onions and sesame seeds and set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add scallops and cook for 1-2 minutes until golden brown on each side. Remove from heat and add butter and mustard to skillet and swirl to combine. Add scallops to skillet and toss to coat with sauce. Serve immediately over hot cooked rice with a spoonful of miso sauce over top. Garnish with sliced green onion and sesame seeds if desired.

Place chicken breasts on a plate and set aside. In a medium bowl combine artichoke hearts, olives, tarragon and garlic. Mix well. Place chicken on a baking sheet. Baste chicken with half the marinade. Bake 10 minutes. Turn chicken and baste with remaining marinade. Bake 10 minutes longer. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foilspray with nonstick cooking spray. Peel 1 lb of the potato and cut it into 1-inch pieces. Toss the pieces in a large bowl. Add the oiltoss again. Transfer the potato to the prepared baking sheet. Bake until the potato is tender when pierced with a knife, 20-30 minutes. In the meantime, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until just fragrant, 30 seconds. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the paprikastir. Remove the potato from the oven and add the paprika mixture. Toss well. Return the potato to the oven and bake until crispy. Remove the potato from the oven. Sprinkle the potato with the cheesetoss gently. Serve immediately. Sprinkle each serving with croutons.

Heat oven to 375f. In a small saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add the black peppercorns and cook until the butter is a light brown and the peppercorns are very dark and toasted, about 2 minutes. Stir in the vegetable stock and whisk until smooth. Set aside. In a large bowl, toss the sprouts with the olive oil, hazelnuts and some salt. Spread the sprouts onto a baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the black pepper butter and roast for 5 minutes more.

Heat the olive oil in a large saut pan over medium high heat. Add the onions and the peppers. Saut for 2 minutes or until the vegetables are crisp tender. Add the tomatoes. Saut for 2 minutes or until the tomatoes begin to soften. Add the capers and the olives and the herb. Saut for 1 minute. Season with the salt and pepper. Add the flounder fillets and cover the pan with a lid. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until the fish is browned and opaque. Sprinkle with the chopped herbs. Serve immediately.

Combine strawberries and white grape juice concentrate in a large saucepan. Add lemon juice and lemon rind. Bring mixture to a boil. Boil hard for 5 minutes. Add gelatin. Stir constantly until gelatin dissolves. Cool. Pour into sterilized jars. Makes 4 to 5 pints.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic cloves and coriandercook 1 minute. Stir in chicken brothbring to a boil. Add lentilscoverreduce heat to low. Cook 15 minutes. Add bay leavescook 15 minutes more. Add potatoescovercook 20 minutes more. Add sausagecovercook 5 minutes more. Stir in spinachcovercook 10 minutes more. Serve immediately.

Lightly whisk together the ricotta, egg and flour. Add the sugar and lemon zest and juice and mix well. Heat 1/2 inch of oil in a large saucepan to 350 degrees. Form the ricotta mixture into small balls and fry in the hot oil for 4 to 5 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from the oil and drain on paper towels. Serve warm or cold, drizzled with honey.

Preheat oven to 400f. Rinse potatoes. Pat dry. Rub with olive oil. Place on baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Squeeze lemon juice over potatoes. Turn chickens over. Brush with olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic. Salt. Pepper. Bake for 20 minutes. Turn potatoes. Pour 1/4 cup olive oil over potatoes. Sprinkle with oregano. Bake for 20 minutes. Pour stock over potatoes. Bake for 10 minutes more. Serve with potatoes, chicken.
Boil dried beef with eggs. Cube dried beef. Cook flour in butter till brown. Add milk and stir till smooth. Add dried beef, olives & seasoning. Simmer till thickened. Serve over biscuits or toast.
Combine pomegranate juice, red wine, honey, cinnamon sticks and cardamom pods into the crockpot. Cook on low for 4 hours. Serve in mugs with a splash of sparkling wine on top.

Peel bananas and slice them lengthwise. Toss them in the flour and egg mixture and then coat them in the panko breadcrumbs until completely covered. Heat up vegetable oil in a deep-sided sauté pan until hot and then add the bananas and cook until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and pour the semi-sweet chocolate chips into the hot oil and cook until melted and smooth. Pour the melted chocolate over the bananas and sprinkle with the ground cinnamon. Serve with whipped cream and enjoy!
Spread cream cheese on 1 side of bread. Sprinkle with garlic and parsley. Crumble bacon onto top. Roll up tightly and wrap with wax paper. Freeze for a few hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners or grease well with nonstick cooking spray. In medium bowl combine flour, sugar, macadamia nuts, baking powder, and cinnamon. Set aside. In a large bowl combine buttermilk, egg, honey, butter, and yogurt. Add dry mixture all at once, stirring just until mixed. Do not overmix. In medium bowl combine pineapple, honey, and cinnamon. Spoon 1/4 cup batter into each muffin cup and top with 1 tablespoon pineapple mixture. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and toothpick inserted into center of muffin comes out clean. Cool completely before removing from pan. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a medium bowl combine lemon juice, dijon mustard, shallot and thyme. Slowly whisk in the oil. Add the mixed greens and toss until coated. Season to taste. Arrange on a salad platter. Sprinkle with blue cheese, pear wedges, and walnuts. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375. In a small saucepan, melt the butter and add the milk. Heat until it boils and then remove from heat and cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine the bread cubes, eggs, milk mixture, sugar and salt. Mix well. Add the broccoli and the cheese. Mix well and transfer to an ungreased 9x13 baking dish. Bake for 1 hour or until the edges start to brown. Serves 4.

Prepare a jelly roll pan by spraying it with a nonstick cooking spray. Mix together crushed pineapple and raspberry gelatin, mix well, then set aside for 10 minutes to gel. In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine the raspberries, water and gelatin mixture. Bring to a boil over medium high heat for about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the sour cream and cool to room temperature. Pour the mixture onto the jelly roll pan, spreading evenly. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 1 hour or overnight. When ready to serve, spread evenly the cool whip on top of the mixture, garnish with the raspberries and serve.
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until cranberries burst. Serve warm.

Slice the ham into strips about 1/4-inch thick. Slice the onion into 1/2-inch rings and place on a paper towel to drain for 10 minutes. Slice the tomato into 1/2-inch rings and place on a paper towel for 10 minutes. Prepare the bread by brushing the cut sides with olive oil and place on a baking sheet and put in a 350 degrees F oven for 3-5 minutes or until just lightly browned. Spread the ham and onion slices evenly over the bread. Spread the tomato rings over the top of the ham and onion. Drizzle with the mayonnaise and mustard. Top with the cheese and broil for 1 minute or until the cheese is melted and lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Soak beans overnight. Rinse beans well. Place beans and pork fat in a large soup pot with enough water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour. Stir often to keep from sticking. Add onion and cook until tender. Add molasses, maple syrup and tomato paste. Stir well to combine. Add water if necessary. Stir well and cook until thick. Add mustard powder and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with baked ham.
Cut chicken into small pieces. Add celery, bell peppers, green onion. In a separate bowl add raisins, chicken, mango chutney, m.whip light. Add dressing to taste. Serve on bed of romaine lettuce.

Rinse the chicken breasts. Preheat the oven to 200C (fan). Mix the onion, mushrooms, garlic and half of the butter. Spoon onto a baking tray and bake for ten minutes until soft. Turn up the heat to 220C. Spread the remaining butter onto the chicken breasts and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Wrap each breast in a slice of bacon and place onto the baking tray. Place into the oven for around 25 minutes until cooked.

Drain grapes. In a small saucepan combine butter, brown sugar and vanilla. Bring to a boil and stir until butter has melted and sugar has dissolved. Pour over grapes and toss well to coat. Refrigerate covered about 1 hour. Stir in sour cream.

Toast pecans in a 350-degree oven for about 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Combine squash and basil in a large bowl and toss with 2 teaspoons of the olive oil and the pecans. Season with the salt and pepper. Transfer the squash to a serving platter. Drizzle with the remaining 2 teaspoons olive oil. Makes 4-6 servings.

Place one breast between 2 sheets of plastic wrap. Pound breast to 1/2 inch thickness. Repeat with remaining breasts. Melt butter in a 10 inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add breadcrumbs and parsley to skilletcook 1 minute. Add cheese and stir 2 minutes or until cheese melts. Add salt and pepper to mixture. Top 1 breast with breadcrumb mixtureplace remaining breasts on top of first breast. Place in oven. Bake at 350 for 10 to 12 minutes or until juice of 1 breast registers 170f on an instant read thermometer. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cut chicken into 2 x 4 pieces. Place into a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place 2 slices pineapple, 1/4 of the onions and peppers, 1/4 cup teriyaki sauce over each piece of chicken. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink inside. Sprinkle with remaining teriyaki sauce. Serve over rice.

In a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat add oil. Add lemon juice, zest of lemon, garlic and dried red chilies. Cook until fragrant and garlic and chilies are softened, about 3-5 minutes. Add chicken thighs and sprinkle with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is cooked through and just beginning to fall apart, about 30 minutes. Serve hot with rice or vegetables of choice.

Peel the parsnips, cut them into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Heat the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until the butter stops foaming, about 1 minute. Add the parsnips and green onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until the parsnips are softened, about 8 minutes. Add the gorgonzola and cook until the gorgonzola has melted and the parsnips are heated through, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Season to taste with pepper. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine potatoes, radishes and eggs. In another bowl combine sour cream, sugar and seasoning salt. Add garlic powder and pepper to taste. Pour over potatoes and radishes and toss until well combined. Sprinkle with fresh dill and serve at room temperature or refrigerate until serving time. Serves 6 to 8 as part of a main meal or 12 as part of a buffet.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain and return to the pot. Mash the potatoes with the onion and salt & pepper to taste. Combine the mashed potatoes with the eggs, matzo meal and baking powder. Heat the oil to 350. Form the potato mixture into 2" balls (about 1 1/2-2 tbsp of mixture) and place on baking sheet. Bake about 10 minutes until golden brown.

Season pork chops with salt and pepper to taste. Heat olive oil in frying pan and saute onion and garlic cloves until tender. Add chops and cook 4-5 minutes per side or until done. Transfer to baking dish. Add sour cream, horseradish and mustard. Mix well and top with ranch dressing. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees until bubbling around the edges. Garnish with parsley and serve with mashed potatoes.

Cut melon into bite size pieces. Add mint leaves. Combine lime juice, sugar and lemon juice in blender or food processor. Process until smooth. Pour into bowl. Add melon pieces. Chill before serving. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet, heat the oil and the butter over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Turn and brown other side. Remove chicken from skillet. Add the onions and garlic and cook until the onions are soft. Add the tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the wine and vinegar. Return the chicken to the skillet and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Stir in the capers and the tarragon and transfer the chicken and tomatoes to a shallow baking pan. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes. Serve hot with white rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Wash beets well. Peel beets by rubbing with kitchen paper. Cut into 1/2-inch roundsplace on baking sheet. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with saltroast until tender when pierced with knife or skewer (about 20 minutes).
