In a small saucepan, combine orange juice, preserves, Grand Marnier and honeybring to a boil. Simmer over medium heat until thickened (about 5 minutes). Add butterwhisk until melted. Drizzle over roasted beetsserve immediately.

In a bowl dissolve gelatin in water. Add pineapple and cranberry sauce and stir until gelatin is dissolved. Refrigerate for about 10 minutes to set. Mix in celery and walnuts. Serve over lettuce leaves and top with apple slices. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Cut potatoes into 1/4-inch thick rounds and toss with the creole seasoning. In a large ovenproof skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the hot dogs and cook until browned and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes. Add the potatoes and cook, turning once, for 3-4 minutes. Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine sugar, water and corn syrup in a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil and cook until mixture reaches 240 degrees on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla. Beat in egg whites, one at a time, until well blended and mixture is white and glossy. Pour into a 9×13 baking pan and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle peanuts over top and let cool for a few hours before cutting into slices. Store in an airtight container in fridge for 2-3 days or freeze for longer storage.

Combine the pineapple, bananas, cherry and eggnog into a large bowl. Stir until well combined. Add the instant pudding mix and fold together until the pudding is completely mixed into the pineapple mixture. Remove 1/2 of the mixture and reserve for another use. Place the remaining pineapple mixture into your trifle bowl. Place the angel food cake into the pudding mixture, pressing down to get as much cake into the mixture as possible. Place the angel food cake back into the bowl. Add the whipped cream over the angel food cake and spread evenly over the top. Sprinkle with the walnuts. Place the remaining pineapple mixture into the bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2-3 hours or until set. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add rice wine and water and bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in chicken and reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until chicken is tender. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside on a platter. Add soy sauce, brown sugar and spices to skilletbring to a boil over high heat and cook 2 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly. Pour sauce over chicken and sprinkle with scallions. Serve over rice, if desired.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Season the steak with salt and pepper and place in the pan. Cook for 6 to 8 minutes on each side for medium doneness. Transfer to a cutting board and let stand for 5 minutes. Slice the steak thinly against the grain. Toss the pasta with the red onion, mayonnaise, sour cream, prepared horseradish, and season with salt and pepper. Serve the pasta on a bed of lettuce with steak, tomatoes, broccoli florets and Parmesan cheese.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch pie pan. Roll out the pie crust and press it into the prepared pan. Layer the sliced green tomatoes in the pie crust, sprinkling the lemon juice and sugar between each layer. Dot the pie with the butter. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Let the pie cool to room temperature before serving.

Place beef in crock pot and add enough of the burgundy wine to just cover the beef. Add the garlic cloves and onion. Cook on low for about 6 hours or until beef is tender. Pour the soup in with the wine. Sprinkle the salt and black pepper over the beef and soup. Mix the flour and olive oil together and stir into the soup mixture. Cover the beef and cook on low for another 30 minutes. Serve over noodles or rice.

Beat eggs with wire whisk. Add cottage cheese, flour, baking powder and salt. Mix well. Add sugar and mix again. In small skillet or pan heat the butter. Add about a 1/4 cup of batter. Flip pancake when bubbles appear. Cook on both sides. Keep warm. Dust pancakes with powdered sugar and sprinkle with cinnamon. Makes about 24 pancakes.

Mix together the orange and pineapple gelatin mixes as directed on the package. Fold in the mandarin oranges and crushed pineapple. Refrigerate overnight. Make the topping by beating the cream cheese until fluffy and then mix in the cool whip until blended. Fold in the sugar and nuts. Spread the topping on top of the gelatin. Refrigerate overnight and serve.

Cook potatoes, cabbage and onion in chicken broth for 20 minutes. Remove from pot, set aside. Pour off any excess liquid from pot. Heat oil in pot on medium heat. Slice sausage into 1/2-inch rings and add to potcook for 3 minutes or until browned. Add cabbage mixture to pot. Season with seasoning salt, paprika and pepper to taste. Cook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately. Serves 8.

In a small bowl combine sugar, cornstarch, water, amaretto liqueur and lemon juice. Heat in a medium-sized saucepan over medium-high heat, whisking constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in almonds. Serve over ice cream or cake.

Mix vinegar and soy sauce. Set aside. Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add rice sticks and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain. Add shrimp and cook for a minute or two until pink. Remove from heat. In a large bowl mix shrimp and rice sticks with the vinegar and soy sauce. Add red pepper and snow peas. Mix well and let cool. Add cilantro and toss. Serve at room temperature. Serve with cucumber.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place 1 pie crust in a 9 inch pie plate. Mix together mustard and olive oil. Spread mixture over bottom crust. Sprinkle with cheeses. Lay tomato slices on top. Sprinkle with herbs. Top with remaining crust. Seal edges. Cut vents in top crust. Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 40 minutes or until crust is golden. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine soup, sour cream, and green chilies in a bowl. In another bowl combine the black olives with the green onion and sprinkle with cheese. Spread the soup mixture evenly in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish and top with the cheese mixture. Bake covered 30 minutesuncover and bake 15 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Serve over rice or noodles, if desired.
In a small saucepan melt the butter. Add the carrots and cook over low heat for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the basil and cook for 1 minute more. Serve immediately.
Mix butter and sugar together. Add egg. Add dates and nuts. Blend well. Place mixture in a small bowl. Form into balls. Roll in rice krispies. Store in refrigerator.

Peel and grate zucchini into a large bowl. Toss with breadcrumbs and oregano and season with salt and pepper. Add eggs and gently stir to combine. Heat oil in skillet or saute pan over medium-high heat. Form zucchini mixture into patties about 3 inches in diameter. Cook until browned and crispy outside. Remove from pan and set aside. Mix tomatoes and mint with a little yogurt. Serve fritters with tomato salsa and lemon wedges.

Slice cantaloupe and watermelon into bite sized pieces. Gently toss with grapes and orange juice. Add honey and lime juice. Toss well to combine. Serve immediately or chill for up to 4 hours. Garnish with lime peel just before serving.

Season the short ribs or pot roast with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, combine the mustard and garlicrub over the beef and marinate in the refrigerator for several hours. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch and waterset aside. In a large skillet cook the short ribs or pot roast in the olive oil until browned on all sides. Remove the meat and place in the crock pot. In the skillet add the honey and the barbecue saucecook over medium heat until thickenedstirring constantly. Pour over the short ribs or pot roast in the crock potstirring to coat. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or until the meat is tender and easily pulled apart. Remove the meat and keep warm. Stir the cornstarch and water mixture and stir into the liquid in the crock potbring to a boil and cook until thickened. Pour over the meat and serve hot. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Preheat oven 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cut cheese into star shapes using star cookie cutters. Arrange parmesan stars in a single layer on baking sheets. Bake for 2 minutes in the preheated oven, until just browned. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, onion and pepper. Spread mayonnaise mixture onto one side of each of the cheese stars. Spread mayonnaise mixture onto the bread slices. Top each bread slice with one cheese star, then top with another bread slice. Repeat with remaining cheese stars and bread slices. Makes 12 sandwiches.
In a large bowl, combine the strawberries, basil, sugar, cucumber and lemon juice. Toss gently. Sprinkle with black pepper and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Brown the hash browns in a skillet with a little oil or non-stick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the hash browns with the cream of chicken soup, sour cream, pepper and pimentos. Spread half of the mixture into a greased casserole dish, then top with half the cheese. Repeat layers.Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly and the cheese is lightly browned and crisp on top. Let stand for 15 minutes before serving.

Heat olive oil and garlic in large pot over medium heat. Add tomatoes and cook 10 minutes or until thickened and fragrant. Add kidney beans and Italian seasoning and cook 5 minutes. Stir in sugar and spinach. Cook 3 minutes or until spinach is wilted. Serve pasta over tomato mixture and sprinkle with feta cheese and olives.

Hard cook 4-5 large eggs. Peel and mash the yolks. Combine mashed yolks, water, mayonnaise, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon white pepper. Mix well. Add the hard cooked egg whites and mix well. Refrigerate. Serve on lettuce leaves. Serve as a sandwich on toast or bagels. Use on salads or pasta dishes. Use as a dip for vegetables.

Combine brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, honey and hot sauce in a bowl. Place breaded and fried chicken tenders in the mixture and stir. Let sit for 1 hour. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a skillet over medium-high heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet. Add cabbage, onion, and green pepper to drippings in skilletsaute until cabbage is tender crisp. Stir in cooked bacon, vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper. Heat through. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400f. Slice bacon slices in half lengthwise. Combine flour, brown sugar and pepper in a small bowl. Dredge the bacon in the flour mixture. Arrange bacon slices in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Bake uncovered for 12 minutes or until bacon is cooked through. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a roasting pan, toss carrots, potato and bacon together with olive oil. Season to taste. Roast for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, in a medium skillet over medium-high heat, saute onion in olive oil until translucent. Add maple syrup and cook until mixture thickens. Add corn and cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Spoon vegetable mixture on top of roasted bacon and vegetables. Bake for 35 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Spread beans in a thin layer on each tortilla. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper flakes. Place on prepared baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes or until heated through. Top with tomatoes, onions and peppers. Drizzle with taco sauce. Bake 2 more minutes. Serve hot.

Combine all the ingredients in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture reaches the soft ball stage (234 degrees F.) or a wooden spoon dipped into the mixture is covered with a thin film of icing. Remove from heat. Beat until icing is cool enough to spread. Beat in vanilla. Use immediately. Makes about 3 cups icing.
Slice onions as thin as you can. Beat the eggs with the milk and add the onions. Dip in pancake mix and fry until crisp. Drain on paper towels and serve with your favorite sauce.

In a 5 quart crock pot, combine all the sauce ingredients except the meatballs and the meatballs. Stir to combine well. Add meatballs and stir to combine well. Cook covered on low for 5-6 hours or on high for 3 hours. Stir in pineapple just before serving. Serve over hot cooked rice.
Wash cherry tomatoes and pat dry. Fill each cherry tomato with a piece of lettuce. Place 2 strips of bacon over lettuce. Add a dollop of mayonnaise. Season to taste. Serve chilled.

Heat the oil over medium-high heat. Cook the sausage until browned. Stir in the shallots and cook until softened. Add the tomatoes and cook until thickened. Add the herbs and season to taste. Serve over hot cooked pasta.
Place lettuce leaves on serving platter. Top with salmon, sprinkle with chili flakes and yogurt. Top with shrimp and sprinkle with cilantro. Serve with alfalfa sprouts.

Cut bread in half and spread one half with peanut butter. Place the other half on top. Mash the bananas and place in a bowl. Add eggs, milk, vanilla and cinnamon. Stir well. Heat butter in a skillet or pancake griddle. Dip the sandwich halves in the banana batter and fry in the butter until brown. Serve hot. This is a great breakfast for kids and adults.

In a bowl, cream the butter and then add the pumpkin puree and stir. Add the sugar and spices and stir. Then take out the bowl of the freezer and stir every 30 minutes until it is the consistency you want. Then put back into the fridge and it will be ready to use. It's good for toast, muffins, waffles and pancakes.

In a small mixing bowl, combine margarine and powdered sugarmix well. Press into a 9 x 13-inch baking dishbake at 350 degrees F for 8 minutes. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs lightly. Add pudding mix, milk, vanilla wafer crumbs, whipped cream, pineapple, and pecansblend well. Pour into baking dishbake for 40 minutes or until top is lightly browned. Cool before serving. Top with whipped cream, if desired.

Crush gingersnaps in a food processor. Set aside. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add eggs one at a time. Beat until smooth. Add condensed milk. Add pumpkin. Add pumpkin pie spice and salt. Pour into crushed gingersnaps and walnuts. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and cut.

Separate each cake into two layers. Crush the hershey bar. Slice the cakes into layers. Place a layer of cake in the bottom of the dish. Top with one layer of crushed candy bar. Spread with pudding mix. Add another cake layer. Top with remaining pudding and candy bar pieces. Refrigerate. Garnish with cool whip and nuts.

Combine white rice, pineapple, sugar and marshmallows in large bowl. Add cream, vanilla, stirring gently. Refrigerate at least 24 hours. Just before serving, top each serving with a dollop of whipping cream. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain off any fat. Add taco seasoning mix, bell peppers, beans and corn. Cook until heated through. Spoon into 2-quart casserole dish. Top with salsa. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve with tortillas or crackers.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add penne and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic cloves and crushed red pepper flakes and saute 30 seconds to 1 minute. Add tomatoes with juice, olives and basil. Simmer 2 minutes. Add penne to skillet. Stir in feta cheese and parmesan cheese and toss to combine. Top with additional feta cheese if desired. Serve immediately.

Grind together cumin powder, ground cayenne pepper and sugar in a mixer and keep aside. Heat a non-stick pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add curry leaves and carrots and fry well. Add water and let it cook for 5 minutes. Add ground cumin powder and mix well. Let it cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the yoghurt and mix well. Garnish with coriander leaves and mint leaves. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease an aluminum foil-lined baking sheet. Cut the pork loin into two equal pieces. Each piece should be about 1/2-inch thick. In an 8-inch skillet cook the butter and pork in the hot oil over medium-high heat until pork is lightly browned and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer the pork to the prepared baking sheet. In a small bowl combine the broth, lemon juice and lemon zestbrush over the pork. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the pork is heated through. Serve with the sauce.

Tie cinnamon stick, cloves and allspice together with kitchen twine. Place in small saucepan with apple cider. Heat to simmer over medium heat. Cover and remove from heat. Steep until desired flavor. Strain out solids. Return to saucepan. Add cranberry juice. Add granulated sugar to taste. Add orange bitters and orange wedges. Mix well. Serve hot. May be served as a punch by adding rum extract to taste.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking and prevent stickiness. In a large bowl combine pasta, chicken strips, peas and red pepper. In a small bowl combine miracle whip and Italian dressing. Pour dressing mixture over pasta mixture and toss well. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serves 4.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the oil and onions. Cook and stir for about 8 minutes until the onions become translucent. Stir in the honey mustard. Cook for an additional 3 minutes. Spread the onions on a slice of rye bread. Top with the roast beef. Drizzle with a little extra honey mustard. Makes two sandwiches. Serve with sliced cucumber or tomato.

Preheat the oven to 400F. Heat the oven to 400F. Make the pizza dough according to the package instructions. Sprinkle 1 tsp of cornmeal onto a pizza stone or baking sheet and place the dough on top. Bake for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, grill the chicken breasts until cooked through. Remove the chicken from the grill and cut into small pieces. In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the sour cream, chipotle chile in adobo and garlic powder. Spread pizza sauce onto the crust. Top with the chicken pieces. Sprinkle with the purple onion and tomatoes. Sprinkle with the cheese and the sour cream mixture. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and the crust is golden brown.

In a large bowl, combine the frozen sweet peas, sliced water chestnuts and celery and toss. In a small bowl, stir together the sour cream and sugar until smooth. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly. Sprinkle with the cashews. Yields 4 servings.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until onion is soft. Add beef, chili powder, cumin and salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until beef is cooked through. Add tomato sauce and refried beans. Stir and cook for 2-3 minutes. Makes about 4 servings.

In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until golden brown. Add the garlic and continue to sauté. Add the curry paste. Stir for 1 minute. Add the cauliflower, stock, salt & pepper, and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes until cauliflower is tender. Remove from heat. Working in batches, puree the cauliflower in a blender or food processor. Return the soup to the pot. Add the yoghurt and stir to combine. Add the heavy cream and stir. Serve hot with pappadams.
Bring the water to a boil. Steep the lavender and mint in the hot water for 5 minutes. Strain the mixture and sweeten it with the honey. Serve with lemon slices. Makes 1 serving.

Combine flour, soda, powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Set aside. Beat butter in a large bowl with a mixer until creamy. Add sugars and beat until combined. Add corn syrup, eggs, and vanilla, beating until well mixed. Add flour mixture, beating until combined. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10 to 12 minutes, or until golden on the edges. Cool on baking sheet 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place eggplants on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt. Roast for 30 minutes. Remove eggplants from oven and allow to cool. Rub eggplant with the steak sauce. Turn and rub with the worcestershire sauce. Grill on preheated grill for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with fresh ground pepper. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with fresh parsley.

Heat oil in large saut pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add ginger and garlic and stir for about 30 seconds or until aromatic. Add roast pork and stir for about 2 minutes or until warmed through. Add bok choy and stir until tender-crisp, about 3 minutes. Add hoisin sauce and stir to coat everything evenly. Add rice wine and simmer until mixture thickens slightly, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve over noodles. Garnish with green onion and sprinkle with cilantro or parsley.

In blender combine lime juice and water to make a slurry. Add crystallized ginger and pulse until ginger is in small pieces. Add lime zest and pulse until well blended. Place melon balls in a bowl. Pour the liquid over the melon balls and gently stir. Sprinkle with mint and serve. You can also use fresh lime juice and sugar instead of the syrup.

Place crabs in a shallow dish. Combine olive oil, vinegar, oregano and spices in a bowl and pour over the crab. Let marinate overnight. To cook: Preheat the broiler. Place the crab on a broiler pan and cook 2 to 3 minutes per side. Turn and cook the other side until heated through.

Combine sugar, flour and lemon peel in a medium bowl. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in lemon juice and coconut. Divide the mixture among 10 tart shells. Bake for 20 minutes or until firm to touch and slightly puffed. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Melt the chocolate in a double boiler. Stir in the cream and butter. Add the creme de cacao and stir. Serve warm with fruit and marshmallows.

Marinate shrimp in oil for about an hour. Mix gingerroot with ground pepper. Remove shrimp from marinade and coat with gingerroot mixture. Fry shrimp in oil until pink in center. Stir together the remaining ingredients in a bowl. Pour over shrimp and serve immediately over steamed rice.

Bring 3 cups water to a boil in a saucepan. Add cauliflowercook 6 - 8 minutes or until tender. Draincool. In a large bowl, mix cauliflower, sour cream, chives, salt, and pepper. Transfer mixture to a 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle cheese over top. Bake at 350 for 20 - 25 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned. Let stand 5 minutes.
Combine Miracle Whip, vinegar, honey and cranberries in a large bowl. Toss well, add coleslaw mix and toss to coat well. Refrigerate 1 hour or more. Serve on sandwiches or as a side dish.

wrap each little smokie with 2 strips of bacon. Place on cookie sheet. Drizzle with brown sugar. Place 2 toothpicks in each little smokie to hold together. Cook at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until bacon is done.

In a large heavy skillet over medium heat saute onions in olive oil until soft but not browned. Add rice and saute for 2 minutes. Add hot chicken broth and tomatoes. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer 15 minutes. Uncover and add salt and cilantro. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve hot with tomatoes on the side.

Prepare and bake cake as directed. Cool. Cut in 2 inch squares. Combine jell-o and boiling water in saucepan. Stir until dissolved. Add cold water and continue to stir. Pour into a 10x15x2 pan. Refrigerate. Beat whipped topping according to package directions. Fold in pudding and milk. Spread over top of cooled lemon cake. Refrigerate. Serve.

Wash berries and remove any stems or leaves. In a large saucepan bring water, sugar and frozen juice to a boil. Add berries and simmer uncovered until berries pop. Remove from heat and add marmalade and the zests. Allow to cool slightly and then add the cinnamon and nutmeg. Chill thoroughly and serve at room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 300f. Prepare the marinade: In small mixing bowl combine the seasoned salt and pepper. Spread mustard evenly over each steak. Rub mustard with the seasoned salt mixture. Cover and refrigerate for about 4 hours. Heat the olive oil in heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook steaks until done to your taste, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Place steaks in baking dish. Combine the butter, horseradish, mustard and marinade. Heat for about 3 minutes in small saucepan or double boiler. Spoon mixture over steaks. Bake for about 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt. In a separate bowl, combine the egg, buttermilk, oil and corn. Stir wet mixture into dry mixture until moistened. Spoon batter into 12 muffin cups. Bake for 15-18 minutes. Cool slightly before serving. Serve warm. Makes 12 muffins.

In the crock pot, combine the onion, oregano, thyme, garlic powder and seasonings. Stir well. Add the lamb chops and the garlic. Stir well. Pour the water over the lamb chops. Cover the crock pot and cook on low for approximately eight hours or until the lamb chops are cooked through. Remove the lamb chops from the crock pot. Place the lamb chops in the baking dish and pour the liquid from the crock pot over the lamb chops. Bake at 400 degrees for approximately ten minutes. Serve the lamb chops with the sauce. You can serve this as a main meal or as an appetizer.

Cook the macaroni according to the directions on the package. Brown the ground beef and drain off excess fat. Stir beef into macaroni and mix well. Stir in tomatoes, oregano and salt and pepper to taste. Spoon into 13x9 casserole and top with grated cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until the casserole is bubbly and the cheese is melted.
Boil carrots and peel. Slice carrots and onions. Cook bacon until crisp. Cook onions in bacon grease. Add carrots and saute. Add sugar and accent seasoning. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 200c/400f. Peel and roughly chop potatoes. Bring a large pan of water to the boil. Add potato cubes and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes well then return to the pan over a low heat. Mash well using a potato masher or blitz in a food processor or blender to a smooth consistency. Add milk, whipping cream, garlic and season with salt and pepper. Mix well then transfer the potato mixture to a shallow dish and leave to cool slightly. Increase oven temperature to 220c/425f. Beat together the egg yolks and 250ml/1 cup cold milk then stir into the potato mixture. Melt the butter in a small saucepan then add the flour. Cook for 3 minutes or until the mixture turns golden brown, stirring continuously. Stir in 150ml/1/2 cup of the hot milk then stir in the rest of the milk in a steady stream, whisking continuously to avoid lumps. Season with salt and

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute 1 minute. Add zucchini and saute 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add penne and cook 3 minutes. Add basil and cook 30 seconds. Add ricotta cheese, salt and pepper. Mix well. Serve with parmesan cheese.
Combine red cabbage and carrot in a large salad bowl. Combine mayonnaise and vinegar. Stir together and pour over cabbage mixture. Add green onions. Toss well. Cover and refrigerate. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 375f. Toss parsnips, oil and salt together in a bowl to coat well. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast until parsnips are tender and golden brown, about 25 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk together vinegar and syrup in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until thickened and syrupy, about 5 minutes. Drizzle parsnips with vinegar mixture and serve immediately.

Cook bacon and crumble into a small bowlset aside. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the vegetables and cook for 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove vegetables and set aside. In skillet, add soup and milk and heat through. Stir in cheese and bacon and heat through. Stir in chicken and vegetables and heat through. Spoon mixture into the unbaked baking dish. In a small bowl, mix together the baking mix and french-fried onionsprinkle over the casserole and bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Prepare rice as directed. While rice is cooking, combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Cool. Add rice to bowl and mix well. Chill. Yield: 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl stir together honey and mustard. In a large bowl, stir together oil and salt and pepper. Place parsnips in a shallow baking pan. Pour over the honey mixture. Bake, covered with foil for 30 minutes. Remove the foil and continue baking until the parsnips are tender and the glaze is bubbly. Serve hot.

Cut eggplants in half lengthwiseremove seeds. Cut halves into 1/2" thick slices. Combine eggplant slices in a bowl. In a saucepan over medium heat combine butter, onions, celery & shrimp. Cook 2-3 minutes until shrimp are pink. Add creole seasoning & stir for 1 minute. Add eggplant slicestoss to coat. Spread eggplant mixture in a baking dish. Cover with breadcrumbs. Bake 40-45 minutes at 350f. Sprinkle with chopped parsley before serving.

Brown beef with bacon in large skillet over medium heat until beef is no longer pink. Drain well. Add cheese, onion, tomatoes and garlic powder. Cook for 2-3 more minutes or until cheese is melted. Divide meat mixture among dinner rolls. Serve with chicken stock.

Peel garlic and chop finely. Sauté in butter in a small pan. Add wine. Reduce by two thirds. Add lemon juice, nutmeg and pepper. Add cheese gradually while stirring. Add cornflour. Blend in kirsch. Serve with French bread cubes. Serves 4.

In a medium saucepan heat the butter over medium heat until melted. Add the onion and cook until golden. Add the stock, and bring to a boil. Add the baby peas and romaine. Let simmer about 1 minute. Remove from heat. Blend soup with a handheld blender until smooth. Season with the mint, salt and pepper. Reheat gently before serving. Serve warm with a garnish of chopped mint and a slice of crusty bread. Makes 4 servings.
Place all ingredients except the fresh fruit into a saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly. Bring to a boil. Cook 1-2 minutes. Stir in fruit. Serve warm with fresh fruit.

Heat oil in medium skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and potato and cook until potato is soft and onion is lightly browned. Season with salt and pepper. In same skillet, beat egg and water together until smooth. Pour into skillet with potatoes and onions. Cook until egg is set on the bottom and top of the skillet. Loosen edges and slide onto serving platter. Sprinkle with fresh herbs. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, season with salt and pepper, cover and cook for 3 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle the beef cubes with the seasoning and place on top of the onions in the skillet. Pour in the beef stock, cover the skillet and cook on low heat for 3 hours or until the meat is tender. Stir occasionally. Drain the beef mixture through a sieve. Mash the potatoes with the butter or margarine and milk or cream in the skillet you cooked the meat in. Season with the seasoning, add the hash and mix thoroughly. Place the mixture in an 8-inch square baking dish. Beat the egg lightly with the milk or cream, and pour over the hash mixture. Bake for 20 minutes or until the egg is set. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise and place in a shallow baking pan. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until potato is tender. Meanwhile, cook bacon until crisp. In a small bowl combine bacon and onions. Drain potatoes and place in a bowl. Melt butter and mix in cheddar cheese and milk. Stir in bacon and onions. Spoon over potatoes and top with bacon. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. On the sheet, toss the broccoli florets and cauliflower florets in the oil, season with salt and pepper, then spread in an even layer. Bake for 15 minutes, stirring once or twice. Transfer the vegetables to a large bowl. In the same baking sheet, cook the bacon in a single layer for 10 minutes. Transfer the bacon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Add the bacon to the bowl of vegetables. Add the mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper to taste. Stir the mixture until well combined. Serve the salad cold or at room temperature.
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Simmer, stirring often, for 20-25 minutes. Cool, cover and store in the refrigerator. Keeps up to 6 months. Makes about 8 cups.

Combine pudding and milk in a bowl and stir until well blended. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour. In a large bowl, combine pudding mixture and topping. Gently stir in fruit and marshmallows. Spoon into bowls or onto dessert plates and garnish with orange segments and maraschino cherries, if desired. Serves 8-10.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place chicken chili in a medium-sized pot. Add corn tortillas and cover with chicken broth. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Prepare lasagna by spreading cottage cheese on the bottom of a 9-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle 1/2 of the cheddar and mozzarella cheese on top. Spread 1/3 of the chicken mixture over the cheese layer. Continue layering until all the ingredients have been used. Bake lasagna for 45 minutes. Let cool for 15 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Heat olive oil in 4-quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add beef cubes in batches and brown evenly. Remove all beef to plateset aside. Add onion to pot. Cook 4-5 minutes or until tender. Add beef cubes. Stir in thyme. Add water. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat. Add bay leaves, bouillon cubes, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, tomato paste. Stir well. Coverreduce heat to low. Simmer 2 hours. Add frozen vegetablesstir. Simmer 1 hour longer. Stir in parsley. Serve with cooked rice, mashed potatoes, or noodles. Makes 6 servings.

Combine half-and-half, white chocolate chips, salt and vanilla extract in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer then turn off heat and let steep for 5 minutes. Serve in a mug with a dollop of whipped cream on top.
Combine parmesan cheese, dressing mix, and garlic powder. Coat chicken with mixture. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until no pink remains and juice runs clear. Serve over rice or pasta.

Combine butter, mushrooms, onions and red peppers in a medium skillet over medium heat. Cook until tender. Add broth and pearl barley. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until barley is tender. Season with pepper. Serve hot.

In 2 quart saucepan combine 1 cup milk and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add 1 cup elbow macaroni. Cover and let stand 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in large saucepan melt butter over low heat. Add egg and beat until thick and creamy. Stir in dry mustard and salt. Stir in cheese, 1/2 cup at a time until smooth and creamy. Add remaining milk and whisk until smooth. Add cooked macaroni and toss to coat. Pour into buttered 2-quart casserole dish. Bake 35 minutes or until golden brown on top. Cool slightly and serve.

In a saucepan, combine the pork and beans with 1/2 cup ketchup, 1/4 cup mustard, 1/4 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup chopped onions. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Divide the hot beans between 12 hot dog buns. Add a frankfurter to each bun. Place a bun halfway open on each plate. Spoon on 1/2 cup of beans. Top each serving with 2 tablespoons ketchup. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley.

In medium saucepan combine sugar, corn syrup and egg yolks. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and coats spoon. Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla. Beat with mixer until smooth. Spread between cake layers and frost entire cake. Store in refrigerator.

Mix crabmeat, mayonnaise, pimentos and shallots. Fill brie cheese with mixture. Wrap each cheese in phyllo dough and place on a foil lined pan. Bake at 375 degrees F for 15 minutes or until the brie cheese is melted and the phyllo is brown. Sprinkle with fresh chives. Serve warm.
Bring cocoa, water and milk to a boil. Add remaining ingredients and stir till dissolved. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together the butter and sugar. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Add the flour and baking powder. Mix until combined. Fold in the sliced almonds. Divide batter into three even portions. Press each portion into a greased and floured 9-inch pie pan. Bake for about 20 minutes or until lightly golden brown.

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water until al dente. Drain pasta and return to pot. Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic cloves and cook until golden, about 2 minutes. Add zucchini and cook until soft, about 2 minutes. Stir in walnuts. Add ricotta cheese and hot pepper flakes. Season with salt. Toss zucchini mixture with pasta. Divide among plates. Serve with tomatoes.
Mix berries and splenda sugar substitute in small bowl. Serve in individual serving bowls. Layer berry mixture in each bowl. Top with yogurt. Top yogurt layer with honey nut cheerios.

Crack the eggs into a bowl. Beat them until well mixed. Add the mayo and butter and beat until well mixed. Add the seasoning and continue beating until well mixed. Pour into a hot, nonstick skillet. Turn heat down to low and cook until eggs are firm. Stir often to prevent them from sticking. Serve immediately.

Slice the red onion into thin slices. Heat 2 TBSP of olive oil in a nonstick pan. Add the red onions and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the rest of the oil and the sliced garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add the sugar and the balsamic vinegar and cook for 1 more minute. Add the capers and remove the pan from the stove. Leave to cool and store in a jar. You can serve it over salads or over pasta.

Heat olive oil in large saucepan over medium high heat. Add onion, garlic and red chile. Saute until onion is translucent. Add sweet potatoes and carrots. Cover and cook over low heat for 10 to 15 minutes. Add stock. Cover and simmer until sweet potatoes are tender. Puree soup in a blender or food processor. Return puree to pan. Heat through.

Whisk together the lime juice, honey, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, salt and pepperset the dressing aside. Mix together the corn, baby spinach, tomatoes and cucumber. Toss with the dressing to coat and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Season salmon with salt and pepper. Brush both sides with mustard. Place salmon fillets skin side down on a baking sheet. In a small saucepan, melt butter. Stir in honey. Pour butter mixture over salmon. Bake salmon 20 minutes. Sprinkle pecans over salmon and bake until pecans are lightly browned and salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork, about 5 minutes longer. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Chop basil leaves. Cut garlic cloves in half. Place tomatoes, garlic, and basil in a bowl. Drizzle with olive oil. Mix well. Place on a cookie sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place salmon fillets in a greased baking pan. Sprinkle salmon fillets with thyme, salt and pepper. Bake salmon fillets for 15 minutes in the preheated oven or until cooked through. Add green onions to hot skillet and stir in butter until melted. Add lime zest and lime juice to melted butter and stir well. Serve salmon topped with lime sauce.

Soak split peas overnight. In a Dutch oven or other heavy pot, combine the split peas and water or stock and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until peas are soft and the soup is creamy, about 2 hours. Add the carrots, onion and garlic powder and simmer until carrots are tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in potatoes and ham bone. Continue to simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes. Add the bay leaves. Remove the ham bone from the pot and chop finely. Add the ham, onion and split pea mixture to the Dutch oven and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer and continue to simmer for 10 minutes to let the flavors blend. Serve the soup hot with crusty bread.

Bring potatoes to a boil in a large pot of boiling water. Boil until they are very soft. Peel them and mash them. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add the eggs and cook until they are very soft. Mix the eggs with the mashed potatoes. In a large bowl, mash the potatoes and eggs with a fork. Add the yellow aji paste, evaporated milk, crackers, oil and cheese. Mix well. Cook the potato mixture in a 3-quart baking dish in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. Serve hot. Serve with olives and lettuce.

In a large saucepan over medium high heat, cook the spaghetti according to directions on package, until tender but firm to bite. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet over medium high heat, heat the olive oil. Saute the garlic until golden. Add salmon and cook until lightly browned on each side. Remove from heat and set aside. In a medium saucepan over low heat, melt the cream cheese. Stir in the evaporated milk until smooth and blended. Stir in the parsley and chicken broth and cook until thickened slightly. Season with salt. To serve: Arrange salmon on each serving of spaghetti. Pour white sauce over salmon. Garnish with black olives if desired. Serves 4 to 6

Place the egg yolks in a mixing bowl and beat with an electric mixer for about 1 minute. With the mixer running add the sugar and continue beating for 2 minutes until thick and lightly coloured. Place the bowl over a pan of barely simmering water, make sure the bowl does not touch the water and beat for 5 minutes until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Remove the bowl from the heat and stir in the butter and orange juice and zest until well mixed. Spoon the curd into sterilized jars and seal immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 9 inch springform pan. In a large bowl combine 1 cup butter, 1 cup of sugar and 1/2 cup of egg yolks. Beat until light. Add 1/2 cup flour, 1 tablespoon of baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Beat well. In another bowl combine 1/2 cup of sour cream, 1 cup of egg whites and 2 teaspoons of vanilla. Fold into batter. Spread into pan. In a small bowl combine 1/4 cup of cream cheese and 1 tablespoon of sugar. Spread over batter. In a small bowl combine 2 tablespoons of butter, 1/4 cup of flour and 1/4 cup of brown sugar. Cut into small pieces. Sprinkle over batter. Bake for 40-50 minutes. Serve warm. Serves 8-10.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9×13 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt and cocoa. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the water, sugar and butter. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Add to flour mixture and stir just to combine. Stir in pecans. Spread into prepared baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool completely. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, yogurt and oil until well-blended. Stir in flour mixture and cornmeal until smooth. Fold in chiles and cheese until just combined. Divide batter between twelve (12) greased muffin cups. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing from pan. Cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place frozen berries into 9-inch pie plate. Combine cornstarch and cold water and stir into berries. Set aside. Combine egg yolks and condensed milk in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thickened. Add juice and food coloring and continue to heat to 160 degrees. Add to berries and stir well. Pour into prepared crust. Bake for 1 hour 20 minutes or until set. Cool for 20 minutes. Beat whipped topping until light and spread over top of pie.
Muddle the mint leaves with the sugar. Add lemon juice, then the rum. Fill with ice cubes. Top with club soda. Serve immediately.

Toast bread in oven. Top with pesto sauce. Place portabella mushroom on top of pesto sauce. Top with slices of bacon. Place slices of cheese on top of the bacon. Drizzle with olive oil. Grill mushroom on the grill until mushroom is tender. Serve hot.

Prick potatoes a few times with a fork, place them in a microwave safe bowl and microwave for 15-20 minutes. Remove potatoes and let cool. Cut in half and remove pulp. Preheat oven to 400 deg. F. Place the potato skins in a single layer on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and top with cheddar cheese. Bake for 5-10 minutes or until the cheese has melted. Turn off oven and crack 1 egg in each potato half. Return to oven for 5-8 minutes until egg white is set. Top with parsley and serve.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a baking dish combine pork chops with stove top stuffing mix. Add soup and milk. Stir to blend and pour over chops. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 45 minutes.

Place ground beef into a bowl and mix in bread crumbs, parmesan cheese and italian seasoning until all is completely combined and everything is evenly distributed through the beef. Form into small meatballs using your hands and place on a cookie sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes or until no longer pink inside. Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and flour. Stir until completely blended and cooked through. Add broth and stir until thick and creamy. Add meatballs and stir until completely covered with sauce. Serve with garlic bread and salad for an easy and quick meal.

Combine pineapple juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, bourbon in a bowl. Whisk well and then set aside. In a separate bowl combine baking soda and garlic powder. Add a few tablespoons of water. Whisk together and set aside. Preheat grill to medium high. Brush the salmon with vegetable oil. Sprinkle with the baking soda/garlic powder mixture. Place the salmon on the grill and cook for 4 minutes per side. Baste with the bourbon glaze. Cook for 1 more minute per side. Serve with a lemon wedge.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, beat eggs and milk. Stir in chili peppers and cheese. Pour into a greased 9 inch square baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Cut into 3 inch squares.

In a medium mixing bowl stir together butter and cinnamon until well combined. Spread evenly over the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Allow chips to soften. Spread peanut butter over the top. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Cut into bars. Makes 24 bars.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Meanwhile, whisk together dressing ingredients (mayonnaise through pepper) in large bowl. Drain noodles and place in large bowltoss with dressing. Add cabbagetoss. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

Split the bread horizontally. Spread the mustard on one half. Layer the ham on top. Top with cheddar. Place the slices of swiss on the other half of the bread. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Brush the outside of the sandwich with butter. Grill the sandwich for about 3 minutes on each side.

In a large pan add the fish sauce, sugar and honey, stirring constantly for about 15 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat and let cool. Mix in the garlic and shallots and set aside. Rinse the fish under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Cut into serving pieces about 1/2" thick. In a large skillet heat the vegetable oil and add the fish pieces. Stir-fry until golden brown on both sides (approximately 3-4 minutes). Add the coconut milk and let it come to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low and add the caramel sauce. Stir until it thickens (about 5 minutes). Serve over white rice.

Peel the potatoes. Cut them in 1/4-inch slices. Place in a large pot. Cover with cold water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil. Cook for 15-20 minutes or until tender when pierced. Drain in colander. Return to pan. Add butter, onions, garlic and cheese. Stir until well combined. Season to taste. Pour into a 9-inch pie pan or gratin dish. Dot with more butter. Bake in 350 degrees F oven for 45-50 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

In a large pot bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add grits and cook 5 minutes or until tender. Drain. Place grits in a large bowl. Add garlic and onion. Toss to combine. In a large mixing bowl whisk together milk, eggs and salt. Pour over grits mixture and toss to combine. Add Velveeta and toss to combine. Spread mixture into a greased 13 x 9 baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees 25 minutes or until browned. Serve hot.

Place shrimp in a large glass bowl. Add cornflour. Add white wine and stir until shrimp are fully covered in the mixture. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour. Heat a large skillet over high heat until hot. Pour in shrimp mixture, stirring constantly until thickened. Stir in shallots and garlic. Cook until liquid thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in evaporated milk and parsley. Serve with fettuccine or penne pasta.

Combine oats and boiling water in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook until oats are soft (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat. Set aside. In a small bowl or liquid measuring cup, combine warm water and yeast. Let stand 5 minutes. In a large bowl or electric mixer, combine oats and molasses. Add yeast mixture. Beat for 2 minutes. Add 1/2 cup butter, 1/4 cup warm water, and salt. Beat until smooth (about 1 minute). Stir in spelt flour and 2 1/2 cups warm water. Beat until dough is smooth. Scrape down sides and bottom of bowl with a rubber spatula. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (about 1 hour). Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 9×5 inch loaf pan. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in remaining 1/2 cup butter and 2 tablespoons warm water. Shape dough into a lo

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and green peppersaute 5 minutes. Add tomatoescook until almost tender. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon cayenne peppercook 3 minutes longer. Combine eggs, milk and salt in small bowlstir well. Add to vegetables in skilletcook just until eggs are set. Stir in cheese just until meltedremove from heat. Serve with warm tortillas and salsa. Makes 3 servings.

In a microwave safe bowl, combine the chocolate chips and butter. Microwave for one minute. Stir until smooth. Add the heavy cream and coffee liqueur. Heat for an additional minute in the microwave. Stir until smooth. Serve hot or cold.

Slice eggplant rounds and lay in a single layer on a plate. Sprinkle with salt and let stand for 20 mins. Drain and pat dry. In a bowl mix cheese and italian dressing. Dip eggplant in dressing mixture and then in dry breadcrumbs. Place on a baking tray. Continue until all rounds are done. Bake at 425 for 10 minutes. Serve warm with salad.

Beat the eggs in a mixing bowl. In a separate bowl mix the flour with the baking powder and salt. Add the flour mixture to the eggs beating until smooth. Add the mashed potatoes to the batter. Stir well. Heat the oil in a heavy skillet. Drop batter by teaspoonfuls into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Roll in the maple syrup while still warm. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, toss carrots with oil and rosemary. Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Turn oven down to 325 degrees and bake for an additional 20 minutes. Remove from oven and toss with the jam and salt. Serve at once.

Wash green tomatoes. Dice them coarsely. Boil onion and bell peppers in water until tender. Add green tomatoes. Drain liquid. Add sugar, celery seeds, mustard seeds, vinegar, turmeric powder. Bring to boil. Simmer for 15 minutes. Cool. Store in sterilized jars.

In a shallow dish combine poultry seasoning and sour cream. Place the cream of celery soup in a separate dish. Dip the chicken breasts into the seasoning mixture, then the soup mixture. Place in a 9x13 pan. Combine the stuffing mix with the melted butter, sprinkle over the chicken. Cover and bake in a 350 degree oven for 35 minutes. Remove from oven. Let stand for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with grated American Cheese. Bake for another 5 minutes.

Add 1 teaspoon of sourdough starter for every cup of flour. Add 1 cup of flour to 1 3/4 cups of water. Add one egg. Add cooking oil. Add instant milk. Add sugar and salt. Add baking soda. Mix well. Pour batter into pan. Cook on one side until bubbles start to form on top. Flip and cook until both sides are browned. Serve hot.

Remove seeds and stems from chiles, then slice them into thin strips. Combine chiles, tomatillos, garlic clove and salt in a blendercover and process until smooth. Serve salsa at room temperature or refrigerate up to 3 days. To serve, place 1-2 tablespoon salsa in each of 6 small serving bowls. Add 3 tablespoon of sour cream to each bowl. Stir together lightly to combine sour cream with salsa. Serve with tortilla chips or serve as a condiment to grilled meats or fish.

Heat oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic clove until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in tomatillo, jalapeno and salt and cook until tomatillo is softened and juices have thickened, about 10 minutes. Transfer mixture to blenderadd broth and puree until smooth. Stir in cilantro and mintserve immediately or refrigerate up to 1 day. Sauce can be frozen in ice cube trays for up to 1 month.

In a large bowl, combine the dates, nuts and the condensed milk. Mix well. Add the cracker crumbs and the butter. Mix until well blended. Divide the dough into 36 equal portions. Shape each portion into a ball. Place 12 balls on each of two cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from the oven. Cool for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove to a wire rack to cool. In a small bowl, combine the powdered sugar and milk to make a glaze. Drizzle over the warm cookies. Cool before serving. Makes 3 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and trim beets. Cut each beet into quarters lengthwise. Place in a medium bowl. Add balsamic vinegar and 1/4 cup sugar. Stir until beets are covered with mixture. Spray a 9X13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Spread beets into pan. Bake 40-45 minutes. Mix remaining 1/4 cup sugar with allspice, parsley and garlic powder. Sprinkle over the beets. Bake another 5 minutes. Turn and sprinkle with cheese. Bake another 5-10 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Mix together the dark chocolate chips, milk chocolate chips, white chocolate chips, sugar and the popcorn. Place in an air tight container or wrap in plastic wrap. Store at room temperature. Yields 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place pizza crusts on a baking sheet. Brush crusts with oil. Sprinkle onions with 1 tsp salt. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and stir to coat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally until onions are golden and caramelized, about 20 minutes. Add vinegar and cook until evaporated. Stir in mushrooms and cook until mushrooms are tender and liquid evaporates, about 5 minutes. Top crusts with mushrooms and caramelized onions. Sprinkle with thyme. Bake until crusts are golden and mushrooms are crisp. Transfer crusts to a cutting board. Cut into wedges and serve.

Line 9-inch pie plate with 1 pie crust. Combine cornstarch, sugar, salt and coconut milk. Bring to boil. Stirring constantly, cook until thickened. Remove from heat. Add frozen passion fruit juice concentrate and water. Return to heat. Cook, stirring constantly until mixture thickens. Pour into pie shell. Cool. Cut into wedges. Top with whipped cream.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions, cook stirring until softened. Add garam masala, ground cilantro, cook stirring for another minute or two. Add carrots and mushrooms cooking for another 3-4 minutes, until the carrots are beginning to soften but the mushrooms are still firm. Add stock bring to a boil then reduce heat cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until the carrots are tender. Add potatoes cook for another 6-7 minutes or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Add salt, pepper and fresh cilantro serve hot.

In a large soup pot, saute the bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pot with slotted spoon and set aside. Add the imitation crabmeat to the bacon fat. Saute for 2 minutes. Add the potatoes, celery, onion, Old Bay seasoning and chicken bouillon cubes. Cover with water or broth to about 2 inches over the top of the vegetables. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add the cream cheese. Using an immersion blender or standing blender (careful), puree the soup. Add the milk to the desired consistency. Add the parsley and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9-inch square baking dish with butter. Combine the first six ingredients in a large bowl. Add the egg and blend well. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake 25 minutes. Serve hot or warm.

Cook bacon until crisp. Cut cabbage into quarters and then cut each quarter into strips. Cook cabbage and onion in olive oil in a large pan over medium heat until crisp-tender. Add bacon and stir. Add garlic. Cook until heated through and cabbage is lightly browned. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add asparagus and cook until tender (2-3 minutes) or as desired. Drain and serve immediately with melted butter and sprinkle with salt, lemon pepper and parmesan cheese. Serves 4-5.

Boil the russet potatoes in lightly salted water until tender. Drain and cool. In a medium bowl, mash the potatoes with the milk. Add the butter and mash until smooth. Add the goat cheese and mash until combined. Season with black pepper and salt. Serve warm. Serves 4-6.

Bake pie crust according to package directions. Cool. Combine coconut, sugar, vanilla and eggs. Beat with mixer until well blended. Pour into cooled pie shell. Bake at 350°F for 50 to 60 minutes. Cool. Store in refrigerator.
Mix all ingredients together well. Form into 2 inch balls. Place on a cookie sheet lined with wax paper. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Store in an airtight container.

Whisk eggs, milk, brown sugar, orange juice and nutmeg in a large bowl. Pour mixture over bread in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish and cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 350f. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in the middle comes out clean. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a skillet. Add 1/2 cup sliced almonds and 1/2 cup brown sugar. Cook over medium heat until nuts are golden brown. Sprinkle over top of french toast just before serving.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl. Beat in the eggs, one at a time. Add raisins, milk and vanillabeat until well blended. Pour batter into two greased round cake pans. Bake at 350 for 40 to 45 minutes or until done. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to cool on wire racks.

Heat oven to 350&deg. F. Coat an 8-inch square baking pan with cooking spray. Crumble in cheesesprinkle with parmesan cheese. Arrange chicken and broccoli over cheese. Pour gravy over all and bake for 35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and bubbly. Sprinkle with additional parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Heat butter in large skillet over medium-high heat until foamy and starting to brown, about 2 minutes. Add sage and cook until wilted and fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in cream and let simmer until sauce is thickened and sage is tender, about 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. Add ravioli and toss over medium heat until heated through, about 1 minute. Garnish with Parmesan cheese, if desired. Serve immediately.

Mix all salmon ingredients in a large glass bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove salmon from marinade and grill to desired doneness or broil for 2-3 minutes per side, or until fish flakes easily with a fork and is slightly charred on the outside. Top with hoisin sauce and serve with steamed rice.

Prepare pie crusts. In a mixing bowl combine the cream of mushroom soup and sour cream. Add in the ham and mushrooms. Mix together. Add in the eggs and mix well. Pour into pie crusts. Sprinkle with the chives and the pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

In a large bowl mix olive oil, vinegar, mustard, sugar, pepper, salt and toss to coat well. Add apple, onion and spinach and toss gently. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Top salad with pecans just before serving. Makes about 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Line a 9-inch round cake pan with foil, with ends of foil extending over sides of pan. Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Pour into pan. Bake 25 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack 1 hour. Combine pudding, cool whip and coconut extract in medium bowlspread over cake. Drizzle with sweetened condensed milk. Top with coconut. Store in refrigerator.

Peel and dice zucchini and squash. Chop tomatoes. Remove seeds and dice poblano. Chop onion. Combine vegetables in a large bowl. Stir in herbs and seasonings. Serve with chips or use as a pizza topping.

Cut the prawns in half lengthways and put them in a bowl with the bean sprouts and the lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper and mix gently to coat the prawns. Mash the gherkin with a fork and stir into the prawns. Spread the wrappers with mayonnaise and top with the prawn mixture and the lettuce. Roll up the wrappers and serve with a wedge of lemon and a dipping sauce made with the yogurt and a dash of lemon juice.

In a large bowl cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in condensed milk and vanilla. Add eggs one at a time and beat after each addition. Blend in baking powder. In another bowl combine flour and salt. Add to creamed mixture and stir until blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes. Makes about 5 dozen.

Melt butter in a saute pan over medium heat. When the butter is melted add shallot and saute until translucent. Add the rice and stir until it is all covered in the butter and the shallot. Add the sherry and bring the liquid to a boil. Cover and reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the mushrooms and the parsley and the pepper. Simmer for another 2-3 minutes. Serve immediately.

Peel hard-boiled eggs and cut in half. Scoop egg yolks into a small bowl and mix with a small amount of miracle whip. Add a pinch of salt and a few turns of pepper. Spread egg yolks back into egg whites and sprinkle with paprika.

Bring stock to a boil with barley in a large pot, then reduce heat to a simmer and cook until barley is tender, about 1 hour.Add leek, celery, carrots, parsnip and bay leaves and cook until vegetables are tender.Add wine, tomato puree and parsley, season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crusty bread

In a pitcher, combine the water, sugar, and orange blossom water. Cut the orange in half and squeeze into the pitcher along with the lemons. Stir well and pour over ice cubes. Garnish with additional orange slices or a sprig of mint if desired. Serve immediately.

Peel and slice potatoes into a large bowl. Add onion, salt, pepper, paprika and toss together until coated with seasonings. Heat a heavy skillet over med-high heat with a small amount of oil in it. Add potato mixture in a single layer so potatoes are not piled up on top of each other. Cook for 5 - 6 minutes per side until browned on both sides.

To make the french toast, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Slice baguette into 1/2-inch slices. Dip slices into egg mixture to coat evenly on both sidesplace onto prepared baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until lightly browned. While french toast is baking, make filling: Stir together pumpkin puree, almond milk, cornstarch, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and vanilla in a small bowl. Remove french toast from ovenspread filling onto each slice of bread. Return to oven and bake 10 minutes longer, or until french toast is warmed through. Serve hot with maple syrup for drizzling. Makes 6 servings.
Make hot chocolate according to the package directions adding cayenne pepper as desired. Serve in a bowl with extra cayenne pepper for sprinkling over the top.

Bring rice to boil in 1-1/2 cups water and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cover and simmer over low heat for 20 minutes or until water is absorbed and rice is tender. Cut Spam into 3/8-inch thick slices and fry in a skillet over medium-high heat until heated through and beginning to brown on edges. Drain on paper towelsset aside. Meanwhile, combine vinegar and sugar in a small bowl and stir until sugar dissolves. Add remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and water and stir until dissolved. Combine rice with vinegar mixture in a large bowl and let cool to room temperature. Arrange 12 sheets of roasted nori on a work surface with shiny side down. Place 1/2 cup rice mixture at one end of each sheet and top with a slice of Spam and a few slivers of cucumber. Starting at rice mixture end of sheet, roll up as tightly as possible and tuck in ends to seal rolls. Wrap rolls with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour or over

Combine the milk and the gelatin in a saucepan. Cook until it boils. Remove from heat and add the lime juice. Cool in refrigerator. In a mixing bowl combine the marshmallows and the cream cheese. Mix until well blended. Fold in the pineapple and the salad dressing. Fold in the gelatin mixture. Pour into a 9 x 13 dish. Refrigerate at least 4 hours. Top with the whipped cream before serving. Serve the salad in a large glass dish. Serves 10.

Boil potatoes and mash them with butter and salt and pepper until they are creamy and smooth. Slice onions into thin slices and fry them in sunflower oil until they are golden brown and crispy. Add parsley and cook for 2 minutes longer and turn off the heat. Fry the pork for 2 minutes on both sides and remove it from the pan. Fry the eggs in sunflower oil for 1 minute on each side until the yolks are still runny. Put the mashed potatoes into a plate and add the eggs and pork. Sprinkle the crispy fried onions on top and serve it with pickled beetroot.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add garlic and cook about 1 minute until fragrant and golden brown. Add wine and boil until half evaporated. Add soy sauce and vinegar and boil until half evaporated. Add drumsticks and cook about 10 minutes until browned and no longer pink in the center. Stir in cornstarch mixture and boil until thickened and glazed. Stir in honey and heat through. Sprinkle with thyme and rosemary leaves.

Soak red lentils overnight or for about 3 hours. Boil lentils in hot water for about 25 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat & blend to desired consistency. In a large skillet heat oil & saute onion over medium heat for about 2 minutes. Add ginger-garlic paste & saute for 1 minute. Add turmeric, cumin & mustard seeds & saute for about 30 seconds. Add the lentil mixture & cook for about 3 minutes. Add salt & cook for about 5 minutes. Serve hot.

In medium bowl, cream together shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and egg yolk. Beat until thoroughly blended. Add chocolate and light corn syrupbeat until blended. Combine flour, baking soda and saltstir into chocolate mixture. Stir in nuts and raisins. Drop by rounded teaspoonful onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake in 375 degree oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes. Remove from cookie sheets to wire racks to cool completely. Store in tightly covered container. Makes 4 dozen.

Beat together margarine, shortening and vanilla in a large bowl. Add powdered sugar gradually. Beat at low speed until smooth and creamy. Add milk if the frosting is too thick to spread. Spread frosting between layers and over top and sides of cake.
Cook quinoa according to package directions. Once done, stir in almond milk, pure maple syrup, dried cranberries, and cinnamon. Serve warm or cold.

Place beef in skillet. Brown and drain. Add garlic. Set aside. In a 2 qt. Casserole, combine remaining ingredients. Add beef mixture and cook over medium heat until heated through. Mix rice in with liquid. Add beef. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until heated through. Serve with any type of vegetable.

Peel and dice the potatoes. Bring to a boil in a pot of water over medium heat. Add the potatoes and cook 5 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes and mash with a potato masher or in a blender until smooth. Stir in yogurt and garlic. Add dill seed. Serve with a dollop of sour cream if desired.

Combine all ingredients in saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Strain through cheesecloth. Combine syrup with remaining 1/4 cup orange juice. Store in an air tight container. Makes approximately 10 cups.

Combine sherbet, cream cheese and lime juice in a blender or food processor. Process till smooth. Pour into glasses or cups. Chill 20 minutes. Beat together whipped topping and milk. Spread over sherbet mixture. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm. Garnish with lime wedges if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Wash potatoes and scrub them with a vegetable brush to remove any dirt. Place them in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to medium. Simmer until tender. Drain potatoes and place them back into the pot. Add a little of the boiling water, 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp black pepper. Mash potatoes with a potato masher until desired consistency is reached. Add 4 bay leaves and mix well. Add 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil and mix well. Serve with butter.

Preheat broiler to high. Cut chicken into strips. Spread chicken with salsa. Sprinkle with garlic salt. Place strips on greased broiling pan. Broil for about 5 minutes. Remove from broiler. On bottom bun place chicken, cheese and lettuce. Top with avocado and tomato. Serve open faced.

Preheat oven to 375f. Beat milk and egg together in a shallow bowl. Mix together flour and seasoned salt and pepper in another shallow bowl. Dip corn on the cob into flour mixture, then into milk and egg mixture, and then back into flour mixture. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry corn on the cob until golden brown on all sides. Place on a baking sheet and bake in the oven for 10 minutes or until cooked through.

In a pitcher, combine tea bags, raspberries, orange and lemon peel. Pour boiling water over mixture, cover with lid, and let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in sugar. Add club soda just before serving. Pour over ice cubes. Garnish with raspberries, orange slices, or mint leaves. Serves 6-8.
Combine cabbage, carrots, green pepper, and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Drizzle with vinegar. Toss together. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl beat eggs and milk. Add spinach and cook until spinach is wilted and liquid is absorbed. Stir in soup mix and cheese. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool slightly before cutting and serving. Makes 1 pie.
Place all ingredients in blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Pour into serving bowl and stir well.

Mix beef and breadcrumbs in a large bowl. In another bowl combine onion, eggs, sugar, soy sauce and water. Add to beef mixture. Add garlic, ginger, msg and black pepper. Shape meat mixture into patties. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Brown burgers about 5 minutes per side. Remove from pan. Add green pepper, carrots, water chestnuts, and onions to the pan. Cook until tender. Top hamburgers with vegetable mixture. Serve on toasted buns. Makes 4 servings.

Clean the kidneys and cut into thin slices. Melt the butter or heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat and saute the kidneys for 3 minutes on each side. Add the onions and cook for another 3 minutes, then add the mushrooms, salt and red wine. Simmer for 3 minutes and serve immediately.

In saucepan over medium heat, combine beans, sauce, onion, vinegar, sugar, pepper, and garlic. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened, about 1 hour. Bake at 375 degrees F for 2 hours or until thickened. Stir occasionally. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter bread slices on both sides. Cut in half. Top with turkey bacon tomatoes and cheese. Place on a baking sheet. Beat eggs, milk, sage and pepper in a bowl. Pour evenly over sandwiches. Bake for about 15 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Cut asparagus into 2-inch pieces. Blanch asparagus in the boiling water for 30 seconds. Drain in a colander. In a bowl beat egg yolks with lemon juice. Whisk in egg white until it becomes frothy. Slowly drizzle in olive oil until mixture becomes thick and creamy. Fold in asparagus. Season with salt. Transfer to a serving plate. Drizzle with orange juice and lemon juice. Garnish with orange slices.

Cut the broccoli heads into florets. Heat the butter and oil in a frying pan over medium heat until melted. Stir the broccoli into the pan. Sprinkle the almonds and the lemon juice over the vegetables. Add the flaked sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Cook the vegetables for 8 to 10 minutes until the almonds are golden brown. Serve immediately.

Put all the ingredients except the olive oil in the bowl of a food processor. Process until smooth. With the machine running, add the olive oil in a slow stream. Pulse until the mixture is smooth. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Stir well before serving. Use as you would ricotta.

Peel and cut potatoes into quarters. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a pan and saute onions until soft. Add chicken breasts and cook until they change color. Add potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Add curry powder and coconut milk and stir to combine. Cover and let simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with steamed rice.

Cook garlic in olive oil over low heat until golden. Add peppers. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in orzo pasta. Add chicken broth, wine, and spinach. Cook 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in feta cheese and parsley. Serve immediately.

Slice ham as thin as possible. Rub ham generously with lime marmalade and brown sugar. Combine nutmeg and pecan nuts. Roll ham in the mixture. Coat the ham in the glace ginger. Place on a baking tray and bake for 10 minutes. Turn over and bake for a further 10 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

To make the topping: In a medium bowl, whisk together the syrup, canola oil, cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Set aside. In a large nonstick skillet or saucepan coated with cooking spray, cook the oats and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly toasted and the liquid is absorbed. Spread the toasted oats in an 8-inch square glass baking dish. Drizzle with the syrup mixture and spread evenly. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until warm. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Place pineapple chunks in a 9-inch square baking dish. Combine wine, Splenda and cornstarch in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until thickened and bubbly. Pour over pineapple chunks. Add grapes and strawberries. Chill for 8 hours or overnight. To serve, sprinkle with almonds. Makes 10 servings (2 cups each).

To make bread, spread cut sides of bread with mayonnaise and mustard. Top with mozzarella and cheddar cheeses. Broil until cheese melts. Top bread with roast beef, tomato and lettuce. Serve on a platter.

Drain and crumble the tofu. In a food processor combine the tofu, garlic powder and onion powder. Slowly add the lemon juice and process until smooth. Add the salt and process. Add the cashews and process until smooth. Add the water a little at a time and process until smooth. Store in the refrigerator in a covered container. Serve with fruit and vegetables.

In a medium bowl, combine rice and milk. In a separate bowl, whisk together cream and coconut milk. Stir into rice mixture. Stir in cardamom and raisins. Spoon into serving bowls and sprinkle with nuts. Serve warm. Makes 6 servings.

In medium pot, bring 4 cups water and bouillon cubes to boil. Add leeks and 1 1/2 teaspoons ground mace and cook for 10 minutes. Stir flour and remaining 1 teaspoon mace into 1 cup of the boiling broth and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add milk and heat to boilingboil 1 minute. Stir soup into broth mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste and heat through. Ladle into soup bowls. Top each serving with a dollop of whipping cream and sprinkle with cheese.

Mix all ingredients in shallow dish or ziploc bag. Add pork chops and marinate in refrigerator for 2 hours. Remove from marinade and grill or broil 4-5 minutes per side. Serve with rice and stir-fried vegetables.

1. Heat the sauerkraut and onion in a small saucepan over medium heat until the sauerkraut is soft. 2. Preheat the grill or broiler. Season the rib racks with salt and pepper. 3. Arrange the rib racks on the grill or broiler pan. Grill or broil until the ribs are cooked through and the edges are crisp, 3 to 4 minutes per side. 4. Transfer the ribs to a cutting board and let them rest for a few minutes. 5. Serve the ribs with the sauerkraut and onion.

Combine the garlic cloves, sea salt, olive oil, harissa and spinach in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook the garlic and spinach mixture for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, until the spinach is wilted and the garlic has browned lightly. Remove from heat. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the spaghettini according to package directions until al dente. Drain the pasta and add to the spinach mixture. Toss to combine. Divide pasta among four plates. Top with olive oil-cured black olives, pine nuts and lemon zest, if desired.

In a food processor or blender, combine the mushrooms and salad dressing until finely chopped. In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, cook the mushroom mixture until it is thick and no liquid remains. Drain off any liquid that rises to the top. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Cut the rolls in half and place on baking sheet. Spread each half with a thin layer of mushroom mixture. Top with sliced onion and tomato. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the tops are toasted.

Line baking sheet with foil for easy clean up later. Combine peanuts and crispy rice cereal in large bowl. Melt white chocolate in microwave for about a minute stirring constantly. Pour white chocolate over peanut mixture and stir well. Add marshmallows and peanut butter and stir well. Spread mixture evenly over baking sheet and refrigerate until set. Makes about a pound and a half.
