Mix sausage and breadcrumbs together. Add eggs and mix well. Add oregano, parsley and seasonings and mix well. Form into meatballs and place in a 9 inch square pan. Cover the meatballs with sour cream. Top with chutney. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Serve with toothpicks.

Dissolve rice flour in a little amount of water. Gradually add more water to make a medium thick batter. When it is cooking, drop one teaspoon of batter in boiling water. It should float. Add sugar and coconut to taste.

Soak barley in cold water at least an hour. Drain. Melt butter in pan. Add barley. Saute for about 5 minutes. Add pine nuts and saute for another minute or so. Add scallions and parsley. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until barley is tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Puree watermelon and sugar in a blender until smooth. Stir in lemon juice and corn syrup. Freeze in an ice-pop mold.

Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and blend thoroughly. Add seasonings, onion and cook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Stir in sour cream. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in green beans. Pour into buttered 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with swiss cheese and bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with corn flake crumbs. Return to oven and bake for an additional 5 minutes.

Peel, core and slice the pears into thin wedges. Toss the pears with the lemon juice and a little seasoning. Divide between four plates or shallow bowls. Divide the salad leaves between the plates or bowls. Arrange the cheese over the salad leaves, then the pears on top of the cheese. Sprinkle with hazelnuts and drizzle with the dressing.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add brown sugar & corn syrup. Stir until smooth. Add cheerios. Stir until all are coated. Spread in an ungreased 15x10x1 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until golden. Stir in peanuts. Spread in pan. Bake for 5 minutes. Spread evenly in pan. Cool. Store in airtight container.

Cut chicken tenders into strips. In a baggie, combine chicken strips with ranch dressing. Add butter to a hot skillet. Dip tenders in butter then in ranch. Cook in skillet until done. Drain chicken onto paper towels. Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Serve with potato chips.
Mix hot sauce, garlic salt, onion salt, black pepper with bisquick. Dip chicken pieces into mixture. Fry in hot oil until brown and drain. Serve with coleslaw.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add orecchiette. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes. Drain pasta. Combine pasta with bacon in a large bowl. Cook bacon in a medium skillet over medium heat until evenly brown. Add onion. Cook and stir until tender. Add frozen peas. Stir until thawed. Add pasta. Stir in garbanzo beans. Sprinkle with fresh mint. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Toss well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheets with cooking spray.Peel eggsslice in half lengthwise. Place egg whites in a single layer on the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 5 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the whites are set. Allow the eggs to cool completely. In a bowl, mash the egg yolks with the blue cheese and mayonnaise until well combinedstir in parsley. Season with hot sauce, salt, pepper, and celery salt. Spoon egg yolk mixture into egg whitessprinkle with paprika.

In a large bowl beat together milk and butter. Add flourbeat until smooth. Stir in cheese until melted. Add hamstir until heated. Add prepared horseradish and prepared mustardstir until heated. Add pepper to taste. Pour into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until hot and bubbly. To serve, top each serving with egg noodles. Makes 4 servings.

Place bay leaves on the grill to warm. In a large bowl, combine the pork and next 8 ingredients. Thread meat onto 12 skewers. Grill for 4 minutes on each side or until done. Remove from the grill and brush lightly with the sauce. Serve over the warm bay leaves.

Brown beef in a skillet with white onion and crushed red pepper flakes. Add seasoning salt and continue to cook for 5 minutes stirring often until beef is no longer pink. Drain fat from skillet and return beef to skillet. Add milk and stir well. Add potatoes and boiling water to skillet with beef mixture. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cover skillet and cook for 25 minutes until potatoes are tender. Stir in butter and sprinkle with cheese and pepper to taste. Cook uncovered for 1 minute more to allow cheese to melt. Serve immediately.

Combine brown sugar, cornstarch, salt and milk in heavy saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Remove from heat. Beat egg yolks until light. Gradually add some of the hot mixture to egg yolks. Return to saucepan and cook until thick and smooth stirring constantly. Remove from heat stir in butter, vanilla. Cool to room temperature. Place in pie shell and chill until firm.

Bring 3 inches of water to a boil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add peas and beans and blanch until tender-crisp, 2 to 3 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer vegetables to a large bowl of ice waterlet stand until cold. Drain well. Pat dry with paper towels. Heat oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heatcook garlic until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add peas and beans and saut over high heat until crisp-tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add lemon juice. Toss until coated. Garnish with mint.

In a medium saucepan, combine the chocolate chips and chunky peanut butter over low heat until melted stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in peanuts, rice cereal and vanilla. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls on wax paper or aluminum foil. Let stand until firm. Makes about 15 - 20 candy drops.

Break each chocolate baking square into small pieces in a large microwave-safe bowlstir in shortening until well blended. Microwave uncovered on High until chocolate is melted and mixture can be stirred smooth, about 3 to 4 minutesstir until smooth. Dip each ice cream sandwich halfway into chocolate mixturelet excess chocolate drip off onto the back of a spoon. Sprinkle each with candy sprinkles, if desired. Place ice cream sandwiches on waxed paperlet stand until chocolate is set. Makes 15 sandwiches.

Combine broth and chicken in a large saucepan over low heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Whisk in honey mustard and peas. Continue to simmer for another 3 minutes. Whisk in cream and cornstarch mixture and simmer for another 3 minutes until thickened.

Cut the boneless chicken breasts into cubes. In a skillet with a little olive oil saut the sweet onion until translucent then add the cubed chicken breasts. Cook them until they are no longer pink. At the same time combine the ranch dressing and water in a bowl to make a dressing. When the chicken is done drain the water off of the chicken then add the almonds, cilantro, ranch dressing mixture, mayo and mix all together. When it is ready to serve spread the mixture onto a whole wheat tortilla then roll it up like a burrito and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly spray a 9 x 9-inch baking dish with non-stick spray. Melt butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Cook scallions, cilantro leaves and peppers until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. In a large bowl, mix the vegetable mixture with spinach, beans, salsa and 1/2 cup cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Lay out 8 tortillas on a work surface. Spread about 1/3 cup filling on each tortilla. Roll up tortillas tightly. Place tortillas seam side down in prepared baking dish. Top with remaining cheese. Bake uncovered until cheese is melted and tortillas are heated through, about 35 minutes.
Beat cream with sugar until soft peaks form. Fold in sour cream and vanilla. Spoon into glasses and top with pie filling and nuts. Chill for 2 hours or until ready to serve.

Preheat the oven to 160C/325F/gas mark 3. Make a slit in each breast and stuff with a small amount of apples and almonds. Place in a shallow baking dish or tray and cover with double cream. Sprinkle over some sugar and some crushed almonds and bake in the oven for an hour or until the juices run clear. Remove and serve with a sprinkling of sugar and crushed almonds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix cake mix, egg and butter in a large bowl until crumbly. Spread evenly in a 9×13 baking dish. Bake for 8 minutes. Remove from oven. Spread peanut butter on top of baked crust. In a saucepan over medium heat, stir together cream cheese, creamy peanut butter, powdered sugar and vanilla until melted. Pour over the peanut butter layer in the baking dish. Bake for another 10 minutes or until the center is set and the edges are slightly golden. Cool completely before cutting into bars. Store in the refrigerator.

In a large bowl combine flour, milk, vegetable oil, sugar, baking powder and saltstir in egg and vanilla. Add cinnamonstir just until blended. Fold in peaches and blueberries. Heat griddle to 375 degrees F. Grease griddle and spoon batter onto center of griddle to form pancakes. Brown and turn pancakes over when edges are firm and drybrown other sides. Serve hot.

Prepare the wings by separating the joints at the bone (if you're not sure how to do this, watch this video) and discarding the wing tips. In a medium bowl or a zip-top bag, combine the ketchup with the remaining glaze ingredientsstir or shake to combine. Add the wings to the bowl or bag and toss to coatset aside to marinade while you prep the remaining ingredients. Heat the oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heatadd the garlic cloves to the oil and sauté for a minute or two until fragrant, then remove the garlic from the oil with a slotted spoon or spider skimmer and set aside. Add the wings to the pot and continue sautéing until the wings are lightly browned all over, about 3 minutes per side. Reduce the heat to medium-lowadd the glaze back to the pot along with the garlic and return to a simmerreduce the heat to low to maintain a low simmer (the liquid will bubble up but not boil). Cover the pot and continue to simmer until the glaze

Prepare a mixture of 2 parts flour to one part cornstarch. Dip steaks into flour mixture and shake off excess. In a large frying pan heat 2 tbsp olive oil on med-high heat. Place tofu steaks in pan and fry 3-4 minutes on each side, turning once. Add 2 tbsp water and cover. Reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes. Serve over rice.

In a saucepan, combine butter, marshmallows and toffee pieces. Over medium heat, stir until butter melts. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal. Press mixture into a 13x9-inch pan. Cool completely. Melt chocolate. Pour over crust. Let stand until chocolate hardens. Cut into squares.

In a small bowl, stir together the pomegranate seeds and vinegar. In a large bowl, combine the pomegranate seeds with the banana, bell pepper and onion. In a small bowl, whisk together the sugar, pomegranate molasses and oil. Season with salt. Pour the dressing over the fruit mixture and toss gently. Chill for at least 2 hours. Makes 6 servings.

Crush cookies in a large plastic bagset aside. Beat cream cheese with Splenda until fluffyadd lemon juice and peel, beating until well blended. Add sour creambeat until smooth and well blendedset aside. In large bowl, combine crumbs and melted margarine until well blendedpress onto bottom and sides of 9" pie plate. Beat cream cheese mixture until well blended and smoothbeat in egg substitute and vanilla until well blendedpour over crustrefrigerate at least 4 hours or until setgarnish with lemon peel strips if desired.

In the crock pot combine Jamaican jerk spice, broth, onion, peppers, ketchup and water. Place the chicken thighs in the mixture. Cook for 4-5 hours until chicken is tender. Remove chicken to plate and shred into bite sized pieces. Return chicken to crock pot. Add mayonnaise. Serve on hoagie rolls. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Slice french bread into 40 slices. Spread each with a thin layer of mayonnaise. Sprinkle each slice with 2 tablespoons shredded cheddar cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 5 to 7 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Place a strip of cooked bacon on each slice. Return to oven for another minute. Serve warm. Makes about 40 bites.

In a small saute pan melt butter over medium heat. Add shallots and cook until softened. Add thyme and saute for about 30 seconds. Turn off heat and add corn. Stir until corn is well coated in butter. Serve with extra thyme sprinkled on top.
Combine all ingredients except prawns in a bowl. Marinate prawns for 15 minutes. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat and saute prawns for 1-2 minutes or just until done.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and saute until translucent. Add rice and stir to coat with oil. Add broth and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for about 20 minutes. Stir in cumin and red pepper flakes. Cook for another 5 minutes. Add vinegar and salt and serve.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, cheddar cheese, green onions, and beer. Transfer batter to a pastry bag or a ziplock bag with a small tip. Pipe batter onto a hot greased skillet. Fry bread until golden brown on both sides. Serve immediately.

Remove roast from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. In a Dutch oven over medium-high heat, warm olive oil. Add carrots and onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant and lightly browned. Add celery and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add roast and cook until browned. Add red wine and deglaze the pan. Add beef bouillon and bring to a boil. Cover with a tight-fitting lid and transfer to oven. Bake at 300 degrees F until the meat is fork-tender, about 4 hours. Remove from oven and skim off the fat. With a slotted spoon transfer roast to a serving dish. Pour the cooking liquid over the roast. Serve.

Combine the first five ingredients and cut in the shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Spread in bottom of ungreased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Combine remaining ingredients and spread over the crust. Bake at 350 for 40-45 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

In a very large skillet over med heat, brown the pork loin chops with bone. Remove chops to a platter and deglaze the pan with the wine or water and flour to make a gravy. Add carrots, potatoes and tomato soup, bring to a boil, then add the chops back in, cover and cook over med-low heat for 1 hour. Serve hot with salt and freshly ground black pepper.

Melt butter in a large skillet over low heat. Add onion and saut until tender and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Add buckwheat groats and stir until coated with onions and fat. Add water, stirring well to combine. Bring mixture just to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered until buckwheat is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Stir in Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

In a small sauce pan combine tea, water and spices. Bring to a boil and cook for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. In a small bowl combine oat bran and chai tea. Sprinkle on top of yogurt or use as topping for pancakes.

Cover the bottom of a 9 x 13 baking pan with foil. In a small bowl combine the soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, garlic powder, and black pepper. Reserve half of the sauce mixture for later use. Place the chicken breasts into the pan. Pour the remaining sauce mixture evenly over the breasts. Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 40 minutes. Remove the foil from the top of the pan. Pour the remaining sauce mixture evenly over the chicken breasts. Bake uncovered for an additional 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

Place all the remaining ingredients into the crock pot. Mix well. Place the chicken on top of the mixture. Cook for 2 hours on low. Remove the chicken to a serving plate and use your potato masher to mash the chicken. Mix all the chicken back into the crock pot mixture. Place the green onions on top. Serve over cooked rice. Garnish with slices of orange.

Melt chocolate in top of double boiler. Remove from heat. Add in vanilla, stir well. Stir in oats and coconut. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet. Let set until firm, then store in air-tight container for up to one week or freeze for longer storage. Makes about 2 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly coat 2 quart baking dish with cooking spray. In large bowl combine sweet potatoes, brown sugar, flour, nuts, butter & salt. Mix well. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake 30 minutes. In small bowl whisk together cream, eggs & vanilla. Pour over potatoes. Bake 20-25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a small bowl, combine mustard, oil, garlic, tarragon, paprika, red pepper flakes. Stir to blend. In a large bowl, toss potatoes with mustard mixture. Place on baking sheet. Roast 30 minutes. Turn potatoes over and roast 15 minutes longer or until golden brown.

Cut potatoes into small cubes. Place in a large bowl. Heat butter in a small saucepan over low heat until butter is melted. Add flour, dill and stir for 1 minute. Add heavy cream and stir until mixture thickens. Add salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Pour over potatoes. Stir well. Add more heavy cream if mixture is too thick. Cool for 1 hour.

Wash mung dal and soak them in water for about 2 hours. After that drain the water. Take a pressure cooker or a pan. Add the dal, green chilies and fenugreek leaves to it. Add 2 cups of water to it. Add asafoetida powder and bicarbonate of soda. Cook it on a low flame for about 15 minutes. Then remove from the heat and let it cool. Then grind the dal mixture to a fine paste. Add gram flour to it. Mix it well. Then add sugar to it. Then add asafetida powder and salt to it. Mix it well. Heat the oil in a frying pan. Add a ladleful of the dal mixture to it. Then spread the dal mixture in the pan. Spread it evenly. After that flip the dal mixture over. After that remove the dal mixture from the pan and place it on a kitchen towel. Fry all the dal mixture in this manner. Serve this spicy moong dal waffles hot.

Preheat the oven to 200C/gas 6/fan 180C.Place the chicken pieces on a wire rack on a baking tray. Brush all over with the oil and sprinkle over the lemon zest, chicken stock powder, salt and pepper to taste. Roast for 30 minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven and spread the lemon juice evenly over it. Sprinkle the garlic and fresh rosemary over the chicken, return to the oven for another 20 minutes, or until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through. Serve immediately.

Combine cucumbers, tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes, artichoke hearts and red onion in large bowl. Set aside. In separate bowl combine feta cheese with olive oil. Season with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Add oregano if desired. Gently fold cheese mixture into cucumber mixture. Serve immediately or cover & refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Serve at room temperature with pita bread & assorted dips (hummus, tzatziki, baba ghanouj etc.)

Heat oil in saucepan over medium-high heat. Add bell peppers and saute 6-7 minutes until tender. Add onion and saute about 4 minutes until tender and slightly browned. Add garlic and saute an additional minute or until fragrant. Add zucchini and saute about 2 minutes until lightly browned. Add mushrooms and saute about 4 minutes until tender and lightly browned. Add wine and stock cube and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 10 minutes until reduced and thickened. Add heavy cream and bring back to a simmer. Adjust seasonings with pepper and serve over pasta of your choice.

To make polenta, start with 4 cups of water in the inner pot of the rice cooker. Add the cornmeal and stir with a wooden spoon. Cover and set the rice cooker on high for about 4 hours. Stir every so often. When it is done the polenta should be soft and creamy. Add the cheese and stir well until it is all melted and well blended into the polenta. If you like add the green onions and stir them in well with the cheese and the polenta. Remove the rice cooker from the heat and set aside uncovered for about half an hour. Then refrigerate the polenta until cold and hardened. Cut into 6 pieces and wrap each piece well in wax paper and put in an air-tight container. Put the container in the refrigerator or freezer. When ready to serve remove one piece and let it come to room temperature and slice into rounds about half an inch thick. If you wish you can fry them in a little oil in a skillet for about one minute on each side until crisp and brown. Or you can just eat them as they are and enjoy this very

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling water. When tender drain pasta and set aside. Heat olive oil in frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saute for 2 minutes or until onion is soft. Add artichoke hearts and peppers. Cook and stir for 2 more minutes. Stir in tomatoes, basil and pasta. Toss lightly. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

Blend coconut cream with honey until smooth and well blended. Stir in cornflour and stir until well blended and smooth. Add pineapple and stir until well blended and smooth. Pour into a pie shell and refrigerate until serving time. Garnish with a slice of pineapple if desired.

Brown ground beef and onion in large pot until beef is cooked through. Add water and stir to combine. Stir in remaining ingredients and simmer on medium heat for 20 minutes or until thickened. Serve over cooked rice.
Place all ingredients in slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 8-9 hours or high 4-5 hours. Shred or slice chicken and serve with warm tortillas and sour cream and salsa.

Preheat oven to 350f. Beat eggs and season with salt and pepper. Beat in parmesan cheese. Add frozen cauliflower and mix well. Heat oil in heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add cauliflower mixture and cook 2 minutes. Pour into 1 quart casserole dish and sprinkle with parsley. Bake uncovered for 25 to 30 minutes.

In a 1-1/2 qt. microwave safe bowl combine salt, turmeric, mustard seeds and celery seeds. Microwave on high 2 minutes. Stir to blend. Add vinegar and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add cucumbers and onions. Microwave 15 minutes uncovered. Stir, then microwave another 10-15 minutes until cucumbers are crisp tender. Remove from microwave and cool. Store refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.

Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and saute until tender and golden brown, about 10-15 minutes. Add shallot and onion and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add wine and thyme and cook until evaporated. Add ham and cook until heated through, about 3-4 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Serves 4 as a side dish or 2 as an appetizer.

Blend margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Blend in vanilla. Stir in vinegar. Combine flour with baking powder and saltadd to creamed mixture and blend well. Stir in raisins. Pour into unbaked pie crust. Bake at 350f for 50-60 minutes.

In a medium bowl, combine soup, milk, chives, dry mustard and hot pepper sauce. Bring to a boil. Stir in elbow macaroni. Pour into a greased 2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with gouda cheese. Melt butterstir in bread crumbs. Sprinkle over macaroni. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serves 4 to 6.
Blend milk, marshmallow creme and chocolate syrup. Pour into 4 glasses. Add ice and stir to combine. Garnish with graham cracker squares and mini marshmallows.

Heat chicken stock in a heavy saucepan until it comes to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in tarragon and orange. Let cool. In a salad bowl, whisk the chicken stock mixture with the olive oil and vinegar. Add turkey, grapes, and onion. Toss to coat. Taste and adjust seasoning. Cool. Arrange salad greens on a serving platter. Spoon turkey mixture on top. Garnish with tarragon sprigs.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut squash in half. Scoop out seeds and membrane. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake until squash is tender and flesh is golden brown. Cut into wedges. In a saucepan, combine butter, honey, worcestershire sauce, and cayenne pepper. Heat and stir until butter is melted. In a small bowl combine pecans and raisins. Place squash in a 13x9 inch baking dish. Spread butter mixture over top. Sprinkle with pecan mixture. Bake until hot and bubbly. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

In a large heavy skillet over medium heat, cook bacon and onion until the bacon is crisp and the onion is golden brown. Stir in the paprika and caraway seed. Remove the meat and place in a greased 1-1/2 quart casserole dish. Stir the tomatoes into the skillet and simmer until thickened. Pour the sauce over the meat and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees f until hot in the center. To serve, place a mound of hot mashed potatoes on each serving plate and top with the goulash. Garnish with sour cream if desired and serve immediately.

Line a 10x15 inch pan with wax paper. Microwave the vanilla baking chips and butter on high for 30 seconds. Stir. Microwave an additional 30 seconds or until melted. Add peanuts, pretzels, marshmallows to the melted butter mixture. Pour onto wax paper lined pan. Spread the melted mixture evenly. Spread the vanilla candy coating evenly over top. Let stand for 5 minutes. Break into clusters. Store in airtight container. Makes about 2 dozen clusters.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly coat an 8-inch square glass baking dish with cooking spray. In a large resealable bag or shallow dish combine cream cheese and jalapenosset aside. Beat chicken breasts in a large mixing bowl until flattened to 1/2-inch thickness. Dip chicken into cream cheese mixture to coat both sidesplace in prepared baking dish. Combine soup mix and onion in another mixing bowlstir in breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over chicken. Bake for 45 minutes or until juices run clear. Sprinkle chicken with garlic powder before serving. Serve chicken over rice.
Place all ingredients into a 3-quart slow cooker. Cook on low 8-9 hours. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 f. In large mixing bowl cream butter, sugar and vanilla extract. Combine flour and baking soda and add to the creamed mixture, stirring just until combined. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts and refrigerate dough for 30 minutes or overnight. Using a scoop or small balls of dough onto waxed paper. Put balls in the freezer for 30 minutes to an hour or until frozen. Melt chocolate and dip frozen balls in chocolate. Place back on waxed paper and put in refrigerator to set until ready to serve. Makes 24 dough balls.

Preheat oil to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Whisk together eggs, corn flakes crumbs, cinnamon, and honey until well blended. Dip ice cream balls into batter until coated evenly. Fry balls until golden brown in preheated oil, turning occasionally. Drain on paper towelskeep warm. Serve with whipped cream. Yield: 6 servings (serving size: 1 ice cream ball)

Combine peanut butter and butterscotch chips in a medium bowl and mix thoroughly with a spoon until mixture is smooth. Stir in corn flakes and pecans and mix thoroughly. Press into a greased 9x13 pan and bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Cool and break into squares to serve. Makes about 20 cookies.
Brown ground beef and drain. Add tomatoes, chili powder and tomato paste, and cook till tomatoes soften. Stir in corn, and cook another 5 minutes. Spoon onto hoagie rolls and serve.

Melt butter in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add chicken breastssaut 3 minutes. Add garlic clovesaut 30 seconds. Add winebring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowcover and simmer 3 minutes. Add mushroomssaut 3 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and liquid is almost evaporated. Add heavy creambring to boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer 3 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened. Transfer to plateserve with mashed or baked potato. Makes 2 servings.

In a large bowl, combine the strawberries with the sugar, lemon juice and salt. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight or for at least 4 hours to allow the juices to extract from the berries. In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in the milk, then add the cream cheese mixture to the strawberry puree. Set the mixture aside for 10 minutes to allow the berries to soften slightly. Combine the milk, heavy cream and vanilla extract in a large saucepan. Heat over medium-low heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, just until the mixture begins to boil. Remove the saucepan from the heat and place the mixture in a large bowl of ice water to cool the mixture rapidly. Whisk the mixture until it is very cold and forms stiff peaks. Place the mixture in the freezer for 2 hours or until it is the consistency of soft-serve ice cream. Stir in the strawberries with a rubber spatula to lightly combine with the ice cream mixture

In a large bowl mix together the biscuit crumbs and melted butter. Press into the bottom of 13x9x2-inch baking dishes. In another bowl beat together the sweetened condensed milk and the lemon rind. Pour over the crumbs. Set aside. In another bowl dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Add cold water. Pour over the filling. Chill until set. Cut into bars. Store in refrigerator.

In large mixing bowl combine corn syrup, brown sugar, butter and 2 cups of water in small sauce pan over medium heat stirring constantly until mixture comes to boil. Boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Pour into 2 gallon plastic bag or large bowl. Cool to room temperature. Dip both sides of bread into mixture. Arrange bread in a large greased casserole dish. In another bowl combine milk and eggs. Pour egg mixture evenly over bread slices. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm.
Bring water to a boil. Stir in flour and nutritional yeast and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in soy sauce and sage. Simmer 10 more minutes. Add remaining seasonings. Serve on a bun or over rice.

In crock pot place ribs. In medium bowl combine onion, apple butter, brown sugar and liquid smoke. Pour over ribs. Cook on low heat 6-8 hours. Add garlic 1 hour before serving. Cook 15 minutes longer.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (180 degrees c). Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Lightly dredge halibut steaks in flour and season with salt and pepper. Place in hot oil and saute for about 4 minutes per side, or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove halibut from pan and set aside. Discard all but 2 tablespoons of fat from pan. Stir in capers and lemon zest. Cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly, then stir in lemon juice and chives. Place halibut in baking dish and pour sauce over top. Bake for about 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350F. In 12 x 10 x 1 1/2-inch pan, place 1 pie crustsprinkle with 1 cup of the sausage and 1 cup of the green onions. In a saucepan, combine the picante sauce and milkbring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in the eggs and the cheeses until well blended. Spoon the mixture evenly over the sausage and onions. Place the remaining pie crust on topseal and flute the edge. Cut slits to vent and brush with the beaten egg. Bake 35 minutes or until golden brown and crust is firm. Cool slightlycut into wedges and serve. Makes 12 servings.

Combine first three ingredients in a 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes. Mix chocolate chips and margarine. Spread over warm nut mixture. Let stand until set. Cut into bars. Makes about 4 dozen.

Bring water to a boil. Add in orzo. Cook until tender. Remove from heat and add in green tea bags. Let tea bags steep for 5 minutes. Drain and add in raisins and pine nuts. Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add in the scallion and pine nuts. Toss until lightly browned. Add to orzo. Drizzle with olive oil. Garnish with more scallion. Serve immediately.

Heat margarine in a large saucepan. Add brown sugar and stir until melted. Add eggs. Stir constantly. Add vanilla. Blend dry ingredients together. Add dry ingredients to mixture. Mix well. Pour into greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes. Cool. Melt butterscotch chips and drizzle over top of brownies. Sprinkle with pecans. Cut into bars.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Sprinkle the scallops with the paprika. Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic clove and cook until the garlic is softened. Add the scallops. Cook until the scallops are lightly browned. Transfer the scallops to a baking sheet. Drizzle the scallops with the remaining butter. Sprinkle the scallops with the tarragon. Sprinkle with the parmesan. Bake 6 to 8 minutes until the scallops are just opaque in the center.
Mix juices in a pitcher. Add lime slices. Slowly pour in the sparkling white wine. Serve over ice. Garnish with a sugar cube. Serve with a straw.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan. In a medium bowl, mix together cookie dough and cream cheese until well blended. Press about half of the mixture in the bottom of the pan. Combine the remaining cookie dough with the cream cheese filling until well blended. Spread over crust. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the center is set. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven broiler. Season beef with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with garlic powder and dried rosemary. Broil for 10 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. Remove from ovenlet stand 5 minutes. Slice beef thinly and serve with your favorite steak sauce or horseradish sauce.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8×8 inch baking dish. Toast the breadcrumbs in a skillet over medium heat until golden brown. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool. Melt the butter in the skillet over medium heat. Add the asparagus and cook until soft. Stir in the cream and garliccook and stir 5 minutes or until the mixture is thick and creamy. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour the asparagus mixture into the prepared baking dish. Crack the eggs over the top of the asparagus. Sprinkle with the toasted bread crumbs and bake uncovered until the eggs are cooked through and the bread crumbs are golden brown and crisp, about 15 to 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) Grease an 8×8 inch square baking dish with the canola oil. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream together the canola oil, granulated sugar, light brown sugar and eggs until smooth. Mix in the vanilla and cinnamon. Sift together the flour, baking powder and saltmix into the batter until well combined. Fold the apples into the batter. Pour into the prepared dish. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top is golden brown. Cool for at least 30 minutes before cutting into bars.

Heat butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion. Cook until tender. Add cabbage. Cook until tender. Add chicken broth, tomatoes, carrots, garlic, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 15 minutes. Add chicken. Cook until chicken is no longer pink. Add basil. Cook until basil is wilted. Ladle into soup bowls. Sprinkle chives on top.

Peel bananas and cut in half lengthwise. Insert wooden popsicle sticks into each half of banana. Spread peanut butter on the bottom of the banana and top with the cookies. Arrange decorative candies on top of the cookies to look like frosting. Place in freezer for an hour or until they are firm. Remove from freezer and serve immediately.

Beat eggs in a bowl. Add cream. Salt and pepper. Stir in onion. Add corn. Pour into shell. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Top with parsley. Bake in 400 degree oven for 30-35 minutes or until pie is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350°. Line an 8x8" pan with wax paper. In a food processor fitted with the metal blade, process the beans until very smooth. Scrape the sides as necessary. Add the eggs and process for another minute or so. Add the butter, cocoa, salt and vanilla and process until well blended. Add the sugar and process until combined. Scrape the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before cutting into squares.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drainrinse with cold water. In a large bowl, combine pasta, Italian dressing and cheese. Toss well. Cover and chill at least 4 hours. Just before serving, sprinkle with parsley. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Dissolve the salt in 2 cups of water. Soak the dates in the water overnight or for at least 4 hours. In a blender, combine the coconut cream and the dates with 1 to 2 tablespoons of water to make a smooth puree. Add the honey and the lemon juice to the date puree. Pour this mixture into an ice cream maker and process according to the manufacturer's instructions. When the ice cream is done, transfer to a freezer container and freeze for at least 2 hours. Serve topped with shaved coconut.

Process peanuts, salt, onion, garlic and mango in food processor until smooth. Transfer mixture to large bowl. Add curry powder, coriander seed and honey and stir until well mixed. Stir in mayonnaise and lemon juice until smooth. Serve with vegetables or crackers. Makes about 4 cups.

Heat olive oil and add cinnamon. Add the steaks and saute on both sides. Add the mushrooms and cook about 2 minutes. Add the wine, cover and cook about 1 minute. Add the linguine and cover. Cook the linguine for about 1 minute or until tender but still firm. Add the hazelnuts and stir through until combined and nuts are golden. Serve at once with crusty bread.

In a 10-inch skillet, over medium-high heat, add the olive oil. Add the sausage and saute until it is browned. Remove sausage from skillet and drain off all but 2 tablespoons of fat. Add potatoes to the skillet and saute for 5 minutes. Add the green and red peppers and red onion. Saute for 5 minutes or until potatoes are tender and onions are translucent. Stir in the onion soup mix and water. Add the sausage back into the pan. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Serve with cornbread.

Prepare couscous according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, whisk together the chicken stock and olive oil. Stir in the mint and parsley. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Fill tomatoes with stuffing. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with feta. Bake in a 400 degree oven until the tomatoes are tender and the cheese is bubbling, about 15 minutes.

Mix chicken, lime juice, fish sauce, sugar in bowl until chicken is coated well. Add chili pepper. Mix rice flour in a separate bowl and set aside. Heat oil in wok over medium heat until hot. Add chicken mixture, stirring until lightly browned. Add rice flour, stirring constantly until mixture has thickened. Serve with green onions, fresh cilantro and fresh mint.

Heat milk in a double boiler or saucepan over low heat. In a medium bowl, beat the egg yolks with the salt and superfine sugar until thickened and pale yellow. Gradually beat in the brandy. Stir in the vanilla extract. Gradually pour the hot milk into the egg-brandy mixture, whisking constantly to prevent curdling. Return the mixture to the saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until the mixture thickens enough to coat the spoon. Transfer to a bowl and let cool. Add the brandy or cognac. Serve chilled in a brandy snifter or shot glass.

Mix together the catsup, apple cider vinegar, orange juice and red wine vinegar. Add sugar, dry mustard and hot sauce. Mix well. Stir in cornstarch until dissolved. Stir in water. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently until thickened and bubbly. Serve over meat.

Toast bread. On one slice spread mustard. Top with ham and cheese. Place second slice on top. Place in toaster oven or on stove top griddle until golden brown and crisp. Serve with apricot jam dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 375. Unroll crescent rolls lengthwise. Cream cream cheese with sugar until light and fluffy. Spread over crescent rolls. Roll up starting with the wide end. Cut into 1/4 inch slices. Place in greased 9x13 pan. Mix together pie filling and pour over crescent rolls. Bake for 35 minutes.
Prepare cake mix as directed on box. Pour into a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Pour peach filling over top. Sprinkle cinnamon and sugar over top. Bake for 40-45 minutes.

Saute cubanelle pepper in oil in a 12 inch nonstick skillet over medium heat until softened, 6 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 5 minutes. Add eggs and cook, stirring constantly with a spatula to form scrambled eggs with chunks of tomatoes, about 2 minutes. Fold in cheese and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Cut tofu into 1/4 inch thick slices. Combine remaining ingredients in small bowl. Brush both sides of tofu with marinade and set aside for 15 minutes. Combine remaining ingredients in large skillet and bring to a boil. Add salmon and cook for 2 minutes or until cooked through. Add tofu and stir well to combine. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until tofu is heated through and cooked through. Serve over rice or noodles.

Boil celery, onion, beets and tomatoes together until softened. Strain. Combine the juice with lemon juice, sugar, spice mixture, Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco. Chill. Makes 2 litres. Serve over ice.
In a saucepan, combine all ingredients over medium heat, stirring constantly until sauce thickens to desired consistency. Makes enough for a 4 person stir fry.

In a small saucepan, bring orange juice and vinegar to a simmer over medium heat. Lower the heat and let simmer for 15-20 minutes until the mixture has reduced and thickened to a syrupy consistency. Remove from the heat and add the sugar and cinnamon schnapps stirring until the sugar dissolves. Set the glaze aside and let cool for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Slice the peaches in half and remove the pit. Place on the grill and cook for 3-5 minutes on each side until the peaches are slightly charred and softened. Drizzle with glaze and serve warm.

In a small bowl, combine the sour cream and mayonnaisestir in the jalapeno peppers, pimiento and onions. Spread in a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with the cheese and sunflower seeds. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes until bubbly and golden brown on top. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving with tortilla chips.

Toss mushrooms with harissa and oil in a bowl. Place the mushrooms on the grill and cook 3 minutes per side or until the mushrooms are soft and the liquid evaporates. Sprinkle with oregano and drizzle with vinegar.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat and whisk in the flour until smooth. Gradually stir in the chicken broth until well blended. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly until sauce thickens. Remove from the heat, stir in the maple syrup, lemon rind and pepper. Set aside. Rinse the chicken in cold waterdrain well. Pat dry with paper towelssprinkle with pepper on both sides. Pour the sauce over the chickencover with foil. Bake for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Transfer chicken to a serving platterkeep warm in the oven. In a small saucepan, melt the butter over low heatstir in the maple syrup. Remove from the heatstir in the almonds. Spoon the sauce over the chicken and serve hot.

Place potatoes in a large pot and add enough water to cover potatoes and a dash of salt. Bring to a boil and boil for about 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. Drain potatoes and mash. In a medium bowl add the mashed potatoes and mix in the rest of the ingredients until well blended. Shape mixture into round balls and place on a cookie sheet that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with plum sauce. Plum Sauce: Cook plums and water together until soft, blend. Add lemon juice and honey to taste and serve with dumplings or pork.

Cut top off each chile. Remove seeds and membranes. Rinse well. Set aside. In small bowl, combine chicken, butter, peanut oil, onion and nutmeg. Mix well. Spoon mixture into each chile. Arrange on baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Spoon in tomatoes. Bake an additional 15 minutes. Garnish with parsley. Serve in chiles. Makes about 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. In a large skillet, cook pork chops in butter over medium-high heat 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer to baking dish. In the same skillet, combine the next 5 ingredientscook over medium-high heat 5 minutes or until almost tender. Add watercook 1 minute or until liquid is gone. Spoon over pork chops. Sprinkle with parsley and salt. Bake at 375 degrees F. for 45 minutes or until pork chops are no longer pink. Serve immediately. Yield: 4 servings.

In a large mixing bowl combine carrots, oranges and onions. In a small mixing bowl combine vegetable oil, lemon juice and water. Pour over the carrot mixture. Allow to marinate for 1 hour. Drain and serve. Makes about 6 servings.
Drain tuna and mix with mayonnaise. Add celery, onion, parsley, lemon juice, salt, pepper & mustard. Toss with pasta shells. Chill until serving.

Put milk in a double boiler over hot water. Stir marshmallow creme until melted. Add peanut butter and stir. Remove from heat. Stir in popped popcorn and mix well. Spread on waxed paper and let stand overnight to harden. Cut into shapes or squares and dip each in melted chocolate and place on waxed paper to set. Sprinkle each with chopped nuts if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 8-inch round cake pans. In a medium bowl, beat the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in the baking powder. Add the eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Beat in the vanilla and milk. Add the flour alternately with the milk, starting and ending with flour. Divide the batter evenly between the two cake pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet. Add the greens, tossing well until they begin to wilt. Add honey and vinegar. Cook another minute or two until greens are crisp-tender, but still brightly colored. Salt to taste. Makes 4 servings. Serve with chicken or fish.

Prepare pork chops as directed on package. In a medium bowl, combine onion, green pepper and next 3 ingredients. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add the vegetable mixture and cook until tender. Add pork chops and remaining ingredients. Cook, covered, over medium heat for 5 minutes or until pork is no longer pink in center. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with almonds. Serve over rice.

Cream the peanut butter with the sugar and egg for about 2 minutes on medium speed until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla and maple extracts. Drop by teaspoons on a nonstick cookie sheet (I use baking parchment). Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from the oven and let cool for 3 minutes. Sprinkle with chocolate chips or toffee bits while still warm. Store in an airtight container. You can also substitute 1 cup chopped nuts for the chocolate chips or add 1 cup chopped nuts and 1 cup chocolate chips for a double chocolate chip cookie. You can also make them with semi-sweet chocolate baking squares instead of the chocolate chips for even more chocolate goodness.

soak the beans in plenty of water overnight. Drain the beans and put in a large pot with the lamb or beef. Add water just to cover the meat. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and simmer until the meat is tender. Remove the meat from the pot with a slotted spoon. Strain the beans and save the broth. Heat the corn oil in a large skillet. Add the onions and cook over moderate heat until they are soft. Add the tomato paste and cook until the paste is brown. Add the crushed tomatoes, the reserved meat broth from the beans and the curry powder. Bring to a boil. Add the beans and the broth from the pot. Simmer for about half an hour. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice or flat bread. Recipe.

In a medium bowl, stir together sweetened condensed milk and yogurt. In another bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and 1/3 cup sugar. Mix in butter and toss to coat. Press mixture onto bottom and 1 inch up sides of a 9-inch springform pan. Bake at 350f for 5 minutes. Cool completely. In a food processor or blender, mix together milk and vanilla until smooth. Beat in yogurt until smooth and creamy. Pour over graham cracker mixture and smooth. Chill for at least 1 hour. Just before serving, cut through the set surface with a knife and gently loosen the sides. Slide the knife along the edge of the pan to remove the sides. If desired, decorate with fresh fruit.
Brown onion and garlic salt in salad oil. Add beans and heat through. Add cheese and jalapeno peppers. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 9x13 inch baking pans. Beat eggs and milk together in a medium bowl. Stir in corn, pepper, and bread cubes until combined. Pour into the pans, and bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven, and stir in the sugar. Sprinkle cereal over the top of the mixture. Bake for 15 more minutes in the preheated oven. Serve immediately, or refrigerate until chilled.

Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a bowl. Cut in butter until crumbly. Stir in cheese and yogurt until just moistened. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently 3 or 4 times. Roll or pat dough into an 8-inch circle. Cut into 8 wedges. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 400 for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks. Makes 8 scones.

In a medium bowl whisk together cream, instant coffee granules, vanilla extract, and sugar free instant vanilla pudding mix until smooth. Cover and refrigerate for 4-5 hours or overnight. Serve with sugar free chocolate sauce or sugar free whipped cream.
Combine dry ingredients in bowl. Beat egg lightly and add to bowl. Stir buttermilk into dry ingredients until smooth. Fry on griddle as usual. Makes 10-12 pancakes.

Mix lime juice with sugar in large pitcher. Add 2 cups of soda water and stir well. Chill thoroughly. When ready to serve pour into glasses. Add ice cubes and maraschino cherries. Top off with soda water. Garnish with lime slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together the peaches, butter and pecan pieces. Pour mixture into an 8x8 baking pan and bake for 20 minutes. Spread cake mix over peaches and bake for another 10 minutes. Sprinkle with coconut and bake for another 10 minutes. Cool and serve.

Bring 1 inch water to a boil in a large pot. Add broccoli. Cover and steam until bright green about 4 minutes. Drain broccoli. In a food processor puree lemon juice, olive oil and garlic until smooth. Pour over broccoli, add salt and pepper. Toss lightly.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, garlic and salt. Saute mushrooms until golden brown. Reduce heat to low. Add half-and-half. Cook until slightly thickened. Stir in cream cheese until melted. Stir in gouda cheese until melted. Stir in spinach. Stir well. Serve with crackers.
Spread pesto on one side of sandwich bread. Layer mozzarella cheese on top. Season with salt and pepper.

Peel, core and cut apples into 1/2-inch cubes. Combine with pineapple and nuts in a large bowltoss to mix well. In another bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise and juice until smooth. Pour over the apple mixture and toss well to coat evenly. Refrigerate until serving time. Just before serving, top with whipped topping. Serve immediately. Yield: 6 servings.

Combine coffee, cinnamon sticks and peppermint extract. Stir well. Heat at low to medium heat for 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and remove cinnamon sticks. Stir in fat-free evaporated milkserve hot.

In a bowl combine egg yolks and sweetened condensed milk. Mix thoroughly. Heat in a double boiler until mixture thickens when spoon is lifted from pan. Add lime zest and lime juice to mixture and blend thoroughly. Cool completely. Pour into crust and refrigerate for at least 3 hours until firm. Garnish with cool whip, lime zest and lime slices.

Prepare a baking sheet with paper towels. Slice potatoes about 1/2 thick. Combine 2 cups of potato slices at a time with 1/2 cup of ice water. Drain for about 10 minutes or until water is clear. Pat the potatoes dry with paper towels. Combine the barbecue sauce with 1/4 cup of peanut oil. Deep fry the potatoes at 375 degrees for 3 to 4 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Serve with more barbecue sauce.

Prepare an outdoor grill for direct cooking over medium heat (350-375 degrees f) with medium hot coals on one side of grill and no coals on the other side or prepare a stovetop grill pan over medium-high heat. Sprinkle both sides of pork with salt and pepperset aside. Whisk together hoisin sauce, lemon juice, mustard and honey in small bowl. Reserve 1/3 cup of sauce in another bowl for brushing on pork during grilling. In another bowl combine remaining sauce with soy sauce, gingerroot and garlicset aside. Brush pork with soy sauce mixture and reserve remaining sauce for basting during grilling. Grill or grill pan sear pork 3 minutes per side or until browned. Brush pork with reserved sauce and cook 10 minutes more or until done (an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest part of pork should read 140-145 degrees f). Transfer to cutting boardtent loosely with aluminum foil and let stand

Bring apricots and 1/2 pint water to the boil in a large pan. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Drain the apricots and place them in a bowl. Pour the brandy over the apricots and leave to soak for 20 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375°F. Cream the coconut oil and sugar together until the mixture is light and fluffy. Add the eggs and beat well. Add the almonds and beat until just combined. Fold in the apricots and brandy mixture with the chocolate. Divide the mixture into 24 balls and place on a baking tray. Bake for 15 minutes until golden brown. Leave to cool on the baking tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cut the ham into 1-inch thick slices. In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the brown sugar, lemon juice, horseradish, yellow mustard, vegetable oil and worcestershire. Seal the bag and shake until the mixture is well blended. Place the ham slices in the bag and turn several times until all sides are coated. Place the ham on the grill. Grill 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Remove from the grill and let stand for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve warm.

Cut the veal into small pieces. Melt the butter in a large pan. Add the veal and brown. Add the leek and the garlic. Cook for a few minutes. Add the barley and cook for a few minutes. Add water to cover the barley. Add the bay leaves, wine vinegar, salt and pepper. Add the sage leaves. Bring the mixture to the boil. Simmer for 30 minutes. Check the barley for doneness. Add more water if necessary. Add the parsley. Serve hot.

Place the rice, barley, wine, thyme, 2 cups water, salt, and pepper in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat. Stir in the remaining water and the orange juice. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork. Sprinkle with the parsley. Garnish with the walnuts.

Thaw the puff pastry according to the package directions. Preheat oven to 400. Unfold the pastry. Sprinkle the turkey breast with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Spread the pastrami on the pastry. Top with the turkey. Brush the pastry edges with the egg wash. Fold over the pastry edges to seal. Place the roll on a baking sheet. Brush the top with the egg wash. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes. Serve on a bed of mixed greens topped with dijonnaise mustard.
Cut melon into chunks. Add to food processor with sugar and mint. Process until smooth. Pour into bowl. Cover and freeze for at least 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Brush each fillet with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Arrange fillets in single layer in shallow baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until just opaque in center. Meanwhile, whisk together honey mustard and thyme in small bowl. Remove fillets from oven and brush with mustard mixture. Sprinkle each fillet with breadcrumbs and parsley. Bake for additional 5 minutes or until fillets are just cooked through and breadcrumbs are golden brown. Drizzle with additional honey mustard sauce. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar and cornstarch stirring to combine. Add orange juice gradually while stirring to prevent lumps from forming. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice and salt. Allow to cool before pouring over desserts or cakes.

Line an 18x28cm slice pan with baking paper. Sift flour and cocoa into a large bowl. Add eggs and sugar. Beat until well combined. Add oil and yogurt and beat until combined. Pour into prepared pan. Bake in a 180C oven for 30 minutes or until firm to touch and cooked through. Cool for 30 minutes in the pan before removing and cooling on a wire rack completely. In a small bowl combine icing sugar and enough water to form a thick icing. Spread evenly over the cooled fudge slice and place malt balls on top. Leave in the fridge for 1 hour before cutting into slices.
In a small bowl mix the refried beans with the jalapeño. Spread the refried bean mixture over the tortilla chips. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Top with sour cream and sprinkle with pimiento.

Place the pizza crust on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle evenly with chilies. Sprinkle with chicken strips. Sprinkle with taco seasoning. Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 15 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Spread with butter and sprinkle with salsa. Sprinkle with ranch dressing. Garnish with tortilla chips.

In a large saucepan bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pastacook until al dente. Drain well. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add prosciuttocook until crisp. Add vodka. Cook until almost evaporated. Add heavy cream. Stir in pasta. Sprinkle with parmigiano-reggiano. Garnish with basil. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta in boiling water 2 minutes or until tender. Drainrinse with cold water and drain again. In a large bowl, combine pasta and the remaining ingredients. Stir to blend. Cover and refrigerate. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Mix all dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Using an electric mixer, cream margarine and sugars in a large mixing bowl until smooth. Add egg whites. Mix until combined well. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients. Stir by hand until just combined. Pour into an ungreased 13x9 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 - 30 minutes or until edges are golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven, allow to cool completely on a wire rack. Makes about 20 squares.

Peel potatoes and cut into pieces. Boil in salted water until tender. Drain well and place in a large bowl. Mash potatoes with butter and milk. Add salt and pepper and continue mashing until smooth. Add heavy cream and mash well again. Add cheeses and continue mashing until smooth. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash potatoes. Cut each into four pieces. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray. Add potatoes. Sprinkle with oil. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Let stand until cool enough to handle. In a medium size skillet over medium heat, cook onion in oil for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add red pepper paste. Stir to combine. Add chicken breasts. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add potatoes. Stir to combine. Add salt to taste. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 4.

Cook pasta in boiling water according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and saute for 5 minutes or until browned. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside. Add the wine and cook for 3 minutes or until almost evaporated. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the dill, chicken and cream. Simmer for 2 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Stir in the lemon juice and parmesan. Serve over hot pasta.

Soak mustard seeds and garlic in water for 12 hours. Strain seeds and garlic, place seeds and garlic in food processor with remaining ingredients and process until smooth. Place in air-tight container and refrigerate for two weeks before serving.

Mix dry ingredients. Add yeast and oil. Add water and egg. Stir until smooth. Divide dough into 20 pieces. Form each piece into a round. Place into a well greased bread pan. Let rise for 15 minutes. Bake at 400 degrees f for 15 minutes.

Clean your catfish thoroughly. Place catfish in a dish large enough to hold all the fish at once. Season fish on both sides with black pepper. Next sprinkle seasoning blend on both sides of catfish. Place in preheated 350f oven for 35-40 minutes.

In an oven-proof roasting pan, add Boston Butt pork roast and pour the vinegar mixture over the roast. Place in the oven at 300 degrees F for 4 hours. After 4 hours of cooking time, remove the roast from the oven, place it on a wire rack to rest for at least 20 minutes. While the roast is resting, prepare the barbecue sauce by combining the ketchup, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, molasses, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic and onion powder in a medium saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil and let boil for 2 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and let the sauce cool for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine the ginger ale and the seasoned salt. Once the sauce has cooled completely, pour it into a 2-cup measuring cup and fill the rest of the way with the ginger ale mixture. Mix well. Remove the Boston Butt from the roasting pan and pour the barbecue sauce evenly over the roast

Cook beef in a large skillet with onion until beef is brown. Drain. Add garlic, pepper, celery and mushrooms. Cook until celery is crisp-tender. Add bouillon powder. Stir in water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until liquid is absorbed. Meanwhile, in a saucepan, combine rice with 1-1/2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until rice is tender but not mushy. Stir into beef mixture. Add soy sauce. Heat through. Serves 4.

Cut the tempeh into cubes and marinate in barbecue sauce for 30 minutes. Thread the vegetables onto skewers alternately with the tempeh. Grill over medium heat for about 5 minutes. Turn the kebabs over and grill for another 5 minutes. Serve warm with rice.

Brown and drain chicken in vegetable oil. Mix broth, garlic powder and noodles in a 2 qt. microwavable dish. Add in chicken and frozen mixed vegetables. Cover dish and cook 3 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with 2 cups cheese. Cook an additional 2 minutes. Stir and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Let stand 1-2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter an 8-inch square baking dish. In a medium bowl beat together eggs and milk. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. In a 12-inch heavy skillet cook butter and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. When melted and foamy add egg mixture and stir. Cook 2 minutes or until bottom is lightly browned and just set. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup cheese. Turn omelet onto baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until puffed and browned. Cut into 4 squares.

Sift together flour and 1 cup of the icing sugar. Cream together the butter and 1/2 cup of the icing sugar until smooth. Beat in the cream cheese and pistachio pudding mix until well blended. Stir in the nuts. Press mixture into a 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 to 25 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool completely. Beat together the remaining icing sugar and the cool whip until smooth. Spread over the cooled cake. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Yields 24 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Pound chicken breasts to an even thickness of 1/2-inch. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium high heatadd chicken breasts and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon oregano leaves, 1/4 teaspoon oregano leaves and 1/2 teaspoon parsley. Cook for 3 minutes on each side, or until no longer pink inside. Combine remaining paprika, parsley, almonds, oregano leaves, parsley, parmesan cheese, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Sprinkle over chicken breastscook for 5 minutes longer or until chicken is done.

Cut bread into slices. Spread both sides of each slice with butter. Place a frankfurter in each slice. Spread both sides of each frankfurter with ketchup. Top each frankfurter with a gherkin. Spread each side of each sandwich with sweet mustard. Wrap each sandwich in foil. Place in a preheated oven at 200 degrees for 10 minutes. Unwrap each sandwich. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400. Cut off the green stems of the leeks. Wash the leeks well and slice the white part 1/4 inch thick. Drizzle the leeks with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast 20 minutes or until leeks are just tender. Toss leeks with parsley and balsamic vinegar.
Hard boil the eggs. Remove the shell and slice the eggs. Mix in the turkey. Drain the gherkins and mix in the salad sauce and mayonnaise.

Preheat oven to 375. In a bowl, mix the sausage with the italian breadcrumbs. Divide the sausage mixture into 10 portions and roll each portion into a ball. Cut off the top 1/2 inch of each mushroom and reserve. Spoon sausage mixture into each mushroom and place the reserved mushroom tops over the filling. Bake in a greased shallow pan for 20 minutes. Sprinkle mushrooms with mozzarella cheese and bake 5 minutes more until cheese is melted.

Place pie crust in bottom of pie pan. Bake in 350 degree oven for 10 minutes. Mix clam chowder and eggs in mixing bowl. Add cheese and green onions. Spread mixture into baked crust. Bake in 350 degree oven for 45 minutes. Garnish with parsley and pepper.
In 2 tall glasses layer the cool whip, yogurt and granola. Top with blueberries.
Combine all ingredients and chill before serving. Serve with chips. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Line muffin pan with paper liners. In medium bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. In separate bowl, combine oil, milk and eggs. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in almond extract and poppy seeds. Fill liners 3/4 full. Bake 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack.
1 can rotel tomatoes 1 pound velveeta cheese 1 pound cooked chicken breasts 1/4 cup milk 1/2 tsp cumin mix all together and put in crock pot on high for 3 hours. serve with tortilla chips.

Cook the rice according to package directions. While the rice is cooking, in a small saucepan whisk together the coconut milk, cream, sugar and salt until well combined. Remove the rice from the heat and add the coconut milk mixture. Stir to combine. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 450. Wash potatoes in a colander. Toss the potatoes in a large bowl with olive oil, garlic cloves, dried rosemary and salt and pepper. Spread potatoes evenly on a large baking sheet. Roast for about 20 minutes or until the potatoes are cooked through. Meanwhile, place the cherry tomatoes on a separate baking sheet. Drizzle them with a little olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast for about 20 minutes or until the tomatoes are softened. Season the cod fish fillets with a little salt and pepper. Heat the remaining olive oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat. Cook the cod for about 4 to 5 minutes per side or until cooked through. Top the fish with kalamata olives. Serve the fish on top of the roasted potatoes and tomatoes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.
Mix all ingredients in a large bowl. Turn into a loaf pan. Bake at 350 for one hour or until done. Serve with mashed potatoes & gravy.

In a large saute pan, over medium heat, heat vegetable oil and add ground sirloin. Stir and break up with a wooden spoon until it is broken down and is lightly browned. Remove from heat and drain off the fat, if any remains. Add the chicken stock and mix well. Add the sweet paprika and worcestershire sauce and mix well. Season with salt and pepper and mix well. Cover and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, heat a large skillet over medium heat and add the ground sirloin mixture. Cook until completely heated through. Serve on hamburger buns with your favorite toppings such as yellow onion or mayonnaise. Makes about 4 sandwiches.

Toast french bread lightly. Cut into bite size pieces and spread with cream cheese and fresh spinach. Top with mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with garlic salt. Bake at 375 for about 12 minutes or until cheese melts and becomes golden brown. Serve warm.

Butter one side of each slice of bread. Lay one slice of bread butter side down in your panini grill. Lay 2 slices of provolone cheese on bread, top with 2 slices of prosciutto. Top with raspberry jam to desired level. Top with 1 egg per sandwich. Close sandwich with remaining slice of bread. Grill on medium heat until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown. Turn over and repeat until sandwich is cooked through. Serve hot.

Heat the oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly oil a 9×13 baking pan. Cook the onions over medium heat with the oil until they are very soft and caramelized, 20 minutes. Layer the potatoes on the bottom of the pan. Layer the kielbasa on top of the potatoes. Scatter the sauerkraut over the top of the kielbasa. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Serve hot.

In a shallow dish combine the Parmesan cheese and mayonnaise. In a separate shallow dish combine the paprika and the hot sauce. Dip each fillet in the paprika mixture and place in the Parmesan mixture and turn to coat both sides well. Place the coated fillets in a greased baking dish. Bake uncovered in a preheated oven of 425 f for 20 to 25 minutes or until done. Sprinkle with the green onions before serving.

Heat butter in pressure cooker. Add leeks and cook until tender. Add potatoes. Add stock. Lock lid in place. Select soup function. When cycle is done and all pressure has been released, add onions. Stir. Add milk. Heat through. Stir in cream. Serve immediately.

Bring potatoes to a boil in a large pot of salted water. Cook until a knife easily pierces the potatoes (about 40 minutes) and then drain them and transfer them to a large bowl. Pour the sour cream over the potatoes and stir well. In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, Dijon mustard and cayenne pepper sauce and season with salt and pepper. Fold the mixture into the potato and sour cream mixture until well combined and then stir in the bacon and eggs. Taste and add more salt if needed. Cover and refrigerate for at least a couple of hours before serving.

In a large bowl, sift together plain flour, brown flour, lsa, salt. In a measuring jug or bowl, combine 100ml oil with 100ml water, then mix in the honey. Add to dry ingredients with the yeast and mix until a soft dough is formed. Knead until smooth, adding more flour if it is too sticky. Place in a bowl, cover with cling film or a clean tea towel. Leave in a warm place for 30 minutes to rise. Divide into 24 equal pieces, shape into balls. Place on a greased tray, cover with a clean tea towel. Leave to rise for 10 minutes. Bake in a preheated oven at 190C, gas mark 5 for 15-20 minutes. Brush with egg glaze to seal. Cool on wire rack. Glaze: Mix 1 egg with 2 tbsp water. Brush bread with glaze before baking.

Remove husks and silk from corn. Brush with a little butter and sprinkle with a little salt and pepper. Place in a baking pan with a little water at the bottom. Cover tightly with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until tender. Remove from pan and brush with butter or margarine and sprinkle with honey. Serve with butter or margarine and honey.

Brown hamburger in skillet with garlic and dried chili pepper flakes. Remove from skillet, leaving grease in skillet. Top with refried beans. Add a layer of nacho chips. Add layer of hamburger mixture. Top with salsa. Top with cheese. Cover with lid or foil. Bake in 350 degree oven 20-30 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Beat egg and buttermilk in a large mixing bowl. Stir in the molasses, then the butter. Sift together the flour, baking soda and baking powder into the molasses mixture and stir just until smooth. Stir in the cornmeal. The batter will be quite thick. Heat a lightly greased griddle over medium heat. Pour batter by 1/4 cupful onto griddle. Cook until the top of the pancake is covered with bubbles. Flip pancakes and cook for 2-3 minutes longer. Serve with butter or maple syrup.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Stir together cocoa and next 3 ingredients in a large bowl. Combine flour and next 4 ingredients in a small bowl and stir well. Add flour mixture to cocoa mixture, stirring just until dry ingredients are moistened. Fold in carrots and nuts. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Cut into bars. Yield: about 2 dozen bars.
Combine vodka, rum, gin and tequila in a large pitcher. Pour in lemonade. Top with curacao and lemonade. Garnish with lemon wedge. Serve in an ice-filled punch bowl or pitcher.

Rinse white asparagus. Cut off woody ends. Cut asparagus into 3-inch pieces. Place butter in a medium skillet. Add asparagus. Season with salt. Add sugar. Slowly cook asparagus. Stir in mushrooms. Continue to cook until asparagus is tender. Add shallots. Continue to cook until shallots are tender. Add thyme. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Stir in parsley. Serve immediately.

In a food processor or blender, combine avocados, sour cream, chicken broth, onion, oil, coriander, chili powder, cilantro, lime juice and salt. Blend until smooth. Add additional chicken broth as needed. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Ladle into bowls and top with cilantro. Serve with toasted tortilla chips.

Roast the strawberries in a cast iron skillet. Put the sugar in the bottom of the pan. Add the strawberries, lemon juice and framboise liqueur. Cook over medium heat until the liquid reduces down to a syrup, about 5 minutes. Let cool. Pile the ice cream into glasses, top each serving with roasted strawberries and drizzle the sauce over the top.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the chops in a single layer. Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Brown the chops on both sides. Add the stewed tomatoes. Turn chops. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer until the chops are tender. Remove from heat. Place chops on a platter. Spoon the tomatoes over the chops.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a medium saucepan. Whisk over medium heat until thickened and bubbly, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in vanilla and chocolate chips. Pour into a 8-inch square baking pan coated with cooking spray. Chill for at least 4 hours or until firm. To serve, spoon cream over the top and sprinkle with chocolate shavings.

Toast the english muffins in a panini maker or on a skillet or grill. Spread the pesto sauce on the english muffins and place tomatoes on the english muffins. Sprinkle with radicchio. Place goat cheese on top. Broil for 2-3 minutes or until cheese melts.

Heat a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil to pan. Add garlic cloves to pansauté for 1 minute or until golden brown. Add portabella mushrooms to pansauté for 1 minute or until mushrooms are golden brown. Add lemon juice to panstir well to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Place pita bread rounds on a baking sheetlightly spray rounds with olive oil cooking spray. Bake at 450° for 2 minutes or until bread is golden brown on both sides. Place mushrooms on bottom of each pita roundtop each with mesclun salad. Drizzle with olive oilsprinkle with vinegar. Serve immediately.

In a food processor, combine coconut, sesame oil and a pinch of red pepper flakes. Process until mixture forms a paste-like consistency, and place in a bowl. Cut 2 shrimp in half lengthwise. Stuff each half with a little cilantro and a small amount of the coconut paste and press the edges to seal. Repeat with the remaining shrimp and coconut mixture. In a small bowl, mix roasted peanuts and lime juice. Roll each shrimp into the peanut mixture. Place on a baking sheet and spray lightly with cooking spray. Bake at 450 degrees f for 4-5 minutes per side or until shrimp are opaque and crisp. Serve warm with a lime wedge on the side.

Preheat oven to 400. Butter a 9-inch square baking pan. Place the catfish fillets into the pan. Mix butter with garlic in a small bowl. Spread the butter mixture over the catfish fillets. Sprinkle the top with breadcrumbs and seasoning salt. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the catfish is cooked through. Serves 4.

Melt the butter in a large heavy bottomed saucepan. Add the sugar and honey. Stir until dissolved. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in puffed rice cereal. Spread onto a lightly greased baking sheet to cool. Store in an airtight container.

Cook frozen vegetables until heated through. Melt butter in small pan. Stir in flour. Cook until lightly browned. Stir in milk. Cook until thickened. Add vegetables and cheese. Stir until melted. Sprinkle with parsley. Spread in 11x7 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serves 4.

Season the chicken with the salt and pepper. In a saute pan, heat the olive oil until it is just shimmering. Add the chicken to the pan. Brown the chicken on both sides. Add the tangerine juice and the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the marmalade. Taste for seasoning. Stir in the vinegar and crushed red pepper flakes. Remove the chicken from the pan. Stir in the tangerine peel. Place the chicken back in the pan. Simmer for 3 minutes. Serve immediately.
Heat oil in pan. Beat eggs. Add onion and green chili pepper. Add salt. Pour in eggs and mix well. Pour milk over eggs and mix well. Serve hot.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add garlic and crushed red pepper flakes. Saute until garlic turns golden. Add whole tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, oregano, basil and parsley. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Transfer to a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Adjust seasonings with salt and pepper. Store in a jar in the refrigerator. Serve over pasta, meatballs or pizza. Makes about 2 cups.

Cook new potatoes in boiling water until done. Drain. Rinse potatoes in cold water. Set aside to cool. In a large salad bowl combine potatoes, lemon juice, vegetable oil, salt and pepper. Toss well. In a medium bowl combine celery ribs, hard-boiled eggs, red onion and fresh parsley. In another bowl combine mayonnaise and cider vinegar. Toss well. Add to potato salad. Mix well. Chill before serving. Serve at room temperature.
