In a large skillet over medium heat, add 1/4 cup of olive oil and cook the chicken until browned and done. Drain and set aside. In the same skillet add the broccoli and cook until tender crisp. In the same skillet add 2 Tablespoons of olive oil and cook the mushrooms until browned and done. Drain and set aside. In the same skillet add the remaining olive oil and cook the rice and season with the paprika and pepper. Cook until done stirring occasionally. Serve the rice with the broccoli, mushrooms and the chicken. Garnish with sour cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large heavy bottomed sauce pan over medium heat. Brown chicken pieces on both sides. Remove to a plate. Add shallot to the pan and cook until soft. Add wine and stir to scrap up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Add garlic cloves and cook until fragrant. Add the chicken back to the pan. Cover the pan with the lid or foil and transfer to the oven. Bake until the chicken is cooked through, about 40 minutes. Remove from the oven. In a blender, puree the rosemary, tomato sauce, milk and the basil. Stir into the pan of chicken. Cover and transfer to the oven. Bake until the sauce thickens, 20 to 30 minutes more. Garnish with Parmesan cheese. Serve with spaghetti or other pasta. Serves 4 to 6.

Cook chicken in broth for 10 minutes. Cool chicken. Cube chicken. Combine chicken, corn, beans and salsa in 10 inch pie plate. Sprinkle cheddar and pepper jack cheese on top. Put 1 pie crust on top. Crimp edges. Brush with melted butter. Bake at 400 for 40 minutes or until crust is brown and bubbly. Serve hot.

Mix together the condensed soups, sour cream and 1/2 of the meatballs. Place remaining meatballs in a greased casserole dish. Cover meatballs with the soup mixture and dot the top with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Cook the egg noodles according to the package directions. Drain and serve over the meatballs.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Sift flour, baking powder and salt into egg mixture. Beat until combined. Add milk and beat until smooth. Pour into a greased and floured 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes or until a cake tester comes out clean. Cool on a rack.

In a small saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate chips. Let cool. Combine milk & egg yolks in a bowl. Beat until thick. Add chocolate mixture and stir well. Add vanilla extract & beat. Whip egg whites until stiff & fold into chocolate mixture. Serve immediately or refrigerate 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 400f. Toss fennel bulb with oil, lemon juice & salt & pepper to taste. Spread evenly onto baking sheet. Roast for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown and tender crisp. Cut bulb into 1/2-inch slices. Toss lettuce with olive oil and tarragon in large bowl. Add fennel & scallionstoss gently to mix. Sprinkle with cheese & serve.

Peel and quarter the potatoes and place them in a pan with the garlic cloves and 300ml/10fl oz of cold water. Bring to the boil and simmer for 30 minutes, or until very tender and the potatoes are falling apart. Drain the potatoes and garlic, reserving the cooking liquid (discard the garlic). Place the potatoes and garlic back into the pan with the lemon juice, ground almonds and olive oil, and mash everything together to a smooth paste. Season with the salt and pepper and add more olive oil to achieve the desired consistency. Serve with raw vegetables and breads.

Combine beef and crushed pineapple in crock pot. Add water and soy sauce. Stir and cover. Cook on low 5 to 6 hours. Add brown sugar and ground ginger and stir. Cook 1 hour longer. To thicken, stir in 1 to 2 tablespoons cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 cup cold water. Cook and stir until thickened. Serve over rice.

In an 8-inch square baking dish, place a layer of bread in the bottom of the dish. In a bowl, combine the marmalade, milk, butter, sugar, vanilla, eggs, cinnamon and nutmeg. Pour over the bread. Sprinkle the nuts evenly over the top of the bread. Cover and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, bake for 30-35 minutes until golden brown and the center is firm. Serve with syrup or butter.

Blend graham cracker crumbs with butter to form a fine crumb. Add lemon gelatin to boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add to softened cream cheese. Stir until blended. Add lemon rind. Fold in cool whip. Spoon into 8" round or square pan. Cover. Refrigerate until firm. Decorate with lemon slices. Serve chilled.
Mix ricotta cheese, garlic, and salt and pepper together. Spread on lettuce leaf. Top with basil leaf and sliced tomato. Garnish with basil leaves.

Heat oil in a skillet. Cut tofu into 1/4 inch cubes. Add to the hot oil. Cook until they are golden. Transfer to bowl. Add soy sauce to the same skillet. Stir in honey. Dissolve the five spice powder into the honey-soy mixture. Pour this mixture over the tofu. Stir to coat. Sprinkle the tofu with sesame seeds. Transfer to platter. Serve immediately.
Chop chicken into small pieces. Combine chicken with remaining ingredients. Chill. Yields 2 servings.

Core tomatoes and cut into 1/4 inch dice. Place in a bowl and toss with olive oil. Set aside. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and saute until fragrant, about one minute. Stir in balsamic vinegar and cook until reduced by half and thickened. Set aside. Slice bread in half horizontally and spread with garlic olive oil. Top with tomatoes and basil. Drizzle with balsamic glaze. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve.

In a 9x13 baking dish, sprinkle half of the flour. In a bowl, whisk together remaining flour with cottage cheese, eggs and salt & pepper to taste until smooth. Spread half of the mixture over the top of the dish. Sprinkle with half of the cheese. Repeat with remaining flour mixture and cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until set and bubbly. Serve warm with salsa, if desired. Makes 6-8 servings.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until softened and slightly translucent. Add garlic clove and saute until it turns golden. Add in cilantro cubes and saute until the liquid is evaporated. Add chicken broth. Stir in rice, cumin and pepper. Simmer until rice is tender. Remove from heat and serve.
Mix cabbage, carrots, onions and sugar. Mix in Miracle Whip. Serve on top of KFC chicken.

Slice the asparagus spears into 2cm pieces. In a non-stick frying pan melt the butter over medium heat. Add the asparagus pieces and a pinch of salt & black pepper. Cook for about 2-3 minutes or until lightly browned. Turn off the heat and set aside. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs, milk, a pinch of salt & black pepper. In a separate bowl combine the feta cheese and the smoked salmon flakes. In another small bowl mix together the chives, dill & tarragon. Preheat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of butter to the pan. Swirl to coat the pan and pour in one third of the beaten eggs. Once the eggs have set add another third of the eggs. Continue to cook until all of the eggs have been added to the pan and the pan is nearly empty of eggs. Sprinkle over half of the feta mixture then gently fold it through the eggs with a spatula. Repeat with the remaining feta mixture. Transfer the mixture to a serving

Cut crab sticks into 1-inch pieces. In a bowl whisk together the eggs and milk. Combine the panko and all-purpose flour on a plate and season with salt and pepper. Dip the pieces into the milk mixture and then into the panko mixture. Place on a baking sheet and refrigerate for 15 minutes. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry the sticks until golden brown and serve hot with tartar sauce and lemon wedges.

In a medium bowl combine cabbage, carrot and red pepper. In a separate bowl combine snow peas and dressing until coated. Pour over cabbage mixture and toss until well combined. Add green onions and toss well again. Serve over noodles and sprinkle with roasted peanuts.

In crock pot, saute onions in butter until clear, add soy sauce and browning sauce. Add beef and brown well on both sides. Add water and onion soup mix and bring to a boil. Cover and cook on high for 5 hours or until beef is tender. Slice beef and place on rolls. Top with Swiss Cheese and serve with au jus for dipping.

Preheat oven to 160c. grease & line a 2lb loaf tin. sift together the flour, baking powder, nutmeg & cinnamon in a large bowl. cream the butter & sugar together until light & fluffy. beat in the eggs a little at a time followed by the bananas. fold in the sifted flour mixture alternately with the milk until a smooth batter has been formed. add the nuts & pour into the prepared tin. bake in the pre-heated oven for about an hour or until a knife inserted comes out clean. leave in the tin for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely. sift a little icing sugar over the top before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. In a large pot of salted water, boil the potatoes until tender (about 25 minutes). In the meantime, heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Remove the potatoes from the water with a slotted spoon, then add the corn to the potato water for 5 minutes. Drain the potatoes and the corn and place on a baking sheet to dry. Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until it just begins to foam. Add the garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant, then add the potatoes and corn to the pan along with the heavy cream. Cook until the potatoes are almost tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste, then transfer to a bowl and place in the oven until warm. Add the sour cream to the potatoes just before serving. Garnish with chopped chives.

Mix the yogurt with the eggs. Season the eggs with the seasoning of choice (Mexican seasoning). Spread the egg mixture evenly over the English muffins. Top each muffin with a slice of green chilies and a slice of cheese. Cook the egg melts in a skillet until the cheese is melted and the eggs are set.

Peel the tomatoes and discard the seeds. Cut them into small pieces and put them in a food processor or blender. Process until smooth. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and saut until tender. Stir in the tomato paste and cook 1 minute. Stir in the basil and oregano. Add the tomatoes and their juices. Cook over low heat for 30 minutes. Season with sugar and salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with meatballs or pizza.
Combine all ingredients in bowl and mix well. Serve with crackers or vegetable sticks.

Melt margarine in skillet. Add onion and garlic powder and saute until onions are clear. Add milk and heat to boiling. Remove from heat and add elbow macaroni and cheese mix. Stir well. Add ham and stir well again. Bake in greased 9 x 13 pan at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until edges start to brown and center is bubbly.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Roll dough into crust. Spread pesto sauce over crust. Sprinkle cheese mixture evenly over crust. Arrange prosciutto over cheese mixture. Bake until crust is golden and cheese mixture is bubbly, about 15 minutes.

In skillet, saute green pepper in oil until tender-crisp. Remove from pan and set aside. In same pan, cook ground beef until no longer pink, breaking into small pieces with spoon. Add pasta sauce and chili powder and heat through. Add macaroni to mixture. Cover and heat through. Add green pepper back to pan before serving.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Add chives and cook until softened, about 1 minute. Remove from heat. In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, cheddar cheese, and salt and pepper to tastestir in cooked chives. Divide mixture between bread cupsplace on a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake until firm, about 15 minutes. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 4 hours before serving. Makes 2 servings.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in large skillet. Add garlic and onions and cook until soft and lightly browned. Add anchovies and rosemary. Cook 1 minute. Add water. Stir in sea salt and ground black pepper. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Serve the onion mixture on slices of baguette.
Preheat broiler. Place cheeses between slices of bread. Lightly coat cut side of bread with olive oil. Place on hot griddle. Top with tomatoes. Sprinkle with onions. Broil until golden brown.

In large saute pan add 3 tablespoons olive oil and 3 tablespoons butter. Saute onion until translucent. Add 1/2 cup of rice and toast until lightly browned. Add 3 cups water and 1 bouillon cube. Cook until rice is tender. Add 1/2 can of enchilada sauce and 1/2 cup frozen peas. Cook 1 minute longer. Remove from stove. Add 1/4 cup green onion and salt to taste. Serve warm.
Saute onions and mushrooms in butter. Add mushroom stock. Add salt and pepper. Taste for seasoning. Add sour cream, parsley and tomatoes. Remove from heat. Sprinkle gouda cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Unroll pastry and lay flat. Cut into 12 equal rectangles. Spread each rectangle with 1/4 teaspoon poppy seeds and 1/4 teaspoon parmesan cheese. Roll up and place seam side down. Spray with cooking spray and bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Let cool and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with vegetables or salad.

Cut tomatoes and cucumbers in half and scoop out seeds and pulp. Cut green pepper in half lengthwise. Cut in half crosswise and remove seeds. Cut into small pieces. In a food processor or blender, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, green pepper and garlic. Add 1 1/2 cups water. Process until smooth. Add next 3 ingredients and process until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Cut bread into small pieces and add to soup. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Serve cold. Garnish with cucumber and green pepper rings.

Saute onions and butter until golden brown and caramelized. Add chicken broth and french bread cubes. Simmer uncovered for 2 hours or until onions are very tender and bread is soft. Serve with grated cheese and crackers.
Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add ricecook until al dente. Drain ricestir in remaining ingredients except avocadoadd more lemon juice to taste. Add avocado just before serving.

In a large bowl mix the apricots, sugar, flour, brandy, cinnamon. Add the apples, stirring to coat. Place in a 2-quart shallow casserole.In a small bowl mix the flour, butter, oats and sugar. Sprinkle over the apple mixture. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven until the top is golden. Cool slightly before serving.

heat olive oil and butter in a dutch oven over medium heat. add the carrots, onion and celery. cook for 4-6 minutes or until slightly softened. stir in dried tarragon and cook 1 minute. stir in broth and wine. bring to a boil. cover and simmer for 20 minutes. blend with immersion blender until smooth. stir in cream and heat through. sprinkle with fresh tarragon.

Heat the oven to 375. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the wings, in batches, and saute until crispy, about 10 minutes. Place the wings on a baking sheet. Stir together the marmalade, mustard, and soy sauce. Brush over the wings. Bake for 25 minutes. Turn the wings over and continue baking for 10 to 15 minutes longer until crispy and glazed.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Season the chicken with the lime juice, paprika, cumin and the salt and pepper to taste. Place the chicken on a foil-lined baking sheet. Roast the chicken until it is cooked through about 20-30 minutes. Check after 20 minutes.
Combine all dry ingredients. Add molasses and milk. Beat eggs in. Add raisins and nuts. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake 30 minutes at 400 degrees. Makes 12 muffins.

Place potatoes in saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring water to boil and cook for about 25 minutes. Drain potatoes and let cool slightly. Meanwhile in a separate saucepan bring 1 cup of water and 1/2 cup of broth to a boil. Add spinach and cook for 2-3 minutes or until wilted. Drain and cool. In a large bowl, combine potatoes with spinach and mash together. Add butter and rosemary and mash again. Add broth and continue mashing until mixture is creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Place in a serving bowl and top with roasted pepper.

Peel the onion and cut into half-moons. In a deep microwave-safe dish add the onion and the olive oil. Cover the dish with plastic wrap, fold back the edges of the plastic wrap to allow steam to escape and microwave on high for five minutes. Add the rice and stir well. Add the stock (use just one cup if you’d like a more brothy risotto) and stir well. Cover the dish with plastic wrap again and microwave on high for five minutes. Check the rice, stir it, add a bit more stock if necessary, and repeat until the rice is cooked through. The microwave cooking time for the rice will be between eight to twenty minutes. Stir in the cheese. Taste for seasoning. If you like you can serve with a squeeze of lemon.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add potatoes and onions and cook until tender. Add carrots and celerycook until tender. Add broth and bring to boil. Add bay leaf and paprika. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Cool slightly. Puree soup with immersion blender. Add creamed corn and continue to puree until smooth. Serve with green onion top.

In a saucepan combine the flour, chicken broth and 1/2 cup of the milk. Stirring constantly over medium heat bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. In a blender combine the remaining 1/2 cup of milk and the cubed havarti cheese. Add the broth mixture and blend until smooth. Transfer to a fondue pot. Set over medium heat and stir constantly until melted. Serve with cubed bread. Sprinkle with crushed almonds.

In a small bowl, combine all salsa ingredients. Preheat grill to medium-high. In another small bowl combine the oil and salt and pepper for the salmon. Rub all over the salmon and place on grill skin side down. Grill for about 5 minutes or until skin starts to get crispy. Flip fish and cover with a lid for about 2 to 3 minutes. Remove fish from grill and place on plate. Top with salsa and serve immediately.

In a heavy 3-quart pot, combine sugar, butter, corn syrup, and baking soda. Over medium heat, stir until butter melts completely and mixture comes to a boil. Immediately remove from heat. Stir in popcorn. Spread on a large baking sheet or tray. Sprinkle mini marshmallows over the popcorn mixture. Sprinkle the graham crackers over the marshmallows. Finally top with the chocolate chips. Bake at 400 degrees for 2-3 minutes until melted. Let cool completely before serving.

Bring 2-1/2 cups of water to boil in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in polenta and continue to stir until mixture is smooth and thick, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in butter and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt until melted. Transfer to 8-inch square pan and spread evenly. Let stand until firm, about 20 minutes. To make the sauce, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and cook until tender, about 4 minutes. Add the white wine and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the broth and simmer until the liquid is reduced by half, about 4 minutes. Add the cream and parsley and season with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt and the pepper and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes. Divide the polenta among 4 slices of bread and top with the mushroom sauce and serve immediately.

Slice eggplants into 1/2 inch slices. Place on paper towels and sprinkle with salt. Let stand for 30 minutes. In 10-inch skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add eggplant and cook 10 minutes until tender and golden brown. In small bowl combine basil, parmesan cheese and egg. Add eggplant and breadcrumbs to egg mixture and mix well. Spoon 1/2 cup mixture onto each bun halftop each with 1/4 cup pasta sauce and 2 tablespoons mozzarella cheese. Bake in 350F oven 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and breadcrumb mixture is browned.

Whisk the eggs in a large bowl and add the breadcrumbs, fresh thyme and season with salt and pepper. Pat the sole fillets dry and dip them in the egg mixture and breadcrumbs and place in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Heat a large frying pan with a little olive oil and saute the fillets for 2-3 minutes on each side until crisp and golden. Drain on kitchen paper. Meanwhile make a brown butter sauce by melting a knob of unsalted butter in a small saucepan until golden brown and add a squeeze of lemon. Pour over the pan fried sole and serve immediately.

Wash and boil beets in a large pan of water for about 1 hour. Drain and cool. Cut beets into 1/4-inch-thick slices and set aside. Combine vinegar, sugar, water and salt in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Boil for 3 minutes. Add allspice and bay leaves. Add beets and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in horseradish root and simmer 30 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand overnight. Drain beets and pack in hot jars, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Wipe rims with dampened cloth and seal jars. Process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes. Makes 6 pints.

In a double boiler add sugar and water. Add the bicarbonate of soda and stir well. Heat until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and add the cocoa and stir well. Let it cool. Beat the egg and add to the mixture. Mix well. Grease and line a 7.5inch square tin and pour the mixture. Bake at 180 degrees for 30 minutes. Allow to cool and cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Season chicken with salt and pepper. In a shallow bowl, combine garlic powder and paprika. In another bowl, combine quinoa with whole wheat breadcrumbs. In a third bowl, combine egg whites. Dip chicken first in egg whites, then in the spices, and then in the breadcrumbs. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook 3 to 5 minutes per side. Place chicken fingers onto a baking sheet and bake 10 minutes. Serve with ranch dressing or honey mustard dressing.

Peel and cut the potatoes into chunks and place them in a large pot filled with water and seasoned with salt to taste. Bring the water to a boil and cook the potatoes until fork-tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the potatoes and place them in a large bowl. Add the cream cheese and mash the potatoes until smooth and creamy. Stir in the butter and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the sour cream and the garlic and season with salt and pepper to taste again. Sprinkle with paprika and serve hot.

Heat butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute until translucent, about 4 minutes. Add rice, pasta, chicken broth and lemon juice. Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in parsley and season with pepper.

Heat oil in a large soup pan. Add leeks, carrots and garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add water and boil until vegetables are soft. Add pumpkin flesh and boil for 15 minutes. Add chicken stock and bring back to boil. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Puree with hand blender or in food processor. Season with pepper and cream. Serve garnished with chopped parsley and a drizzle of olive oil.

Prepare scalloped potatoes according to package directions. In a small bowl combine poultry seasoning with boiling water. Add soup to bowl, mix well. Add cooked chicken, carrot, celery and onion to the mixture. Spread over potatoes. Bake according to scalloped potatoes directions. Makes 6 servings.

Place lime slices in a large bowl and pour boiling water over them to cover. Let stand about 1 hour. Meanwhile, place chicken in another large bowl and pour lime juice over chicken and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss chicken with lime juice mixture until chicken is evenly coated. Transfer chicken and marinade to a steamer basket set over a pot of boiling water. Cover and steam about 8 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center and juices run clear when chicken is pierced with a knife. Meanwhile, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add brown sugar and cook for about 3 minutes or until sugar dissolves and mixture begins to boil. Add vinegar and continue cooking until mixture is thick and glazed, stirring constantly. Pour over asparagus and toss to coat evenly. Serve chicken and asparagus with sauce spooned over top.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat when melted. Stir in krispies. Press onto a wax paper-lined baking sheet. Cut into bars. Melt margarine in a saucepan over low heat. Combine with remaining ingredientspour over krispies. Chill. Cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place tomato soup mix, flour, italian dressing mix, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Mix well. In another large bowl combine butter, paprika and cooking spray. Mix well. Dip chicken breasts into the tomato mixture then into the butter mixture. Place in a 15x10 baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Turn chicken over. Bake for an additional 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with foil. Spray with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the pecans and 2 tablespoons of the orange juiceset aside. In a large bowl, whisk together the rind, juice, egg white, brown sugar, salt, chipotle, and cranberries until smooth. Add the pecanstoss to coat evenly. Spread pecans evenly on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until the mixture is set and the pecans are golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes. Let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Grease 1 1/2-quart casserole. In medium bowl, combine eggs and soup. Pour into baking dish. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until eggs are set. Melt butterdrizzle over eggs. Sprinkle with pepper. Serve immediately.

Cut zucchini in half lengthwise. Using a small spoon or melon baller, scoop out the seeds and discard. Set zucchini on a baking tray. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic cloves. Bake for 20 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine the zucchini, mint, pasta and almonds. Toss with enough olive oil to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve at once.

Mix ranch dressing mix with 1/2 cup water (you will need to add more water to get it to mix well) and set aside. Mix beans, tomatoes, green chilies, olives and cheddar cheese together (this can be done in advance). Spoon 1/2 cup bean mixture into each of 4 individual serving cups or 1 large bowl. Top with 1/2 cup dressing mix. Repeat layers with remaining bean mixture and dressing mix. Top with avocado chunks or slices. Serve with tortilla chips, Fritos or Ruffles potato chips or corn chips.
Slice bread horizontally. Melt butter in pan. Mix cinnamon and brown sugar. Spread on bread. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Flip over. Cook another 10 to 12 minutes. Let cool. Serve.

Peel and chop onion into 1/4 inch slices and mince garlic. Toss with salt and pepper to taste in a bowl and set aside. Heat the vegetable oil in a Dutch oven over high heat until the oil is hot but not smoking. Pat the short ribs dry with paper towels and sear in the oil for about 3 minutes per side or until golden brown on all sides. Transfer to a crock pot or large pot and pour in the beef broth, stewed tomatoes, onion soup mix, garlic, onion, black pepper, chinese five spice powder, soy sauce, and sugar. Cover the crock pot with a lid and cook on high for 6 hours or on low for 8 to 10 hours or until the meat is falling apart when pierced with a fork or spoon. Serve immediately or allow to cool for refrigerating. Refrigerate any leftover beef in an airtight container for up to 3 days or freeze up to 3 months for longer storage.

In a large skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of the butter over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes on each side or until done. Remove chicken from skillet. Meanwhile, cook the chicken helper according to package directions. Add 1 can of water and the soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 10-15 minutes or until the rice is tender. Stir in the brown sugar and remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Remove chicken from bones and cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Stir chicken and vegetables into the rice. Makes 4 servings.
Put the peas and broth in a large pot. Add the remaining ingredients. Heat to boilingreduce heat. Simmer for about 20 minutes or until peas are tender. Serve hot.

In a large bowl combine water, olive oil, and garlic. Microwave on high for 2 minutes. Pour mixture into a large bowl. Add sugar and 2 cups of the flour and stir until smooth. Cover and let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes. Stir in remaining flour and seasonings. Knead on a lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic. Divide into 4 balls. On a lightly floured surface, roll each ball to a 9 inch circle. Bake on a greased baking sheet at 375f for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 10 minutes.

Cook macaroni according to directions on package. Drain and rinse with cold water. Add butter. In a large bowl combine macaroni, milk, Miracle Whip, eggs, onion, green pepper, sweet gherkin, black pepper and paprika. Chill for 2 hours. Serve cold.

Heat tortillas on a pan until warm to touch. Cut the tortillas into six equal pieces. Place a piece of lobster meat on each tortilla piece. Top with muenster cheese. Fold the tortilla over the lobster meat to make a sandwich. Serve with a squeeze of fresh lime juice and salsa for dipping. Serves 6.

In a large bowl combine chickpea flour with salt and pepper. Add warm water to form a pancake batter. Add olive oil to the batter to prevent it from sticking to the pan and give it a nice glossy finish. Heat a large frying pan over medium heat. Add some olive oil to coat the bottom of the pan. Use a ladle to pour some batter into the pan. The batter should be quite thick. Cook on medium heat until lightly browned on the bottom. Carefully turn it over to cook the other side. Remove from the pan when lightly browned on both sides. Place on a plate and continue making more socca. Serve immediately as an appetizer or side dish. Garnish with minced onions and fresh rosemary leaves.

Cut each chili into quarters. Wrap each quarter with 1 slice cheese. Heat olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chilies until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and sprinkle with paprika. Slice olives into quarters. Spread tortillas with olive oil. Spread with tomatoes. Top with olives and chilies. Sprinkle with coriander. Roll up tortillas. Cut into wedges.

In a large non aluminum pot, combine beer, garlic, ketchup, chili powder, balsamic vinegar, brown sugar and mustard. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Place steaks in the boiling mixture and turn occasionally until steak is cooked through. Remove steaks and keep warm. Continue cooking for about 15 minutes or until gravy is slightly thickened.

Place the carrots and parsnip in a large saucepan with the pear pieces, peppercorns, bay leaf, and stock. Bring to a boil, cover partially, and simmer for about 20-30 minutes or until the parsnips are tender. Remove the bay leaf before serving. Arrange the carrots and parsnips on a serving plate or platter, sprinkle with chopped fresh chervil and serve immediately.

In skillet, brown chicken breasts in olive oil and italian dressing. When browned, add chicken broth and chicken broth soup. Let simmer until heated through. Add salsa and green onions and continue to simmer until warm. Serve over warm tortillas with sprinkled cheese and red bell peppers.

In a large pan add oil. Add cumin and chili powder. Cook for about 30 seconds over medium heat. Add broth, rice, onion, garlic, and pepper and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes or till rice is tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot or cold. Serve over lettuce leaves or use as a side dish.

Combine first five ingredients in medium bowl and mix well. Add mayonnaise and curry powder and mix well. Serve on bread or lettuce leaves and garnish with slivered almonds and fresh chopped parsley. Makes four sandwiches.

In large saucepan over medium heat, heat oil and cook garlic until golden. Add sausage and mushrooms and cook until mushrooms are soft and sausage is brown, stirring often. Add collard greens and dried italian seasoning and cook until greens are tender. Add remaining ingredients except pasta and parmesan cheese. Cook until pasta is tender. Serve with parmesan cheese on top.

Peel and slice carrots. Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add carrots and saute for 10 to 12 minutes or until tender. Add onions and saute for 5 minutes longer. Stir in ginger and saute for 1 minute. Stir in orange juice and cook until most of the liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and stir in jelly and salt. Serve topped with parsley.

Combine all the marinade ingredients except the steaks in a small bowl and mix well. Add the steaks to the marinade and turn to coat evenly on both sides. Cover and refrigerate at least 6 hours or overnight. Remove the steaks from the marinade and reserve the marinade. Heat the grill to medium-high heat. Grill the steaks until they are browned on both sides and a thermometer reads 135 145 degrees for medium doneness. Tent the steaks with foil and allow them to rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Arrange the steaks on a serving platter. Brush the reserved marinade over the steaks and sprinkle lightly with fresh ground black pepper. Serve immediately.

Place pork shoulder, cut into 3/4-inch slices, and beef broth into a 4- to 5-quart crock pot. Season pork generously with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on high for 6 hours or on low for 8 hours. Remove pork and slice thinly. Place on hamburger buns. Serve with barbecue sauce.

In a heavy skillet brown the beef until it is almost done. Drain off excess fat. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until beans are tender. Serve over rice or noodles. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease bottom and sides of jelly roll pan. Beat egg whites until stiff. Add baking powder and cream of tartar. Beat 1 minute. Stir in sugar substitute. Add salt. Stir until well blended. Add popcorn and mix well. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto prepared pan. Bake 15 minutes. Makes 3 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine dressing mix, olive oil, dill, garlic granules and lemon pepper in a small bowl. Spread onto crackers in an ungreased 13x9 inch baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring once during baking. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper before serving. Makes 36 servings.

Peel and chop onions. Peel pumpkin. Place pumpkin and onions into a large pot with chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour. Stirring occasionally. When pumpkin is soft enough to mash with a potato masher, add garlic cloves, bay leaf and fresh thyme. Season to taste with salt and pepper. When pumpkin has reached the desired consistency, remove bay leaf and puree the soup in batches with an electric blender or food processor. Stir in the scallions and melt the butter into the soup. Serve with a dollop of crème fraîche and a slice of bread.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Place the roast in a 3 quart rectangular baking dish. Sprinkle the dry onion soup mix over the roast. In a small bowl, combine the cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, Worcestershire sauce, and water. Pour over the roast. Bake for 4 to 4 1/2 hours in the preheated oven, until meat is very tender. Remove from oven. Remove the roast from the liquid in the baking dish, reserving both. Slice the roast into 1/2 inch pieces. Return the roast to the baking dish, pouring some of the liquid from the baking dish over the roast. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Beat egg in medium bowl. Add milk and stir well. In another bowl combine quick oats, onion, salt and pepper. Add ground beef and mix well. Combine oats, egg mixture with ground beef. Form into 4 meatloaf patties. Bake 45 minutes. Meanwhile combine ketchup and brown sugar. When meatloaf is done, top each meatloaf patty with about 2 tsp mustard. Spoon ketchup mixture over. Bake an additional 5-10 minutes. Serve hot or warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Fill the tortillas with 1/4 cup each of the broccoli, cheese, tomatoes, onion, jalapeno, tomato sauce and sour cream. Fold the tortillas in half over the filling, and place them in an ungreased baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, until the cheese has melted and the tortillas are golden. Serve with salsa and sour cream.

Line a 9x13x2 inch baking pan with foil, leaving 2 inch overhang. In 3-quart heavy saucepan, combine white vanilla chips and milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently until smooth. Cool slightly. Add frosting. Beat until well combined. Fold in red food coloring. Pour into pan. Refrigerate at least 3 hours. Remove from pan. Cut into 2-inch squares. Top each square with peppermint candy. Store in an airtight container.

Beat eggs and milk together in a shallow dish. Mix brown sugar and butter together in another shallow dish. Melt butter over low heat in fry pan. Dip bread slices in egg mixture. Dip bread in brown-sugar mixture. Place bread in pan. Cook until golden brown on the bottom. Place bananas over the bread. Pour corn syrup over the bananas. Place walnuts over the bananas. Cook until walnuts are toasted and bananas are cooked through. Turn over the French toast. Cook until the other side is golden brown.
In slow cooker combine chicken, soup mix, garlic salt and italian dressing. Pour water over all. Cook 6 hours. Slice chicken and put in buns. Serve with extra dressing.

In a large pot cook onion in butter until soft. Add broth and pumpkin and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook until pumpkin is tender. Add rice and continue to cook until rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Stir in white pepper and cream. Ladle into bowls and top each serving with a tablespoon of chopped chives.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease two cookie sheets. Beat together the butter and sugars until creamy. Add the egg and the vanilla extractmix well. Stir together the dry ingredients and add the chocolate chips. Stir until well combined. Drop the batter by teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges are golden brown. Cool on wire racks.

Combine first four ingredients in a medium bowl and mix until well blended. Arrange beans on the bottom of a medium sized bowl. Top with the meat mixture and sprinkle with tomatoes and lettuce. Sprinkle with cheese and top with tortilla chips and salsa if desired. Serve immediately.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil and butter and cook chicken until no longer pink in center, about 2 minutes per side. Add garlic and cook until golden. Add penne and toss for about a minute. Add broth and simmer until almost completely absorbed. Add heavy cream and pesto and season with salt and pepper. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add a few drops of vegetable oil and then add onion, green bell pepper and red bell pepper and saute for a few minutes. Add corned beef and continue cooking until the corned beef is no longer pink. Add hash browns and stir well. Continue cooking until browned and crisp. Season with cajun seasoning and serve. Makes about 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13x9 inch pan with cooking spray. In large bowl, mix together cake mix, pudding mix, water, egg and oil. Pour into pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool. In small saucepan, combine apple pie filling and cornstarch. Stir over low heat until thickened. Spread over cake. In small bowl, combine powdered sugar, milk and vanilla. Drizzle over top of cake. Refrigerate before serving. Variations:Substitute strawberry pie filling for apple pie filling.Substitute lemon pie filling for apple pie filling.Substitute cherry pie filling for apple pie filling.

In a large skillet brown ground beef with salt and pepper. Add tomato sauce and onions. Stir well. Add worcestershire sauce to taste. Pour into 13x9-inch baking dish. Cover with baked beans. Spread mashed potatoes over top. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350f until bubbly. Cool 5 minutes before cutting. Serves 8.

Cut off top of each egg and use a spoon to scoop out yolks. Set egg whites aside. Blend yolks, vinegar, bay leaves, whole black peppercorns and allspice berries in blender or food processor until smooth, about 2 minutes. Spoon yolk mixture into egg whites. Top each egg with a small piece of bacon, if desired. Refrigerate for 1 to 2 days before serving.

In a food processor fitted with a metal blade, pulse sun dried tomatoes until finely chopped. Add garlic and basil and pulse again until the mixture is a rough paste. Add in the oil and blend until the mixture is a smooth sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook according to package directions. When done, drain and return the pasta back to the pot. Add the tomato sauce and toss until the pasta is coated and all the pesto is distributed evenly. Serve with freshly grated parmesan.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees. Wash mushrooms well. Place in large bowl. Heat 3 Tbsp. butter in skillet. Add 1/2 cup minced onionscook 5 minutes. Add to mushrooms in bowl. In another bowl, combine 1/2 cup breadcrumbs with 1/4 cup melted butter and 1/4 teaspoon saltset aside. Crumble 1/2 cup bacon and add to bowl with mushrooms. Add 1/2 cup grated Cheddar cheese. Spoon mixture into mushroom caps. Place in greased shallow pan. Melt 1 Tbsp. butterdrizzle over mushrooms. Sprinkle with remaining breadcrumbs. Bake for 20 minutes or until mushrooms are tender.

Spray a 9-inch pie pan with cooking spray. In a large saucepan, combine the rhubarb and the next five ingredients. Cook over medium heat until mixture is boiling. Pour into pie crust. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Reduce the heat to 325 degrees. Bake for 40 minutes or until the filling is thick and bubbly. Cool for at least an hour. Serve with whipped cream.

Take 80 g cream cheese and 80 g blue cheese and mash together to form paste. Add 3 tbsp port wine and mix in. Place 120 g grapes in bowl and stir in the mixture. With hands roll mixture into balls. Place in refrigerator until ready to serve. Roll balls in ground nuts. Serve with toothpicks.
Cut bread into strips and brush with butter. Toss bread with basil and pizza sauce. Sprinkle with mozzarella and bake for 10 minutes. Serve with marinara sauce.

Boil water in large saucepan. Add vegetablescook for 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drainreturn vegetables to saucepan. Add dressingtoss to coat. Season with salt & basil & oregano to taste. Transfer vegetables to serving bowl. Toss with parsley before serving if desired.

Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and next 4 ingredientssaute 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in broth and next 5 ingredients (through chicken)bring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 15 minutes or until carrots are tender. Stir in tortellinicook 2 minutes or until tortellini is tender. Stir in cream and parmesan cheesecover and cook 1 minute longer or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Combine flour with garlic powder in a shallow dish or on a plate. Dip each chicken breast into flour mixture to coat evenly on all sides. In large skillet cook chicken over medium heat for about 8 minutes on each side or until done. Remove chicken from skillet and place on cutting board to cool slightly. Reserve skillet drippings for later use. Heat water to boiling in large pot. Add bouillon cube and stir to dissolve completely. Add pasta and return to boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook pasta until tender but firm to bite, stirring occasionally. While pasta is cooking melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add lemon juice, white wine and chicken broth and stir to combine well. Toss chicken into skillet mixture with lemon juice and white wine. Add pasta to mixture with chicken in skillet. Toss to combine well. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Heat 2 teaspoons of oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook until tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in chickencook until no longer pink, stirring occasionally. Add remaining teaspoon of oil to skilletcook pepper until tender. Combine chicken mixture with peppersspoon about 3/4 cup of chicken mixture onto each bun halftop with cheese. Microwave sandwiches on high about 30 seconds or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in heavy saucepan. Add onion, cauliflower and broth. Cook over medium heat until tender. Stir in flour, milk and cheese. Season with pepper. Add parsley. Cook for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and thoroughly mixed. Pour into bowls. Garnish with croutons. Serves 4-6

Bake the pie shells according to package directions. While the shells are baking, combine the cheese, half-and-half and egg yolks in a large mixing bowl and stir until smooth. Combine the hot pepper sauce and nutmeg and blend thoroughly. Fold the cheese mixture into the egg mixture and set aside to cool. Remove the chilies from the stems and blot them with a paper towel to remove the seeds and membranes. Carefully place the cheese filling into the chilies. Dip the shells into the egg mixture and then roll them in the bread crumbs. Place the shells, seam side down on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Turn the shells and bake another 10 minutes or until the shells are puffed and golden brown. Serve hot with the hot pepper sauce and sour cream. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Lightly grease a shallow baking pan. Combine tomato sauce and sliced mushrooms in a sauce pan over medium heat. Stir occasionally until mushrooms are cooked through. Remove from heat. Arrange fish in prepared pan. Spoon mushroom sauce over top of fish. Sprinkle cheese over top. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until fish is done. Garnish with olives.

In a small mixing bowl combine the cream cheese, milk, and worcestershire sauce until well blended. Stir in the blue cheese, garlic powder, and black pepper until well blended. Add the nuts and mix well. Spread into a 13x9x2 inch glass baking dish. Chill for 1 hour or until firm. Serve with crackers or vegetables. Makes 24 servings.

Place shrimp in shallow bowl. Add butter, garlic and pepper to a small sauce pan over medium heat and cook stirring constantly for 1 minute or until butter is melted and mixture is fragrant. Pour over shrimp and toss to coat evenly. Place shrimp on a baking sheet. Broil 4-5 inches from heat for 1-2 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a medium bowl, combine the gelatin with the orange juice. Stir until well combined. Chill until slightly thickened. In a large bowl, combine the cream cheese, milk and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Fold in the lemon gelatin mixture. Pour into 4 parfait glasses. Serve immediately.

Combine oil and paprika and rub over chicken. In a small bowl, combine the rosemary and garlic. Rub over chicken. Place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Roast at 400 for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, add the potatoes to a pan with the olive oil and 2 tbsp water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and cook for 15 minutes. Add 1/4 cup water and cover and continue to cook for another 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Transfer potatoes to a bowl and add the remaining oil. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with the chicken.

In large saucepan saute onion and butter until tender. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and water. Bring to boilingreduce heat. Stir in pumpkin and nutmeg. Cook for 15 minutes or until heated through, stirring constantly. Makes 6 servings.

Peel papaya and cut in half. Remove seeds. Add onions and garlic to a skillet. Sauté 1 minute. Add tomatoes. Cook 5 minutes longer. Add ham. Remove from heat. Add sweet pepper. Stir well. Remove papaya seeds. Fill with tomato mixture. Cover top with breadcrumbs. Add egg. Bake at 350 degrees until breadcrumbs are golden.

Bring currants and tea to simmer. Cool to room temperature. Stir in sugar. Add egg and butter to tea mixture. Sift in flour. Knead into dough. Roll out to 1/4 inch thick. Cut into rounds. Bake on hot griddle for 2 minutes on each side. Serve hot or cold with butter.

In a small sauce pan, heat the olive oil and shallot over medium heat until shallot is translucent. Add the cherry tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add the olives, capers and oregano. Cook for 2 minutes more. Add the vinegar and salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crackers.

Mix cake mix, pineapple and frozen peaches (thawed) in a bowl. Pour into a 13x9-inch baking pan. Melt 1/2 cup butter and sprinkle over the top of cake. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-45 minutes or until a knife inserted into center comes out clean. Serve warm with ice cream.

Slice potatoes as thin as possible. Grease crock pot with cooking spray. Layer potatoes in crock pot. Sprinkle with onion & ham. Pour soup over potatoes. Bake on high for 3-4 hours or low for 5-6 hours or until potatoes are tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain. Add ground beef, cooked sausage, cheese, onion, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, and garlic powder. Cook for about 15 minutes or until hot. Pour into a casserole dish. Toast bread. Butter one side of each bread round. Spread the toast with mustard. Place a piece of sausage mixture on each piece of toast. Broil on high for 2 to 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.
In a pitcher or punch bowl combine 1 part water to 1 part sugar. Stir well. Squeeze 1 lemon into the pitcher or bowl and stir. Pour over ice cubes and add cold water to desired volume. Serve chilled.

In a medium bowl combine poultry seasoning with mayonnaise. Place chicken breasts in a zip-top bag and add marinade. Refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours. Grill chicken until no longer pink inside. Place a leaf of romaine on each bun and add chicken and cheese. Slice bacon and place on top. Serve with a pickle spear or a tomato wedge.

Spread out 2 sheets of phyllo pastry. Brush each sheet with butter. Layer 2 sheets on top of each other. Spread with 1/2 the roasted pepper mixture. Top with 1 salmon fillet. Add remaining roasted pepper mixture and 2 sheets of phyllo. Brush with butter. Fold edges of phyllo together to make packet. Cut into 2-inch pieces. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until done.

Place the potatoes in a large saucepan of boiling water and cook until tender when pierced with a fork, about 10 minutes. Drain the potatoes and transfer them to a large bowl to cool slightly. Add the onion, radishes, peas, eggs and dill. In another medium bowl, beat together the mayonnaise, mustard, milk and salt and pepper until smooth. Pour over the potato mixture and toss well to combine. Refrigerate until ready to serve, then garnish with the parsley sprig.

In large saucepan heat oil over low heat. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, garlic cloves, basil, salt & peppercorns. Simmer covered 1 hour or until very thick & smooth. Cool slightly. Puree in blender or food processor. Makes 1 & 1/2 quarts sauce.

Combine all of the ingredients except the raisins in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring the water to a boil, then cover, reduce the heat to low, and cook for about 20 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed. Stir occasionally. Fluff the rice with a fork. Remove the cinnamon stick and the bay leaves. Add the raisins and stir. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together flour, baking powder, and salt in medium bowl. Stir in white sugar and cream cheese. Beat in eggs until blended, then stir in banana. Fold in chai tea. Pour batter into greased and floured 9 x 5-inch loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour or until toothpick inserted near the center of the loaf comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely.

In large bowl combine soup, water, onion, tomatoes and salsa. Arrange chicken breasts on bottom of 13x9 pan. Top with soup mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Top with tortilla chips. Bake another 10-15 minutes or until chips are crisp.

Place steaks in a shallow baking dish and pour salsa over top. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until meat is cooked through. Cut steaks into stripsreturn to baking dish with salsa. Set aside. Meanwhile heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add peppers and cook for 2 minutes or until they begin to soften and get slightly brown. Add steak strips and heat throughspoon over salsa in baking dish. Top with ranch dressing and serve with iceberg lettuce and low-fat cheddar cheese.
Slice peaches, sprinkle with sugar, add 1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar to each slice. Lay peaches on grill for 3 to 4 minutes each side or until soft. Serve with blue cheese or gorgonzola cheese.

Mix cake according to package directions. Pour into greased 12 cup tube pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. In small saucepan combine sour cream, oil and almond extract. Cook over medium heat until very warm. Drizzle over cake. Garnish with cherries and chocolate chips. Allow to set before cutting.

Place the beef and Spanish rice in a Dutch oven. Add the water and the tomato juice. Stir in the chili beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Spoon into baked potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese and top with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Beat eggs and mayonnaise together until well mixed. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Spoon into a small greased 2-cup baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Let sit for 5 minutes to cool. Cut into wedges and place on a bed of mixed greens.

Combine crushed tomatoes, tomato puree, water, white onion, garlic paste, oil, vinegar, dried oregano, salt, chilies in a bowl. Mix well. Let sit at room temperature before serving. Serve with chips and tacos.

Peel the avocados and remove the pits. Fill each one with 1 tablespoon of the wine and 1 tablespoon of the sugar. Place the remaining wine in a glass and fill with ice. Serve the avocados in the glasses.

In saucepan over high heat, bring passion fruit juice, water and sugar to a boil. Stir until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and stir in ginger. Set aside to cool slightly. Cut melon into pieces of desired size. Garnish melon wedges with mint leaves and place in serving dish. Pour ginger syrup over melon wedges to cover. Refrigerate before serving.

Cook onion and garlic in butter until onion is clear. Add chopped spinach or chard and stir until all liquid is absorbed. Add bacon and nutmeg. Serve on toast with french fries or boiled potatoes or as side dish with any meal.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel cauliflower, cutting into 1-inch florets. In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook cauliflower until tender, about 8-10 minutes. Drain cauliflower well. Beat eggs with condensed milk, salt, pepper and paprika. In a separate bowl, combine flour, milk and paprika. Stir cauliflower into flour mixture until thoroughly combined. Add cauliflower mixture to egg mixture and stir until well blended. Coat a 9x13 baking pan with cooking spray. Pour cauliflower mixture into pan. Sprinkle with cheese and bake for 25-30 minutes or until top is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350. In medium bowl, combine mushrooms and pizza sauce. Spread on 4 hot dog buns. Top with cheese. Bake 10 minutes or until heated through. Top with pepperoni. Garnish with tomatoes and basil.

Drain rhubarb (save the juice) then add sugar, water and orange rind. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add strawberry jello. Mix well. Place in refrigerator until almost set. Add strawberries. Refrigerate. Top with whipped topping or whipped cream. Serve with a little sour cream.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Combine the brown sugar and mustardset aside. Remove the brisket from the canplace it in a large shallow dish. Pour the brown sugar mixture over the brisketcover with foil and bake for 3 hours. Remove the foil from the brisket and bake uncovered for an additional 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease an 8 x 11 inch pan with nonstick cooking spray or butterset aside. In a medium saucepan over low heat, melt butter. Stir in corn syrup, brown sugar and vanillamix well. Pour mixture into greased pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutesremove from oven. Sprinkle chocolate chips over mixturereturn to oven and bake for another 10 minutes. Remove from ovensprinkle cereal evenly over top of candy. Return to oven and bake for an additional 5 minutes or until cereal is lightly toasted. Remove from ovensprinkle with candy sprinkles. Cut into squares. Makes about 16 squares.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add zucchini and cook for another 2 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce and italian seasoning and bring to boil. Cover and cook for 15 minutes. Uncover and cook for another 15 minutes. Stir in cheeses and heat until melted. Serve with hot cooked pasta.

Slice apples thinly. Sprinkle with lemon juice and allow to marinate 15 minutes. Drain. Combine mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, sugar, and tarragon. Drain celery. Add celery to dressing. Fold in the apples. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve with a small wedge of sharp cheddar cheese.

Slice boneless chicken breast in half lengthwise. Cut into small pieces. In a bowl, stir together lemon juice, light soy sauce, honey, and garlic. Set aside. Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Drop in celery ribs and blanch for 1 minute. Transfer to a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. Drain the celery and cut into thin strips. Put the celery in a bowl with 3 tablespoons of the soy sauce marinade and toss well. Heat the remaining soy sauce marinade in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry until it is cooked through, about 3 minutes. Add the celery and the cornstarch mixture, stirring constantly. As the mixture thickens, add the Szechwan pepper and stir in 2 tablespoons of the remaining soy sauce marinade. Serve at once.
Combine orange juice concentrate and Campari in a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Top with sparkling water and garnish with orange rind twists.

Place the basil in a food processor container. Process until finely chopped. Add the spinach and walnuts and process until smooth. Add the asiago cheese and process until smooth. Add the silken tofu, salt and pepper and process until smooth. With the motor running slowly add the oil and lemon zest until the mixture is smooth. Serve with fresh vegetables.

Toast bread and butter lightly. Mash together the cooked pumpkin, cream cheese, seasonings until well blended. Spread in a shallow serving dish. Top with sliced deli ham, red bell peppers, green bell peppers, and sliced black olives. Serve with crackers or tortilla chips.

In a saucepan or medium skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onions and saute until soft and translucent. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Stir in the cooked noodles and toss until well blended. Add the Parmesan and toss to coat. Top with Swiss Cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Brown hamburger, add green chilies and refried beans. Mix in cream of chicken soup and sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon mixture into flour tortillas, sprinkle with cheese and roll up. Put in a baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes. Serve with lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream and salsa.

Boil the pasta in a large pot of boiling water until just al dente. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking water. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the spaghetti to the skillet. Stir until coated with oil. Add the parmesan cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Add the fresh lemon juice. Stir. Add the reserved cooking water. Stir until combined. Season with the salt and pepper. Toss in the lemon zest. Garnish with the fresh basil. Serve.

Heat 1 teaspoon oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add bok choy and stir fry until tender. Stir in ginger, rice wine and soy sauce. Heat through. Add green onions and sesame seeds. Toss lightly and serve.

In a large pot bring broth and water to a boil over medium high heat. Add potatoes and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until tender. Add carrots and celery and simmer for 5-10 minutes. Add kielbasa and cook until done. Add the bean soup. Stir in black pepper.

Combine cream cheese & cheddar cheese in food processorprocess until smooth. Add onion, pimiento, & green pepperprocess until smooth. Stir in worcestershire sauce & lemon juicecover & refrigerate for 1 hour or until ready to serve. Spread mixture in 9-inch pie plate or bowl. Roll pecans in cracker crumbssprinkle over cheese mixture. Chill until ready to serve. Yield 25-30 servings.

Cut steak into strips. Mix together marinade ingredients in small bowl and pour over steak strips. Marinate in refrigerator for at least 3 hours. Remove from refrigerator and remove steak strips from marinade and place on skewers. Grill over medium high heat until meat is cooked through and tender. Sprinkle with fresh ground pepper to serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Mix together flour, rolled oats, sugar, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. Beat together melted butter and pure vanilla extract. Beat in egg white. Add to dry ingredientsmix well. Stir in raisins. Drop by spoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove and cool on wire rack. Store in airtight container.

Heat 1 tablespoon butter in large skillet. Sprinkle chicken with flour. Brown chicken in skillet. Remove chicken to a plate. Add remaining butter to skillet. Saute mushrooms until lightly browned. Add chicken broth to skillet. Stirring constantly, bring mixture to a boil. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add chicken to skillet. Stir in half-and-half. Cook until thickened and heated through. Season to taste with salt and white pepper.

Wash rice in a colander under running water until water runs clear. Drain well. In a medium saucepan bring 1-1/2 cups water to a boil over high heat. Stir in rice and return to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 1 minute or until rice is parboiled. Drain rice and place in a greased 2-quart casserole dish. In a small bowl combine cinnamon stick, turmeric, sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon water until a smooth paste forms. Spread over rice evenly. Cover with lemon slices. Combine butter and 2 cups boiling water in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir until butter melts, then pour over rice. Cover with foil. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Remove from oven. Discard cinnamon stick and stir rice to combine. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Serve.

Heat oven to 350. Heat oil in Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add meatballs and cook 4 minutes or until browned on all sides. Stir in green bell pepper and celery. Cook 4 minutes. Stir in rice and season with salt and pepper. In small bowl combine egg and milk. Stir into rice mixture. Pour into 13x9-inch baking dish. Combine cream of mushroom soup and buttermilkspoon over meatball mixture. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake 30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Serve.

Combine the pudding mix and water and mix well. Add lemon juice and mix. Chill. Mix gelatin and water in small bowl and let stand 5 minutes. Stir into pudding mixture. Pour into chilled graham cracker pie shell. Chill for several hours. To serve top with whipped topping.

Heat oven to 350. Boil eggs for 8 minutes. Rinse spinach. Drain spinach. Crumble cheese. Mash ham. Mash eggs. Combine eggs, cheese, ham, and spinach in a bowl. Put in 12-14 muffin cups. Bake 20 minutes. Cool. Serve.

Heat oil in soup pot over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook 5 minutes. Add chicken broth and parmesan rind. Bring to boil. Add egg and cook until done. Add salt and pepper and hot sauce to taste. Serve hot.

Blend mustard and honey until smooth. Cut sausages into thin slices. Warm tortillas in microwave 5 seconds each. Dip tortillas into mustard mixture and place on platter. Top with sausage. Serve immediately. Makes 8 servings.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. In a small bowl, combine cracker crumbs, cheese, parsley, and pepper. Dip chicken into egg mixture. Dip into crumb mixture. Place on skillet. Brown for about 3 minutes on each side. Remove from skillet. In skillet, add beef broth to deglaze. Add mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are tender. Serve over chicken.

Beat cream cheese with an electric mixer on medium speed until creamy. Add white chocolate chips and beat until blended. Gently fold in whipped topping. Pour into crust. Top with toffee pieces. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Serve with fresh fruit.
Pour rum and apricot brandy into shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into tall glass. Top with grenadine. Fill with orange and pineapple juices. Add pineapple. Serve immediately.

Brown the ground beef in large skillet. Drain and place in slow cooker. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well. Heat on low for 8 hours or until the beef is tender. Serve with garlic bread and salad.

Prepare cauliflower according to package directionsset aside. Combine remaining ingredients in medium bowlstir until blended. Add cauliflower to dressing mixturetoss to coat. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until thoroughly chilled. Garnish with cherry tomatoes just before serving.

Roll the dough out into a long rectangle. Spread with butter and layer with deli ham and cheese, and chicken. Roll up longwise and pinch edges closed. Cut into slices and place in a greased baking dish. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 375 for about 30 minutes or until lightly browned.

Saute shrimp and shallots together until shrimp is pink and shallots are soft and translucent, about 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds more. Add butter and stir until melted. Add olive oil and black pepper and cook 1 minute more. Add linguine and cook about 8 minutes, tossing often until al dente. Drain and transfer to bowl. Add lemon juice and parsley and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Bring 3 cups of water to boil in a small saucepan. Remove from heat. Add couscouscover and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Stir in olive oil, rosemary, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Refrigerate until well chilled. Makes 4 servings.

Grease an 8x8 baking pan. Melt the margarine in a large pot over medium heat. Add the marshmallows to the pot. Stir until the marshmallows are completely melted. Add the rice krispies. Stir until the mixture is well coated. Press the mixture into the prepared pan. Top the mixture with peanut butter chips. Allow to cool before cutting into squares.

Cut chicken fillets into cubes about 2cm thick. Heat oil in frying pan over medium-high heat. Add garlic and chicken and cook, stirring often until lightly browned. Transfer to medium bowl. Add remaining ingredients and toss well to combine. Thread chicken mixture onto wooden or metal skewers, then thread chorizo slices around chicken mixture to form skewers. Place skewers on prepared tray and bake about 25 to 35 mins until chicken is cooked through. Serve with rice or flat bread.

Combine first five ingredients in a medium bowlmix well. Place chops in a shallow dish and pour marinade over themturn to coat well. Cover and let stand for 30 minutes or up to one day. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pork chops and cook until browned on each side. Transfer to a baking dishbake for about 25 minutes in the preheated oven, turning once halfway through baking time. Serve with rice.

Cream together butter and margarine until light and fluffy. Beat in sugars and egg yolk. Beat in flour until dough forms a ball. Roll dough into 24 balls and place on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 f for 8-10 minutes. Remove from oven. Press potato chips into cookies. Sprinkle with walnuts. Mix remaining butter, margarine, sugar, vanilla, and egg yolk together to make a glaze. Drizzle over cookies. Cool on wire rack.

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add vanilla. Add flour and salt and mix. Add jam by the tablespoon full and mix until it resembles dough. Roll into balls. Place on cookie sheet and bake at 350 for about 10 minutes. Remove and let cool. Press thumb into middle and fill with jam. Makes about 4 dozen.

Cream butter, brown sugar and honey together. Add egg and water. Beat until well blended. Sift together flour and saltadd to butter mixture. Mix well. Fold in oats. Form into balls about 1 inch in diameter. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 24 cookies.

Cream together the butter and cream cheese. Add in the sugar, egg yolks, vanilla, and flour. Roll out dough. Put on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Spread cool whip over top and return to oven for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line baking sheet with aluminum foilset aside. In a large bowl, combine peanut butter, soy sauce, honey, garlic clove, and crushed red pepper flakesstir until blended. Place chicken wings into the peanut butter mixturetoss until coated. Place the wings onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes or until wings are brown and cooked throughturn after 15 minutes. Serve immediately with fresh cilantro sprinkled over the top.
Sift together Bisquick, water, sugar, and eggs. Mix well. Pour into greased 10 inch pan. Bake at 425F for 20-25 minutes or until done. Remove from oven and cool before cutting into 12 pieces.

Cook macaroni al dente. Drain pasta and set aside to cool completely. Dice bell peppers and onion, set aside. Combine diced red delicious apples with sugar, mayonnaise, and roasted red peppers, set aside. Fill a 1 gallon Ziploc bag with the pasta and apples mixture. Seal bag completely and shake well to combine. Serve with sliced black olives, if desired.

For the marinade: Mix olive oil, red wine vinegar, balsamic vinegar, garlic, onion, fresh rosemary and a pinch of salt and black pepper in a large bowl. Add steaks and marinate for 1 hour or more. For the sauce: Heat a little olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan. Add the garlic and onions and saut over medium heat for about 2 minutes. Add the fresh rosemary, balsamic vinegar and stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until reduced by half. Serve with steaks.

Preheat waffle iron. In a mixing bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. In a separate mixing bowl combine milk and egg. In another mixing bowl combine sugar, vanilla and melted butter. Stir well. Add the milk mixture to the dry mixture. Stir until all the lumps are gone. Add the sugar mixture and stir again. Add white chocolate chips and stir well. Bake according to your waffle iron instructions. Serve with your favorite syrup.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add the pork chops and cook until browned on both sides. Transfer the pork chops to a plate. Add the onion, green pepper and mushrooms to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until the onion is tender. Pour in the broth and add the rice. Stir well. Cover, reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the pork chops. Cover again and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve the rice and pork chops with a glass of white wine.

Combine Bisquick with milk in a large bowl. Stir in cheese and butter. Knead until a soft dough forms. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and roll to 1/2 thick. Cut with a biscuit cutter. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet and bake at 400 for 10 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 16 biscuits.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Coat an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, mash the beans. Add the onion, celery, carrot, and green pepper to the beans. Stir in the bread crumbs and the eggs. Form into four 1/2-inch-thick patties. Place the patties in the baking dish. Bake 10 to 15 minutes on each side, or until golden. Makes 4 servings.
Combine green beans and onion in a large bowl. Add parsley and garlic. Drizzle with lemon juice. Add oil and pepper. Stir to combine. Adjust seasoning. Serve right away.

Place milk in a heavy saucepan. Add the eggs one at a time stirring continuously. Add the vanilla extract. Add the sugar. Beat until mixture thickens. Add the salt and the black pepper. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish. Pour the mixture into the dish. Bake for 35 minutes. Cool in the refrigerator. Serve with a garnish of parsley.

Preheat oven to 400f. In food processor combine nuts and salt and process until crumbly. Add flour and butter and process until mixture resembles coarse meal. Turn into a bowl and add ice water one teaspoon at a time until dough holds together and forms a ball when pressed in hand. Roll out between 2 sheets of parchment paper until 1/8 inch thick and 7 inches round. Refrigerate 20 minutes before cutting out 5 inch rounds and assembling. Makes 8 crusts.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown sausage. Add cabbage and onion. Cook until cabbage is tender- crisp. Add caraway seed, red pepper flakes and chicken stock. Cover and simmer until cabbage is tender. Add vinegar and salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Mix together the dry ingredients. Add the wet ingredients and stir until just moist. Drop by spoonful onto a hot well-oiled griddle. Bake until golden brown. Serve with butter and maple syrup.

Stir the cornstarch with 1 Tbsp cold water in a small bowl. Set aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the garlic and ginger and stir-fry for about 1 minute. Add the oysters and stir-fry for a minute longer. Stir in the wine and the reserved cornstarch mixture and cook for another minute or two until the sauce is thickened and the wine is evaporated. Sprinkle with scallions and serve immediately. Serve with white rice.

In a large bowl mix together the feta and the fresh mint. When combined add the tomatoes, cucumber, red pear tomatoes and the kalamata olives. In a separate bowl mix the olive oil with the lemon juice and zest of the lemon. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Pour the mixture over the tomatoes and toss until coated. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Divide dough into 4 equal partsroll each part into a ballplace on a floured surfacecover with plastic wraplet rest at room temp for 15 minutesflatten dough with hand or rolling pin into 12-inch roundsbrush edges of crust with heavy creamsprinkle with mozzarella cheeseadd ham slicessprinkle with thinly sliced oniontop with arugulasprinkle with fresh ground black pepperdrizzle with fresh lemon juiceserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Lightly coat 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In large bowl mix brown sugar and butter until crumbly. Stir in pumpkin pie spice and vanilla. Mix in cereal. Press mixture firmly into bottom of prepared baking dish. Bake for 8 minutes. Meanwhile in small bowl stir together sugar and cinnamon. Remove crust from oven and sprinkle with cinnamon mixture. Return crust to oven and bake for 12 minutes more or until crust is golden brown on bottom and sides. Cool on wire rack. In small bowl mix butter and confectioners sugar until smooth. Spread over crust. Sprinkle with pecans and press gently into top. Cool completely before cutting into squares. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Sprinkle the sole fillets with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sole fillets to the skilletcook for 5 minutes on each side. Sprinkle the fillets with lemon peel. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the butter to the pancook for 1 minute. Add the heavy cream to the pancook for 1 minute or until the cream is bubbly. Remove the fillets from the pankeep warm. Place the pan over medium heat. Add the pesto to the pan. Cook for 1 minute or until the pesto is heated through. Spoon the pesto over the fillets. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with tortilla chips or fresh vegetables.
Brush baguette with oil. Drizzle with basil leaf. Top with prosciutto. Add cheese. Add figs. Drizzle with lemon juice. Serve.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallots and cook until softened and translucent. Add the dijon mustard and cook for a few minutes. Add the green beans to the saucepan and cook until bright green and crisp tender. Remove from heat and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Prepare a potato ricer. Peal and cut the potatoes into small pieces. Rice them and place them back into the pan. Melt unsalted butter and pour over the potatoes. Season with salt and herbs, mix well. Form into balls and then fry them. Serve with a salad.

Pour apple cider in a medium pot. Add lemon juice. Add brown sugar. Bring mixture to a boil. Add cloves, cinnamon sticks and orange peel. Turn down heat and simmer until cider is warm and flavors are combined, about 5 minutes. Pour into warmed cups and serve.

Preheat panini maker to medium heat. Spread one side of one piece of bread with mustard. Sprinkle with cheese, bacon, apple, and the other piece of bread. Cook until cheese is melted and bread is toasted. Cut into quarters for serving.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook about 1 minute longer. Add potatoes and cook until potatoes are lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Add water, cabbage, salt, and pepper. Cover pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until cabbage is very tender, about 20 minutes. Stir flour into the skim milk until smooth. Add flour mixture and the Velveeta to the pot. Cook about 10 minutes longer or until potatoes are very tender. Serve topped with parsley if desired.

Cook pasta according to directions. In a large bowl toss together pasta, grapes, mandarin oranges, onion and walnuts. In a small bowl mix together dressing. Pour over pasta mixture. Serve cold or at room temperature.

To make the meatballs combine the bread with the milk in a large bowl. Let soak for 5 minutes. Add the beef stock. Add the ground beef and the remaining ingredients. Mix well. Roll into meatballs and place in a large skillet. Add the broth to the skillet to cover the meatballs. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the orzo pasta and cook according to the package directions. Drizzle the orzo with olive oil and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with meatballs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan. Combine flour, baking powder and spicesset aside. Beat together butter and sugar until creamy. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Beat in pumpkin and vanilla extract. Gradually beat in flour mixture just until combined. Stir in nuts. Spread into prepared loaf pan.
