Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack to cool completely.

Prepare yellow cake mix as directed on box and bake in greased pan in 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. When cool cut cake into cubes and place in shallow pan. Mix together cherries and sugar. Add nuts if you like. Pour over cake cubes. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares and serve.

Heat the oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves, thyme, salt and pepper. Add vegetables and sauté until browned. Roast the vegetables for about 15 minutes or until tender.

Heat butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat until melted. Add celery and onion and saute until softened. Add ketchup, lemon juice, sugar, vinegar, worcestershire sauce, mustard, and pepperbring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened slightly. Store in an airtight container.

Cut bread in half lengthwise. Spread butter on both sides of each piece of bread. Arrange a few salad burnet leaves on one side of each piece of bread. Spread a thin layer of cream cheese on the salad burnet. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Top with remaining salad burnet and bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Heat oil in skillet. Add chicken fillets. Cook until golden brown. Set aside. Melt butter in same skillet. Add shallotscook until tender. Add garliccook until fragrant. Add crabmeatcook until heated through. Add lemon juice. Stir in cream. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon mixture over chicken fillets. Bake until chicken is cooked through. Serve immediately.

Peel and dice potatoes (about 3 cups). Steam or boil in water until tender but not mushy-- about 10 minutes. Drain and place in a large bowl. Peel onion and dice (about 1/4 cup). Chop celery (about 1/4 cup). Add to potatoes along with mayonnaise, honey, mustard, salt, and pepper. Fold together well. Add pecans and toss to combine. Serve warm or cold. Makes about four servings.

Preheat oven to 350. Beat egg whites until they form soft peaks. Add cinnamon and beat well. Sift flour over mixture and beat until blended. Add sugar and beat well. In a large bowl, mix together papayas, lime juice, lime zest and orange extract. Pour into pie shell. Spread meringue over pie and bake for 45 minutes. Cool before serving.

In a medium saucepan bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add potatoes. Reduce heatcover and cook for 20 to 25 minutes or until tender. Drain. Cool slightly. In a small bowl mix together Miracle Whip and chicken broth until smooth. In a large resealable plastic bag combine potatoes, broth mixture, dried oregano, garlic powder, and onion powder. Seal bagturn to coat. Refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. Remove potatoes from marinade, discarding marinade. Thread potatoes on skewers. Grill 4 inches from medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until tender. Serve with additional Miracle Whip for dipping.

Heat oil in large soup pot or dutch oven. Add onions and carrots and saute until tender. Add garlic and saute 1 minute more. Add beans and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 2 hours or more. Add italian seasoning, salt and pepper.

Soak the eggplants in a bowl of water for 10 minutes. Drain them. Slice them cross-ways to a thickness of about 1/4 inch. In a large pan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced eggplant. Sprinkle with 1 tsp of the salt. Stir the eggplant well for 5 minutes. Add potatoes and sprinkle with 1/2 tsp of the salt. Stir well for 5 minutes. Add courgettes, sprinkle with 1/2 tsp of the salt. Stir for 3 minutes. Add garlic and stir for another 3 minutes. Add the onions and stir for 3 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes. Sprinkle with the cinnamon, the remaining 1/4 tsp of salt and the remaining 1 tsp of the salt. Mix well. Cook until the eggplant is tender for 20-30 minutes. Serve hot with plain yogurt.

Peel the pineapple. Remove the eyes by cutting off the top and bottom of the pineapple. Remove the skin with a sharp knife and cut into pieces. Put the pieces into a large bowl with the water and sugar and stir. Cover the bowl with a plastic wrap and leave for 24 hours to ferment. Strain the liquid through a sieve into a large jug or bottle with a lid. Add the raisins and yeast. Cover with the lid or with a paper towel and leave for another 24 hours to ferment again. You may need to stir the beer from time to time to stop the yeast from sticking to the bottom of the jug. Add the vodka, the ice cubes and serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line baking sheets with parchment paper. Unroll breadstick dough onto floured surface. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 2-inch circles with a sharp knife. Lightly brush each round with oil. Sprinkle with cheese. Sprinkle with herbs. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 24 mini focaccia rounds.

Preheat oven to 400. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Cut puff pastry into squares and place each square on a square of parchment paper. Place a mushroom cap on each square. Top each mushroom with about 1 teaspoon goat cheese and about 1/4 teaspoon thyme. Bring up the corners of the pastry squares to make a triangle and press them together at the tip to seal. Brush the tops with olive oil. Bake for 20 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash potatoes and cut them into 1/4 inch thick french fry shapes. Place them on a baking sheet and coat them with olive oil. Sprinkle them with garlic granules and parmesan cheese. Bake them for 20-25 minutes until they are crispy and golden brown. Remove them from the oven and sprinkle them with sea salt. They are so good warm or cold. I like them on top of a green salad. Yum.

Combine all the sauce ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Cut salmon into 2cm cubes. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a frying pan and add salmon. Cook for 2 minutes on each side. Serve with wasabi mayonnaise.

Heat olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and carrotsaute for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add round steakcook for 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Add lime juice, marjoram and beef brothcook for 10 minutes or until liquid almost evaporates. Stir in tomatoescook for 2 minutes. Remove from heatstir in cilantro. Serve over tortillas. Serves 4.

In a large pot over medium-high heat, warm the oil until hot. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour in the rice and stir to coat well. Stir in the broth and water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and cover with a tight-fitting lid. Cook for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit for 5 minutes before serving.

Cook the stewing beef in the tomato sauce and stewed tomatoes until tender. Add the dry onion soup mix, water and frozen vegetables. Simmer about 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add the alphabet pasta and simmer about 5 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crackers or biscuits.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium high heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until golden. Add the wine and bring to a boil. Add the chicken thighs. Cover and cook 10 minutes. Add the cilantro and parsley and continue to cook for 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

Place potatoes and enough cold water to cover by 2 inches in a large stockpot over high heat and bring to a boil. Cook until potatoes are tender but not falling apart, about 12 to 20 minutes. Drain potatoes and mash them to a puree consistency using a potato masher or large fork. Season potatoes to taste with salt and white pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter and stir in flour until smooth and golden brown, about 2 minutes. Add milk and whisk until smooth and simmer until thickened and bubbly, about 2 minutes longer. Remove from heat and stir in dill. Pour over potatoes and gently fold until well incorporated and potatoes are smooth and creamy. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garliccook until onion is tender, stirring frequently. Add mushroomscook 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender, stirring frequently. Add broth, tomato paste, pepper and winebring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 5 minutes or until liquid is slightly reduced. Remove from heatstir in cornstarch mixture until smooth. Serve over meat.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine the cranberries and brandy in a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until berries are tender and mixture is thick, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough to a 12-inch circle. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate and trim to 1/2-inch from the edge. Combine the butter and sugar in a large bowl. Beat until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and beat well. Add the salt and flour and beat until smooth. Spread the filling into the pie crust. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until the center is set. Cool slightly. Spread the cranberry mixture over the cooled pie. Bake 15 minutes more. Cool to room temperature. Garnish with nuts.

Cut the pork into 1/4" thick slices. In a large bowl, combine the pork, garlic, soy sauce, honey, wine, ginger, five spice powder and food coloring until well blended. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from the refrigerator 1 hour before roasting. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Arrange the pork slices in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on high until the pork is tender, 2 to 3 hours, or until the pork is tender when pierced with a fork. Serve the pork on the bread of your choice, or over rice.

Preheat oven to 170 C. Line 2 trays with baking paper. Crush graham crackers to fine crumbs. Mix all crumb ingredients. Press into bottom of trays. Bake for 8 minutes or until firm. Spread sweetened condensed milk over base. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely. Melt chocolate in the microwave. Drizzle over the top. Sprinkle with icing sugar. Allow to set. Cut into squares.
Place the goat cheese in a small bowl and add the half-and-half and honey. Stir until smooth. Add the pistachios and stir once more. Serve on crackers.

Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan. Add the yellow peppers and cook for 5 minutes until softened. Add the garlic cloves and red chile. Cook for 1 minute more. Add the sherry wine and saffron. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until reduced by half. Add the chopped tomatoes and prawns and cook for 2 minutes. Season with fresh ground black pepper. Serve topped with fresh flat-leaf parsley. Serve with crusty bread.

Cook noodles in boiling water for 8 minutes or until tenderdrain. In a large bowl combine noodles, sugar, raisins and eggsbeat until well blended. Grease a shallow baking panspread noodle mixture in pan. Bake in a preheated 325 degree oven for 40 minutes or until set. In a medium bowl combine pineapple, lime juice and cinnamonpour mixture over kugel. Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through. Yield: 4 servings.

In large saucepan brown beef and onion over medium heat until beef is no longer pink. Drain fat. Stir in garlic and seasoningcook and stir 1 minute longer. Stir in tomatoes and beef brothheat through. Stir in pasta and vegetablesheat through. Serve hot

In a large mixing bowl, beat shortening until fluffy. Beat in sugar. Beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in baking soda. Beat in molasses. Beat in flour. Add nuts. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto a cookie sheet. Bake in a 400F oven for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 1 minute then remove to wire racks to cool. Store in a tightly covered container. Makes about 12 dozen toffees.

Mix together the flour, pecans and brown sugar. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl combine the butter, sugar and vanilla. Beat until combined. Add the eggs one at a time. Add the flour mixture alternately with the milk. Spoon into greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes.

Cut red, yellow and green peppers into chunks. Cut green onions into thin rings. Mix mayonnaise, mustard and chili powder and pour over vegetables and cheese. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with fritos corn chips.

Cut chicken into strips and place in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken strips in one layer and saute until golden brown and cooked through. Add maple syrup and lemon juice and stir. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve over pasta or rice or on a bed of salad greens.
Heat oven to 350. Place chicken in single layer on baking sheet. Combine remaining ingredientspour over chicken. Bake uncovered 25 min. or until no longer pink. Yield: 4 servings.

Soak rice overnight. Bring 10 cups water to boil. Add rice and boil 5 minutes. Add 1/2 cup palm sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir well. Let rice cool. Cut pandan leaves into 1/2" strips. Strain rice and reserve liquid. Place rice, coconut milk, and pandan strips into blender. Blend until smooth. Pour rice mixture into a pan. Add coconut milk. Cook over medium-low heat until thick. Add more coconut milk if needed. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt. Serve hot.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until translucent and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Add tomatoes and cook for 1 minute. Add spinach and stir until just wilted. Remove from heat. In a medium bowl combine the cooked brown rice, tomato mixture, tamari sauce, cumin and 1/4 cup water. Transfer to a greased 2 qt casserole and bake 25 to 30 minutes or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees C (350 degrees F). Grease 20 x 30 cm (8 x 12 inch) tray baking pan. Line base with pastry (see note). To make the filling, combine coconut with vanilla and caster sugar in medium bowl. Beat until well combined. Add egg and beat until smooth and creamy. Spread mixture into baking pan and smooth surface. Bake for 8 minutes until coconut is golden. Remove from oven and spread with jam. To make the topping combine flour and caster sugar in medium bowl. Add butter and combine using electric mixer until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Spread evenly over jam layer in baking pan and return to oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool in pan for 1 hour or until cooled completely. Cut into 24 squares. To serve, dust with icing sugar and drizzle with extra jam if desired. Note: for the pastry, place 1 sheet of pastry into base of prepared pan and press over base and 1 in

Slice garlic cloves and saute in olive oil until soft. Add chickpeas and tahini and cook 1 minute. Add lemon juice, soy sauce and cayenne. Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Add pasta and broccoli florets. Simmer 5 minutes. Sprinkle with roasted sesame seeds and serve.

Wash beet greens and dry with paper towels. Cut greens into 1-inch pieces. Wash beets. Peel beets and cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Heat olive oil in a skillet over moderate heat. Add beets and onion. Cook until beets are tender, about 5 minutes. Add greens. Cook until greens are tender, about 3 minutes. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Season with balsamic vinegar and water. Toss and serve.

In a large skillet cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon to paper towel lined plate. Reserve bacon drippings. Drain beans, reserving liquid. Add bacon drippings to skillet. Add garlic. Cook and stir 3 minutes. Add beans. Sprinkle with oregano. Cook and stir until beans are heated through. Stir in reserved liquid. Add tomato and onion. Season with lemon juice and pepper. Top with bacon. Serve immediately.

Cook the orzo according to directions. Cook the rice according to directions. Heat the butter over medium heat until melted, add the broth and the ranch dressing mix, stirring constantly until the dressing is dissolved and the liquid begins to boil. Stir in the mushrooms and chicken, cook until heated through. Add the sour cream and combine well. Serve with the orzo and rice. Serve with the orzo and rice. Serve with the orzo and rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Wash and cut squash in half. Remove seeds. Dice squash into 1 inch pieces. Place in a medium saucepan with 1 cup water. Bring to a boil, cover tightly with lid. Simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain squash. In a medium saucepan, combine pineapple, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, ginger. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Pour mixture over squash. Stir well to combine. Pour mixture into a 13 x 9 baking dish. Bake 30 minutes. Sprinkle with nutmeg.

In a wok or large skillet add the water and soy sauce and bring to a boil. Add the meat, cayenne pepper, and bell pepper. Cover and cook on medium heat until the meat is cooked through. Meanwhile, boil the rice in the same wok or skillet with the same water used for the meat until the rice is tender. Stir together the meat mixture with the rice. Add the green onions and cilantro and serve immediately.

Place the garlic, tomatoes, capers and olives in a blender and process to a smooth puree. Pour into a saucepan and heat gently until the mixture comes to the boil. Cook until reduced by half. Meanwhile prepare the pasta according to the instructions on the pack. Drain the pasta and add to the sauce. Toss to combine and serve sprinkled with the parsley.

In a bowl sift together the flour, baking powder and sugar. Add the milk and egg and mix to a smooth batter. Heat the oil in a large frying pan and drop spoonfuls of the batter in. Fry until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from the pan and place on absorbent paper to remove excess oil. Mix the honey and cinnamon together. Serve the puffs with honey.

Preheat the oven to 400f. In a bowl combine the carrots and butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for about 20 minutes or until tender. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with parsley. Makes 1-2 servings.

Preheat grill. Trim the ends of the asparagus. Cut the rest of the spears into 1/2-inch pieces. Brush the asparagus with the dressing and sprinkle with the seasonings. Place the asparagus on the grill and cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until the asparagus is tender-crisp. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in small frypan and add mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes, then add garlic and thyme and cook for another minute or two. Spoon mixture on toast and top with cheese. Bake under griller until cheese melts and toast is golden brown.

Drain hard-boiled eggs and cool. Peel or slice in half. Put egg yolks into a small mixing bowl. Add mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar and prepared mustard. Stir well. Spoon or pipe yolk mixture into egg whites. Sprinkle with paprika.

In a large soup pot, sauté onion in oil until it is tender. Add pork jowl and cook until it is browned. Add the beans, broth and the seasonings. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the beans for 2 hours or until the meat is tender. Drain the liquid from the beans and reserve the liquid. Add the reserved liquid and the diced tomatoes to the beans. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with cornbread.

Melt chocolate cookies with butter in a microwave or double boiler. Spread into a 9x13 pan. Freeze until ready to use. Crush vanilla ice cream and mix with strawberry ice cream topping. Spread over chocolate mixture. Freeze until ready to use. Crush strawberry ice cream with a fork and mix with fudge sauce. Spread over chocolate and vanilla ice cream mixture. Freeze until ready to use. Spread whipped topping over strawberry ice cream mixture. Sprinkle with strawberries.

Preheat over to 350 degrees F. Combine 1/2 cup salsa, jelly and vinegar in shallow roasting pan. Add ribsturn to coat. Bake uncovered 3 hours or until meat is fork tender. Baste every 30 minutes. Meanwhile, combine remaining salsa, sugar and vinegar. Stir until smoothbrush ribs to coat. Return to ovenbake 15 minutes. Sprinkle ribs with lime juice. Serve with warmed tortillas. Serves 8.

Put all ingredients in a saucepan and cook over low heat until mixture comes to a boil and then boil for one minute. Remove from heat and stir in powdered milk and vanilla. Pour into an ungreased 8 x 8 pan and cool in the refrigerator for several hours before cutting into squares.

In a bowl combine ground turkey, egg, onion, mushroom and garlic powder, oregano and black pepper. Mix well. Form into patties and brown on each side in a skillet with cooking spray over medium-high heat. In a bowl combine pizza sauce and bread crumbsspread over the patties. Cook for 2 minutes or until crumbs are golden brown and heated through. Makes 4 servings.

Mix together Splenda, cornflour, cocoa powder and salt in a large bowl until well blended. Make a well in centre of dry mixture and add milk, stirring until smooth and free of lumps. Pour into individual serving bowls or custard cups, cover with plastic wrap and chill in refrigerator for at least 8 hours or overnight before serving. Garnish with fruit or whipped cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place potatoes, parsnips, sweet potatoes, onions, garlic in roasting pan. Drizzle olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt. Mix well. Bake for 20 minutes. Increase heat to 425 degrees. Add beets, and maple syrup. Bake another 30 minutes.

Cook fettuccini according to directions on package. Set aside. Meanwhile, heat heavy cream and dijon mustard over medium heat until cream begins to bubble. Add roasted red pepper and cooked chicken to cream mixture. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve chicken mixture over fettuccini.

Heat sesame oil and peanut oil in a wok. Add garlic and ginger. Add rice. Stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce and peas. Stir-fry for another minute. Add eggs and stir until the eggs are cooked. Add spring onions and stir. Add bean sprouts and stir. Serve hot.

Take one slice of ham and lay in middle of slice of bread. Top with cheese slices. Lay one egg on top. Butter bread slices and lay under egg slices to hold them down. Cook on griddle or in frying pan until egg is cooked. Flip over and cook other side until egg is done.

In a medium size saute pan, melt the butter over medium heat, add the carrots, onions, garlic, and salt. Cook for a few minutes until the carrots are tender but not too soft. Add the vinegar and chives for the last minute of cooking. Serve hot as a side dish or add to any pasta dish.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook asparagus spears for 3 minutes. Drain, and cool under cold running water. Drain tortellini and toss with pesto and lemon rind. Serve tortellini with asparagus spears. Garnish with pine nuts.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl combine vegetables. In small bowl combine oil, garlic and rosemary. Pour over vegetables and toss. Spread vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast 30 minutes. Sprinkle vegetables with salt and sugar. Roast an additional 30 minutes or until vegetables are golden and tender. Sprinkle with additional rosemary and parmesan before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, stir together 1 stick of the butter, brown sugar, milk, egg, baking powder, and cinnamon. In a separate bowl, combine the flour and salt. Add the flour mixture to the wet mixture. Stir in the blueberries. Spoon the batter into greased muffin cups. Bake for about 20 minutes. Let the muffins cool slightly before removing them from the pan. Makes 18 muffins.

Preheat grill to high heat. In a small bowl, mix together the dressing, oregano, lemon pepper, garlic powder, mayonnaise, and lemon juice. Rub chicken with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Grill chicken breasts for 12 to 15 minutes on each side or to desired doneness. Serve chicken topped with the italian dressing mixture.

In a large pot, combine soup and water. Add rice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 20 minutes. Stir in milk and broccoli. Simmer for another 5 minutes. Sprinkle cheese on top and serve.

Mix egg whites and milk together. In a bowl, combine sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla. Melt butter or margarine in pan. Add bread to pan and cook until brown. Sprinkle with sugar mixture. Add sliced bananas. Cook until bananas are heated through. Makes 2 servings. Serve with lowfat yogurt.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking sheet with foil. Cut 1/2 inch slices from tomatoes. Place in a single layer on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with dried herb seasoning and seasonings. Roast until soft and browned on one side, about 30 minutes.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add chicken breasts. Sear on both sides for about 2-3 minutes. Remove from pan. Add onion. Sauté for 2 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook for another 2 minutes. Add paprika. Stir well. Add chicken base. Add heavy cream and sour cream. Cook for a few minutes until mixture is thick. Add the cooked chicken.

Mix together the first 5 ingredients. In a shallow dish combine the rest of the ingredients. Add salmon to the mixture and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Grill salmon on medium heat about 4 to 5 minutes on each side until the fish flakes easily with a fork.

In a large bowl, combine broccoli florets, egg, milk, onion, mayonnaise. Add the cheese. Mix well. Spread half the mixture in the bottom of a 9 by 13-inch baking pan. In a small bowl, combine soup, salt and pepper. Spread over the broccoli mixture. Add the rest of the broccoli mixture. Sprinkle with cheez-it crackers. Melt butter. Drizzle over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes until bubbly. Serve immediately.

In a large nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil over high heat. Add potatoescook until potatoes begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Add garliccook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add mintstir to combine. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Taste and adjust seasonings. Serve immediately.

Melt the chocolate chips with the butter in the microwave. Add the half-and-half, corn syrup and salt. Add the vanilla. Heat until the mixture is hot but do not boil. Remove from heat. Makes about 2 cups.

Cut the steaks into serving sized pieces and lightly brush with butter. Cook the steaks on a preheated grill pan over a medium heat for 1-2 minutes on each side or until done to taste. Meanwhile fry the onion in the butter in a small saucepan over a low heat for 2-3 minutes or until soft but not browned. Add the scotch whisky and stir to deglaze the pan. Add the double cream and season to taste. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning if necessary and remove from the heat. Serve the beef in the whisky sauce and sprinkle with parsley to serve.
Muddle strawberries and basil sprig with powdered sugar and vodka in a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake well. Pour into glass and top with soda water. Garnish with strawberry slices.
Toast the bagel. Spread cream cheese on one half of the bagel. Top with pineapple slices and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Broil until the cheese is melted and the pineapple is warm and brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a shallow bowl, beat the eggs and milk togetheradd the sugar and salt. Slice the bread into 1/2-inch slices. Dip each bread slice into the egg mixture and arrange the slices into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. In a small bowl, mix together the butter and maple syrup. Brush the mixture over the french toast. Bake for another 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve immediately with butter and syrup.

Mix together cereal, pretzels and peanuts. In a 9x13x2 casserole dish, arrange mixture in 2 layers. Melt oleo in a small saucepan, add in brown sugar and honey and stir until melted and smooth. Add in vanilla. Pour over cereal mixture and toss well. Bake in a 350f oven for 20 minutes.

Mix together peanut butter, powdered sugar and oil until combined. Press into a 9x13 pan. Melt dipping chocolate and pour over top of peanut butter mixture. Spread evenly over the peanut butter mixture. Allow to set completely before cutting into bars. Store tightly covered at room temperature.
Soak 3 garlic cloves in lemon juice. Whisk together tahini, lemon juice, 1/2 tsp. salt in a medium bowl. Add parsley and garlic cloves. Stir to blend. Serve over lettuce or rice.

In a large soup pot saute the onion and celery in the butter until tender. Add the potatoes, broth and water and bring to a boil. Add the kielbasa, garlic and the soup. Cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Stir in the cream of chicken soup and pepper. Serve hot.

Bring coffee grounds, cinnamon stick, cardamom seeds to a boil in a coffee maker. Once boiling, remove cinnamon stick and cardamom seeds. Add sugar to coffee maker. Add rum extract to coffee. Add milk to coffee maker. Brew coffee. Stir well. Add more sugar to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl combine cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. In a medium bowl beat together milk, eggs and butter with a whisk. Stir into dry ingredients just until combined. Spoon batter into a greased 13x9x2-inch pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the bread comes out clean. Sprinkle with pork rinds. Bake 5 minutes longer or until topping is golden brown. Makes 12 servings.

Cube chicken. Heat olive oil and sesame oil in a large skillet. Add chicken and brown lightly. Remove chicken from skillet and add mushrooms. Brown mushrooms in the fat and remove from heat. Add wine to skillet and cook until slightly reduced. Add chicken stock and return chicken and mushrooms to skillet. Cook until chicken is tender. Add parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve over pasta.
In a blender combine pineapple juice, zucchini, and sugar. Blend until smooth. Strain through a strainer to remove pulp. Stir in food coloring until desired color is reached. Refrigerate.

Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. In a medium bowl mix the chicken with the apples, celery and walnuts. In a small bowl combine whipping cream and mayonnaise. Add Dijon mustard, salt and pepper. Toss with the chicken mixture. Serve with lettuce leaves.

In a small bowl combine oil, brown sugar and vanilla extract and mix well. Add egg and beat well. Add flour and baking powder and salt and mix well. Add sesame seeds and mix well. Place the mixture on a cookie sheet and bake at 450 degrees for about 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle the top with the toasted sesame seeds and bake at 450 degrees for a minute or until the sesame seeds are golden brown. Remove the cookies from the oven and let cool before placing them in an airtight container.

Place bread dough in a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake in a preheated 400° F oven for about 10 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Meanwhile, combine pudding mixes, milk, sugar, and cinnamon in a large bowl. Mix well. Spread over hot bread dough. Bake another 20-25 minutes or until bread is golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack before cutting into 2-inch squares.
In a large bowl, combine artichoke hearts, mayo and parmesan cheese. Mix well. Add lemon juice and old bay. Mix well. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with crackers.

In a small bowl, whisk together light soy sauce, oyster sauce, creamy peanut butter, shallot, gingerroot, red pepper flakes and 1 tablespoon oil. In a large wok or saute pan over high heat, add remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add green beans and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add soy sauce mixture and stir-fry for 1 more minute. Remove from heat, stir in cilantro and serve garnished with roasted peanuts.

Beat eggs until foamy. Beat in sugar and milk until smooth. Add chocolate and butter and mix well. Pour into pastry-lined 9-inch pie plate and bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Let cool before serving.

Mix together the soy sauce, water, garlic cloves, brown sugar, vegetable oil and ground ginger in a nonreactive dish and stir well to combine. Lay the flank steak into the marinade and turn to coat evenly. Marinate the steak in the refrigerator for about two hours. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Remove the steak from the marinade and grill it to your desired doneness. Serve with steamed jasmine rice and vegetables.

Preheat over to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Brush pierogies with butter or margarine. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese. Place in shallow baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Place sausage in a large skillet. Sauté over medium heat until cooked through. Remove sausage from skillet. In the same skillet saut the vegetables in the olive oil. Add the white wine. Add the sausage back to the skillet. Season to taste with oregano. Serve over cooked spaghetti.

Preheat oven to 300 F. Place chickens in a large roasting pan. Sprinkle with seasoning salt and pepper. Place half of the tabasco sauce in a bowl with water and mix well. Pour over the chickens and pour the remaining sauce into the bottom of the roasting pan. Bake at 300 F. for 1 hour. Lower the heat to 170 F. and cook for an additional hour. Allow the chicken to rest in the pan for at least 10 minutes before carving.
Bring water to boil and pour over tea. Let steep about five minutes and then add milk and sugar. Stir and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Toss together the apple slices, granola cereal, juice and water in a 13×9 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 1 hour in the preheated oven. Drizzle apple slices with butter, and sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake 30 minutes longer, or until apples are tender. Serve warm.
Place cinnamon stick, whole cloves, allspice, fresh mint leaves in teapot and add hot water. Cover. Steep for 10 minutes. Strain. Add sugar to taste. Pour over ice cubes. Garnish with mint sprig.

Heat oil in large pot or dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened and translucent, 3-4 minutes. Add garlic and saute until fragrant, 1 minute more. Add broth and tomatoes and cook until heated through, about 10 minutes. Add lime juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with cilantro before serving and serve with tortilla chips or rice or quinoa.

First we start with mushrooms. Add them to a pan with some oil to warm them up. Then take them out of the pan and set aside. In the same pan, add some more oil (maybe 2 tablespoons) and then add your garlic. Saute it until it&s golden. Then take it out of the pan and set it aside. Add your mushrooms back into the pan with more oil to warm them up. Once they are warmed up and the pan is nice and hot again, add your garlic. Then pour the whole thing into your blender or food processor (if you have one) and blend until it is all smooth. Once it is all blended together, put it back into your pan and stir it over heat to heat it up. Now you should be ready to make your burgers. Heat your grill pan or stove top pan up and add some olive oil. Once it is hot, take out your hamburger buns and put them on the grill pan. Then put your burger patties on there as well. Let it cook until it is ready. Once it is ready, put some of your burger mixture onto the top of your bur
Place sliced onions in slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Stir occasionally. Remove from heat. Serve with hamburgers or hot dogs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with foil or parchment paper. Spread nuts evenly over the baking sheet. Sprinkle the pecans with maple syrup and almonds with olive oil. Sprinkle nuts evenly with herbs and seasoning. Bake for 5 to 8 minutes or until nuts are toasted and dry. Transfer to a large bowl to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week. Makes 1 pound of nut mix.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Mix cajun seasoning and salt & pepper and rub on both sides of fillets. Heat olive oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium high heat. Add marlin steaks and cook until nicely browned on both sides. Place steaks in oven and bake until fish is opaque and just cooked through about 6 to 8 minutes. Garnish with lemon wedges and serve immediately.

In a large skillet, heat butter over medium heat. Add onions and sausage. Cook and stir until onions are soft and sausage is browned. Remove from heat. Beat together eggs and milk. Add to skillet and stir until well combined. Cook until eggs are set. Sprinkle with pecans and salt and pepper. Top with cheese and place in refrigerator until ready to use. Heat a grill or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Spread one side of the bread with butter. Place buttered side down on grill. Top with 2 tablespoons of egg mixture. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of cheese and 2 tablespoons of pecans. Top with 2 tablespoons of egg mixture. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of cheese and 2 tablespoons of pecans. Top with the remaining bread. Cook until cheese is melted and bread is lightly browned. Cut in half and serve with fruit.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the chicken. Cook for 4 minutes on each side. Add the soy sauce, honey, and water to the skillet. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Makes 2 servings.

Mix wine and rosemary and pour over the chicken breasts. Marinate for 30 minutes or more. Heat oil over medium heat in a skillet. Add the mushrooms and saute for 5 - 7 minutes or until tender. Add the chicken breasts, saute for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until cooked through and no longer pink inside. Remove chicken from pan and keep warm. Stir in the remaining ingredients and cook until thickened and bubbly. Spoon over chicken breasts and serve immediately.

Boil potatoes in lightly salted water until they are just cooked through. Drain and allow potatoes to cool for about 30 minutes. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan and cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towel and set aside. Toss spring onions with potatoes and white wine vinegar in a large bowl and leave to stand. Blend the remaining ingredients together in a small bowl. Pour the dressing over the potato mixture and toss together. Add the bacon and season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate until needed.

Heat broth and spices until broth is steaming and simmering lightly. Add salmon and cook until it just begins to flake when tested with a fork, about 5 minutes. Remove salmon and keep warm. Add bok choy and cook until just tender, about 2 minutes. Toss with salmon and serve immediately with remaining broth.
Brown bacon in a skillet. Add cooked rice, onion, green peppers and chili powder. Mix well. Heat through. Stir in soup until heated through. Add sugar to taste. Serve immediately.

Combine oats, flour, cornstarch, cinnamon and nutmeg. Add 4 cups of the peaches. Toss lightly. Place in a greased 13×9 inch pan. Sprinkle brown sugar over the top. Drizzle honey over the top. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Combine sugar, baking soda, salt and buttermilk in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir until mixture boils. Boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Quickly stir in butter until smooth. Stir in pecans. Pour mixture into a lightly greased 9x13x2-inch baking pan. Cool completely. Cut into small squares. Roll each square in sugar. Store at room temperature in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Soak dried peas overnight in cold water. Drain peas and add to stockpot. Add remaining ingredients and cook until peas are tender. Stir often and cook until tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crackers or french bread.
Place all ingredients in a large pot. Bring to a boil. Turn down to a simmer. Simmer for one hour. Remove cloves and cinnamon. Let cool. Serve in small bowls. Top with whipped cream.

Combine watermelon and cantaloupe in a large bowl. Cut away and discard rinds from both fruits. Cut melon into bite-sized pieces. Chop mint and basil leaves and mix into the melon. Add lemon juice. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Combine simple syrup and amaretto in a small bowl and pour over melon. Toss until well coated. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Toss once or twice. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 9x13 inch baking dish. Beat together eggs and half and half. Soak bread slices in egg mixture about 1 minute per side. Layer bread in prepared baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine brown sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon. Sprinkle over bread. Bake until bread is golden and center is set, about 40 minutes.
Blend together the cream cheese, lemon juice and anchovy paste until smooth. Stir in the onion and chives. Serve with crackers or vegetable dippers.

Prepare pie crusts as directed on package for a double crust pie. Reserve one crust for top. In a large mixing bowl combine the sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt. Add the beaten eggs. Stir in the light corn syrup. Add butter and vanilla. Add quick-cooking oatmeal. Place one third of mixture into bottom crust. Top with apple pie filling. Dot with remaining one-third of mixture. Top with remaining crust. Seal and flute edges. Cut slits in top crust. Brush top with milk. Bake at 400 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely before cutting.

Combine first seven ingredients in a small bowl. Pour over chicken in a large resealable plastic bagturn to coat chicken with marinade. Refrigerate chicken for 8 hours turning bag occasionally. Remove chicken from bagreserve marinade. Grill chicken, covered with grill lid, over medium-hot coals until no longer pink, 20 to 25 minutes per side. Serve with reserved marinade.

Heat olive oil in saute pan over medium heat. Add chopped spinach to pan. Cook until wilted about 3 minutes. Add garlic cloves to pan and cook 1 minute. Add breadcrumbs to pan. Stir until bread crumbs are coated with the spinach mixture. Remove from heat. Add parmesan cheese and salt & freshly ground black pepper to taste. Stir until mixture is evenly blended. Serve as an accompaniment to any Italian meal or as a side dish to pasta.
Bring 6 qt water to boil. Cook pasta until al dente. Drain. Combine pasta and sauce in a large bowl. Stir to mix. Serve with broccoli florets and sprinkle with cheese.

Heat the oil in a large nonstick pan and saute the onion over medium high heat until soft. Add the garlic cloves and saute for a further minute. Add the rice and stir for a few seconds. Pour in the vegetable stock. Season the stock with black pepper. Add the sweet corn and peppers. Bring to the boil, cover with a lid and simmer over low heat for around 12 minutes, until the rice is cooked. Check the rice is cooked by tasting. If the rice is not cooked after 12 minutes add a little more stock. Serve garnished with a sprinkling of chopped parsley.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add macaroni and cook according to directions on package. Drain. Add milk and butter. Combine macaroni, cream of celery soup, and tuna. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese.

Boil the water in a saucepan until it reaches a boiling temperature. Add the corn and boil for 5 minutes. Remove the corn from the saucepan. In a large bowl place the sugar, salt and water. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Place the corn in the bowl and stir well. Place the corn in a freezer bag or container. Seal the bag. The corn can be kept in the freezer up to 6 months.

Heat olive oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add shallot and saute until fragrant and translucent but not brown. Add penne and stir frequently. When penne is 3/4 cooked add tomatoes and cook 1 - 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in whipping cream and ground nutmeg. Add the vodka and fresh dill and salt and pepper to taste and toss. Spoon mixture into pasta bowls and top with smoked salmon. Garnish with fresh dill and serve immediately.

Combine rice and chicken. Set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet. Add onions and saute for 3 minutes. Add beans, tomatoes, jalapeno, vinegar, cumin and salt. Cook for 5 minutes more. Spoon chicken mixture onto the bottom of each salad plate. Top with beans mixture. Garnish with green onions.
Wrap each breast with 2 slices of bacon, tuck in a slice of cheese and a tablespoon of diced tomatoes. Place in a baking dish and bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with rice and green salad.
In a pan heat ghee and fry the onions. Add the curry and red chili powder and fry for a minute. Add salt and stir. Add the beef. Add water and bring to a boil. Simmer for a while and serve.
Combine tuna, tomatoes, onion, cilantro, lime juice, jalapeno peppers and salt. Mix well. Serve on boston lettuce. Top with baked tortilla chips.
Combine all of the ingredients, except the breadcrumbs. Mix together well. Shape into balls. Roll them in the breadcrumbs. Deep fry until golden brown. Serve.

In a 9x13x2 inch baking dish, combine the soup with 1 cup of water and the celery and water chestnuts. Arrange the cooked chicken breast halves in the baking dish. Melt the margarine and mix with the cracker crumbs. Sprinkle the cracker crumbs over the top of the chicken. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with almonds before serving. Serve with a green salad.

Mix the orange jell-o with the water according to directions on box. Stir in the crushed pineapple, cool whip and cream cheese until blended. Fold in the can of mandarin oranges and pour into moulds and chill until set. This is a very fast salad that is so yummy on a hot summer day.

Prepare angel food cake mix as directed on box. Grease 9x13 pan. Spread half of the cake batter in the pan. Add 2 cups of milk to a large bowl. Add one box of pudding mix to the milk and whisk until smooth. Spread pudding mixture over the angel food batter. Top with remaining angel food batter. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes. Meanwhile combine 3 cups of cool whip with 1/2 cup strawberry jam. Spread evenly over warm cake. Garnish with fresh strawberries.

Place chocolate in small bowl. Heat in microwave in 20 second intervals until melted stirring in between until melted. Add in all remaining ingredients except nuts. Heat on stove or in microwave for about 4-5 minutes stirring occasionally until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in nuts.

Prepare tomatoes by cutting out core and seeds and chopping into medium dice. Prepare radishes by thinly slicing and soaking in cold water for 5 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold running water and pat dry with paper towels. Toss together in a medium bowl and add mint leaves. Sprinkle with scallions and toss. In a small bowl whisk together oil, lemon juice and salt and pepper. Add to radish mixture and toss. Chill 2 hours or longer.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Mix the honey, apple cider and mustard in a small bowl and pour over the chicken. Place in a shallow baking pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 30 minutes, then baste chicken with the mixture. Continue baking for another 20 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the apple cream sauce. In a saucepan combine the apple and the juice. Cook over medium heat until apple is tender. Stir in the cream and heat until warm. Serve the chicken with the sauce.

Microwave margarine and sugar in a large microwave safe bowl until margarine is melted and mixture is smooth. Add ice cream and mix well. Add crushed crackers and stir well. Pour into pie crust and refrigerate for 3 hours or until set. Top with whipped topping and serve immediately. Enjoy!

Prepare rolls according to package directions. Meanwhile combine pudding mix and milk. Add brown sugar and butter. Cook on medium heat for 5-7 minutes. Spread 1/2 of the mixture on the rolls. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes. Serve warm.

Wash the rice 3-4 times until the water is clear. Soak the rice for 10 minutes. Heat oil in a pan or pot over medium heat and add the cardamoms, cloves, black peppercorns and bay leaves and saffron threads. Add the rice to the pan and stir-fry for a minute or two. Add 3 cups of water or broth and bring to a boil. Lower the heat to medium-low and simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Add more water if necessary to keep the rice moist.

Toss the mushrooms with the mustard and 1/4 of the vinegar. Cover and let stand for 15 minutes. In a large bowl, toss the green beans with the vinegar. Add the mushrooms and bacon and toss. Add the parsley and toss again. Makes 4 main course servings.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add carrots and pea pods. Cover. Cook for 3 minutes. Add butter and cook for another minute or so. Add water. Cover. Cook until vegetables are tender. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with enough water to form a thin paste. Stir into skillet. Bring to a boil. Stir constantly until thick. Add honey. Stir until well combined. Serve warm.

Mix together the first four ingredients and pour over chicken breasts in a shallow dish and marinate for at least one hour or overnight. Grill or broil for 8 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve immediately.

Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Add onions and bell peppers, cook until tender. Beat eggs, cream and season with salt and pepper. Pour into skillet on top of vegetables. Sprinkle with cheeses, cover skillet and cook until omelet is set. Remove cover and sprinkle with salsa. Serve with tortillas or toast for dipping.

Toss spinach leaves with raspberry jam and vinegar. Add honey and oil. Add macadamia nuts and toss to coat. Divide into two bowls. Put cantaloupe balls into one bowl and top with fresh strawberries. Repeat for second serving. Sprinkle with macadamia nuts.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a muffin pan or line with paper liners. In a large bowl or mixer, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Beat in the vanilla. In a separate bowl combine the flour, baking powder and salt. Gradually add to the butter mixture and beat until smooth. Spoon into the prepared pans. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for five minutes. Frost and enjoy.

Combine soy sauce and cornstarch in a small saucepan and bring to boil stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in black pepper and garlic ginger until blended. Cool slightly and add brown sugar and sesame oil stirring until blended. Let stand for at least an hour before serving. To make the dipping sauce combine white and brown sugar in a small saucepan stirring until blended. Add soy sauce and hot sauce stirring until blended. Remove from heat and stir in cornstarch and ginger stirring until blended. Stir in water until smooth and shiny. Remove from heat and stir in sesame seeds until blended.

Mix cake mix, egg and water and pour into prepared pan. Bake at 350 for about 15 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool. When cool combine ricotta cheese and almond extract and spread over top of cooled cake. Dust with sugar and refrigerate.

In a 6-quart crock pot add olive oil, diced onions and garlic. Cook over low heat until soft. Stir in the pearl barley. Add the rosemary. Add the sweet potatoes. Pour in the stock. Cover and cook over low heat for 8 hours. Serves 8.

Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet. Add the ginger and onion and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the broth and bring to a boil. Add the mushrooms and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the noodles and cook until tender. Stir in the bean sprouts and cook for 1 minute. Add the snap peas and cook for 2 minutes longer. Stir in the soy sauce and serve immediately.

Pound the chops to 1/4 inch thickness and sprinkle with seasoning. Dredge in cornstarch and shake off excess. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat and saute chops for 2-3 minutes on each side or until browned on all sides. Serve immediately with desired sauce or gravy.

Cook the bacon in a large skillet until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet with slotted spoon, reserving drippings in skillet. Saute mushrooms in hot drippings for 3-4 minutes. Combine all other ingredients except romano cheese in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Add bacon. Cook covered for 8-10 minutes until lima beans are tender. Sprinkle with romano cheese. Serves 6-8.

Saute garlic and crushed red pepper flakes in oil for 1 minute. Add tomatoes, basil, salt and black peppercook for 2 minutes or until tomatoes are tender-crisp. Add pastatoss with sauce. Stir in brothcook 3-5 minutes or until pasta is al dentetoss with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a jelly roll pan (a 15 x 10 inch pan).In a bowl of an electric mixer beat together the eggs, the white sugar, the water, the baking powder, the salt, the cocoa powder, and the cake flour. Beat on medium speed for about 2 minutes.Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for about 12 minutes or until the center is firm. Cool.Cut into 1 inch strips. In a bowl combine the confectioners' sugar and the cocoa powder. Add enough water to make a paste-like consistency. Drizzle over the cake strips. Makes about 20 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Line baking sheet with aluminum foil for easy cleanup.Toss together brussels sprouts and butter, spreading the sprouts evenly onto the baking sheet.In a small bowl combine almonds and honey, stirring well.Sprinkle almond mixture over brussels sprouts.Sprinkle with salt and peppertoss to combine.Roast for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring once or twice.Toss sprouts with lemon juice and serve immediately.
Puree all ingredients in blender until smooth. Cover and chill up to 24 hours. Serve with tortilla chips or as a condiment with barbecued meats or seafood.
Slice sausage into rings and brown in pan over medium heat. Add pineapple and brown sugar. Cook until heated through. Remove from heat and add banana slices. Serve warm over rice or mashed potatoes.

Cut watermelon in half lengthwise, then scoop out seeds with spoon. Cut melons in chunks or cubes. Gently toss together in large bowl with grapes and mint leaves. In small bowl, stir together lime juice, honey and 2 tablespoons mint leaves, until combined well. Pour over salad. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 8 hours before serving. To serve, spoon salad onto bed of lettuce. Garnish with remaining mint leaves. Serve immediately.

Cream together shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add milk and vanilla and beat until well combined. Add egg and beat until blended. Sift together flour, salt and baking soda and add to shortening mixture. Stir until combined. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts, if desired. Drop by teaspoon onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes, until golden around the edges. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack to cool completely. Makes approximately 3 dozen cookies.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add chicken breasts and brown. Add soup and wine. Add cheese and ham and stir until cheese melts. Remove from heat and pour into baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Spread cream cheese on bagel. Cut red onion into thin slices and layer on cream cheese. Place smoked salmon on top and drizzle with lemon juice and a sprinkle of dill and capers. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl mix together flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder and salt. In another large bowl, mix together buttermilk, egg and vegetable oil. Add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients and stir just until moistened. Fold in the sweet red pepper. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups. Bake at 400 for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Muffins may be stored in an airtight container at room temperature up to 3 days.

Combine all ingredients except shrimp and cucumber slices in a large bowl, stirring well. Chill thoroughly. Fold in shrimp and cucumbers. Garnish with additional parsley if desired. Serve with crackers or roll-ups.

Place first four ingredients in a medium saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth. Cool. Fold in nuts. Refrigerate until firm. Form into balls with hands. Roll balls in chocolate sprinkles and shredded coconut. Store in refrigerator. Makes about 2 dozen.

Peel papayas and slice into chunks. Blend chunks in a blender until smooth. Strain through a colander. Squeeze lime juice into papaya mixture, then add water. Stir well and serve over ice in a tall glass. Garnish with a slice of lime.

Mix together all ingredients. Place chicken breast in a Ziploc bag and pour marinade over. Marinate for about an hour. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Grill chicken breast for about 8 minutes on each side or until done. Slice chicken breast into thin strips. Serve on a bed of mixed greens, then top with avocado slices. Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Garnish with sliced green onion. Serve with tortilla chips.

Dissolve unflavored gelatin in boiling water. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add coffee and hot coffee. Add sugar to taste. Add salt to taste. Chill in refrigerator until set. Cut into squares and serve.

Wash and dry the mint leaves and put them in a bowl. Pour the vinegar over the mint leaves. Let this mixture stand for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally to bruise the leaves. Strain the mixture through a fine sieve, pressing hard to release all the liquid. Discard the leaves. In a small saucepan combine the mint liquid with the sugar and stir over medium heat until the sugar is completely dissolved. Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer gently for 5 to 10 minutes, until the liquid is reduced to about 1 cup. Remove the saucepan from the heat and add the certo, stirring until dissolved. Pour the jelly into hot sterilized jars leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Wipe the rims with a damp cloth. Screw on the lids and process in a boiling water bath for 5 minutes. Cool and label. This jelly is great on lamb and pork. Makes 3 pint jars

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Beat egg whites in a medium bowl until foamy. Gradually add sugar while continuing to beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Sift cocoa powder over egg whites and beat until stiff peaks form again. Drop meringue by teaspoonfuls onto prepared baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes or until meringues are crisp, but not browned. Melt chocolate chips in a double broiler for about 2 minutes or until melted. Dip the bottom half of each meringue into the chocolate and place back onto the baking sheets to set. Store meringues in an airtight container. Makes 5 dozen

Mix together milk and cornstarch in a small saucepan over low heat until cornstarch is dissolved. Add sugar and cocoa and cook over low heat for 10-15 minutes or until mixture is thickened to consistency of thick custard. Cool slightly. Beat in vanilla. Fold in espresso powder. Pour mixture into 6 individual serving cups or a 10 inch round cake pan. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight. Top with a dollop of whipped cream and garnish with sliced almonds.

Combine chicken with evaporated milk in medium bowl. Whisk in flour and seasoningsstir in soup and water. Spread mixture evenly in 9-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center. Sprinkle with butter pieces. Makes 4 servings.

Place the carrots in a large pot. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Cook until the carrots are fork tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the carrots. In a bowl, combine the carrots, radish, sesame oil, rice wine vinegar, soy sauce and sugar. Toss until well coated. Season with cayenne. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
Preheat oven to 400f. Combine sugar, cinnamon, apple and butter in a small baking dish. Add pork chops. Pour cranberry juice over top. Bake for about 30 minutes or until cooked through.

In medium saucepan, combine broth with tomatoes and potato. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potato is tender. Add remaining vegetables and meatballsstir and continue cooking until heated through. Season with garlic powder and parmesan cheese.

Soak dried mushrooms in Marsala for 15 minutes. Place mushrooms and wine in a saucepan and cook over medium heat for 15 minutes. Strain mushrooms from wine and discard mushrooms. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in flour and cook until flour is golden. Add wine and cook until mixture is smooth. Add mushroom wine. Heat until mixture comes to a boil. Add cheeses, 1/2 at a time until cheeses are melted. Stir in pepper. Serve with crusty bread.

Place broccoli, green beans, onions and peppers in a 2-quart saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Drain well. In a medium bowl combine milk and crabmeat. In a medium skillet melt margarine. Add garlic powder. Cook 1 minute. Stir in basil. Add minute rice. Cook and stir until heated through. Add vegetable mixture. Stir in crabmeat mixture. Add parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with parsley.

Melt butter in heavy saucepan over low heat and stir in flour, salt and pepper. Cook 2 minutes while constantly stirring until mixture is bubbly and brown. Add sugar and stir until smooth and thick. Add eggs and continue to stir until smooth and thickened. Add milk and lemon juice and bring to boil over medium heat while constantly stirring. Cook until thickened to your liking. Serve over steak or chicken or fish or anything that needs to be perked up.

Combine the wine vinegar and jelly and bring to the boil in a small pan. Reduce the heat and simmer until reduced by half. Add the rosemary and garlic and leave for 1 hour. Strain the mixture and put in a serving dish. Place the lamb chops on a plate, rub them with the garlic and oil and season with freshly ground black pepper. Add the redcurrant jelly and roast in a hot oven for about 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and coat the lamb chops with the vinegar and jelly mixture and serve with the lamb and rosemary dressing.

Heat oven to 350f. Grease 9-inch square baking pan. In a large bowl, cream together butter, 1/2 cup sugar and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time. Mix together flour, baking powder and salt. Add to butter mixture alternately with milk, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. In a medium saucepan, bring to a boil sugar, boiling water and 1/2 cup water. Cook, without stirring, until mixture is amber brown. Pour into a bowl. Add butter, vanilla and milk. Cool 10 minutes or until slightly thickened. Pour over cake.

Cut spaghetti squash in half and place cut side down in baking dish. Add 1 cup water to dish. Bake at 400 degrees until done. Cool slightly and scrape out seeds with fork. Mix together 1/4 cup butter and 1/4 cup diced onion. Mix with squash. Serve with grated cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9 x 13 casserole with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine cake mix, eggs and melted butter. Stir to combine. Add apple pie filling and stir until just moistened. Pour into casserole and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and spread evenly with the chopped nuts. Return to oven and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until done. Cool completely.
Cook couscous in chicken broth in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat until tender. Stir in butter and parmesan cheese. Add frozen peas and season to taste. Serve immediately.

Place mushrooms and water in a pan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until mushrooms are tender, about 25 minutes. Remove from heat, drain and chill. Cut the onion into quarters lengthwise. Peel the mushrooms if they are not already peeled. Slice the onion thinly, crosswise. Drain the mushrooms. Mix with the onion. Add the cream, lemon juice and pepper. Chill the salad for 1 hour or more before serving. Serve with lettuce leaves.

Hard boil eggs as directed in package. Allow them to cool before peeling and slicing in half lengthwise. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, sour cream, mustard and relish. Blend thoroughly. Add garlic and season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon filling into the eggs. Garnish with paprika. Chill and serve.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Rinse under cold water. Drain. Combine noodles, cucumber, kiwi and strawberries. Toss with dressing. Sprinkle with cashews. Garnish with swiss cheese. Serve on lettuce leaves.

Mix brown sugar and mustard in a small bowl and set aside. Soak skewers in water for at least one hour or overnight. Brush salmon fillets with soy sauce and sprinkle with pepper. Thread onto skewers alternating with onion slices (if desired). Spread mustard mixture evenly over the salmon fillets and bake on a broiler pan (or grill) for 3-4 minutes on each side until just cooked through. Serve immediately. Serve over rice or noodles and a side salad.

Combine cereals in a large bowl. Melt butter in a small heavy saucepan over low heat. Add sugar substitute and syrup. Bring to a boilboil and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in extract and vanilla. Pour over cereal mixture and stir. Add raisins and nuts. Spread on waxed paper and cool completely. Store in airtight container.

Spread butter on the outsides of your french rolls. Cut your cheese into slices about an inch thick or thinner. Spread fig jam on the inside of your french rolls. Layer cheese, prosciutto and fig jam. Close up your sandwiches. Heat your skillet on medium high heat. When your skillet is hot, add about one tbs of butter. Place your sandwiches on the skillet. Let the sandwiches cook until the cheese has melted. Flip the sandwiches over so the cheese can melt on the other side. Let your sandwiches cook on the other side for about one minute then remove your sandwiches from the skillet. Let your sandwiches cool. Cut into halves or quarters depending on your preference.

Cut prickly pears into quarters. Squeeze the seeds out of the quarters into a colander. Pour boiling water over the quarters to dissolve the seeds. Drain and squeeze out the seeds again. Add the seeds to the sugar in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add butter and cinnamon stick. Cook over low heat until the mixture is thickened to a caramel-like consistency. Pour mixture into an 8-inch by 8-inch glass baking dish. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup sugar. Bake for 10 minutes. Dot with butter and sprinkle with the remaining 2 tablespoons cinnamon. Bake until golden, 20 to 25 minutes more. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

Heat bacon fat in a large saute pan over medium high heat. Saute clams until they open. Stir in parsley and parmesan cheese. Remove clams from pan and set aside. Add flour to fat in pan and cook for 1 minute. Add chicken stock 1/4 cup at a time until smooth, creamy consistency is reached. Add kosher salt and fresh pepper to taste. Serve clams on top of sauce garnished with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease 9 x 5 loaf pan. Combine egg beaters egg substitute, vanilla, splenda brown sugar blend, and cinnamon in large bowl. Beat until well combined. Combine whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt and walnuts in a small bowl. Stir into egg mixture. Spread evenly into prepared pan. Bake 45 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack. Cut into slices. Makes 12.

Slice green tomatoes about 1/4 inch thick (if they are too ripe they will fall apart) Dust them in flour, salt, and pepper. Put oil in large skillet heated to 375 degrees. When oil is hot, put in tomatoes to cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side until brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately with mayonnaise or ranch dressing.

Beat egg whites at medium speed until frothy. Add cream of tartar and continue beating until soft peaks form (when beaters are lifted the whites will stay in place). Gradually beat in sugar a small amount at a time, until stiff peaks form (when beaters are lifted they will stand straight up). Add extract and beat for one more minute. Scoop the mixture onto parchment paper and spread in a thin layer (about 1 1/2 inch in diameter). Sprinkle with candy pieces and press lightly into the mixture. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes in a preheated 300 degree oven or until the candy pieces have melted and the meringue is dry and crisp. Store in an airtight container.

Beat cream cheese with mixer until creamymix in garlic, onion powder, parsley, pepper. Spread over bottom of 9-inch pie plate. Top with artichoke heartssprinkle with cheese dressing mixtop with roasted red pepper ringssprinkle with remaining cheese dressing mixsprinkle with olivescover with plastic wraprefrigerate at least 1 hour. Slice before serving.

Combine the garlic, ground cumin and chili powder with the ground turmeric and salt in a small bowl. Place the shrimp in a shallow bowl. Pour the lemon juice and yogurt into the bowl and toss to coat the shrimp. Drizzle the shrimp with the red food coloring and turn the shrimp over. Marinate for 2 hours. Thread the shrimp onto metal skewers. Preheat a grill to medium. Place the shrimp on the grill and cook for 3 minutes. Turn the shrimp over and cook for 3 more minutes. Sprinkle with lemon juice and serve with warm naan.

Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick frying pan over medium heat. Add the zucchini and cherry tomatoes and saute until tender. Add the green onions and saute for 2 more minutes. Stir in the vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Stir the basil into the vegetables and cook for about a minute. Remove from the heat and sprinkle with the pine nuts. Serve at room temperature.

Beat sour cream in a small mixing bowl until soft peaks form. Add pure maple syrup, beat until just blended. Gently fold in strawberries. Spoon into small bowls, or a small dish, sprinkle brown sugar on top if desired. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving time.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Drain again and combine with cheddar cheese, salad oil, vinegar, onion, cooked ham, frozen green peas, celery and pepper. Cover and chill overnight. Toss with mayonnaise just before serving.

In pitcher combine sugar and star anise pods. Add grapefruit juice and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add campari and stir. Just before serving add sparkling wine. Pour into champagne flutes. Serve immediately. Serving info is approximate.

Follow package directions for jello salad. It will be a little thick. Add a little of the juice or 7-up until you have the desired texture. Let cool until almost set and add the applesauce. Chill thoroughly.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Dredge the cube steaks in the flour, then add to the hot oil. Fry until golden brown on all sides. Remove and set aside. Pour off the grease from the pan. Add onion, mushrooms, garlic powder, and salt & pepper. Sauté until tender. Add the stewed tomatoes. Mix together the brown gravy mix & water. Pour over the vegetables. Return the cube steaks to the pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover & simmer for 45 minutes. Serve over egg noodles.

Preheat the oven to 325. Combine the pesto sauce and the balsamic vinegar. Place the lamb in a shallow roasting pan. Pour the marinade over the lamb and marinate overnight. Bake the lamb uncovered for 3 hours, basting several times during the baking process. Serve hot with a tossed salad.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line a muffin pan with paper liners. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, bran and cinnamon. In a large bowl, combine pumpkin puree and soymilk. In a small bowl, combine egg, buttermilk and oil. Make a well in the center of the flour mixtureadd egg mixture and beat until well blended. Add pumpkin mixture and stir until just combined. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups. Bake 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 5 minutesremove and cool completely on a wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.

Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a small saucepan. Stir in the quinoa and reduce the heat to a gentle simmer. Cover and cook for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand for 10 minutes. In a large bowl, toss the corn and tomatoes with the parsley. Drain the quinoa and stir into the corn mixture. In a blender or food processor, combine the lime juice, vinegar, and garlic and puree. With the machine running, gradually add the oil in a thin stream. Season the dressing with salt and pepper. Drizzle over the salad and toss to coat. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut squash in half, remove seeds and pulp. Place halves in a glass or ceramic baking dish and pour in margarine. Sprinkle with cinnamon and brown sugar. Place dish on a cookie sheet to catch any overflow. Bake for 1-1/2 hours or until squash is tender when pierced with a fork. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Cream together butter and sugar. Beat in egg and vanilla until well blended. Beat in mashed banana. Sift together oats, flour, baking soda and saltstir into mixture. Chill for 1 hour. Shape into 1-inch balls and roll in chocolate chips. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutesremove to wire racks to cool completely.

In a heavy skillet over medium heat, cook onions in butter until they are golden brown and caramelized. Cool onions. Slice beets into 1/2-inch pieces and cook in chicken broth until tender. Purée beets in a blender. Melt butter in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Add flour and stir for 1 minute. Slowly add port and beet purée and stir until smooth. Add broth and beets and cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and top with dollops of sour cream. Sprinkle with chives and serve immediately.

In a large skillet cook beef over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in onioncook until tender. Add macaronicook until heated through. Stir in tomato sauce, water and worcestershire saucebring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with cheese if desired. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking sheet with vegetable oil cooking spray. In a shallow dish combine bread crumbs with 1 tablespoon parsley and black pepper. Place the mayonnaise in a shallow dish or plastic bag and add the water. Press the fish into the bag or dish to coat evenly with the mayonnaise mixture. Transfer the fish from the bag to the bread crumb mixture and turn to coat evenly with the bread crumbs. Place the coated fish onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake the fish in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove the fish from the oven and season with the remaining parsley and hot pepper sauce. Serve fish with lemon wedges.

Remove corn kernels from ears and place in large bowl. Add olive oil and toss to coat evenly. In small bowl, whisk together shallot, vinegar and basilseason with salt and pepper. Drizzle over corn and toss gently.
In a large skillet brown the ground beef and onion. Drain. Add the taco seasoning and mix well. Add the tomatoes, cook for a few minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.

Cut the mushrooms into small pieces. Heat butter in a small pan. Add mushrooms, lemon juice, parsley and garlic. Cook until tender. Stir in egg yolk, salt and pepper. Serve on lettuce leaves or with bread.

Melt 1 1/2 cups butter in microwave safe bowl. Add cracker crumbs and stir until crumbs are evenly moistened and mixture forms a ball. Press onto bottom of 9-inch pie plate and refrigerate until firm. Beat pudding with milk as directed. Fold in 1 1/2 cups whipped topping until smooth. Spread over crumb crust and refrigerate until set. Top with remaining whipped topping and sprinkle with Heath bits.

In a small saucepan, heat the cream just to boiling. Pour over the chocolate and let stand 3 minutes. Stir to combine and set aside to cool. In another saucepan, combine the sugar and corn syrup. Heat to boiling and boil for 1 minute without stirring. Add the butter and the vanilla and stir until the mixture forms a soft ball. Let cool to room temperature. With an electric mixer on low speed, beat the chocolate mixture until it is smooth. With the motor running, add the vanilla and beat until smooth. Gradually add the cooled butter mixture and beat until smooth. Divide the mixture in half and mix in the nuts. Spoon into molds. Chill 2 hours. Top with additional nuts if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease a 13x9-inch baking dish. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar and peaches. In a separate bowl, beat together the baking powder, soda and salt. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs and vanilla. Stir the dry ingredients into the peach mixture and then add the buttermilk and eggs. Mix until just blended. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes. Reduce the heat to 325 degrees f and bake until a knife inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 20 minutes longer. Cool the cake in the pan for about 20 minutes before inverting onto a serving plate. Sprinkle with the pecans.
In a large bowl toss together the couscous and lemon zest. Add the olive oil and nuts and toss. Season to taste.

Combine almonds and sugar in a bowl and set aside. Combine spinach and lettuce in a salad bowl and set aside. Combine dressing in a bowl and set aside. Combine strawberries with dressing and set aside. Place almond and spinach salad on a plate. Top with strawberries and dressing. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees C. Grease a large baking tray with butter or margarine. Beat together eggs and sugar until light and creamy, and then stir in the butter until the mixture is smooth and thick. Add the passion fruit and stir well. Pour the mixture onto the baking tray and bake in the pre-heated oven for about 20 minutes or until set and light brown.
Slice banana & apple into thin strips. Slice strawberries into quarters. Spread strawberry cream cheese on bagel & layer with fruit. Drizzle with honey if desired.
Place sausages in a shallow baking dish. Cover with barbecue sauce. Add water and bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes. Serve with chips.

Wash figs. Cut in half lengthwise. Pour into a heavy saucepan. Add sugar and lemon rind and juice and enough of the honey and orange juice to cover the figs. Add the cinnamon stick and cloves. Cook over low heat for about 3 hours or until the figs have become a thick jam, stirring occasionally to prevent scorching.

In a medium bowl, stir together boiling water and gelatin until dissolved. Cool for 5 minutes. Add the pudding mix to the bowl, stirring well. Stir in mandarin oranges and 1 cup cool whip. Spoon into 3 1/2-inch ramekins or into 10-inch jelly roll pan. Refrigerate 1 hour. Top each with remaining cool whip.

Preheat broiler. Place chicken in shallow dish. Season both sides of chicken with Cajun seasoning. Broil about 4 inches from heat for 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Cut into 4 pieces.
