For dressing, combine mayonnaise, ginger, lime juice & tabasco in blender or food processor. Taste for seasoning. Place chicken in serving bowl. Drizzle with dressing. Serve hot.

Soak the beans overnight. Drain the beans and rinse them thoroughly with lots of water. Place the beans, onion, jalapeno, garlic, salt, black pepper and cumin into a crock pot or dutch oven. Cover with water and cook on low for 10-12 hours. Puree the mixture with an immersion blender and serve. You can either serve as is or add some sour cream for a little more flavor.

Combine the sugar, cocoa, and corn syrup in a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and boil gently for 1 minute without stirring. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and salt. Cool completely before serving. Makes 2 cups. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Combine lettuce, celery, egg, peas and pepper in large bowl. In another small bowl combine mayonnaise, sugar, onion and celery seeds until well blended. Add to vegetablestoss to coat. Cover and refrigerate several hours or overnight. Before serving add bacon and cheddar cheese to saladtoss well. Serve on lettuce leaves if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine honey, curry powder, ginger and cayenne pepperset aside. Rinse and pat dry the chicken wings. Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag and pour the honey mixture over the wings. Seal the bag and toss the chicken in the bag to coat evenly. Place wings on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes or until brown and crispy.

Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a small bowl, combine the dry mustard and cornstarchstir in 1 tablespoon of the water. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of water to the pineapple juice in a small saucepanbring to a boil. Add the mustard mixture and the soy sauce. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in the honey and vinegar. Heat through. Cut the hens in half and remove the backbones. Place the hens in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Pour the sauce over the hens. Bake for 1 hour. Remove the hens from the sauce and place on a serving platter. Pour the sauce over the hens. Garnish with the pineapple and peppers. Serve immediately. Serve with rice.

Mix together 1 1/2 cups chocolate syrup, 2 cups vanilla ice cream, and 2 colas. Fill a glass half full with ice cubes and pour mixture over ice cubes. Top with a maraschino cherry and an ice cream cone.
Brush each side of bread with melted butter and sprinkle with cheese and bacon. Broil 3 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and bread is toasted. Serve.

In a large saucepan or dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, garliccook for about 5 minutes or until onions are soft. Add basilcook for another 2 minutes. Add chicken stock, increase heat to highbring to a boil. Add pasta. Cook for another 10 minutes. Add lemon juice. Dish up with a garnish of parsley.

Preheat the oven to 400. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil. Toss the asparagus with the olive oil. Sprinkle the asparagus evenly with the kosher salt and the black pepper. Roast for about 25 minutes, or until lightly browned. Remove the asparagus from the oven and set aside. In a medium saucepan, combine the butter, garlic and lemon zest. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer. Add the lemon juice and the salt and pepper. Stir well. Pour the sauce over the asparagus.

Melt butter in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add almonds and cook until lightly browned, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Whisk together cream, chocolate chips and amaretto until smooth. Stir in almonds and season with salt. Recipe.

Bring 1-1/2 cups water to a boil in a medium pot. Add bouillon cube. Stir in rice. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered for 40 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in cream cheese, sour cream, parmesan cheese and garlic powder. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Season with black pepper. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Spread the walnuts and brown sugar evenly on one half of the baguette. Bake 10 minutes until the sugar is bubbly. Remove from the oven and top with the brie. Sprinkle with the apples. Broil until the apples are golden brown and the brie is bubbly. Serve warm.

Place butter and brown sugar in saucepan over medium heat and melt. Add milk and powdered sugar, stirring continuously with a wire whisk until frosting reaches spreading consistency. Refrigerate if not using immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a casserole dish with cooking spray. In a mixing bowl, combine sausage, cheese, eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour into prepared casserole dish. Cut each slice of white bread into quarters. Place evenly on top of egg mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Let stand five minutes. Cut into squares and serve.

Preheat oven to 350. Peel potatoes and place in a large pot. Cover with water. Cook until potatoes are tender (about 15 minutes). Drain potatoes and return to pot. Mash potatoes with a potato masher. Add butter to potatoes. Mash again with potato masher. Add cream cheese to potatoes and mix well. Add cream and season with kosher salt. Serve with sour cream.

Mix the flour and sugar together with the vanilla essence and coconut. Add the eggs and mix well. Place in a greased pie dish and sprinkle the top with sugar and a pinch of cinnamon. Bake in a preheated oven at 190 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with ice-cream and chocolate sauce.

Preheat oven to 350F. Press crumbs into a 9-inch pie pan to form a crust. Combine sugar and butter in a saucepan over low heat until sugar is melted. Pour the mixture into the crust. Bake the crust until it's lightly browned, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Whisk together the cream cheese, milk, cinnamon, and gelatin until smooth in a large mixing bowl. Pour the mixture over the cooled crust. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until set. Arrange raspberries in a pretty design over the top of the pie. Garnish with whipped cream or topping of choice and serve with vanilla ice cream.
In a large skillet over medium heat, combine the mushrooms with the vinegar, mustard and butter. Cook for 2 minutes, then stir in the chives. Season with freshly ground pepper. Serve at once.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 10x13 inch baking pan and line with parchment paper.Mix the butter and brown sugar together in a large bowlbeat until creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the flour and baking soda. Fold in the butterscotch chips and nuts. Spread into the prepared pan.Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool and cut into bars.

Cook the ground beef over medium heat in a large skillet until no longer pink, about 10 minutes. Drain the fat. Add the salsa and the water, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the pasta and salt to taste. Cook, covered, over medium-low heat for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Top with the sour cream before serving.
Combine cream cheese, mayo and artichokes in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in garlic and paprika. Continue cooking until hot but not boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in parmesan. Serve warm.

Blend chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini and harissa in a food processor until smooth. Add garlic and parsley. Season to taste with salt and water. Transfer to a small bowl. Serve with warm pita bread. Makes about 1-1/2 cups.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel and cube potatoes. Place in a large bowl. In a medium saucepan melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth. Whisk in broth and soup. Cook until thick and bubbly. Pour over potatoes. Add cheese. Stir to coat. Transfer to a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake uncovered for 40-45 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Sprinkle with fresh parmesan cheese and ground black pepper, if desired.

In a small bowl combine cornstarch and sugar. In medium saucepan heat milk and half-and-half together over medium heat. In a large bowl whisk together half-and-half mixture, yolks, vanilla and nutmeg. Pour custard mixture back into the medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly with a whisk. Cook custard until thickened about 4-5 minutes. Stir in fresh fruit. Serve immediately or cool in an ice bath. Serve cold.

Peel and core the apples. Cut each apple into 8 wedges. Place apple wedges in a small bowl with the lemon juice. In a saucepan, over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the honey. Remove from the heat and add the orange flower water. Mix well. Pour the honey mixture over the apples and toss well. Serve in a bowl garnished with the pine nuts and raisins.

Steep tea bags in 4 cups of water 20 minutes. Heat butter in a saucepan. Saute celery and onion until tender. Add cauliflower. Add stock. Cover. Cook until cauliflower is tender. Purée soup in batches. Add tea and seasoning. Return to saucepan. Reheat. Ladle into serving bowls. Garnish with chopped parsley. Makes 6 servings.
Cut bread rounds in half, place in shallow bowl. Crumble brie over rounds. Pour warm juice from berries over brie and bread. Sprinkle with nuts and serve.

Crumble sausage into large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and crumble until browned. Drain fat. Add spinach and cook until just wilted. Drain fat. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add onion and cook until tender. Add ziti and saute until lightly browned. Add parsley and season to taste with oregano, black pepper and garlic powder. Transfer to 2-quart casserole dish. Cover tightly and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered until cheese is bubbly. Serves four.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, beat butter and sugar until well-blended. Beat in flour and vanilla. Divide dough into four equal pieces. Roll each piece into an 8 x 12-inch rectangle. Sprinkle each rectangle evenly with potato chips. Roll each rectangle up, jelly-roll style. Wrap each roll tightly in plastic wrap and freeze overnight. Cut each roll crosswise into 1/4-inch slices. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden. Cool 5 minutes. Drizzle with powdered sugar icing. Yield 5 dozen.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir onion and garlic until onion is tender and translucent. Stir in applesauce and sugar and cook for 1 minute. Stir in red wine vinegar and bring to a boil. Stir in cabbage and cook until soft. Remove from heat and stir in apple juice. Serve warm.

Peel carrots and parsnips and cut into small pieces. Place in a pot with water and cook until tender. Add the butter, sugar and salt and pepper to taste and mash until smooth with a potato masher. Add chopped parsley for garnish. Serve warm as a side dish with any dinner or roast.
Drain frito scoops and put into a casserole dish. Spread evenly with chili. Sprinkle with cheese, onion, jalapeno if desired, and bake until cheese is melted. Serve with lots of cracked black pepper.

In a 4-quart pot over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the butter and the onions and cook until they start to brown. Add the bay leaves and the salt and stir. Add the cannellini beans. Stir and pour in the stock. Simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the pancetta. Cook until the soup is hot and the pancetta is crisp. Ladle the soup into bowls. Sprinkle with the freshly ground black pepper and the chopped parsley. Serves 6.

Combine frozen spinach, onion soup mix and butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook until liquid evaporates. Stir in stuffing mix until well combined. Stir in eggs and combine well. Pour into an un-greased 9-inch pie pan. Bake for 35 minutes at 350f. Let cool slightly and serve with your favorite sauce.
Put eggs in a bowl. Add rum, brandy, bacardi light rum. Add sugar. Mix well. Add peach brandy. Add apple brandy. Add milk. Add whipping cream. Add nutmeg. Mix well. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

In a medium bowl mix together the meatballs and soup. Add in milk and nutmeg. Mix well. Spread in a 2 quart baking dish. Bake 30-40 minutes at 350 degrees. Combine sour cream and soup. Mix well. Spread on top of meatballs. Bake another 5 minutes. Serve with bread.
In a small saucepan combine water and sugar. Stirring over medium heat. When it boils, add cornstarch. Stir until thickened. Add butter and vanilla. Salt to taste. Cool. Use with bread pudding.
Pour tea over the ice cubes. Add orange and grapefruit juices. Slice and squeeze orange and grapefruit rinds on the top.
In a large bowl combine tomato with dressing and mix gently. Add basil and mix again. Place on a serving plate. Top with crumbled blue cheese and fresh ground black pepper and sea salt.

In 13 x 9 pan, melt syrup and sugar together over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Pour mixture over rice krispies. Sprinkle chips over mixture. In small saucepan, melt butterscotch chips. Pour over bars. Spread chips over top. Refrigerate until set. Cut into bars.

Rinse rice. Combine with 2 cups water and bay leaf in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and simmer over low heat until rice is tender (about 18 minutes). Remove bay leaf and set aside. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until golden brown. Remove from heat and add lime juice and zest. Add rice and combine well. Salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve immediately.

In a shallow bowl combine the flour and seasoned bread crumbs. Season with salt and pepper. In a medium bowl whisk together egg, water and oil. In a 13 by 9 inch pan coat bottom with oil. Add floured bread crumbs in a single layer on bottom of pan. Arrange frying chicken over bread crumbs and sprinkle with seasoning. Pour egg mixture over chicken. Bake for 1 hour, until internal temperature reaches 160 degrees Fahrenheit and juices run clear when frying is pierced with a skewer.

Heat oil in wok or large fry pan. Add garlic and ginger and saute until fragrant. Add baby bok choy and cook until tender. Stir in sweet chili sauce. Serve over hot cooked rice. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the wine and simmer until the liquid reduces by half. Add the heavy whipping cream and simmer until the liquid thickens slightly. Stir in the sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil. Add the chicken breasts and cook over medium-high heat until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the breasts and place them in the sauce. Stir in the red bell pepper. Divide the sauce and the chicken over two plates. Garnish with the basil and serve.

Cream together sugar and margarine. Add milk and salt. Mix well. Add cocoa and vanilla. Mix well. Add oatmeal and peanut butter. Mix well. Drop by tablespoon onto waxed paper. Refrigerate. Roll into balls.

Dice bread into small pieces. Add milk to bread in blender. Blend on high speed for 20 seconds. Add eggs one at a time. Add dry mustard and blend. Add cooked sausage. Stir in 1 1/4 cups of shredded cheese. Pour into greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes. Serve with remaining shredded cheese.

In a small bowl, combine the broth and cornstarch. In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until opaque. Add the broccoli and the soy sauce and continue to cook until crisp-tender. Add the vinegar and stir-fry for about 1 minute. Add the chicken broth mixture and the ginger. Bring to a boil and cook until thickened. Remove from the heat and stir in the pepper flakes. Serves 4.

Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large skillet, saute the onion in the butter until tender. Add the flour. Cook until the mixture is smooth and bubbly. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Remove from the heat. Stir in the hot sauce, salt and pepper. In a large pot of boiling water, cook the crabmeat and shrimp until done. Drain and return to the pot. Add the milk mixture to the pot. Cook over low heat until the mixture is thickened and bubbly. Serve topped with parsley.

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with foil, coat with cooking spray, and set aside. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup cornstarch with 1/4 cup cold water. In a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat, heat 2 teaspoons vegetable oil until hot. Add shrimp to pancook until pink and opaque, about 2 minutes per side. Remove shrimp from panset aside. Add 1 tablespoon each soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, and sesame oil to skilletcook until mixture thickens into sauce, stirring constantly. Return shrimp to pan with stir fry vegetables and gingerrootcook 1 minute longer or until heated through. Remove mixture from panset aside. In a small bowl, combine remaining 1/4 cup cornstarch with 1/4 cup cold water to make a slurry. Heat 1 tablespoon each soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, and sesame oil in skillet over

In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute garlic and potato in butter until lightly browned, about 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add water and bouillon granule, cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes or until potato is tender. Remove from heat and stir in milk, parsley, cheese and salt and pepper to taste. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Drain the artichoke hearts in a colander, reserving the liquid. In a food processor, combine the artichokes, cheese, garlic and parsley until smooth. Stir in the liquid and mayonnaise. Add more mayonnaise if necessary. Serve with rounds of Italian bread for dipping.
Place all ingredients in a shaker and shake for 30 seconds or so. Serve in a martini glass with a cocktail umbrella.

In a large pot, combine currants, water and raspberries. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until fruit is soft. Pour fruit into a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth. Line a sieve with a double layer of cheeseclothpour pureed fruit into sieveallow to drain until mixture is thick enough to cover the back of a wooden spoon. Add sugar and lemon juicestir until thoroughly combined. Pour jam into jars or containerslet stand until jam is cool enough to cover the back of a wooden spoon (about 2 hours). Store jam at room temperature for up to 3 months. Makes about 5 cups.

Cook rice according to package instructions. Mix cooked rice with the shrimp. Mix mayonnaise, yogurt, mustard, lemon juice, salt in a bowl. Add the rice mixture to the bowl. Add the strawberries. Toss together. Refrigerate until serving time. Divide between four salad plates. Top each plate with romaine lettuce.

Cut biscuits in half and place in greased baking pan or on a cookie sheet. Beat butter and brown sugar together until smooth. Spread over biscuit halves. Sprinkle with pecans and banana slices. Bake at 400 degrees for about 12 minutes until biscuits are golden brown and bananas are soft.

Cut 4 chicken thighs into 2 inch cubes. Mix together 1/4 cup each guava nectar, soy sauce, oyster sauce, chinese five spice powder, sugar, and catsup. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt. Add chicken. Toss to coat. Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a wok over medium high heat. Add the chicken. Stirring frequently, cook 3 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Stir in 1/4 cup water. Stir fry 2 minutes more or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from wok, arrange in an oval shape. Pour 2 tablespoons of the remaining guava nectar mixture over chicken. Broil 2 minutes or until chicken is browned. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Prepare a spring form pan by lining the sides and bottom with a round of parchment paper that overlaps the sides of the pan by about 1/2 inch. Line bottom of pan with the overlapping parchment paper. If you prefer not to use parchment paper, you can bake this cheesecake in a water bath by lining the sides of the pan with heavy duty aluminum foil so that it also overlaps the sides by about 1/2 inch. In a food processor bowl, combine cream cheese, granulated sugar, flour and lemon zest. Pulse until well combined. Add orange zest and process until well combined. Add egg yolks one at a time, pulsing after each addition to incorporate them into the cream cheese mixture until all of the yolks are used up. Add the heavy cream and the vanilla extract and pulse until all of the ingredients are well combined. Pour the filling into the prepared pan. Smooth the top of the filling out evenly to eliminate any air bubbles. Bake the chees

In a skillet cook sausage and onions until sausage is browned and onions are translucent. Add hash browns and cook until potatoes are thawed and mixture is heated through. Add soup mixes and stir until smooth. Heat to a simmer, stirring occasionally until hot and bubbly. Serve with crackers or biscuits and a green salad for a complete meal.

Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch dice and place in a microwaveable dish with 1 tablespoon butter and 1/4 cup water. Cover and cook on high for 8 to 10 minutes. When cooked, add the sour cream and chicken stock and stir well. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup breadcrumbs with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Remove potatoes from microwave and stir in 1/2 cup cheddar cheese and 1/4 cup green onion. Spoon potato mixture into a greased 1-quart baking dish and sprinkle with remaining cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until breadcrumbs are golden brown.

Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook 3 minutes or until soft. Add tomatoes and water and bring to boil. Add kale and cook 1 minute or until wilted. Sprinkle with salt to taste and serve with rice or bread.
Mix together all ingredients. Place chops in baking pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

Soak rice for 15 minutes. Cook the rice in a pot with 2 cups water, turmeric powder, sugar and salt. When rice is 90% cooked, add water, saffron (optional) and ghee. Let cook for another 5 minutes. When rice is 100% cooked, turn off the stove. Add canned pineapple, lemon juice and pistachios (optional). Serve hot.

Grease an 8 x 8-inch pan. In a large bowl, mix the brown sugar and butter together. Stir in the eggs and maple flavoring. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to the maple mixture and mix well. Fold in the walnuts. Pour the batter into the pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Let cool before cutting. Serves 8-10.

Melt margarine in saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat and add chocolate. Stir until melted. Stir in sugar substitute and vanilla. Mix in cream cheese. Stir in nuts. Pour into buttered 9x9x2-inch pan. Chill. Cut into 1 inch squares. Store in refrigerator. Serves 6.

Toast walnuts in a dry skillet over medium-low heat, stirring until they are lightly toasted, 3 to 5 minutes. Let cool. Combine walnuts with greens. Toss gently. Add apples and cranberries. In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar, mustard, honey, and vegetable oil. Season vinaigrette with salt and pepper. Toss salad with vinaigrette.
Slice bacon. Cook tomatoes and onion. Assemble on tortillas.

Place the chicken and onion into a large saucepan of boiling water and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the spinach and cook for a further 5 minutes. Drain the mixture and add the tomatoes. Blend the taro root with the cornflour until smooth. Add the coconut cream to the mixture and stir until well combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir the mixture into the chicken mixture. Preheat the oven to 200c/400f. Lightly grease an ovenproof dish. Spoon the chicken mixture into the dish. Arrange the lemon slice on top of the chicken mixture and bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve the chicken mixture with rice and lemon slices on the side.
Combine the first six ingredients in a bowl. Spread on crackers. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 400f. Blend cornmeal, sugar, salt and baking powder together. Mix in the egg and buttermilk. Stir in the oil. Drop batter by spoonfuls on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve warm.

Boil a large pot of water for spaghetti. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally until spaghetti is al dente. Drain water from pasta and add to skillet. Stir in olive oil and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in italian parsley. Season with black pepper to taste. Drain pasta in a colander. Toss with a little olive oil and sprinkle with parmesan.

Combine cherries and sugar in a saucepan and cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until cherries release their juices and the sugar has dissolved. Stir in tapioca and almond extract and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes longer. Place the filling in the prepared pie crust and dot the top with butter. Roll out remaining pie crust and place over filling. Cut vents in the top of the crust to allow steam to escape while baking and press edges together to seal. Bake at 425 for 10 minutes then reduce heat to 350 for 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool on wire rack before slicing.

Grind salmon, whitefish, carrots, onion and eggs in food processor. Season with salt and pepper. Add matzo meal. Beat well. Heat 1/2 inch oil in medium skillet. Fill a large Ziploc freezer bag with 1/4 cup batter. Cut small hole from corner of bag. Squeeze batter into oil. Fry until lightly browned. Drain on paper towels.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter and flour an 8x8x2 pan. Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla. Sift together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt. Stir into creamed mixture. Spread batter evenly in prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool in pan. Frost with Chocolate Frosting.

In a blender combine olive oil and garlic cloves. Process to blend smoothly. Stir in onion and process to a smooth puree. Stir in orange juice and remaining ingredients. Chill, covered, for 2 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil. In a bowl combine the zucchini with the oil and seasoning. Spray the zucchini with cooking spray and place on the foil lined cookie sheet. Bake for 45 minutes. When the zucchini is done remove from oven and drizzle with the chili sauce.

In large saucepan, combine tomatoes, water, balsamic vinegar, distilled white vinegar, granulated sugar and salt. Heat to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 20 minutes. Add ground black pepper. Pour into molds. Refrigerate until firm. Unmold onto individual serving plates. Garnish with lemon gelatin.

Boil asparagus spears for 3 minutes. Drain and allow to cool. Spread cream cheese onto each spear. Sprinkle with horseradish, mustard and worcestershire. Wrap each spear with a slice of ham. Place on a platter and serve immediately.

Beat yogurt and sugar together until smooth. Add eggs and beat well. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Add to yogurt mixture alternately with lemon juice and lemon rind. Fold in cherries and pour into greased and floured 9-inch square pan. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool and sprinkle with confectioners sugar before serving.

Preheat the oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Remove the cases from their packaging and lay them out on a baking tray lined with baking paper. Place one case on top of each one and press down gently. Bake for 10-15 minutes until the cases are crisp and golden brown. Meanwhile, make the filling by mashing together the cream cheese and oysters with a fork. Add the parsley and black pepper and mix well. Season with salt if desired. Spoon the oyster filling into the vol au vents and sprinkle with a little grated cheddar. Place back under the grill for a few minutes until the cheese starts to melt and bubble. Serve immediately with lemon wedges and a green salad, if desired.

In a large mixing bowl combine the yeast and warm water. Mix and let sit for about 5 minutes until the yeast is foamy. Add the all-purpose flour and mix until a dough is formed. Turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes. The dough should be soft but not sticky. Add more flour if necessary. Form the dough into a ball and place it in a lightly greased bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the dough rise in a warm place for about an hour or until doubled in size. Punch the dough down and turn it onto a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough into eight equal pieces. Roll each piece into an 8-inch rope. Dissolve the baking soda in the hot water. Brush each rope with the melted butter. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Arrange the pretzels on a greased cookie sheet. Brush the pretzels with the melted butter and sprinkle with coarse salt. Bake at 375 for 8-10

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease and lightly flour 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan. In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press evenly onto the bottom of the prepared pan. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and sprinkle with chocolate chips, raisins and nutsthen sprinkle with coconut and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Remove from oven and cool completely on a wire rack. Cut into bars. Store at room temperature, or freeze up to 2 months. Makes 32 servings.

Heat oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Brown the beef in the oil until no longer pinkdrain. Add the garlic powder and seasoning saltstir until the beef is well coated. Add the carrots and onioncook and stir until crisp-tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in the cabbage and pepperscook 5 minutes. Add the soy sauce and cook 1 minute or until heated through. Stir in the ramen noodlescook 1 minute or until heated through. Serve over rice.

Mash the mango pulp and squeeze the lemon juice into a blender. Add the sugar and water and blend for a few seconds. Put a fine sieve over a bowl and pour the mixture into the sieve. Leave to stand for at least 1 hour. Meanwhile, bring a small pan of water to the boil. In a bowl beat the egg white until stiff. Stir the chili pepper into the mango pulp. Add the sugar and the lemon juice to the egg white and beat together to make a smooth and glossy mixture. Add this to the mango pulp and stir well. Pour into the ice cream machine. Start the machine and leave it to churn. When the machine starts to freeze the mixture scrape some of the mango pulp from the sieve into the machine. When the sorbet is ready to serve, remove it from the ice cream machine and put it into a container. Store it in the freezer until needed.

Mix together the yeast and warm water in the bowl of the stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. Let stand for 5 minutes. In another bowl combine the flour and salt. Add the water-yeast mixture and mix on low until blended. Add the egg white and cornmeal. Mix on low until well blended. Cover and let rise until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Divide dough in half and roll each half into a rope. Form each rope into a braid. Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Cover and let rise until doubled in bulk, about 45 minutes. Preheat oven to 375f. Beat the egg yolk and water in a bowl. Brush the loaf with the egg wash. Bake until golden brown and the loaf sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom, about 20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Peel tamarillos. Chop in half and scoop out seeds. Bring water, beef stock and brown sugar to the boil in a saucepan. Add tamarillos. Cover and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in five-spice powder. Serve with roast pork.

Mix flour, oatmeal, brown sugar, butter, caramel & vanilla together until crumbly. Press into a 13x9-inch pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Mix remaining ingredientspour over crust. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes more or until topping is golden brown. Cool completelycut into bars.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Combine the brown sugar and cinnamon in a large bowl. Peel and cut the apples into slices. Add the sliced apples into the brown sugar mixture, and toss to coat evenly. Grease a square baking dish with butter. Pour the apple mixture into the baking dish. Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in the flour, sugar, and salt until well mixed. Remove the mixture from the heat. Pour over the apples in the baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven, sprinkle with almonds, and serve warm.

Combine sugar, flour, cream cheese in a large bowl. Stir until smooth. Add milk gradually to reach desired consistency. Pour into pie crust. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 45 minutes. Cool slightly before serving. Garnish with fresh strawberries.

Saute onion, celery and garlic in olive oil for about 5 minutes. Add the chicken and carrots. Stir fry for 10 minutes. Add the parsley. Add the pasta, salt and pepper to taste. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Serve.

Combine beer, corn syrup, mustard, chili powder, and onion in a resealable plastic bag. Add the loin to the bag. Refrigerate for 6 to 24 hours. When ready to grill, remove meat from the marinade. Discard marinade. Grill loin 10 to 15 minutes per side or until a meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the loin registers 155 F.

Wash 1 box white rice in hot water. Drain and set aside. Saute 1 clove minced garlic in a large pot with 1 tbsp olive oil until softened. Add 4 cups boiling water to rice. Bring to a boil and immediately cover pot and reduce to medium heat. Cook for about 15 minutes (or until water is absorbed) stirring occasionally. When water is absorbed fluff rice with fork and add 1 can salsa to pot. Taste for seasonings. Serve with your favorite protein/side items. Serves 4

In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add celery, onions, and cook, stirring often until tender. Add water, orange and lemon juices. Heat to a boil. Stir in rice. Reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. Add hot sauce and cook 5 minutes longer. Stir in almonds. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet brown sausage until no longer pink in center. Add flour, salt, baking powder and stir. Gradually add milk and stir until thickened. Add eggs and stir until just mixed. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350F for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from baking sheet to wire racks. Serve with ketchup or mustard. Makes 4 dozen.
Roll out dough. Spread pizza sauce. Sprinkle mozzarella. Add assorted vegetables. Add parmesan cheese. Bake at 400 for 15 to 20 minutes or until crust is golden. Serve with salad.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken in a 9 x 13 pan. Add celery, carrot, onion, garlic cloves, and bay leaf. Pour water over top. Cover. Bake in oven for 1 hour. Add noodles and bake another hour. Take out chicken. Stir in cheese. Serve.

In a 1-quart bowl, combine 2 cups of mccormick grill mates zesty herb marinade with 3 tablespoons of white vinegar. Add 2 pounds of chicken wings. Cover & refrigerate for 2 to 24 hours. Remove chicken from marinade. Discard marinade. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the chicken wings. Cook for 10 minutes or until browned, stirring frequently. Add 1 tablespoon of ketchup. Cook for 5 minutes or until desired crispness, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Pour chicken mixture into a 2-quart bowl. Add 1 tablespoon each of mccormick red pepper crushed& mccormick red pepper flakes. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Combine cucumbers, onions and vinegar in large bowl, stirring occasionally. Cool 45 minutes in refrigerator. Combine remaining ingredients in small bowlpour over cucumber mixture. Stir well. Let stand 30 minutes at room temperature or refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Peel papayas and remove seeds. Cut flesh into small cubes. Combine with 1/4 cup water in a saucepan. Simmer for 5 minutes or until papaya is just tender. Cool slightly. Combine with remaining ingredients in a food processor or blender. Process until smooth. Refrigerate in an airtight container up to 1 week. Makes about 1 1/4 cups.

Cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and mix until smooth. Stir in the soda, water and vanilla until smooth. Combine the flour and sugaradd the flour mixture to the butter mixture and mix just until combined. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour. On a floured board, roll out the dough to 1/4" thickness. Cut into strips with a floured 2" pizza cutter. Bake at 425 for about 7 minutes until they just start to turn golden around the edges. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on the cookie sheet for about 2 minutes. Transfer the cookies to cooling racks and allow them to cool completely before storing in an air tight container.

Place arborio rice, coconut milk, and water in a microwave safe bowl. Cook for 15 minutes. Add butter and sugar and cook 5 minutes more. Stir in the banana. Cook for 5 minutes more. Stir in the shredded coconut. Serve hot or cold.

In a large pot boil the barley in the water for 30 minutes. In a large pan, combine apples with the lemon juice and cook for 2 minutes. Add the barley and the cream. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir well. Serve warm. Makes 6 servings.

Pour Bailey's over ice in a tall glass. Top with coconut milk. Add banana slices and shredded coconut. Add yellow food coloring if desired. Add a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Top with a splash of whipped cream if desired.

Place the cucumber, dill and yogurt in a bowl and stir to mix well. Chill for at least one hour or until ready to serve. Lightly brush the salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook the salmon fillets under a broiler until they are done to your liking. Serve the cucumber salad on top of the salmon and serve on sourdough bread.

Preheat oven to 400f. Butter a baking dish. Beat the breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese together in a large bowl. Add the parsley and season with salt and pepper. In a separate bowl, combine the butter and garlic. Place the chicken breast halves in the bowl with the garlic mixture. Toss to coat. Lay the chicken in the baking dish. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture over top. Bake for 35 minutes, or until the chicken is no longer pink and the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Serve immediately.

Slice oranges into 1/4-inch rounds and place in bowl. Squeeze juice over oranges and set aside. In small bowl, mix together remaining vinaigrette ingredients. Arrange spinach on plate or platter and sprinkle with oranges and prosciutto slices. Spoon over vinaigrette and toss to coat.

Wash and pat dry the chicken breasts. Combine feta cheese with basil, oregano and crushed garlic. Spread the mixture evenly on both sides of each chicken breast. Roll up each chicken breast and wrap in a Ritz cracker. Secure the rolls with toothpicks. Melt the butter in a small dish and brush each roll with the butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes in a 350 degree oven. Check after 15 minutes to make sure the Ritz crackers are not burning. Serve with a side of spaghetti squash or vegetable medley.

Pour citrus-infused vodka, prepared sweet-and-sour mix and cranberry juice into a large pitcher. Top with carbonated lemon-lime beverage just before serving. Garnish with lemon wedges. Makes 10 servings.

Heat canola oil in a large saute pan or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and garlic. Sauted until softened and beginning to brown. Add the dried chilies and saute for a minute or so. Add the curry powder and saute for another minute. Stir in the chopped tomato and saute until it becomes a thick paste. Add the water and the squash. Bring the mixture to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cover the pan. Simmer the mixture until the squash is fork tender. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with lime wedges.

Remove sausages from casing. Chop the peppers and the onions. Add sausages to hot, lightly oiled grill. Turn frequently until sausages are evenly brown. Put the sausages on sliced bread. Top with the vegetables and hot peppers. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 175 C or 350 F. Grease and line an 8 x 4 inch loaf tin with baking paper. Beat the butter and sugar together until creamy and light. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the flour and mix well. Add the orange zest and juice and mix well. Turn out the mixture into the loaf tin and level the top. Bake for 55 - 60 minutes or until the cake springs back when pressed gently in the middle and the skewer comes out clean. Remove from the oven and leave for 10 minutes before turning out of the tin and allowing to cool on a rack. To make the icing, heat the milk and the chocolate together in the microwave for 30 seconds at a time on high or melt it slowly in a bowl over a pan of simmering water (make sure the base of the bowl does not touch the water). Remove from the heat and leave for 30 seconds then beat in the butter and the icing sugar. The icing will be thick and you can add more milk if
Mix all ingredients except pecans. Form in a ball. Roll in pecans. Refrigerate. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350F. Brush both sides of bread with olive oil. Spread the dressing on the bread and top each bread with a slice of cheese and the chicken breast. Cook in the oven about 4-6 minutes each side or until chicken is cooked through and cheese is melted. Serve warm on the bread.

Heat oil in a large frying pan. Add onion and garlic and cook over medium heat until onion is soft. Add the peppers and cook for 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes, basil and parsley and cook for 10 minutes. Cut the chicken into pieces and add to the pan. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cover and cook over low heat for about 10 minutes. Serve with pasta and a green salad. Serves 4-6.

Place the steaks on a plate and rub with a combination of salt, pepper, and garlic. Let the meat sit at room temperature for 1 hour. Place the skillet over medium-high heat. When the pan is hot, add the butter. When the foam subsides, add the steaks. Cook, turning once, until they are browned on both sides, about 2 minutes on each side for medium rare. Transfer to a platter. Sprinkle with a few pinches of coarse sea salt. Garnish with the parsley. Serve with garlic bread.

Preheat oven to 350f. Wash potatoes and cut into 1/4 inch french fries. Mix sumac and chili powder together with salt to taste. Dip potatoes in beaten egg whites then roll in sumac and chili mixture. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Turn once. Serve with ketchup, garlic butter or mayo.

Combine dry ranch dressing mix and mayonnaiseadd 1/4 cup milk. Stir until well blended. Add remaining milkstir until smooth. Add remaining ingredientsstir until well mixed. Store in airtight container in refrigerator. Yields 12 servings.

Puree strawberries with sugar, cornstarch and water over medium heat until thick and smooth. Add food coloring to taste. Remove from heat and stir in butter until melted. Pour into pie crusts and top with banana slices. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to firm up pie filling. Top each pie with frozen whipped topping and garnish with strawberry halves.

Mix the butter, brown sugar and all-purpose flour together and press into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 8 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove from oven and sprinkle caramels over the top and spread evenly. Bake for another 1-2 minutes until caramels are melted. Remove from oven and spread the chocolate chips over the top. Let sit until hardened. Cut into squares and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375. Prepare jiffy mix according to box directions. Let stand 2 minutes. Stir in blueberries and pecans. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake for 18-22 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Cool 10 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

Crush graham crackers and mix with melted butter. Press mixture into pie pan and bake until crust is set. Cool completely before filling. Beat cream cheese and sugar until creamy. Beat in vanilla and sour cream. Fold in whipped topping. Pour into crust and top with white chocolate chips. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.

Cook celery and onion in butter in heavy large pot until celery is tender, about 5 minutes. Add rice and cook until lightly browned. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until rice is tender, about 45 minutes. Stir in dates. Transfer rice to a large serving platter. Sprinkle with walnuts.

Mix first 5 ingredients in mixer. Blend well. Add dry ingredients. Mix until smooth. Pour into greased and floured 9 inch square pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Cool. Frost with your choice of frosting. Makes 12 servings.

In saucepan combine sugar and light karo syrup over medium heat. Stir constantly until mixture comes to a boil. Continue boiling until mixture reaches 238 degrees on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat and add peanut butter stirring until well blended. Pour into 9 x 13 inch baking dish and allow to set at room temperature for 2 hours until firm. Cut into squares.

In a large pot or dutch oven over medium-high heat, saute pumpkin in butter and olive oil until it begins to soften. Add the wine and stir to deglaze the pan. Add stock and garlic. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until pumpkin is tender. Working in batches, puree soup in a blender or food processor. Return puree to pot. Add cream and mustard. Season with salt and pepper. Add worcestershire sauce and reheat. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Place all ingredients in bread machine in the order specified by manufacturer. Select dough setting. When cycle is complete, remove dough to lightly floured surface. Knead dough 4 or 5 times. Roll out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut with floured 2 1/2 inch biscuit cutter. Place on greased cookie sheet. Let rise until doubled in size. Bake in 400 degree oven for 10 minutes. Makes 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Prick potatoes with fork and place on baking sheet or roasting pan. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until fork tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle with ground cumin and return to oven for 5 minutes to warm and crisp spices.

Cook asparagus until tender. Drain. Heat the sesame oil in a frying pan or wok. Add the garlic and cook until softened. Add the mushrooms and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the asparagus and wine. Cook until heated through. Add the soy sauce and cashews and toss to blend. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Brown meat in batches. Remove meat. Add onion, carrots and celery. Cook 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add sugar, salt, dry tapioca and V8. Cook 3 minutes. Add meat, potatoes, ketchup and enough beef stock to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 3 hours. Add more stock or water if stew becomes too thick. Serve.
Prepare jell-o according to package directions. Add fruit. Chill until firm. Meanwhile crush oreo cookies. Whip cream. Fold in crushed cookies. Add 1 cup to jell-o. Chill.

Preheat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5. Butter the madeleine tray with melted butter. In a bowl whisk together the eggs, caster sugar, flour, cocoa powder and a pinch of sea salt. Stir in the melted butter until smooth. Spoon the mixture into the madeleine tray. Bake for 10 minutes until well risen. Cool in the tin. Serve immediately.

Preheat the broiler to high. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup salsa, 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro, 1 minced garlic clove and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Place 1 cup shredded lettuce in each of 4 individual salad bowls. Top with 1/4 of the turkey, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1/4 cup salsa mixture and 2 tablespoons shredded cheese. Broil for 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Rinse fish fillets and pat dry with paper towel. In a shallow bowl, combine the flour, paprika, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. In another bowl, combine butter and worcestershire sauce. Dip fillets in butter mixture, then in flour mixture and place in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil or waxed paper. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove from oven and serve immediately with lemon wedges and sprinkling of parsley on top of each fillet.

Combine the cream cheese and butter in a large bowlmix well. Add the green onions, salt, pepper and winemix well. Place about 1/3 of the seafood mixture in the bottom of a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Top with the remaining seafood mixture. Combine the cheesessprinkle over the top. Bake at 375 for 20-30 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm with crackers or raw vegetables. Makes about 60 servings.

In a shallow bowl combine crumbs& cashews. Beat egg lightly in another shallow bowl. Dip chicken into egg& then into crumb mixture, pressing crumbs into chicken. Coat well. Heat oil & butter in skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add chicken to skillet. Cook until golden on both sides. Remove chicken from skillet. Combine cognac& flour. Brush chicken with mixture. Return to skillet. Cook 3-5 minutes longer.

Heat oven to 375f. Spray 13x9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In small bowl stir together picante sauce, mustard and brown sugar until well blended. Cut each chicken breast into 1/2 inch strips. Place in baking dish. Spoon picante mixture over chicken. Bake uncovered 30 minutes. Increase oven temp to 425f. Sprinkle with mozzarella. Continue baking 5 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Serve with cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. In a small bowl combine bread cubes and evaporated milk. Tear sausage into small pieces and add to bread cubes. Add egg beaten with water and dry mustard. In a separate bowl, combine eggs and milk. Add cheddar cheese and salt. Pour over sausage mixture. Bake for about 45 minutes or until center is set. Serve with fresh fruit or salsa.

Mix milk and sugar in a saucepan over low heat until it is simmering. Take off heat and add pudding mix and stir until pudding is smooth and thickened. Let cool completely and then freeze in your ice cream maker according to manufacturer s instructions. When done pour into a storage container and freeze for an hour and then place in freezer until ready to serve. Serve topped with cool whip and a drizzle of vanilla extract.

Melt chocolate according to package directions. Add peppermint extract and stir well. Add crackers and stir until well combined. Place mixture onto wax paper and allow to cool. Once mixture has hardened and cooled, break into pieces. Melt chocolate again and dip each piece into chocolate and place on wax paper to set. Melt remaining chocolate and drizzle over each piece. Allow to set. Once set, place on plate and sprinkle with red and green sugars. Place a piece of a candy cane on each mint and sprinkle with red and green sugars. Store in air-tight container.

Prepare pie crust according to directions on package. Combine strawberries and sugar in large bowl. Cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes. Add cornstarch and water. Cook until thick. Remove from heat. Cool and add jello. Pour into pie shell and refrigerate.

Combine sugar and corn syrup in saucepan and bring to boil over medium heat. Continue to boil until mixture reaches hard crack stage. Remove from heat and add peanut butter and vanilla. Pour into buttered pan and sprinkle with corn flakes. Let cool and break into pieces.
Put sugar into a large pot. Add water. Add lemon juice. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in anise seed. Add pear halves. Cover pot & let stand overnight. Serve cold or warm. Makes 6 servings.

Prepare tamales according to package directions. Remove from water and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the oil. Add onions and cook 3 minutes or until softened and translucent. Add the chili with beans or chili without beans, depending on the taste you like, and continue to cook 1 minute or until warmed through. Add the tamales to the skillet and stir to coat with the chili sauce. Sprinkle with the cheese and garnish with cilantro.
Slice the Kirby cucumbers. In a large bowl combine the tomato sauce, lime juice, low-sodium soy sauce, sugar, ginger and hot pepper sauce. Add the Kirby cucumbers and green onions. Toss and serve.

Heat oil in large skillet or wok over medium-high heat until hot. Add leek and cook until tender-crisp, about 2 minutes. Add sugar snap peas and cook until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Add lemon and cook 2 more minutes or until peas are completely tender-crisp. Add salt and freshly ground pepper to taste and toss well to combine. Stir in fresh dill and serve immediately.

Combine skim milk and powdered milk in medium-size saucepan. Stir well to combine. Heat over medium heat just to boiling. Remove from heat and stir in yogurt. Ladle into glass or plastic containers. Cover tightly. Place in warm oven and set timer for 7 hours. Check after 7 hours by taking out of oven and pressing container. If it doesn't move, it is done. Let cool. Store refrigerated.

Melt the butter in a large sauce pan and saut the zucchini and onions until they are tender. Add the tomatoes, brown sugar and curry powder and cook until the sauce has thickened. Stir in the parmesan cheese. Serve with chicken or fish.

In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, bring whole milk, cinnamon stick and arborio rice to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20-25 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in Nutella. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. In a medium bowl, beat together egg yolks and sugar. Stir into rice mixture. Divide among 4 dessert dishes. Cover each serving with plastic wrap directly on surface of rice mixture. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight. To serve, top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream. Garnish with hazelnuts.

Boil water in a deep frying pan. Add green peas and cook for 2-3 minutes. Drain water. Add vegetable oil. Add green onions. Cook for 1 minute. Add mushroom. Cook for 1 minute. Add low sodium soy sauce. Serve hot.

Combine sugar, cocoa and margarine in a large saucepan and stir over medium heat until smooth. Add vanilla and stir constantly until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Add peanut butter and stir until melted. Add oats and stir until well blended. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on wax paper or on a parchment paper lined baking sheet. Let stand until firm and cut into squares. Makes about 36 squares.

Cut boned leg of veal into slices about 1 inch thick. Place in a large pan. Season with salt, pepper and paprika. Heat butter in a separate pan. Brown onion in it. Sprinkle in cornflour. Add water slowly. Stir well. When sauce is thickened add sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over veal and simmer for 5 minutes.

Combine vinegar, mustard, sugar and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl. Whisk in oil. Add remaining 1/2 teaspoon pepper and oregano. Shake vigorously. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

In a food processor, combine the garlic, ginger, sugar and crushed red pepper flakes. Pulse until finely chopped. Add the lime juice, soy sauce and sesame oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Place the tuna steaks in a large zip top plastic bag. Pour in the marinade and seal. Refrigerate for 40 minutes. Heat the grill to high. Remove the tuna from the bag and grill for 4 minutes per side for medium-rare. Serve with the ginger-lime sauce.

Snap off and discard the tough ends of the asparagus. Steam or boil until just tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Meanwhile, saute the shallot in butter until it is softened. Add the mushrooms and cook over high heat, stirring occasionally, until they are just tender. Drain asparagus and toss with shallot-mushroom mixturesprinkle with lemon juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
In 9x9 glass dish add crushed pineapple. Mix in sour cream. Add strawberry jello. Stir well. Add boiling water. Stir again. Refrigerate. Top with crushed pecans and strawberries. Serve cold.

Cook manicotti according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In large skillet, combine remaining ingredients and cook until heated through and thickened. Pour manicotti into a 2-quart casserole dish. Top with marinara and cheese. Freeze uncovered until solidly frozen, about 24 hours. To serve, thaw in refrigerator 1 day ahead. Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before baking. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cover dish with foil and bake 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake 15 minutes longer or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 400f. Line 2 baking sheets with waxed paper or aluminum foil. In a small bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of the cornmeal with the dill, salt, pepper, paprika, and 1/4 teaspoon of the skim milk powder. In a shallow dish combine remaining 1/2 cup of the cornmeal, remaining skim milk powder and remaining 1/4 teaspoon of the paprika. In a third shallow dish combine the remaining cornmeal and the breadcrumbs. In a fourth shallow dish combine the remaining 1/4 teaspoon paprika and the remaining 1 teaspoon skim milk powder. Dip each piece of fish in the dill mixture, then in the skim milk mixture and then in the paprika mixture. Place on the prepared baking sheets and repeat with remaining fish. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown and fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with tartar sauce.

Grate the carrots. Cut the zucchini and onions into small pieces. Combine with the carrots and add the egg whites. Mix well with your hands. Divide into 4 portions. Form into burgers and fry for 4-5 minutes on each side. Serve with lettuce, tomato or whatever you like.

In a small skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil and garlic until garlic is golden. Add pine nuts and cook until toasted. Remove from heat. Add fresh lemon juice and zest. Place pasta in a bowl and toss with olive oil and garlic. Add lemon juice mixture and toss. Add parsley and serve.
In a small saucepan over medium heat combine brown sugar, all-purpose flour and milk. Cook and stir until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in butter and maple extract. Cool. Spread on toast.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook pasta according to package directions until al denteabout 3 minutes (or use your favorite frozen spinach). Drain and rinse under cold water to stop cooking and coolset aside. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the dip by combining spinach, ricotta cheese, scallions and radishes in a food processor and pulse until smooth. Add the salt and pepper to taste and fold in the dill. Transfer to a serving bowl or a large platter. Top with the water chestnuts and parsley and sprinkle with cherry tomatoes and olives if desired. Serve with the pasta or use crackers as chips for dipping.
Beat cream and sugar until soft peaks form. Blend in lime juice and zest. Fold in vanilla and mint. Serve in parfait glass with lime slice and sprig of mint. Makes 4 servings.

In a blender or food processor, puree the milk, vanilla bean pod and seeds for 1 minute. Add the eggs and sugar and pulse for 30 seconds. Transfer the mixture to a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring constantly with a whisk, until the mixture thickens slightly. Transfer to a bowl. Strain through a fine sieve into a bowl. Stir in the cornstarch mixture and continue to cook over medium heat, stirring constantly with a whisk until the mixture thickens slightly. Transfer to a bowl, stir in the lime juice, lime zest, rum and coconut milk. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour. Prepare an ice bath. Place a fine-mesh sieve over a bowl. Ladle the mixture into the sieve and let sit for 10 minutes. Stir with a spoon to help separate the cream from the liquid. Spoon the cream into an ice-filled bowl. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until set.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Grease or spray a nonstick baking sheet. In a large bowl, whisk together cornmeal, baking powder, egg, onion, frozen corn, yogurt cheese and Splenda. Add water and whisk until smooth. Drop by teaspoons on prepared baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for a few minutes. Yield is approximately 12.
Trim asparagus and place in a large bowl. Add melted butter and Dijon mustard. Toss to coat asparagus. Place on a platter or individual serving plates. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Cube the tomatoes. Saute the onions in oil until they are soft, add the tomatoes and cook for a few minutes. Add the red pepper, the garlic cloves and the tomato paste. Add the chicken stock and cook for 15 minutes. Add the chicken breasts and cook for another 15 minutes. Stir in the peanut butter and the fresh coriander leaves. Season with salt and pepper

In a bowl combine apple pie filling, spice cake mix and egg. Stir well. Pour into a greased and floured tube pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes and remove from pan. Cool completely on a wire rack.

Combine sugar and flour in large mixing bowl. Cut rhubarb into small pieces or slice into thin strips. Toss with sugar mixture until evenly coated. In separate bowl, mix pineapple with juice. Place rhubarb mixture in unbaked pie shell. Top with pineapple mixture. Dot with butter. Cover with top crust. Seal with crimped edge or with strips of pastry rolled around rim of pie pan. Cut slits in top crust for steam vent. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool pie completely on wire rack before cutting.

Remove the giblets from the cavity of each hen. Pat the hens dry with paper towels. Melt 4 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet. Add the sage, garlic cloves, lemon zest, paprika, salt, and pepper. Heat over medium heat until the sage is lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Place the hens in the skillet. Pour the wine over the hens. Cover and cook over medium heat until the hens are cooked through, about 10 minutes. Turn the hens over. Cover again. Cook until the wine is evaporated and the hens are cooked through. Serve the hens with the lemon wedges.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Add vinegar and molasses. Stir well. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. combine flour, almonds and walnuts. Beat together egg and honey until smooth. Add to flour mixture, stirring until smooth. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8 to 10 minutes. Cool 1 minute. Remove cookies from cookie sheets with metal spatulas. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Cool completely. Makes 3 dozen cookies.

Combine yeast and warm water and stir until yeast dissolves. Stir sugar and salt to the yeast mixture and set aside to let bloom for about 20 minutes. In a bowl mix flour and cornmeal and stir well to combine. Add yeast mixture and olive oil to flour mixture and mix well to form dough. Knead until dough is smooth and elastic. Add butter to dough and knead until well incorporated. Place dough in greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Allow to rise for 2 hours. Punch down dough and divide in 2. Shape each piece into a loaf and place in greased loaf pans. Allow to rise for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake for 30 minutes or until done. Makes 2 loaves.

Cook bacon over med heat until crispy. Remove bacon and reserve. Add brussels sprouts and cook for 1 minute then add mashed potatoes and stuffing mix and cook until all moisture is gone. Season with salt and pepper and add the bacon back in and mix in the potato mixture until well combined. Form into 1 1/2 inch patties and dip in egg and then dredge in seasoned bread crumbs. Fry in oil until golden brown and serve with sour cream and salsa if desired.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the pasta shells and cook according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, broccoli florets, anchovies (with their oil), and red chili pepper flakescook until the broccoli is crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Drain the pasta shells. Toss the pasta with the broccoli mixture in a bowlstir in the lemon juice. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.

Spray an 8 inch square baking dish with nonstick spray. Line with bread. Top with ham, onion, bell pepper, eggs and cheese. In a small bowl combine milk and egg whitepour over the bread. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until the bread is toasted and the eggs are cooked through. Serve with ketchup.

In a large saucepan heat the olive oil over medium high heat. Add the garlic, rosemary, crushed red pepper flakes and the chickpeas. Cook for a few minutes until the rosemary is fragrant. Add the chicken stock and the lemon juice. Season with sea salt. Simmer for about 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Using a hand blender blend until the soup is smooth. Garnish with fresh rosemary and serve.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with butter. Combine the flour, baking soda and baking powder. In a large bowl, mix the butter and brown sugar until fluffy. Beat in the eggs and vanilla extract. Add the pudding mix and beat until smooth. Add the flour mixture and blend well. Stir in the chocolate chips. Spread into the prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated over, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack.

In a small bowl whisk together glaze ingredients. Put salmon in a small baking dish and pour glaze over fish and bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot or at room temperature. Garnish with fresh lime wedges and parsley.

Combine all the ingredients in crockpot and cook on low for about 7-8 hours. The meat will be very tender and the sauce will be delicious. Serve the meat and gravy over rice or mashed potatoes. Serves 6.

Peel and slice beets. Combine vinegar, water and spices in a saucepan and bring to boil. Add the beets and simmer until tender, 30 minutes or longer. Drain beets and return to saucepanadd sugar and cook until hot and thickened. Coolstore in refrigerator up to 6 weeks.

Heat a nonstick frying pan over medium heat. Add the scallops and cook for 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Remove scallops from pan and set aside. Add the bacon to the pan and cook until crisp. Remove from pan and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour the sauce over the scallops and bacon and serve.

In a medium bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Let cool. Stir in berries. Pour into a glass dish. Pour margarita mix over berries. Chill until set. Top with tequila, orange liqueur and lime wedge. Mash until combined. Serve in a margarita glass. Garnish with mint.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and rosemary and saute until fragrant about minutes. Add shrimp and saute until pink about minutes. Add lemon juice and hot sauce and toss well. Salt and pepper to taste and serve.

Cream the butter. Add the sugar gradually and beat until creamy. Add the egg yolks. Add the flour and mix with a spoon until the mixture is crumbly. Add a little cream to make the dough workable. Roll the dough out to 1 cm thick. Cut out rounds with a cookie cutter. Place the cookies onto a greased baking sheet. Bake at 200 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool.

Preheat grill. In small bowl combine chili powder, cumin, black pepper and salt. Drizzle chicken breast with cooking spray. Sprinkle chicken evenly with spice mixture. Grill 4-5 minutes per side. Cut chicken into 1/2 inch pieces. Warm tortillas in microwave or in oven. Top tortillas with chicken, cabbage, cheese and sour cream.

Spread 2 slices bread with butter and top with 2 slices tomato and a slice cheese. Sprinkle with basil leaves and pepper and salt to taste. Drizzle with olive oil and lightly toast in a skillet over medium heat. Spread 2 slices bread with mayonnaise and top with tomato and cheese slices and sprinkle with basil and pepper and salt to taste. Drizzle with olive oil and lightly toast in a skillet over medium heat.

Cook bacon until crisp and drain off all fat but leave the bacon. Cut bacon into small pieces. Dice onion, celery and green pepper. Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp and drain off all but 1/2 tablespoon of fat from the bacon grease. Add the onion, celery, green pepper and saute until tender. Add tomatoes with their liquid and stir well. Reduce heat to low and cook for 10 minutes. Drain the liquid from the green beans. Add the green beans to the skillet, stir to mix well and cook for 5-10 minutes until beans are tender but crisp. Season with salt, pepper and sugar to taste and stir well. Pour into 2-qt casserole dish and top with slices of american cheese. Bake for 30 minutes until bubbly on top. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat grill or broiler. Rub steaks with olive oil. Sprinkle both sides of steaks with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Lay slices of blue cheese & cream cheese alternately on each side of steak. Place steak under broiler & cook 5 minutes for rare. Turn & brush with tomato sauce & worcestershire sauce. Cook 2 minutes more for rare. Garnish with parsley & garlic.

Peel the sweet potatoes. Chop into cubes and put in a pan with cold water. Bring to the boil and simmer for 15 minutes or until soft. Drain. Place in a large bowl with the garlic and coriander and mash. Season with salt and pepper. Add the creme fraiche and mix well. Serve with your choice of chicken or meat.

Cut oysters in half. Combine all dry ingredients in a bowl. Add oysters and toss until lightly coated. Pour oil into skillet. Heat oil over medium high heat. Add oysters and fry until golden brown. Remove from oil and place in a bowl of hot sauce. Serve immediately.

In a bowl, combine cabbage, flour, dashi, sake and soy sauce until well blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add beaten eggs and mix well. Add chopped green onions and ham. Heat some oil in a small frying pan (10cm/4in diameter). Pour in the batter and cook on both sides until golden brown and crisp. Remove from the pan and let cool. Spread mayonnaise on the base and top with sliced green onions.
Combine all of your ingredients together in a large zip top bag. Add fish and coat well. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.

Peel and slice potatoes into thin rounds. Combine all ingredients except potatoes in a bowl and stir well to blend. Add the potatoes and toss gently to coat. Chill for at least one hour. Garnish with chives just before serving.

Cut the fillet into 4 equal pieces and set aside. Place the wine in a pan with the celery and bay leaf. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken and boil for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Place the chicken in a blender with the celery and leaves. Blend until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the chives. Season with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Spread on bread slices. Serve.

Melt butter in a 13 x 9 inch pan. Add brown sugar and Karo syrup and mix well. Beat eggs and milk together. Add to butter mixture and mix well. Add bread cubes and stir to coat. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve with fresh fruit.

In a saucepan combine 2 cups granulated sugar and 1/4 cup cold water. Bring to boil over medium heat, stirring frequently. Once boiling, let boil 5 minutes. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt. Add 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in walnuts. Spread evenly onto a parchment lined baking sheet. Chill 1 hour to allow nuts to cool. Break into pieces. Store in airtight container.
Fill a teapot or other large pot with water and bring to boil. Add all the ingredients and bring to boil again. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve hot and enjoy!

In a large sauce pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the Gruyere and stir until melted and bubbly. Add the ham and mushrooms and saute until the mushrooms are tender. Add the nutmeg. Remove from heat. In a large bowl combine the eggs and the heavy cream. Stir until well blended. Add the Gruyere mixture and stir until well combined. Spoon the mixture into six ramekins or small bowls. Bake for 12 minutes. Serve immediately.
In a medium bowl, combine the cherries and cranberries. Add the sugar and spices and toss well. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours before serving. Can also be used as a glaze for ham or turkey.

Wash and trim collards, removing any tough stems. Cook the bacon until crisp and drain on paper towelsset aside. Crumble bacon and reserve 1 tablespoonset aside. Cook the leeks in a small amount of water in a large Dutch oven over medium heat until tender, about 4-5 minutes. Add the collards and cook until wiltedabout 10-15 minutes. Add the reserved bacon and stir. Season with pepper and saltadd red pepper flakes and stir well. Cover and simmer over low heat for 15 minutesstirring occasionally. Uncover and stir in the reserved bacon and cook for 10 minutes more or until the greens are tender but still have some crunch. Add the vinegar and stir well.

Slice the onion in half lengthwise and cut into thin strips (about 1/8 inch wide). Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heatcook onion and garlic clove, stirring occasionally, until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the apple, curry powder, salt, pepper, cauliflower, broth, honey, vinegar, and bay leavesbring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat to low, cover partially, and simmer until the cauliflower is tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and remove the bay leaves before serving. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut the squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. Place each half cut side up in a shallow baking dish. Add 1 tablespoon butter to each half and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon each ground cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger. Bake for 45 minutes or until the flesh is soft when pierced with the tip of a knife. Remove the squash from the oven and cool for 5 minutes. Scoop out the flesh of the squash into a medium bowl. Add the remaining 4 tablespoons butter, the syrup, and the cinnamon. Using a hand mixer, beat until smooth. Add the pecans. Season with additional cinnamon. Serve hot.
Slice potatoes and place in a pot. Add butter and onion to pot. Cook over medium heat until potatoes are tender. Add green pepper. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese. Serve hot.

Mix cider vinegar, garlic, mustard, honey, brown sugar, black pepper and olive oil in a bowl until smooth. Place turkey breast cutlets into a large resealable bag. Pour marinade over and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Heat a charcoal or gas grill. When the coals are ready, brush the grill with olive oil and place turkey on the grill skin side down over the hot coals. Grill until the turkey is just cooked through and no longer pink inside, 10-15 minutes.

Grate raw potatoes (about 4 medium) into a clean cloth. Squeeze out all the liquid. Add the grated potatoes to the mashed potatoes. Combine the flour and salt in a bowl. Add the milk to the flour mixture and stir to form a soft dough. Add the egg to the dough. Mix well. Add the grated potato to the mixture. Knead the dough into a firm ball. Divide the dough in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll out each half of the dough to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut out circles with a 3-inch cookie cutter. (I used a drinking glass.) Heat a little vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium-low heat. Fry the boxty cakes for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towel. Serve with salt and pepper.

Mix dry ingredients first, then add crushed pineapple, evaporated milk, eggs, margarine and vanilla, mix well. Pour into greased pan and bake at 350 degrees for 35-45 minutes. After baking, mix coconut with sugar and spread on top of cake while hot. Cool before removing from pan. Makes 12-15 servings.

Combine all the marinade ingredients in a large bowl. Cut the flank steaks into 1 inch slices. Add the steaks to the bowl of marinade and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat your barbecue or grill to medium high heat. Grill the flank steaks about 3 minutes per side for rare (to medium for medium). Serve the flank steak hot or at room temperature. Slice the steak and serve in lettuce cups or on a sandwich. You could serve the meat with rice and vegetables.

Preheat oven to 425. Spray an 11x7 glass dish with cooking spray. Combine mustard and vinegar in a small bowl. Place chops in dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, combine cranberry sauce with mustard mixture in small saucepan. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until heated through. Pour over pork chops. Bake another 5-10 minutes until pork is cooked through. Serve over mashed potatoes or rice.

Pound the cube steaks with a meat tenderizer or mallet to make them thin. Cut the onion into small pieces. In a bowl mix together the flour and beef stew seasoning. In a large frying pan, heat the vegetable oil. Dip the cube steaks in the flour mixture. Place in the hot oil and fry on each side until cooked through. Add the onions to the pan. Add the water. Simmer until thickened. Salt to taste. Serve over hot rice.

Mix poppy seeds with soy sauce, sake and Worcestershire sauce in a small bowl and set aside. Soak bamboo skewers in water for 30 minutes. Thread salmon onto bamboo skewers, alternating with poppy seed mixture and ginger and garlic slices. Grill for about 6 minutes or until salmon is cooked through. Serve with rice or noodles and garnish with fresh green onions or green peppers.
Combine all ingredients into a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve.

Prepare pork sausage as directed on package. Slice and arrange on ungreased cookie sheet. Brush each sausage slice with 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Bake at 375f for 10-12 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Meanwhile, combine cornstarch and vinegar until smooth. Add pineapple chunks and remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Cook over medium-low heat until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in brown sugar. Cool slightly. Spread pineapple mixture over sausage slices. Refrigerate until serving time. Makes 12 nibblers.

Dissolve the gelatin in the boiling water. Let cool until just warm. Whisk in the cold water. Add the strawberries. Pour into a 9 x 13-inch dish. Refrigerate until firm. In a medium bowl, beat the whipped topping with the sugar until stiff peaks form. Spread over the gelatin layer. Chill until ready to serve. Cut into 3-inch squares. Makes 40 squares.

Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. In another bowl, whisk together sugar, eggs, and creamstir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in butterbatter will be thick. Spoon batter into waffle iron and bake according to manufacturer’s directions. Serve warm. Makes 10 to 12 waffles.

Cut chicken into pieces. Brown chicken pieces with oil or margarine. Add 1 can of condensed tomato soup and 1 can tomato paste. Add onion salt and garlic salt. Cook until boiling. Add oregano. Add mushroom pieces and mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle parmesan cheese on top. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour. Remove from oven and stir well. Bake again for 1 hour.
