Combine citric acid, tartaric acid and Epsom salts in a large container. Add 20 lemons and cut them into quarters. Add the juice and zest from the lemons and stir well. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Strain through a fine sieve and into a large container. Add the granulated sugar and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat and add the boiling water. Bring to a boil again and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and cool completely before storing.

In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl beat the eggs and mix with the milk, then add the lemon juice and zest and whisk well. Add the liquid mixture to the dry mixture and stir until smooth. Add the butter and beat with an electric mixer until the mixture is light and fluffy. Pour into a greased and parchment lined 8 inch square baking pan and bake for 30 minutes or until lightly brown and set. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

Cream together butter and condensed milk. Add vanilla. Combine flour, pecans (if using) and salt. Add flour mixture to condensed milk mixture. Chill dough for one hour. Roll into 1-inch balls. Roll into chopped pecans or sprinkles. Place 2 inches apart on cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes. Cool for 2 minutes. Transfer to cooling rack. Serve immediately.

Mix together cream and beef stock in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer. Cook until reduced to 1 cup. Stir in soy sauce and flour. Cook and stir until thickened and smooth. Season with salt and white pepper. Serve with Swedish meatballs.

Spread the bread slices with the softened butter. Place on a baking tray and bake for about 15 minutes until golden brown and crisp. Turn the slices over halfway through. Remove from the oven and divide the beans between the toast slices. Sprinkle over the cheese and return to the oven for a couple of minutes until the cheese is bubbly and melted. Serve hot.

Wash ribs and place in a large pot. Add water. Bring to a boil. Simmer 30 minutes. Remove ribs from pot and set aside. Place ribs in a large glass or ceramic dish. Stir together remaining ingredients. Pour over ribs and cover. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Preheat grill. Grill ribs 45 minutes to 1 hour or until tender. Brush with remaining sauce. Cook 5 minutes per side.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Beat together eggs and sugar until thick and pale. Stir in cornflour and milk. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and coats the back of the spoon. Stir in vanilla essence and nutmeg. Cool. Divide custard mixture among pastry shells. Bake for about 30 minutes. Serve immediately.
Mix cream cheese with vanilla, beat in sugar. Add eggs. Beat until smooth. Pour into crust. Bake at 325 for 1 hour. Let stand for a few minutes before cutting. Makes a 9 inch pie.

Bring soymilk to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add corn kernels and cook until heated through. Stir in onion powder and salt and pepper to taste. Add pasta and cook according to directions on package. Serve with a squeeze of lemon and top with tahini.

Peel potatoes. Smash them flat with a rolling pin until they are about 1/4-inch thick. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the smashed potatoes and cook until they have browned on the first side about 4 minutes. Flip the potatoes and cook until they are browned on the second side another 4 minutes or so. Add the butter and chipotle chile puree stirring well to distribute the butter and seasonings evenly over the potato slices. Season with salt if desired. Transfer the sweet potato slices to a platter and serve immediately while they are hot.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place frozen french fries into baking pan. Spray with cooking spray, drizzle with oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 30 minutes. While baking, melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Crush garlic cloves with back of a spoon. Add to butter. Cook, stirring frequently for about 3 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. When french fries are done baking remove from oven. Add garlic mixture to french fries. Toss to combine. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Preheat broiler. Grease a baking pan. Mix together mayo, lemon juice and basil. Lay tilapia on baking pan. Pour half the mayo mixture over each piece. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Broil about 5 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork.

Season pork with ginger and garlic. In a large skillet or wok cook the pork until well browned on one side. Deglaze with wine and mushrooms. Cook for a few minutes. Add ginger and soy sauce. Cook until liquid is nearly absorbed and pork is cooked through. Transfer pork to a plate and keep warm. In the same skillet, add the oil and cook the onions. When the onions are tender add the seeds. Toss and cook a minute longer. Serve on top of the pork.

In a large mixing bowl combine flour and butter using pastry blender or fork until crumbly. Add almonds, mix well. Press mixture into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 10 minutes. Cool completely. In a large mixing bowl combine cream cheese, sugar, almond liqueur, and vanilla extractbeat until smooth. Stir in Cool Whip until blended. Spread over cooled crust. Spoon cherry pie filling over cream cheese mixture. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate for 1 hour or until ready to serve.

In a small bowl combine the orange juice and vegetable oilset aside. In a medium bowl, combine the light soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic, ginger and pepper. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch and water. Heat a nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Season the fish with salt and pepper. Add the vegetable oil mixture to the pan and swirl to coat. Add the fish to the pancook 2 minutes per side. Add the soy sauce mixturecook 1 minute. Add the cornstarch mixturestir until the sauce thickens. Serve over the fish. Serves 2. Prep time includes cooking time.
Heat oil in skillet. Add onion and ginger. Cook for 2 minutes. Add cauliflower and broccoli. Cook until tender. Stir in salt. Add lemon juice and zest. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9x5 inch loaf pan with cooking spray. Melt butter and sugar in saucepan. Add eggs and vanilla. Stir in sour cream and bananas. In a large bowl, combine flour and baking soda. Gradually add the banana mixture to the flour mixture. Spoon batter into prepared pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes or until top is golden and wooden toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool. Makes 1 loaf.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. In a medium bowl, mix together cream cheese and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Unroll crescent rolls. Cut each roll into four pieces. Place three of the pieces in a single layer in the bottom of a greased 13 x 9 baking dish. Spread with half of the cream cheese mixture. Arrange another three pieces of crescent dough in a single layer over the cream cheese mixture. Spread the remaining cream cheese mixture over the top layer. Top with the remaining crescent dough pieces. In a small bowl mix together the sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle over the top of the cake. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. Serves 10.

To make the herb stuffing, combine the garlic cloves, fresh sage and fresh thyme. Divide the herb stuffing into thirds and place into the cavity of the trout. Season the trout on both sides with the salt and freshly ground black pepper. Wrap bacon around the trout and secure with string. Place the trout onto a wire rack on a baking tray and cook for 12-15 minutes or until the fish flakes when tested with a fork or skewer.

In a small bowl, combine broth, tahini, soy sauce, honey, garlic and ginger. Blend until smooth. Set aside. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook, turning once, until no longer pink. Remove chicken from pan. Add hot sauce and 1/2 cup water to pan. Heat until boiling. Reduce heat and simmer 2 minutes. Add tahini mixture and stir until hot. Add chicken and heat through. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Grease 8x8 dish. Cut sausage links in half and add to bread. Cube bread and add to sausage. In saucepan combine eggs, milk, mustard and salt. Beat until smooth. Pour over bread and sausage. Bake at 425 for 25 minutes or until set. Remove and sprinkle with cheese. Return to oven and bake an additional 5 minutes. Cool slightly before serving.

Cut peppers into quarters lengthwise, then slice them crosswise. Toss together with olive oil and vinegar in large bowlsprinkle with salt and pepper. Transfer to shallow baking panroast peppers in oven for about 25 minutes. Meanwhile, place basil leaves in small bowldrizzle with oil. Toss lightly to coat basil with oil. Remove peppers from ovensprinkle with basil mixture. Serve hot or at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

Mix together flour and salt and pepper to taste. Mix in egg and butter and add milk a little at a time until dough forms. Divide into 12 pieces and roll each into a ball. Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes. (i baked them for 10 minutes and then checked them and they were good) Remove from oven and place in a bowl and add milk if they are dry.

Place a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add chicken breasts and sprinkle with curry powder. Cook until chicken is no longer pink. Remove chicken from skillet. In the same skillet, saute onion in butter until soft. Add spinachcook 3-4 minutes or until wilted. Stir in soup and sour cream. Cook until heated through. Stir in mayonnaise. Add chicken to saucestir to coat. Serve over rice or pasta.

Saute onion in oil for 5 minutes. Add garlic and saute for another 1-2 minutes. Add spinach and saute for 3 more minutes. Stir in cumin, chickpeas and butter. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with pita bread.

Crush the graham crackers with your hands or a rolling pin and stir in the sugar until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Press the crumbs firmly into an 8-inch pie plate. Chill the crust while you make the filling. Beat the mascarpone with the sugar with an electric mixer until the filling is smooth. Stir in the whipping cream until smooth again. Spoon the mixture into the pie crust. Cut the strawberry into 1/4-inch thick slices. Arrange the slices in rows on the filling to make a lattice design. Chill for 3 hours or until firm enough to cut. Serve with slices of kiwi.

Combine sugar and corn syrup in a heavy bottomed kettle. Stir until the mixture comes to a boil. Boil for 6 minutes or until a candy thermometer reads 255 degrees f. Remove from heat. Stir in the baking soda and butter. Stir until the butter is completely melted. Stir in the vanilla. Pour into a buttered pan. Cool slightly before cutting.
In a small bowl combine sour cream, onion powder and seasoning mix. Refrigerate 30 minutes or longer if desired to blend flavors. Serve with vegetables, crackers or breads. Yields 1/2 cup.

Combine tapioca, milk, sugar and salt in heavy saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring constantly until tapioca thickens. Add egg yolks and butter, stir until thickened. Remove from heat, add vanilla. Let cool to room temperature. Turn into a lightly greased 2-quart casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Cut into squares. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream. Makes about 10 servings.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly oil an 8-inch baking dish. In a large saucepan of boiling water, blanch the corn 1 minute. Drain and cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine the corn with the cream cheese. In a small saucepan, melt the butter. Stir in the garlic and sugar. Add to corn mixture. Add the salt and parsley. Pour into prepared dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden. Cool slightly before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 325f. Cook pasta according to directions. Blanch pumpkin cubes in boiling water for 5 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Melt butter in saucepan. Add pumpkin, nutmeg, milk, eggs, and cooked pasta to saucepan. Blend well until thickened. Season with salt & pepper if needed. Spread 1 cup of pumpkin mixture into 9 x 13 baking dish. Layer with 1/2 cup pine nuts, 1 1/2 cups grated cheese. Repeat layers 2 more times. Top with remaining cheese, pine nuts. Bake for 1 hour or until bubbling. Allow to stand for 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 450f. Pierce potatoes several times with fork. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry potatoes until golden brown, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Season to taste with pepper, oregano, vinegar, salt. Place potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake at 450f for 25 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine the white rice and whole milk in a pot over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, stirring frequently so it doesn't stick to the bottom of the pot. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, 45 to 50 minutes. Stir in the sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and orange zest and stir until dissolved. Serve warm or cold with cinnamon or orange zest on top.

Heat butter and oil. Add onion and mushrooms and cook till tender. Add stock and garlic and cook till rice is done to your liking. Add rice to pan and stir till all is combined. Add tomato and season to taste with oregano and basil. Serve with sliced avocado and olives.

Beat eggs and water with butter and seasonings. Pour into 8-inch pie pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Sprinkle with deli ham and tomatoes. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake at 375 degrees for 40-50 minutes. Let sit for 5 minutes before cutting into wedges and serving with toast.

Beat together the eggs, sugar, salt and milk until well blended. Add the flour and beat until smooth. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef, onion and mushrooms. Cook 6 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Pour the batter into the skillet. Bake 15-20 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle chicken thighs with pepper and coat with mustard. Arrange chicken thighs in an ungreased shallow baking dish. Layer with sauerkraut and Swiss cheese slices. Bake for 35 minutes or until chicken is tender and cheese is melted and slightly browned. Drizzle with Thousand Island dressing and serve warm.

Cook onion in bacon fat until soft. Add celery and cook 5 minutes more. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cover pot. Cook for about 15 minutes or until celery is tender. Mince parsley and add to pot with salt and black pepper to taste. Melt butter in a small skillet over low heat. Add parsley and cook until it turns a light green color. Remove from heat and add to celery mixture. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 4-6 servings.

Bring broth to a boil. Add tortellini and cook until al dentedrain. In a skillet saute vegetables and gingerroot until tender-crisp. In a bowl combine tortellini with vegetables and gingerroot. Stir in broth and season with sesame oil, soy sauce, pepper and green onions.

Brown beef in large saucepot over medium heat, add onion and cook until tender. Stir in peppers and cook until crisp-tender. Add rice and coleslaw mix and cook until thoroughly heated. Stir in bloody mary mix and heat through. Serve with hot sauce and shredded cheese and lime wedges as garnishes. Serves about 10.

Heat oil in large pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft and translucent. Add shrimp and cook for about 3 minutes or until shrimp just begins to turn pink. Add spiced rum and let cook for another 30 seconds to let the alcohol burn off and the shrimp to cook through. Stir in water and cajun seasoning. Let simmer for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, thai curry paste and fish stock. Cover and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the shrimp is cooked through and the curry paste has thickened the sauce. Stir in jasmine rice and cook for another 5 minutes or until rice is warmed through and heated.

Beat eggs in a large bowl. Add pineapple, ham, cheeses, seasonings and water and beat until just moistened. Pour mixture into a greased 10 inch skillet over medium heat. Cook, without stirring until edges begin to brown and set. Lift edges with a spatula to let uncooked portion flow underneath. Continue cooking until set but still moist in center. Serve warm or chilled.
Heat milk and water together in a saucepan until just hot. Stir in coffee and sugar. Divide among 4 mugs or coffee cups. Pour milk over the top of each mug. Top with whipped cream, if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Place potatoes in large bowl. In a small saucepan heat butter and garlic over medium heat until butter is melted and garlic is cooked. Add to potatoes, along with bacon bits and chives. Mix well. Pour into a 9 by 13 inch baking dish. In a small bowl beat together egg, milk and 1 tablespoon of seasonings until well blended. Pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese and paprika. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until golden brown and potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Serve immediately.

Bring 6 cups of salted water to boil in a large pot. Add orzo pasta, cook 10 minutes. Drain pasta, return to pot and let cool. In a large bowl, combine zucchini, parsley, mint, lemon rind, lemon juice, olive oil and salt and pepper. Toss together pasta with vegetable mixture. Toss pasta mixture together with lemon juice. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Cut the beef tenderloin in half lengthwise. Then rub it with butter and herb mixture. Heat the oven to 425 degrees. Heat a 12 inch cast iron skillet in the oven while it is heating. Add the beef to the skillet. Bake for 30-35 minutes, until cooked through. Allow to rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve hot.

For egg salad, peel and chop hard-boiled eggs. Mix with curry powder and mayonnaise. Garnish with garlic chives, coriander leaves, and lettuce leaves.For wraps, cut lavash bread into strips. Spread each strip with a thin layer of egg salad. Arrange a lettuce leaf on one side of each lavash strip. Top each lavash with a slice of ham. Fold over ham side of each lavash strip to make a wrap. Serve immediately or chill for up to 4 hours.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Rinse chicken and pat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle inside and outside of bird with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add thyme and lemon wedges and butter and rub all over the bird. Roast for 1 hour 15 minutes or until juice runs clear when pierced at thickest part of thigh. Allow bird to rest 10 minutes before carving and serving with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream together peanut butter and brown sugar. Beat in egg whites until well combined. Stir in vanilla and flour just until moistened. Stir in chocolate chips and drop batter by tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutescool completely on a wire rack. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 2 dozen bars.

In a large bowl, combine the barbecue sauce, tomato sauce and worcestershire sauce. Add the wings and mix to coat well. Pour into a 13 by 9-inch baking pan. Sprinkle the brown sugar and paprika over the top. Bake for 45 minutes. Broil for 2-3 minutes.

Whisk together the raspberry vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, honey, kosher salt, fresh ground pepper. Add the romaine lettuce and toss to coat. Divide among 6 salad plates or bowls, top with pomegranate seeds, roasted pistachios, and crumbled gorgonzola cheese.

In a saute pan heat 2 tablespoons of the butter over medium heat until it foams. Continue to cook until the butter is a deep golden brown. Add nutmeg and turmeric and cook for 1 minute longer. Drain the fettuccine and toss it with the brown butter. Add the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter and gouda. Toss to combine. Remove from heat and toss with bread crumbs and pine nuts. Serve immediately.

Trim fat from beef steak. Cut into 1 inch strips. In small bowl combine french dressing and hollandaise sauce mix. Pour over steak strips. Marinate for 15 minutes or longer. Drain and place in 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Add mushrooms, celery ribs, water, worcestershire sauce. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour. Serve over cooked noodles.

Combine dry ingredients in a bowl. Add yogurt, egg, vanilla, oil, and apples. Fold together until just combined. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F oven for about 25 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack.

Cook bacon. Chop up green bell pepper and onion into small pieces. Add chopped bell pepper and onion to bacon grease. Add salt. Stir well. Add canned tomatoes. Bring to boil. Add brown rice. Cook until rice is done. Serve with your favorite bread.

Cook broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside. Pound chicken breasts to 1/4 inch thickness. Dip each breast in beaten egg and then into breadcrumbs. Place in hot skillet and fry in hot fat until lightly brown. Remove from pan and keep warm. In same skillet heat soup and lemon juice. Add curry powder and stir to mix well. Add broccoli and warm through. Serve on top of chicken. Top with cheese. Melt in oven for 2 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400. Spray 13x9 baking dish. Combine seasonings in small bowl. Sprinkle tilapia with seasonings. Place fillets in baking dish. In small bowl combine butter, lemon juice, cilantro and lemon peel. Spoon butter mixture over tilapia. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until tilapia is opaque. Serve with rice.
Bring the apple cider to a boil. Add sugar and cinnamon sticks. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Add the tea bags. Steep for 3 minutes. Pour into mugs. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a loaf pan. In a large bowl, combine oats, sunflower seeds, flax meal, flaxseed, and brown sugar. Combine the beer and water and add to the dry ingredients. Add the flours and stir until a sticky dough is formed. Transfer to the prepared loaf pan and smooth out the top. Bake for 55-60 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

In a 9 x 13 baking pan spread the frozen veggies and half the soup. Sprinkle on the Swiss cheese. Top with the rest of the soup. Cover with sour cream and sprinkle with onion. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 10 minutes longer. Serve with french bread.

In a blender or food processor, combine the oil, molasses and vinegar. Blend well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Place greens in a bowl. Add strawberries and walnuts. Drizzle with dressingtoss to coat. Arrange on a platter. Garnish with chevre and pepper.

In a large bowl beat the eggs until well blended. Add the milk, cheese, butter, and garlic. Beat again. Place the potatoes in a casserole dish. Pour egg mixture over the potatoes. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Crumble the sausage and sprinkle over the top. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over the top. Bake for another 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line the muffin cups with paper cups or spray with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the cake mix and the mayonnaise. Add the water and the instant coffee granules and stir until smooth. Beat the eggs and add to the mixture and stir until just combined. Stir in the cinnamon. Spoon the batter into the muffin cups and sprinkle a few mini chocolate chips on top. Bake for about 20 minutes or until done. Cool on a wire rack. Frost if desired.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Brown ground turkey in skillet and drain. Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Serve over rice or cornbread.

Sprinkle salmon with 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Place lemon zest, lemon juice, honey, butter and 1/4 teaspoon hot pepper flakes in a small bowl. In a second small bowl, combine remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Brush salmon with Diana Honey Garlic Sauce. Spread 1/4 of the lemon mixture over salmon. Sprinkle with 1/4 of the salt mixture. Repeat with remaining salmon. Grill salmon for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Serve with remaining sauce.

In a skillet over med-high heat, heat oil and saute peppers and onions until tender, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Heat chicken stock to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. In a medium bowl, combine chicken stock, flour and soy sauce and whisk until smooth. Add in chicken and cook 1 minute per side until lightly browned. Add pepper and onions and simmer until heated through, about 30 seconds. Serve over rice.
Mix all together except the quick oats. Stir the quick oats into the mixture. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Chill overnight before eating.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Cut the apples and the pineapple into cubes and place them in a bowl. Add the onions and toss to combine. In a separate bowl mix together the feta cheese and the balsamic vinegar until it forms a paste. Add the paste to the fruit and toss to coat. Spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray and place the fruit on the pan. Bake the fruit for 30 minutes or until it is soft. Cool the fruit. In a large bowl add the lettuce and the fruit. In a separate bowl add the mustard and the vinegar and whisk until smooth. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 400. Melt 1/4 cup butter in large skillet. Add polenta and cook, stirring occasionally, until firm, about 30 minutes. Stir in stock. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Covercook, stirring occasionally, until polenta is tender and thickened, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in herbs and remaining 1/4 cup butter. Spoon polenta into 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400 for 25 minutes or until firm. Sprinkle with cheese. Top each slice of polenta evenly with salami, tomatoes, pepper, salt, and pepper. Bake at 400 for 5 minutes. Serve.
In a large bowl, mix together the baked beans, onion, apple, mustard, sugar, bacon and salt. Transfer to a greased 9-inch square baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

Shell and devein prawns and cut them into chunks. Heat oil in a large frying pan and fry onion and garlic until lightly browned. Add prawns and fry for about 2 minutes. Add wine and simmer until almost evaporated. Add curry paste and stir for a few seconds. Add tomatoes and cook until they begin to break down. Add butter and stir until melted. Add flour and stir until smooth. Add coconut milk and stir. Add ketchup and stir until well combined. Add prawns and simmer for a minute. Add lime juice and stir. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Combine oats and 2 cups flour. Cut in shortening. Add baking soda. Combine well. Spread into an ungreased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Dot with butter. Mix apples with cinnamon and white sugar. Arrange over top. Bake for 40-50 minutes. Cool. Cut into squares. Makes 30 squares.

Mix eggs and sugar well and set aside. Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler. Add eggs and sugar mixture and stir until well blended. Add rum and coffee extract. Put 1 Tbsp mixture in a ramekin and bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Cool and top with whipped cream.

Soak beans overnight in enough water to cover them by 2 inches. Drain beans well and discard the water. Place beans in a large pot with fresh water to cover beans by 2 inches. Add ham bone and salt pork to pot. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-high and boil until beans are tender, about 2 hours. Add more water if necessary to keep beans covered by 1 inch. Discard ham bone and salt pork. Serve beans with shredded cheddar cheese and butter on top.

Combine all ingredients except salmon in a blender or food processor. Process until smooth. Spray a nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Heat skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle salmon with lemon juice. Cook about 3 minutes on each side or until done. Serve with avocado sauce.

Sift together flour, cornmeal and salt in large bowl. Mix together water and 2 tablespoons sugar and mix into dry ingredients. Place mixture onto wax paper and roll into a ball. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or preferably overnight. Roll out 1/4 inch thick and cut into circles about 3 inches in diameter. Place circles on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until lightly brown around the edges. Cool completely. Combine grapes, remaining sugar and tapioca. Cook until grapes are tender and mixture is thick, about 20 minutes. Pour mixture into cooled pie shells and cool completely. Garnish each pie with a few walnut halves and serve chilled.

In a food processor or blender, combine garlic and mustard and process until smooth. Add vinegar and process until smooth. Add soy sauce and process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper and set aside. Combine greens in a large salad bowl and toss with dressing just before serving. Top with sliced almonds. Serves four as a light dinner salad or eight as an appetizer.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl, cream together the shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg. Sift together the flour, cocoa, baking powder, nutmeg, and cinnamon. Stir into the creamed mixture. Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 4 dozen.

In a large saucepan, bring broth and water to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and carrot and cook for 6 minutes or until tender. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add chicken and cook for 6 minutes. Add to saucepan and simmer for 15 minutes. Add pasta and simmer for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Remove and discard bay leaves. Stir in chopped parsley.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to pot. Add laughing cow cheese. Add skim milk and pepper. Heat through. Serve with parmesan cheese and chives.

In a large bowl of an electric mixer, mix together the egg yolks, sugar, half-and-half and vanilla. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker, then churn until thickened (about 30 minutes). Scoop the ice cream into a storage container and stir in the heavy cream until it is well combined. Cover the ice cream container with plastic wrap and freeze for at least 6 hours before serving.

Brown ground beef in skillet. Add diced tomatoes and beef broth. Stir in seasoning. Bring to a boil. Add macaroni. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until macaroni is tender. Add kidney beans and garbanzo beans. Cook for another 3 minutes. Add green beans. Cook for 3 minutes. Serve.

Put dry onion soup mix in a large plastic bag. Add pork tenderloin and shake until evenly covered. In a slow cooker, combine red wine, soy sauce and garlic. Place pork in slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours or on high for 2 hours until tenderloin reaches an internal temperature of 145f. Serve with desired side dishes and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Separate egg whites from yolks. Beat egg whites with vanilla and milk until stiff. Set aside. Beat egg yolks with sugar until thickened. Add flour and baking powder. Beat until smooth. Add milk mixture, peanut butter, and chocolate. Beat well. Add egg whites and beat well. Pour mixture into a greased and floured tube pan. Bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes. Check center with a toothpick.
Mix flour with egg and milk. Dip fish in mixture. Dip in batter again. Dip in batter again. Dip in batter again. Drop in hot oil. Cook until lightly browned. Drain. Serve with tartar sauce.

Pour the sugar into a heavy saucepan & bring to a boil. Cook until sugar is light golden. Stir constantly. Carefully pour into a glass or ceramic bowl. Cool to room temp. Place in ice cream freezer and freeze until firm.

Combine butter and sugar in a large bowl. Beat until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla extract. In a separate bowl combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Add to butter mixture and stir until combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 8 to 10 minutes.

Preheat the grill. Place the tortillas on the grill and spoon on the Dijon. Top the tortillas with the ham. Sprinkle on the green onions and the green peppers. Sprinkle on the cheese. Top with the jalapeno. Spread on the salsa. Cook until the tortillas are lightly browned and the cheese is melted. Serve immediately. Makes 4 quesadillas.

Place water in a pot and bring to a boil. Add garlic cloves and cook for 5 minutes. Add potato and carrots and cook for 15 minutes until vegetables are tender. Add milk and continue cooking for another 15 minutes. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream.

Spread 2 pieces of bread with Miracle Whip. Stack chicken, bacon, tomatoes, lettuce on bottom piece of breadspread with Miracle Whiptop with remaining bread and cut into 4 sandwiches. Makes 4 servings.

Combine all the dry ingredients in a bowl. Heat the water to a boil. Remove from heat. Add the canning salt to the boiling water. Stir to dissolve. Add the herbs. Chill. Submerge turkey in brine. Refrigerate for at least 8 hours.

In a large pot combine chicken stock, red wine vinegar, lentils, onions and garlic clove. Simmer over medium low heat for about an hour, stirring occasionally. After lentils have softened add chorizo sausage. Continue simmering for about another half hour. Add red wine and parsley and thyme. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crusty bread and salad or as a side dish with roast chicken or pork.

In a large mixing bowl mix together the Bisquick, beer, and sugar. Add the egg, stirring to make a thick batter. Place about 1/4 cup of the batter into a lightly greased muffin pan. Bake in a 400 degree F oven for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool in pan for 5 minutes. Makes 12.

Place all vegetables in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil and simmer for 1 hour or until very soft. Melt butter in saucepan. Add flour and stir until smooth. Gradually add stock and stir until smooth and thickened. Add all the vegetables and seasoning. Simmer for about 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease 9x13 pan. In medium bowl combine butter and sugarcream until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and eggsmix well. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking powder and saltmix well. Add the flour mixture to the creamed butter and sugar. Stir in the Ghirardelli Sweet Ground Chocolate and Cocoa until just moistened. Stir in walnuts. Spread the batter in the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Cool for 1 hour. Remove brownies from pan using the edges of the foil as handles. Cut into 2 inch squares. In a double boiler over simmering water combine milk and chocolate. Stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat. Add the Ghirardelli Sweet Ground Chocolate and Cocoa and stir to blend. Drizzle over brownies and serve.

Slice eggplants. Put them in a bowl and add salt and extra virgin olive oil and mix. Grill each side for about five minutes. Toast the bread. Spread the arugula leaves on the bread. Slice the mozzarella cheese. Put it all together.

Cut peaches into cubes. Mix together sugar, flour, cinnamon and nutmeg. Sprinkle over peach cubes. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Mix together oats and brown sugar. Cut in butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Sprinkle over peaches. Bake at 350 degrees f for 45 minutes. Top with cool whip. Serve cold or warm.

In large pot or dutch oven, brown meat in the tomato sauce until no longer pink. Stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer for about 1-1/2 hours over low heat until flavors blend well. Serve over rice or pasta or with chips. Serves about 6-8 people.

Sprinkle scallops with cayenne pepper and season with salt. Combine lime juice, garlic, cumin, chili powder and olive oil. Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Skewer scallops and tomatoes together. Brush with lime mixture. Grill until scallops are cooked through. Remove from grill. Squeeze lime over scallops. Garnish with chives. Serve with lime wedges.

In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs and milk. Add salt, pepper and oilbeat well. Heat a large non-stick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heat. Add eggscook 2 minutes or until almost set, stirring constantly. Add pesto saucecook 1 minute. Spread egg mixture evenly onto 4 slices bread. Top each with 1 tomato slice, 1 tablespoon mozzarella cheese and 2 slices provolone cheesecover with remaining bread slices. Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heat. Cook sandwiches 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown. Cut each sandwich diagonally into 4 slices.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil for easier cleanup. Cut the pita bread into quarters. Lay on the baking sheet. Brush the pita bread with the melted butter. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Sprinkle with kosher salt. Bake for 8 minutes. Flip the pita bread over. Bake for another 6-7 minutes or until crispy. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Serve warm with hummus or ranch dip.

In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt. In another bowl combine milk, egg and vanilla extract. Gradually add dry mixture to liquid mixture and whisk until smooth. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add vegetable oil to pan. Using a 1/4 cup measure, drop batter into oil. Cook 2 minutes per side or until golden brown. Remove from pan. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve pancakes with strawberries and whipped cream.

Cut squid into rings and rinse with cold water to remove any residual ink. Drain and pat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle squid with sea salt and black peppercorns and let stand for 10 minutes. Beat eggs and cornflour together in a small bowl and then dip squid rings in this mixture. Heat oil in a wok or deep-fry pan and cook squid rings until golden brown and crisp, about 1 minute per side. Sprinkle with red chile and green onions and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat a 1 1/2 to 2 qt. baking dish with nonstick spray. Place fish in dish. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, seasoning, lemon juice, and parsley. Spoon sauce over fish. Sprinkle fish with parmesan cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Garnish with slivered almonds and crabmeat. Serves 4.

Mix the horseradish with a little mayonnaise to make a spread. Spread each slice of bread with the mixture and top with the smoked salmon, sprouts and scallions. Slice the eggs and arrange on top of the salmon and sprouts. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a bowl, then stir in the coconut and peanuts. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Mix pork and flour together. Heat a pan with olive oil and melted butter in it. Add the sage and fry the pork until brown. Serve with potatoes and vegetables.
Cut shortcakes in half. Place one half on each skewer. Dip in margarine. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Arrange strawberries on each skewer. Yields 3 servings.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and thyme leaves and cook until tender about 5 minutes. Season lamb chops with salt and pepper. Place chops in pan and cook for about 4 minutes on each side. Remove from heat and allow chops to rest for about 10 minutes. Slice chops and serve with onions and lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl mix together cream cheese, garlic cloves, feta cheese, salt and pepper. Place figs in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 8 minutes or until figs are tender. Remove from oven. Remove pits from figs. Serve figs topped with cream mixture.

Remove seeds from pepper. Slice into strips. Cut into strips. Chop onion. Peel and chop cucumber. Mince garlic. Combine all of these vegetables in a large mixing bowl. Add the tabasco sauce and the V-8 juice and mix well. Chill for two hours. Add the lime juice and the salt. Add the chopped cilantro and mix well. Serve in bowls garnished with fresh cilantro.

Pour the cranberries into a heavy saucepan. Add the sugar and stir to combine. Add the red wine and cinnamon sticks. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Stir in the orange rind. Let sit 10 minutes. Discard the cinnamon sticks. Serve warm.

Brown sausage in frying pan. While sausage is browning, dice celery and onion. Add to sausage after browned. Add water and soup mix to frying pan. Add rice and soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer for 20 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.

Combine the first four ingredients in crock pot. Add taco seasoning. Brown the beef. Add to the crock pot. Pour the can of refried beans over the meat. Sprinkle with salsa. Top with cheese. Cook on low for 3 hours. Serve in warmed tortillas or on top of corn chips.

In a large dutch oven or stockpot, cook steaks in a small amount of hot oil over medium-high heat for 2 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove from pan. Add tomato sauce, water and bouillon cubes to the pan. Bring to a boil. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in tomatoes with their juice, vegetables and pasta. Return steaks to pan. Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until meat and vegetables are tender. Serve with bread.

Combine cream cheese and butter in food processor bowl and process until smooth. Add flour and salt and process until smooth and holds together when pinched between fingers. Gather dough together and press into ball. Wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly grease a 12-cup muffin pan. In a large bowl, mix together the bananas, egg, buttermilk, granulated sugar and brown sugar. Combine the flour, baking soda and saltgradually stir into the banana mixture. Spoon batter into prepared cups. Top each with 1 tablespoon of chocolate chips. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden. Cool on wire racks.

Heat oil in a large skillet. Add shrimp and scallion. Cook until shrimp is pink. Add garlic and tomatoes. Cook 1 minute. Add basil. Cook 1 minute more. Add pasta and peas. Toss until well mixed. Serve warm.

In a food processor or blender, puree green onions and stewed tomatoes until smooth. Stir together with remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.

Mix together first four ingredients. Press into a greased 8x8 pan. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes. Cool completely. Melt chocolate chips with shortening. Spread over cooled bars. Cool before cutting. Yields 24 bars.

Mix the glutinous-rice flour, tapioca starch, parmesan cheese, egg, butter, milk and mozzarella cubes together until you get a mixture that will hold together well but is not too sticky. Roll into balls. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and refrigerate 30 minutes before serving with crackers or baguette slices.

Butter one 8 x 8 inch pan and line with vanilla wafers. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Blend cornstarch with sugar and ginger in bowl. Add half-and-half and whisk until smooth. Add vanilla and mix well. Pour into prepared pan and bake until set about 30 minutes. Cool. Crumble wafers and mix with coconutspread over pudding. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares and serve. Makes 16 servings.

In a large saucepan, cook ground beef, onion, garlic clove and green pepper over medium heat until browned. Drain well. Stir in diced tomatoes, chili powder, worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper to taste. Simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in beans. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer 10 minutes longer. Serve over cooked macaroni noodles.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the scallions and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Add the green chilies, black beans and water. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a low simmer, cover and cook for 30 minutes. Stir in the salsa and simmer for 5 more minutes. Serve hot with shredded cheddar cheese and chopped cilantro.

In skillet heat oil over medium heat saute squash, peppers and onions until tender. Add tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce and cook until heated through. Sprinkle with oregano and mozzarella and serve warm over pasta.

In 10-inch skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil on medium-high heat until hot. Add pork chopscook 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil and green onions to skilletcook and stir 1 minute or until onions are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with mustard and orange rindstir well until blended. Return pork chops to skilletstir until well coated with sauce. Cover and simmer on low heat 30 minutes or until pork is fork-tender. Garnish with orange slices and serve.
Mix all ingredients. Refrigerate 24 hours. Serve on crackers. Serves 4.

Spiralize zucchini. Mix bread crumbs & cheese in a large bowl. In another bowl lightly beat egg. Dip zucchini in egg. Coat in bread crumb mixture. Place on parchment paper. Bake in 375f oven for 10 minutes or until crispy. Serve warm.

Bring water to boil in a medium saucepanadd orange zest and orange juice. Remove from heat and add oil and saltpour mixture over couscous, cover, let stand 10 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Makes 4 servings.

Cut the top off a lemon and squeeze the juice into a small bowl. Add the ginger, crush the garlic cloves and stir to combine. Season the chickens with the lemon mixture and a pinch of coarse salt. Place the chickens in a roasting pan, cover the pan with foil and roast for 1 1/2 hours. Uncover the pan and roast for a further 1 hour or until the juices run clear when the birds are pierced with a knife. Serve with roast potatoes and seasonal vegetables.

Brew the chai tea bags in the boiling water and let cool. Add the chocolate syrup and caster sugar and mix well. Pour the mixture into a glass filled with ice and top with the whipped cream. Sprinkle with some more chocolate syrup and serve.

In a medium bowl, mix together the granulated sugar, cornstarch, salt, milk, egg yolks, butter, and vanilla until smooth. Cook on high for 2 minutes (or until thickened). Refrigerate until cool. Combine pudding with wafers and bananas. Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving. Top with whipped topping if desired.

Prepare bread according to package directions. Spread the tuna over the top of the bread. Sprinkle the diced tomatoes over the bread. In a small bowl mix together the remaining ingredients. Sprinkle mixture over top of the tuna. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until bread is toasted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Combine apples with brown sugar, flour, and spices. Spread in a single layer onto the baking sheet. In a large bowl combine oats and butter. Mix until crumbly. Sprinkle over apples. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. To make the topping, mix together the brown sugar and flour. Cut butter into the mixture until crumbly. Sprinkle the topping over the crisp. Serve immediately with whipped cream.

In a large cast iron skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add sprouts and season with sea salt and pepper. Cook stirring occasionally for 1 minute, then reduce heat and cook stirring occasionally for about 12 minutes more, until browned and tender. Remove from heat and drizzle with fresh lemon juice and toss well to combine. Sprinkle with toasted pine nuts and serve.

Season tenderloins with salt and pepper. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine shallot and butter. Add the mustard and cook until it begins to thicken. Add the brandy and cook until it is evaporated. Add the beef stock and Worcestershire and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the sauce is thickened. Stir in cream and simmer until slightly thickened. Serve sauce over the beef.
Brown cubes steaks. Drain. Combine all remaining ingredients in a 3 quart casserole dish. Add the steaks to the casserole. Cover. Bake at 350 for 1 1/2 hours.
Mix cream cheese and mayonnaise in a small bowl. Add garlic salt to taste. Spread on a whole wheat bagel or pita. Top with tomato slices and bacon. Makes 1 serving.

Clean mushroom stems by cutting out the stems from caps and chopping roughly. Add chopped bacon to pan with mushroom stems. Cook until mushroom stems are tender, about 5 minutes. Stir mushrooms into bacon mixture until mushrooms are tender, about 2 minutes. Drain excess liquid from pan and set mixture aside to cool for about 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl combine cream cheese, mushroom mixture, mushroom caps with stems removed and shredded cheese. Spoon mixture into mushroom caps, dividing evenly. Bake for about 10 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and mushrooms are heated through.
Cook macaroni in salted water till tender. Melt butter in a saucepan. Add macaroni. Stir in evaporated milk. Add cheese. Season to taste. Serve hot.

Cook potatoes and vegetables. Cook chicken in broth until done. Drain. Combine soup, potatoes, vegetables and chicken. Pour into 1-1/2 quart casserole. Combine soup and cheese. Spoon over hot mixture. Sprinkle with onions. Bake uncovered 350f 30 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl combine cream cheese and mozzarella cheese until smooth. Add 2 tablespoons of Italian seasoning and 1 teaspoon of garlic powder. Stir until evenly combined. Take about 1 tablespoon of mixture and roll into small ball. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Place baking sheet in oven for 20 minutes or until cheese is hard. Once cooked roll cheese balls into nuts or sprinkle with bacon bits. Store cheese balls in refrigerator.

In a saucepan, bring 3 cups of water to a boil. Stir in the oats. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and add milk, molasses, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, vanilla, and salt. Cover and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, stir in any toppings you would like. Reheat on stovetop or microwave.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cut the yams up and place in a large baking dish. Place the butter over the top of the yams and sprinkle with the brown sugar and maple syrup. Add the lemon juice and lemon zest and mix well. Bake for 45 minutes to an hour. When the yams are fork tender and the brown sugar/syrup mixture is bubbly and golden, take out of the oven and pour in the Southern Comfort. Mix well and serve hot.

Cook hot dogs according to directions. Wrap bacon around hot dog. Place on a skewer. Top with cheese. Microwave for 1 minute. Spread mustard on bun. Add hot dog. Add onion, pickle relish. Top with jalapenos and sauerkraut. Serve with a toothpick.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and sauté 2 minutes. Add garlic and sauté 1 minute. Add mushrooms and sauté 3 minutes. Add chicken and sauté 2 minutes. Add white wine and cook 30 seconds. Add tomato soup and thyme. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve over cooked rice.

To cook sprouts: In 8 qt saucepan combine brussels sprouts and 1/4 cup of water. Cover and heat to boiling. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes or until sprouts are tender. Drain sprouts, reserving cooking liquid. Set sprouts aside. To prepare sauce: In small bowl combine yogurt, dijon mustard, maple syrup and 1/4 cup of reserved cooking liquid from brussels sprouts. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Spread brussels sprouts in 13 x 9 baking dish. Spread yogurt sauce evenly over sprouts. Sprinkle with fresh dill. Bake uncovered in 350 degree oven for about 20 to 30 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Brown beef and sausage in skillet and drain. Add soup and tomatoes. Bring to boil then reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in cheese and jalapenos. Cook and stir until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips and hot salsa. Serves 4

Preheat oven to 350 deg. F. In a large mixing bowl combine all ingredients except pecans. Beat with electric mixer on medium speed until combined. Stir in pecans. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 x 2 inch baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes then cut into squares. Store in an air tight container.

Place chayote and onion in a small bowl. Add water and soak 1 hour. Drain and cut into 1-inch pieces. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chayote and onion. Cook for 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook 2 minutes. Add cooked rice. Add tomatoes with their liquid. Season with salt and pepper. Add chives and stir well.
Combine vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, and ginger. Pour into a large glass container. Add cucumber. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Before serving, stir in green onions. Serve chilled.

Peel and slice the avocados. Peel and slice the eggs. Put the lettuce leaves in a bowl and add the avocados and eggs. Add the tomatoes. Sprinkle with alfalfa sprouts. Make the dressing in a small bowl and add to the salad. Sprinkle with fresh dill. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil. Sear the pork chops on both sides until browned and cooked through. Transfer to a plate. In the same skillet, combine the cherry fruit spread, red wine and vinegar. Bring to a simmer. Return the pork to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes. Season with rosemary and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Rinse the potatoes. Pat them dry with a paper towel. Cut them into small cubes. In a small bowl, combine the dried cilantro, dry mustard, salt, and pepper. Add the cream and whisk to combine. Pour the mixture over the potatoes. Sprinkle the top with parmesan cheese. Bake for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and stir. Continue to bake for another 10 to 15 minutes, until the potatoes are tender. Serve.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook onion in cooking oil until soft. Add garlic and cook one minute. Stir in tomatoes and chilies and cook one minute more. Add eggs and cook until just set. Remove from heat and sprinkle with salt and pepper. To assemble, spread each tortilla with about 1/2 cup egg mixture. Sprinkle each tortilla evenly with 1/2 cup cheese. Fold over tortilla and brown in a hot nonstick skillet or in the microwave. Makes 4 servings.
Grate cucumber. Squeeze out liquid. Add rest of ingredients in a blender. Chill. Serve as dip or sauce.

Cut roma tomatoes in half lengthwise. Place on foil lined baking sheet. Add basil, sea salt and olive oil to taste. Bake in preheated oven at 220c for 20 minutes or until tomatoes start to turn brown.

Cut off the woody ends of the asparagus and discard. Wash the spears under running cold water and drain well. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place asparagus in an 8-by-10-inch baking dish. In a medium bowl, beat together eggs, sour cream, cheese, mushrooms, 1/2 teaspoon of garlic, tarragon, salt and pepper. Pour over asparagus. Sprinkle with red pepper. Bake until set in center, about 40 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting into wedges to serve.
Mix together the beans and barbecue sauce in a 3-quart slow cooker or large roaster. Add the sausage. Top with bacon and brown sugar. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or until the meat is cooked through.

Soak the black-eyed peas overnight or for 6 hours. Drain and grind the peas coarsely in a blender or food processor. Mix the peas and the other ingredients well. Wet your hands and form the mixture into small balls. Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the akkara balls until they turn golden brown on all sides. Drain on absorbent paper. Serve hot with tomato sauce or ketchup.
Mix the sour cream, dill, pepper & lemon juice together. Place the fillets in a shallow dish & cover with the mixture. Serve on crackers.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in flour and cook, stirring for one minute. Stir in milk and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened, stirring constantly, about 5 minutes. Add cheese, one cup at a time, stirring after each addition until cheese is melted and mixture is smooth. Add cornstarch and whiskey and stir until cheese is melted and mixture is smooth. Stir in pepper. Serve with dippers.

Slice onion thinly and saute with curry powder until onions are translucent. Add beans with crushed tomatoes and worcestershire sauce. Simmer until heated through. Arrange sausages on top of beans, cover with foil and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve hot.
Melt butter in skillet. Add garlic and onion and saute until golden. Add dill, poppy seeds, cheese. Melt. Sprinkle over biscuits. Bake according to directions on package.

In a large skillet, combine chicken pieces, soup mix, onion soup mix, rice, soup, bouillon cube, and broth. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 15 minutes or until chicken is done. Remove from heatlet stand, covered, for 10 minutes. Serve.

In a 6 qt pressure cooker add 1 1/2 cups water, 1/3 cup oil. Add onion soup mix and cook on high for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add 4 boneless chicken breasts and 1 14-oz can of whole berry cranberry sauce, 1/4 cup French dressing and 1/2 can cream of mushroom soup. Cook on high for 20 minutes. Serve over egg noodles. Serves 4-6.

Cook the beef and onion until beef is done and onion is clear. Add sweet peppers and butter. Cook until butter is all melted. Add eggs. Cook until the eggs are done. Mix all together and roll up. Make 10 to 12 egg rolls.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Coat a small baking dish with olive oil and place the swordfish steaks in the dish. Pour over the chili sauce and sprinkle with the nam pla and ginger. Season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper and bake in the oven for 10 - 15 minutes until just cooked through. Serve with fresh mint and coriander scattered over the fish and a squeeze of lime juice. Serves 2 as a main meal or 4 as a starter.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Grease an 8-inch square pan. Combine yogurt, oil, sugar, flour and baking powder. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Spread batter in the prepared pan. Sprinkle with coconut. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool in pan on rack. Cut into squares. Serve.

Cut each biscuit in half and place on a large baking sheet. Spread with mustard. Top with a slice of sausage. Break a raw egg on each biscuit and top with cheese. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with chopped basil and onion. Serve immediately.

Cook rice in 2 cups boiling water. Drain and set aside to cool slightly. Wash spinach and drain well. Chop finely. Heat oil in skillet and saute onion and scallions until soft. Add spinach. Cook until wilted and any liquid has evaporated. Cool completely. Combine rice, spinach mixture and dill. Add lemon juice and season with pepper and salt. Form into balls or oblong patties. Roll in breadcrumbs. Refrigerate until ready to fry. Fry in hot shortening or oil until golden. Drain on paper towels. Serve with lemon wedges. Makes 12.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel and core apples. Place in bowl with 3/4 of juice. Add sugar, flour, spices and salt. Mix well. Transfer to greased 9 inch pie plate. Mix together topping ingredients. Spread over filling. Bake for 45 minutes or until apples are tender. Cool before serving.

In a medium skillet cook onion and garlic in butter until tender. Add flour and cook for one minute. Stir in clam juice and milk. Bring to a boil. Stir in clams. Add cooked pasta and parsley. Add parmesan cheese. Toss lightly. Serve immediately.

Peel the potatoes. Cut into quarters and boil in lightly salted water until tender. Drain and return potatoes to pan. Mash with butter and add dill and sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Heat a grill pan over medium heat. Add radicchio and drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and grill on each side until crisp tender. Combine honey and balsamic vinegar in a small bowl. Place radicchio in a large bowl. Toss with vinaigrette. Serve immediately.
Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl combine the ground beef, eggs, cheeses and taco sauce. Mix together well. Form into small balls. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 35 minutes. Serve with salsa.

Heat olive oil in large frying pan on medium-low heat. Salt the pork and add to frying pan. Cook on each side for about 8 minutes or until the inside is cooked through. While cooking pork add lemon pepper to taste. In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add the orzo and cook for about 10 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine the cooked orzo with the pork, grape tomatoes, kalamata olive and feta cheese. Add the spinach and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse fillets and pat dry. In medium bowl, combine egg white, salt and peppermix well. Dip fillets into egg mixture, then coat with mayonnaise. Place in ungreased 13x9-inch baking dishsprinkle with dill weed. Bake uncovered 45 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork. Cool 5 minutes. Sprinkle with dill and lemon wedge. Makes 4 servings.
Cook pasta according to directions. When done, drain pasta and pour yogurt mixture over the pasta. Add garlic, fresh mint and season to taste.

Cut salmon into 1/2-inch-thick steaks. Sprinkle with pepper and set aside. Melt the butter in skillet over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic in the melted butter for 3-4 minutes or until tender. Add salmon and cook until fish begins to flake. Add soy sauce and cook 1 minute longer. Add lemon juice, orange juice and cook an additional minute. Serves 2-3.

In a large skillet brown the vegetables in the butter. In another skillet saute the onion in the remaining 1/4 cup of butter until golden brown. Transfer vegetables and onion to a large bowl. Add mayonnaise. Mix well. Spread in a shallow 1 1/2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with crackers. Makes 6 servings.

Cut up the chicken into small pieces. Beat the egg and put it in a plastic bag. Add the sweet paprika. Add the pieces of chicken to the bag and shake them to evenly cover them with the egg/paprika mixture. Put the corn chips in a plastic bag. Add the parsley and shake to evenly cover them with the parsley and chip mixture. Next put the pieces of chicken in the bag with the crumbs and shake to evenly cover them with the crumbs. Put them in the fridge for 15 minutes. In the meantime you can make the breading. Take some oil and put it in a plastic bag. Take the pieces of chicken out of the fridge and shake them in the oil bag. Place them in the oven at 400 degrees F for about 20 minutes. I don t remember the exact time. You can put them in the oven at the same time you put the crusted potatoes in the oven. They are good with ketchup.
Saut&eacuteonion, garlic, salt and pepper for about 5 minutes. Add split peas, vegetable broth, curry powder. Bring to a boil then cover. Simmer for about 1 hour. Serve with a dollop of plain yogurt.
Mix dry ingredients. Add eggs and milk. Melt butter. Mix all together. Add diced apple. Bake in waffle iron.

Soak red cabbage leaves in cold water for 10 minutes. Drain well. Blot with paper towel. In small bowl combine salt pepper and 2 tablespoons sugar. Sprinkle over cabbage. Toss to coat. Transfer to serving dish. Sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons sugar. Add red wine vinegar. Toss to coat. Transfer to serving dish. Set aside. In small bowl combine sunflower oil, applesauce and cranberry jam. Toss to mix well. Add walnuts. Toss to coat. Sprinkle over cabbage. Garnish with apple slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13x9x2-inch baking dish. In a large mixing bowl combine sugar and butter. Beat until creamy. Stir in milk and eggs. Mix well. Add vanilla wafer crumbs. Combine well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Spread coconut on top. Bake for 5 minutes longer or until golden. Cool. Sprinkle with nuts. Cut into bars.

In a large bowl sift flour, sugar, baking powder, cardamom, salt and set aside. In a separate bowl, mix together milk, eggs and oil until smooth. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and mix well until smooth and just combined. Pour batter into the loaf pan and arrange the pears evenly on top. Bake for about one hour until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let the loaf cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. In a large mixing bowl combine the gluten-free flour, cornstarch, salt, baking powder, xanthan gum, eggs, milk and vanilla. Mix until smooth. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in each of 6 well-buttered, nonstick muffin cups or ramekins in the oven until hot. Remove from oven and add the batter, filling each cup 3/4 full. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until puffed and golden brown on top. Serve with your favorite meat dish or stew.

Boil potatoes in water until tender. Drain. Melt butter in a large pot. Stir in flour. Gradually add milk. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add potatoes and cook until thickened. Stir in kale. Add sausage to potatoes. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in skillet on medium heat add the garlic and parsley flakes and saute about 30 seconds add the lemon juice and stir until the mixture is slightly thickened place steaks in skillet and cook about 2 minutes on each side. Sprinkle steaks with onion powder and salt and pepper to taste. Cook another 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until desired doneness is reached remove from heat and serve immediately. Serves 2 to 4.

Heat the olive oil in a wok or large saut pan over medium high heat. Saute the onions until they begin to soften, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds longer. Stir in the bell peppers, mushrooms, rice wine, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Simmer 1 minute longer, until the vegetables are heated through. Serve immediately.

Peel the shrimp and set aside. In a bowl, combine the shrimp, salt and turmeric powder. Set aside. Heat the sesame and peanut oil in a deep pan over medium heat. Add the shrimp to the pan and fry for 3-4 minutes or until they are just cooked through and curled. Remove from heat and set aside. Thread the shrimp onto the bamboo skewers. Sprinkle the shrimp with the chili powder and serve with a sprinkle of salt and a squeeze of lime.

Place the eggs into a blender with the beef, rice, soup mix and chili powder. Blend until well mixed. Form into patties about an inch thick. Bake in an ungreased pan for about 20 minutes. In the last five minutes of cooking, pour the beer over the top of the patties. Pour the stewed tomatoes over the top of the patties and bake uncovered for 5 more minutes.

Combine olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, salt, pepper, sugar, turmeric and tomatoes in a bowl. Marinate overnight. When ready to serve, cut green onion and parsley. Drain marinated tomatoes, reserving marinade. Toss together tomatoes, green onion, parsley with reserved marinade. Garnish with parsley.

Cut tomatoes into wedges. Cut tuna into 1/4-inch cubes. Toss tuna and tomatoes with celery, tarragon leaves and onion. Add mayonnaise and lemon juicetoss lightly. Season salad with salt & pepper. Divide mixture into two equal portions. Arrange lettuce on individual plates or salad plates. Spoon tuna mixture over lettucesprinkle with tarragon leaves.
Combine mushrooms and sauerkraut. Cook until tender. Add onion. Combine flour and water. Add to mixture. Simmer 30 minutes. Add butter and paprika. Serve over noodles.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees. In a bowl combine wine and 1 cup water. Soak chicken in this mixture for 1 hour. Drain chicken. Combine 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 cup of the seasoned salt. Dip chicken into the seasoned-flour mixture. Place chicken in a 9 x 13 baking dish. In a large saucepan heat oil to 375 degrees. Add egg white and stir until white and frothy. Dip chicken into egg mixture and fry for 8 minutes or until golden brown. Transfer chicken to a wire rack to cool. In a saucepan combine white vinegar and remaining 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boil. Add chicken and cook for 20 minutes. Serve with white rice.

Wash green peppers well. Cut tops off peppers. Remove seeds, cut each pepper into 4 wedges. Brown beef. Add onion. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Drain. Add tomato sauce and taco seasoning. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in beans and heat through. Divide beef mixture among peppers. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes. Serve on lettuce leaves.

In large saucepan heat oil and cook onion and garlic over medium heat until softened. Stir in cream cheese with garlic and herbs. Cook and stir until cheese is melted and mixture is smooth. Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Stir in cornflour. Cook until slightly thickened. Stir in wine. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in brie cheese and cook until melted. Ladle into bowls. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with french baguettes and cranberry sauce.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Spread butter over each crust. Place chicken on each crust. Top with salsa and monterey jack cheese. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until crusts are browned. Cool for 5 minutes. Serve with lettuce leaves.

In small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff. Add brown sugar, maple flavoring, pecans, and breadcrumbsmix well. Shape into 1-inch balls and place on waxed paper-lined baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees 10 minutes or until set. Cool. Store covered overnight in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 190c. Whisk together flour, sesame seeds, five spice powder, cayenne pepper and salt. Put egg into a small dish. Dip each piece of chicken into egg then coat with crumbs. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add chicken pieces, a few at a time, and cook until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Place chicken on a lightly greased baking tray. Combine remaining marinade with 3 tablespoons water. Pour over chicken. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with dipping sauce.

Wash and trim artichokes. Steam artichokes over simmering water until tender. Drain artichokes well. Mash mayonnaise with mustard and lemon juice until smooth. Add garlic, turmeric, ginger, cumin, pepper, dill weed, and cayenne pepper. Dip artichokes in sauce. Yields 6 servings

Mix together shortening and butter in a large bowl. Cream together until light and fluffy. Add powdered sugar 1 cup at a time until it is thick and fluffy. Add cream. Add meringue powder and mix until well combined. Add vanilla or almond extract and butter flavoring if desired. Spread over cake and allow to set before cutting. Can be colored or decorated as desired. Makes a wonderful frosting for all occasion cakes.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Saute the scallions until golden, about 3 minutes. Season with paprika. Lay the fillets on top of the scallions. Pour orange juice and orange zest into the pan. Cook until the fish just flakes with a fork. Season with salt and pepper. In another skillet, heat the heavy cream over medium heat. Whisk in the flour. Add to the pan with the fish. Stir until thickened. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve over rice.

Heat skillet over medium heat and cook ground beef until done. Drain and return to pan. Add salsa and chili powder and stir until combined. Add corn and green beans and stir until heated through. Serve over rice. Top with cheese and garnish with sliced jalapenos if desired.
Combine all the ingredients and spread between slices of bread or use as a filling for crepes.

Mix the flour and sesame seeds together. Add the water and knead into a smooth dough. Knead on a lightly floured surface for about five minutes. Roll the dough out into 8-inch rounds and place on a greased baking tray. Brush with some milk and sprinkle with sesame seeds and black pepper. Bake for about 20 minutes at 200°C/400°F.

Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and saute until softened about 5 minutes. Add apple and ginger. Cook about 5 minutes. Add sausage. Cook until browned about 15 minutes. Add water. Cover and cook over low heat until sausage is done 15-20 minutes. Stir in mustard seeds. Cook uncovered 3-5 minutes longer. Serve immediately.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine cocoa, sugar and milk. Heat until warm and sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and spices. Pour cocoa into mug and top with marshmallows and whipped cream.

Cream together sugar and butter. Add milk and vanilla. Combine flour and salt. Add flour mixture to sugar mixture and blend until smooth. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 6 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately sprinkle with coconut and oatmeal. Repeat for remaining cookies. Cool on wire rack.
Combine all in a punch bowl or large mixing bowl and chill for several hours or overnight. Serve in small cups with a spoon or in a tall glass with a straw.

Rinse brown rice until water runs clear. Combine brown rice, wild rice, chicken stock, bay leaves, dried shallots and butter in a 2 to 3 quart saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover tightly and simmer until rice is tender and liquid has absorbed. Remove bay leaves. Salt to taste. Serve immediately. This rice can be refrigerated up to 2 days or frozen up to 2 months. If freezing, defrost overnight in refrigerator or microwave on low 10 to 15 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat butter. Add onions and celery and cook until onion is translucent. Stir in the flour and cook and stir for about 2 minutes. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add the cheese and the pecans and stir well to combine. Pour into a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish. Bake for about 20 minutes or until browned and bubbly.

Place chicken pieces in a resealable plastic bag with lime juice, orange juice, zest of lime and orange, olive oil, garlic cloves, dried oregano and jalapeno pepper. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to marinate. Thread chicken pieces on skewers. Grill on medium heat for 8-10 minutes per side. Garnish with parsley sprigs and lime zest.

Combine meat with the egg. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Divide into four portions and shape into balls. Place the balls onto the bread and press with the back of the spoon to spread the filling and seal the sandwiches. Fry the sandwiches over medium heat until golden on both sides. Serve with tomatoes on the side.

In a large saucepan over high heat, heat oil until hot. Add garliccook 30 seconds. Stir in mussels, cover & cook, stirring occasionally, until mussels openabout 3-4 minutes. Discard any unopened mussels. Stir in parsleystir 1 minute. Add cornstarch mixturestir 1 minute longer or until thickened. Serve hot with crusty bread.

In a small bowl combine zest and juice of 1 orange. Squeeze remaining oranges to get juice. Set aside. Using a mixer cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in rind of 1 lemon and salt. Beat in egg. Beat in orange juice mixture. Add flour and mix until dough forms. Chill dough for about an hour. Preheat oven to 375°F. Roll dough into a 1 inch log. Wrap in plastic and chill for a few hours or overnight. On a lightly floured surface cut dough into 1/4 inch rounds. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for about 8 to10 minutes until lightly browned. Cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar. Yield: about 2 dozen cookies.

Cream together margarine and sugar. Beat in eggs. Sieve together flour, baking powder and salt. Fold into sugar mixture. Add milk. Divide between 6 cupcake cases. Bake at 180C/350F/Gas Mark 4 for 20 minutes. Cool. Decorate.

Heat oven to 350f. In large heavy saucepan, over low heat, stir together chocolate chips, sweetened condensed milk, vanilla, maraschino cherries and miniature marshmallows. Stir constantly until mixture is smooth. Pour into 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake at 350f for 25 to 30 minutes or until firm. Cool completely. Top with chopped nuts, if desired. Cut into 12 bars. Store in airtight container. Yield: about 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 325f. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the eggs and cook for about 3 minutes or until the whites are set and the yolks are still a bit runny. Add the feta cheese and stir until it melts, about 1 minute. Pour the mixture into a greased 2-cup baking dish and bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the top is browned and the center is set. Serve warm.

Mix sweet potato, milk and butter in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and cook for 20 to 25 minutes or until potatoes are very tender, stirring frequently. Remove from heatcool slightly. Beat potatoes until fluffy. Stir in brown sugar, vanilla extract and ground nutmeg. Makes 4 servings.

Bring water to a simmer in a saucepan over high heat. Add the gnocchi and cook until soft and floating to the top of the water. Drain well in a colander. Return the gnocchi to the pot and stir in the butter to coat. Set aside to keep warm. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the leeks and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the flour and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the milk until smooth. Cook until thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the cheese until melted and smooth. Add the chicken broth and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the gnocchi to the skillet and toss well to combine. Add the spinach and toss until wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees. Place eggplants and basil leaves in a bowl. Sprinkle with 1 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cover with plastic wrap and let stand 20 minutes. Drain eggplants and basil in colander. Place basil, 2 cloves garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and balsamic vinegar in a food processor and pulse until smooth. With processor running, gradually add olive oil. Stir in remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowllet stand 30 minutes. Spread pesto on 2 baking sheets. Add eggplants and toss to coat. Bake 2 hours. Serve.

Mix the flour and seasonings together and dredge the chicken breasts on both sides in the mixture. Place the chicken on a baking sheet and place in a preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes until the chicken is cooked through. Saute the mushrooms and shallots until the shallots are translucent and the liquid has evaporated. Add the champagne and simmer until the liquid is almost evaporated. Whisk the heavy cream until it is heated and begins to simmer and then pour over the chicken and mushrooms. Stir and pour over the chicken and mushrooms. Stir and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease a muffin tin or line with cupcake papers. Cream together brown sugar and cocoa powder. Mix together flour, baking soda and salt in a separate bowl. In a large mixing bowl beat together buttermilk and eggs. Add vanilla extract and beat until combined. Add the sugar and cocoa mixture to the wet ingredients and beat until just combined. Fold in the flour mixture until just combined. Fold in the chocolate chunks and pour into muffin cups. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to a cooling rack. Serves 12.

Bring milk to boiling. Stir in molly mcbutter with garlic salt. Stir constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in arrowroot, stirring until smooth.
