Spray 13x9 inch pan with cooking spray. In large bowl beat cake mix and butter until crumbly. Press into bottom of pan. Bake 15 minutes. Cool. In small bowl stir together pie fillings. Spread over cooled crust. Bake 30 minutes more. Sprinkle top with toasted walnuts and bake 10 minutes longer. Cool on rack. Cut into squares.
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Heat until sugar dissolves. Let simmer for 5-10 minutes, or until the wine is heated through. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except ragu tomato sauce and raisins. Roll into meatballs and place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Drain tomatoes and raisins. Add to meatballs and bake for another 30 minutes.

Heat oven to 350F. Thaw spinach and squeeze out excess moisture by wringing it out over a bowl. Combine spinach, sour cream, onion flakes, cheese, garlic salt, and bread crumbs. Spread into a shallow 2-quart casserole dish. Combine melted butter and parmesan cheesedrizzle over spinach mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

In a small bowl combine soup, mustard, and Old Bay. Set aside. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add lobster and onion and saute until lobster is browned and onion is soft. Stir in mushrooms and garlic and cook until mushrooms are tender. In a small bowl combine milk and cornstarch and stir until smooth. Add milk mixture to skillet and cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in parmesan cheese and soup mixture until well blended. Serve over hot cooked rice and sprinkle with parsley if desired. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder and saltset aside. In a large bowl, combine sugar substitute and eggsbeat until well blended. Add oil and vanillabeat until smooth. Fold in zucchini. Slowly add the flour mixture into the egg mixturemix just until blended. Pour into two greased loaf pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool in pans for 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes two loaves.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut beef into 1/2-inch thick slices. Place in shallow baking pan. Sprinkle with onion soup mix and broth. Add beer and onionstir. Bake for 30 min. or until beef is done. Slice beef thinly on diagonal. Serve on rolls with au jus.

In a large bowl cream together smooth peanut butter and chocolate morsel. Stir in the butterscotch chips. Place cracker in the bowl and stir until it is well coated. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool on baking sheet for a few minutes then move to a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix first 6 ingredients in a bowl. Cut each loaf into halves lengthwise. Spread cut sides of each bread half generously with butter. Sprinkle each half liberally with cheese mixture. Top each half with remaining bread half. Place bread halves in a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until bread is golden. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 450f. Cut broccoli into florets. In a large bowl combine broccoli, olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic and onion powders. Mix well. Spread evenly on two cookie sheets. Roast for 10 minutes. Stir and roast until tender and lightly browned 15 - 20 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan.

Combine oats, almonds and sugar in a large bowl. In a small bowl mix oil, honey and vanilla. Add to oat mixture and stir well. Spread on baking sheets and bake at 275f. 2 hours, stirring every 30 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in raisins. Cool completely before storing in airtight container.

Hard boil 6 medium-size eggs for 10 minutes and then run cold water over them to stop cooking. Peel them and cut them into cubes. Add the other ingredients and mix well. Toast the muffins for 3 minutes. Lay out salad leaves on a plate and put half of the salad in each muffin. Sprinkle with some chives and lay some tomatoes on top of that. Add a couple of cherry tomatoes to each muffin. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 9x13-inch baking dish. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in celery, onion and mushrooms. Cook until onion is tender. Stir in rice, garlic and oregano. Cook for 1 minute. Add broth. Cook, stirring constantly until rice is almost tender. Remove from heat. Stir in bacon. Transfer rice mixture to prepared baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Stir. Bake for 15-20 minutes more or until rice is tender and golden brown. Yield: 8 servings.

Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add eggs and beat well. Add milk and beat well. Heat 1 tablespoon of the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in a separate skillet over medium high heat. Add sausage to the skillet and cook until browned. Add eggs to the skillet. Cook for 3 minutes or until the eggs begin to set. Top with cheese and sprinkle on bread. Cook for 1 minute. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees farenheit. Beat soup and broth. Add the rice. Add the rest of the ingredients and toss to mix. Add the fish. Arrange in a baking pan and bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve over rice and top with sour cream.

Grate the cucumber and squeeze the liquid out. Put the cucumber in a bowl with the garlic, olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and add the mint. Leave to marinate for at least 15 minutes. Stir in the yogurt just before serving. Serve with grilled meats, chicken or fish.

Soak figs overnight in a mixture of port wine, red wine and orange rind and cloves. Add cinnamon stick and star anise. Add brown sugar and simmer over medium heat until figs are soft about 30 minutes. Drain figs and refrigerate until chilled. Whip heavy cream and top with fig mixture and slivered almonds.

Preheat oven to 400f. Mix together cream cheese with onion & chives. Stuff manicotti with mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until hot & bubbly. Remove from oven & top with spaghetti sauce & sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 5 more minutes or until cheese is melted & slightly brown.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine meat, egg and cracker crumbs. Mix well. Add onion, garlic, and pepper. Mix well. Form meat mixture into meatballs about the size of a walnut. Place in a greased 9 by 13 inch dish. In a saucepan combine soup and water. Stir in flour and cook over medium heat until thick and bubbly. Pour over meatballs. Bake 30 to 35 minutes. Serve with rice or noodles.

Bake pie shells according to package directions. Cool completely on wire rack. Beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy. Add flour and mix until well blended. Spread evenly over bottom crust and up the sides of the pie pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips and nuts evenly over filling and press gently into filling. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until set. Let cool completely. Spread ice cream evenly over pie and top each pie with whipped cream. Serve immediately or freeze until ready to serve.

Butter the bottom and sides of a 9 inch square pan. Mix sugar, milk, and butter in a small saucepan until it boils. Boil for one minute. Remove from heat and add in flour all at once, stirring with a whisk until smooth. Stir in eggs until combined. Pour the batter into the pan and bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. In the meantime combine berries and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat until berries begin to burst open. Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes or until syrup thickens up a bit. Carefully run a knife around the edges of the pan then place on a serving plate. Pour the syrup over the top of the batter. Serves 4.

Place chicken thighs in the crock pot. Mix together the rest of the ingredients. Pour over the chicken. Cook on low for 4 to 5 hours or on high for 2 to 3 hours. Remove chicken from the crock pot and set aside. Add the peanuts and simmer for another 15 to 20 minutes or until the liquid thickens. Pour over the chicken. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve over rice.

Cook the pasta according to the directions. Drain. Rinse under cool running water and drain. Combine the cooked pasta with the broccoli florets and the carrot. Place the mixture into a large serving bowl. Add the diced tomato and black olives. Toss gently. Stir the black beans and dressing into the salad mixture. Chill for one hour. Sprinkle with shredded cheese if desired.
Combine all dry ingredients. Add milk. Stir well. Add egg. Add oil. Stir well. Add chips. Spoon into greased loaf pans. Bake at 350 degrees for about 50 minutes. Cool before slicing.

Mix oatmeal and pecans. Beat syrup and margarine together until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla. Beat until blended. Add oatmeal mixture and mix well. Spread in a greased 15 x 10 x 1 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into bars. Store in an airtight container.

Melt butter in a medium skillet set over medium-high heat. Add onion and shallots. Cook, stirring frequently until they're softened, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme. Add flour, stirring constantly. Cook 1 minute. Whisk in broth, thyme, soy sauce, and worcestershire sauce. Bring mixture to a simmercook 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Serve turkey drizzled with the gravy.

Cut the cabbage into 2-inch squares. Cut the daikon into 1/2-inch rounds. Chop the green onions into 1-inch lengths. Peel the carrot and slice it into 1-inch lengths. Trim the ginger root into 1-inch lengths. Slice the garlic into 1/8-inch slivers. In a small bowl, combine the chili flakes, 1/2 teaspoon of the sea salt, and the whey. Pour the mixture over the cabbage mixture. Toss well to coat. Pack the cabbage mixture into the crock. Press the cabbage mixture down with your hands as you pack it. Place a plate on top of the cabbage mixture. Weight the plate down with a heavy can of vegetables or juice. Cover the crock with a clean dishtowel. Leave the crock at room temperature for 4 to 5 days. After 4 to 5 days have passed, remove the plate from the crock. Add the daikon radish, carrot, green onions, ginger and garlic. Pack the vegetables into the cabbage mixture. Cover

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt butter in 2 quart casserole. Add onion and cook until tender. Add potatoes and cook and stir until potatoes are crisp tender. Drain off any excess liquid. Mix potatoes and onions together in casserole. Combine eggs and milk in small bowl. Add milk mixture to potato mixture and stir. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Sprinkle with bacon and bake an additional 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings.

Pound chicken breasts to 1/4-inch thickness. Place flour in a shallow bowl. Combine the soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, onion powder, garlic powder, and sesame seeds in another shallow bowl. Dip the chicken breasts into the flour, then coat with the soy sauce mixture. Fry until done. Serve over hot rice.

Slice the lemon in half and squeeze the juice into a glass measuring cup. Add the water and stir. Place the chicken in a shallow roasting pan and pour the lemon juice mixture over the chicken. Roast the chicken in a 350 degree F oven for 1 hour or until it is cooked through. Mix the honey and 1/2 cup water in a bowl. Place the hickory chips in a small aluminum pan and place in the oven with the chicken. Baste the chicken with the honey mixture every 15 minutes during the last 45 minutes of baking. After the chicken is done remove it from the roasting pan and keep warm. Set the hickory chips aside in a small bowl. Take the roasting pan to the stove top and boil the juices. Boil until the liquid is reduced to about 1 cup. Add the hickory chips and cook over low heat until the sauce is thickened. Pour the sauce over the chicken and garnish with parsley. Serve the chicken with rice.

Grate cheeses and combine with garlic and paprika. Add apple juice. Simmer over low heat until mixture is smooth and bubbly. Stir in cornstarch and lemon juice. Season with nutmeg. Serve in fondue pot with crusty bread.
In a large soup pot, cook potatoes in boiling broth until soft. Drain and add carrots, onions and garlic. Cook until tender. Add curry powder and caraway seeds. Heat through. Serve with sour cream.

Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain and crumble. Combine broccoli, cauliflower and celery in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise and sour cream. Stir in bacon and garlic powder. Add to broccoli mixture. Add salt to taste. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Season steaks with salt and pepper. Dip steaks in egg and dredge in flour. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion, carrot and celery rib. Saute 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add tomato sauce and heat through. Place steaks in a slow cooker. Top with vegetable mixture. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve with rice or noodles.

Heat butter in heavy saucepan over medium heat until hot and butter is lightly browned, stirring constantly. Add shrimp and cook about 2 minutes on each side or until shrimp is just cooked through. Add spinach and toss together in pan until spinach is just wilted and cooked through. Add parmesan and toss together in pan until melted and incorporated into mixture. Add lemon juice and toss together in pan until lemon juice is evenly distributed over all the shrimp and spinach. Remove from heat and serve over pasta, or rice or alone as a side dish.
Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl, combine apples, cranberries, sugar, quick-cooking oats and pecans. Stir until coated. Spoon into an 8-inch square pan. Bake 30-35 minutes. Serve warm.

In large pot or dutch oven over medium heat, warm oil and add leeks and celery. Sauté until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add broth, cauliflower and potatoes and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. In small bowl, combine half-and-half, nutmeg and salt and pepper to taste. Puree cauliflower mixture using immersion blender or food processor. Transfer back to pot and heat through. Remove from heat and stir in cheese until melted. Serve immediately. Serves 4-6.

Preheat oven to 400 F degrees. Lightly grease a 9-inch pie plate. Beat eggs with light corn syrup, vanilla extract and sugar. Add salt. Stir in pecans. Pour into pie plate. Bake until filling is set - about 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Serve warm or at room temperature. Top with whipped cream if desired.

In a large bowl, combine Bisquick with milk and eggstir well. Pat mixture evenly into a 9x13" baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40-45 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Remove from oven and cool completely. Mix together ground beef, cheese, broccoli and garlic powderspread over top of crust. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15-20 minutes or until heated through. Top with sour cream and parmesan cheesesprinkle with parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f (165 degrees c). Grease and flour 2 8x4x2 inch loaf pans. Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the vanilla and eggs. Combine the flour, baking soda and cocoastir into the creamed mixture. Add the soda and mix well. Pour into prepared pans. Bake for 40-45 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans. Cool completely on a wire rack. Drizzle with chocolate glaze and sprinkle with chocolate chips.

Combine flour and cornmeal in a large bowl. Whisk together. Add salt and baking powder. Cut in sugar. Stir in milk and oil. Add eggs. Pour into a greased and floured 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until done. Cool slightly. Top with creamed corn.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Blend in the golden syrup, then the muesli and flour. Add the baking soda and mix until well blended. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool on wire racks.
Combine vinegar, raspberries, honey and basil leaves in a blender. Blend until smooth. Add the oil in a slow, steady stream until emulsified.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a cookie sheet or spray with cooking spray. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup butter, baking soda, ground cinnamon, pure vanilla extract, salt and eggs. Blend well. Add 2 cups of flour. Stir until just mixed. Stir in the oats and raisins. Drop by teaspoon onto baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Let cool for 2 minutes before removing from baking sheet. Makes 36 cookies.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add a tablespoon of salt. Add ravioli and boil for 6 minutes. Drain ravioli. In a large frying pan heat butter over medium heat. When the butter is foaming, add walnuts and sage and cook for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in ravioli and toss to coat with the sauce. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and serve.

Heat vegetable oil in a nonstick frying pan over medium high heat. Combine chili powder, salt, flour. Dip chicken in flour mixtureshake off excess flour. Place in hot pan. Cook chicken until done. Stir in chicken broth. Simmer until sauce thickens. Sprinkle with lime juice. Garnish with cilantro.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Spray a 13x9x2 inch baking dish with cooking sprayset aside. Combine shallots, vermouth, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a bowlset aside. Place pork chops in baking dishcoat with vermouth mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until internal temperature registers 145 degrees f on instant-read thermometer. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Place all the spices in a saucepan with water, bring to boil and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain the spices out of the liquid. Bring the liquid to boil again and add sugar. Stir till sugar is dissolved. Serve with milk and coffee.

Cook pasta according to directions on package. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine onion and basil. Heat oil in a small skillet. Add capers and cook for 1 minute. Add onion mixture to skillet and saute for 2 minutes. Drain pasta and place in a bowl. Add tuna, lemon rind and juice. Pour onion mixture over top. Toss lightly. Serves 6-8.

Cook mixed vegetables in a little butter until tender. In a separate pan brown turkey in a little butter and set aside. In a third pan melt a stick of butter and pour in a can of cream of chicken soup. Add mixed vegetables and turkey. Add 1/2 cup milk to make soup and heat through. Put turkey mixture into a 9 x 13 casserole dish. In a bowl, combine bisquick and 1/2 cup milk. Pour over top of turkey mixture and dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

Wash mushrooms, slice them with a knife and cut them into quarters. In a skillet saute the garlic clove with 2 spoonfuls of olive oil. Add the mushrooms and saute for 10 minutes. Add the spices and cook for a further 10 minutes. Pour over the vinegar. Add the water. Salt to taste. Boil for 10 minutes. Serve with a salad.

Remove stems from kale and coarsely shred. In a food processor, pulse together the almonds and shallots until finely ground. Add the kale and garlic and process until the mixture comes together. Add the cheese and pulse until the mixture is coarsely chopped. With the machine running, add the oil in a slow, steady stream until the mixture is smooth. Season with salt and pepper.

Pour sugar into a large saucepan. Add milk and margarine. Bring to a rolling boil and boil for 5 minutes. Stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add chocolate chips, marshmallow creme and vanilla. Pour into a greased 9x13x2 inch pan. Sprinkle with nuts. Chill. Cut into squares.

Mix together the sugar, brown sugar, shortening, eggs, vanilla and mix until light and fluffy. Sift together the flour, baking soda and salt. Mix into sugar mixture until combined. Fold in the oatmeal until just combined. Chill dough for at least 2 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Drop dough by tablespoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown around the edges. Cool for 2 minutes then transfer to cooling racks to cool completely. Store in airtight containers. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Put the eggs, the plain flour, the sea salt and the cold milk into a jug. Mix it all up well until you get a smooth batter. Then put the vegetable oil into a large frying pan over a medium heat. Pour the batter into the hot oil to make the pudding. Serve with roasts, or just eat them plain.

Bring milk and beef broth to a boil in a saucepan. Add butter and stir until melted. Add salt and pepper. Stir in the hash browns. Cover and bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and add garlic powder and colby. Return to oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat barbecue on high heat. Rub chicken legs with butter. Stir together green onion, garlic, breadcrumbs, parsley and mustard. Sprinkle chicken legs generously. Place on barbecue grill and grill 5 minutes on each side.

Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large pan. Add onion to the pan and saute until translucent. Add the chicken broth to the pan with the onion. Add the carrots, celery, and frozen vegetables to the pan. Bring the mixture to a boil then reduce heat to medium. Add the boneless chicken breasts to the pan and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove the chicken breasts from the pan. Add the cream of chicken soup to the pan. Add the frozen biscuits to the pan. Stir well to coat with the soup. Add the parsley to the pan. Stir until well combined. Remove from heat. Serve with the chicken breasts.

Place chicken tenders in a baking dish. Add 2 teaspoons kosher salt and 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper. Drizzle 1 teaspoon olive oil over chicken. Toss to coat. Bake in preheated oven until chicken is cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes. While chicken is baking, prepare pesto in food processor. Add walnuts to food processor. Process until walnuts are finely chopped. Add chicken, 1 tablespoon olive oil and cilantro leavesprocess until smooth. Add parsleyprocess until smooth. Transfer pesto to bowl. Add lime juice and remaining 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Stir to combine. Serve chicken topped with pesto.
Spread cream cheese on pumpernickel bread. Add dressing mix, cucumber slices and cooked bacon. Cut into 6 sandwiches.

In a large pot of boiling salted water cook macaroni until al dente. Drain. In a large skillet over med-high heat add oil and heat until very hot. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add tomato halves to the garlic-oil mixture and cook 2 minutes. Add basil. Remove from heat. Combine balsamic vinegar with 1 Tbsp of water. Add to skillet and stir to blend. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving plate. Arrange macaroni on top of tomato mixture. Top with mozzarella slices. Drizzle with balsamic-water mixture. Garnish with fresh basil.

Heat the butter and add the minced garlic and parsley. Remove from the heat and add the mussels, shallot, thyme and bay leaf. Add salt and pepper. Pour the dry white wine and cover. Cook for 5 minutes or until the mussels open. Serve on a plate, garnish with parsley and enjoy.

Divide frozen bread dough into three equal pieces. On lightly floured surface roll out each portion into an oblong shape approximately 9 inch by 5 inch. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees F for 8-9 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Cut each roll horizontally into three equal slices. Spread with pizza sauce and sprinkle with cheeses, pepperoni and broccoli florets. Bake at 350 degrees F for 5-8 minutes or until cheese is melted and broccoli is tender crisp.

Sift 2 cups flour with salt in a large bowl. Add the shortening and cut in with a pastry blender or 2 knives until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the orange juice and stir with a fork just until the dough holds together. Divide the dough in half and shape into 2 disks. Wrap each disk in plastic and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 2 days. The dough can also be frozen for up to 1 month. On a lightly floured surface, roll each disk of dough into a 12-inch circle. Fold the dough in half and gently press the edges together. Using a sharp knife, cut a 5-inch circle from the center of each dough round. Gently press the edges together. Fold the dough in half and gently press the edges together. Using a sharp knife, cut a 5-inch circle from the center of each dough round. Bake in a 375 oven for about 20 minutes or until golden. Cool on a wire rack.

Cook the pasta in plenty of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking. Put the pasta in a bowl and toss together with the potatoes and green beans. Just before serving, add the pesto, stir to coat the pasta and vegetables lightly and season to taste. Serve this salad at room temperature or chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cut tenderloin into 1/4-inch slices. Combine tenderloin, caesar dressing and canola oil in large ziploc bag. Seal bag and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. Heat pitas as directed on package. Remove tenderloin from bag, discarding marinade and drizzle with ranch dressing. Divide tenderloin evenly among pitas. Top with cucumber and red onion slices. Serves 4.

Place pork chops on a plate and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper. Mix breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup cheese and sage in a small bowl. Beat eggs and milk in another small bowl. Beat remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper with flour in a third bowl. Dip each chop in egg mixture, then flour mixture, then roll in crumb mixture to coat all sides evenly. Set aside. Melt 3 tablespoons butter and 1 teaspoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork chops and cook 2 minutes on each side until browned evenly. Transfer chops to a baking dish and place in oven. Pour off drippings from skillet and add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add lemon peel and remaining 1/4 cup cheese and cook over medium heat until cheese is melted and lemon is wilted, about 2 minutes. Pour sauce over chops and serve with rice and vegetable of choice.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, warm the oil for about a minute. Add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute or until the garlic is soft and translucent. Add the tomatoes and cook for about 1 minute or until the tomatoes break down into a saucy consistency. Add the arugula and cook for about 1 minute or until the arugula has wilted and the sauce is reduced slightly. Add the penne and cook for about 4 minutes or until the pasta has softened. Season with the chili pepper flakes and the salt and parmesan cheese and stir until evenly distributed. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Add black mustard seeds, asafoetida powder, cayenne, onions and saute until onions turn golden. Add tomatoes and salt. Saute until tomatoes are soft. Add hot chili peppers. Add salt to taste. Serve hot.

Season pork chops with paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper and black pepper and salt on both sides. Drizzle pork chops with olive oil and place in a dish. Roast in a pre-heated oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until internal temp is 160 degrees and pork is golden brown and cooked through. Prepare the potatoes while pork is cooking. Peel sweet potatoes and cut into pieces about 1 inch thick and place on a cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with cumin and salt and pepper to taste and roast in oven for about 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown. Remove from oven and drizzle with maple syrup and stir together.

Slice baguette in half lengthwise and then in half again lengthwise. Spread 1 side of each half with cream cheese and top with tomatoes and green onions. Bake at 425 for 5 minutes until cheese is melted. Remove from oven and top with roast beef and sprinkle with black pepper. Serve hot.

Combine all ingredients except breadcrumbs and onion. Form into 1 inch balls. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat and add meatballs. Cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes. Transfer meatballs to slow cooker insert with onion. Add remaining 1/2 cup water and cook on high for about 3 hours or low for about 6 hours.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f (163 degrees c).Line 2 cookie sheets with waxed paper.In a large bowl, mix together the syrup, brown sugar, canola oil and vanilla extract until smooth. In a separate bowl, mix together the oats and cinnamon. Add the oat mixture to the syrup mixture and stir well. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dishes and spread evenly.Bake for 1 hour and remove from the oven. Remove the granola from the baking dish and place on a cutting board or flat surface. Use a knife to cut the granola into 1-inch squares. Place the granola back into the baking dish and bake for another hour. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely before serving.Store the granola in an air-tight container and refrigerate for up to one week.

Preheat broiler. Combine vinegar and sugar and stir well. Place tenderloin in shallow baking dish and pour marinade over the tenderloin. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator overnight. Broil for 8-10 minutes or until tenderloin is cooked through. Baste with marinade frequently. Serve with brown rice and steamed broccoli.

Cook linguine in rapidly boiling salted water until al dente. Drain. Add olive oil to skillet along with prawns, red chilies, garlic and flat leaf parsley. Cook prawns until they change color. Remove from heat. Toss with linguine. Taste and season. Garnish with parsley and lemon rind.
In a large bowl, combine the beef and pork. Add the onions and mix well. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Place in a greased 9 inch by 5 inch loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour.

Combine tuna, cream cheese, capsicum in a bowl with margarine. Spread on 2 slices of bread. Top with other slices of bread. Wrap in plastic wrap or foil and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Slice on a diagonal and serve.

Sauté onion and celery in a heavy skillet until tender but not brown. Add the garlic clove and beef broth. Bring to a boil and then simmer for five minutes. Add the squirrel and mix well. Add the fresh ground black pepper and mix well. Add the Mexicorn and mix well. Add the cornstarch and stir until thickened. Remove from heat and let stand for ten minutes before pouring into a prepared pastry shell for a single-crust pie or a prepared pie pan for a double-crust pie. Let stand until cool enough to handle. Cover with the pastry and crimp the edges together with your fingers. Brush the pastry with the egg yolk and water mixture and sprinkle with the granulated sugar. Bake the pie at 400° for approximately forty minutes or until the pastry is golden brown and cooked through.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Toss the eggplant and the garlic cloves with the oil and spread on a baking sheet. Bake for about 55 minutes or until the eggplant is soft. Let cool for 2 minutes. Chop the garlic and the eggplant and place them into a food processor. Add the basil leaves and the vinegar. Pulse and process to a smooth puree. Season with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature.

Combine all marinade ingredients in a food processor and pulse until very finely chopped. Place steak in a shallow glass or plastic container and pour marinade over top of steak. Cover and marinate for at least 1 hour but no more than overnight. Remove steak from the marinade and grill to desired doneness. Serve with the marinade as a sauce for dipping steak into or over the top of the steak as a basting sauce.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line 2 large baking sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, caster sugar, desiccated coconut, egg whites, vanilla extract, salt and baking soda until well blended. Add the corn flakesstir until well coated. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely. Melt the butter with the brown sugar over medium heat, stirring until the sugar has dissolved. Stir in the nuts. Spread evenly over the cookies.

Soak rice in milk overnight. Next day, place rice in pan with milk, cinnamon stick, lemon rind, and salt. Bring just to a boil over medium heat. Lower heat to very low. Cook uncovered 1 hour 30 minutes or until rice is very tender. Remove cinnamon stick. Blend egg yolks and sugar in blender. Add yolk mixture to rice mixture. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thickened. Cool slightly. Stir in butter and nutmeg. Serve warm or chilled.
Preheat waffle iron. In a large bowl combine all ingredients. Beat until smooth. Fill waffle iron to desired thickness and bake until golden brown. Makes 4 waffles.

Wash and hull strawberries and peaches. Hull blueberries and cherries. Mash all fruit well using your fingers or a potato masher. Add lemon juice and dry pectin and mix well. Put mixture into a large bowl. Let stand for 2 hours. Add honey and mix well. Pour into clean, hot half pint jars leaving 1/2 inch head space. Wipe rim of jars and place lids on jars. Tighten lids securely. Process filled jars in boiling water bath for 10 minutes for pints and 5 minutes for half-pints. Remove jars from canner and let stand for 24 hours. Check seals. Any unsealed jars should be refrigerated and used within 2 weeks.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and cook 3 minutes or until softened. Add apples and cook 2 minutes. Add vinegar and stir. Add chiles and cook 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients and cook 3 more minutes. Serve warm.

Pre-bake pie crust. Fill pie crust with vegan pumpkin pie mix and bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. After the pie is done cooking, cool in pie crust for 1-2 hours before removing from pie crust and cooling on a wire rack. Melt coconut oil and honey in a saucepan. Add cashews and stir well until all cashews are coated. Let cool slightly and then pour over pumpkin pie filling and spread out evenly with a spoon. Cool in refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Garnish with walnuts or pecans. Serve chilled.

Cut up fresh peaches and place in blender container. Add peach juice and lemon juicepuree until smooth. Pour into pitcher or container and add ginger alestir to mix. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve over ice cubes and enjoy!

Mix first 4 ingredients well and pour into small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly until it boils and thickens slightly (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Peel and mince ginger and combine it with pepper flakes and 3 tablespoons sherry vinegar in small bowl. Pat chicken dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper and set aside. Preheat grill to medium-high. Prepare skewers by threading 4 pieces of chicken on each skewer. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon ginger mixture on each skewer. Grill skewers on both sides until cooked through and lightly browned on all sides (about 5 minutes per side). Serve with remaining ginger mixture and remaining vinegar on side.

In a large skillet over medium heat saut mushrooms and green peppers in butter until tender. Add ground beef and brown. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Pour in tomato soup and cream of mushroom soup. Heat through. Pour into 13 x 9 inch pan. Top with cheese. Bake 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Serve over cooked pasta or rice.

Beat cream cheese and sugar together until fluffy. Add sour cream. Add eggs one at a time. Blend until smooth. Stir in lemon juice and lemon zest. Pour into a prepared pie crust. Bake at 375f for 30 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Serve chilled.

Place the lentils in a colander and rinse under cold running water for about 1 minute. This will remove any dust or debris from the lentils and improve their appearance and flavor. Rinse the lentils again and drain them in a colander. Place the rinsed lentils in a medium saucepan. Add the water, turmeric, and salt and bring the mixture to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the lentils until the water is absorbed and the lentils are tender and cooked through, about 40 minutes. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for about 10 minutes until soft and translucent. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute or until fragrant. Add the dried red chilies and cook for another minute. Add the cumin seeds and stir for about 1 minute until fragrant. Remove the lentils from the heat and add the onion mixture and stir gently with a spoon until the mixture is evenly blended and the lentils are well coated with the

Boil 1 cup of water with tea bag for 10 minutes. Remove bag and allow to cool slightly. Combine boiled tea with 1 cup of water and ice. Blend together until smooth and chill. Pour into tall glasses and top with 1 tbsp of yogurt and 1 tbsp of chocolate chips. Enjoy!

Peel and boil potatoes in water until soft. Mash with lemon juice. Add 1/2 cup flour. Mix well. Add 1/2 cup milk. Beat with a fork. Add 2 eggs. Beat well. Add remaining flour. Add enough water so batter is easy to stir. Let stand 10 minutes. Heat oil in skillet. Add 2 tablespoonfuls of batter at a time. Fry until golden brown. Serve with applesauce. Makes 6 servings.

Place the rice, water and salt in the inner pot of the cooker. Stir well to combine. Cover and cook for 10 minutes on high pressure. Remove from the cooker and let stand for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Stir in the parsley. Heat the oil in a small skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add the peas and corn and saute until heated through. Stir in the parsley. Serve the rice topped with the vegetable mixture.

Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add chicken cutlets and cook until lightly browned and cooked through. Remove cutlets from pan and allow to rest. Cut brie cheese into 1/4 inch slices and lay on top of each cutlet. In the same pan, heat mango chutney and add sliced sweet onions. Saute until softened and lightly browned. Place cutlet and brie cheese on a piece of focaccia bread. Add the mango-onion mixture and serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Marinate lamb for 30 minutes in a resealable plastic bag. Place lamb in a roasting pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and spoon off any excess fat. In a small bowl combine honey and sherry. Brush lamb with honey mixture and place in oven. Bake for 10 minutes longer or until internal temperature reaches 150 degrees F. Remove lamb from oven. Combine remaining honey mixture and hoisin sauce in a small bowl. Drizzle over lamb. Broil 2 minutes or until glaze is bubbly. Garnish with orange zest and sesame seeds. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray. Place tortillas on a flat surface. Divide the cranberries into 4 equal portions. Spread 1/4 of the feta cheese over the tortilla. Top with the cranberries. Place a second tortilla on top. Spread with 1/4 of the cream cheese. Roll the tortilla like a jelly roll. Secure with a toothpick. Repeat with remaining tortillas. Place pinwheels onto baking sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until light brown. Serve with a side of sour cream. Makes 4 servings.

Butterfly chicken breast, laying it flat and opening it like a book. Lay one slice of swiss and one slice of ham on each breast and roll up as if making a jelly roll. Brush with margarine and wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Next day, remove from refrigerator and unwrap the breast. Place in a greased baking dish and add cream of mushroom soup and sour cream and bake at 350 for one hour.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Slit open the bread and spread pizza sauce inside. Sprinkle with pizza seasoning. Top with cheese and pepperoni. Bake in oven for 15-20 minutes. Serve warm.

In a small bowl, combine the dressing and wine. Marinate the fish in the mixture for 15 minutes. Combine the mustard and cream and spoon over the fish. Broil the fish for about 3 minutes on each side. Serve with rice and fresh green beans.

Cream together the cream cheese and butter until light and fluffy. Mix together the flour and the parmesan cheese and then sift into the cream cheese mixture. Combine the flour mixture into the cream cheese mixture. Divide the dough into two portions. Shape each portion into a ball then flatten each ball into a disc shape, approx 20cm wide by 2cm thick. Sprinkle each disc with the poppy seeds and then press down to cover the surface with poppy seeds. Use a 4. 5cm cutter to cut out the shapes and place onto a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper. Bake the shortbread for 15 minutes or until lightly browned on the bottom. Remove from the oven, allow to cool for a few minutes before removing from the baking tray to a wire rack to cool completely. The shortbread will keep well for at least 1 week if stored in an airtight container.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the scallions and saut until tender-crisp. Add the salmon fillets and saut until browned and cooked through. Stir in the garlic and cook for about 1 minute more. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the tomatoes and capers. Spoon the mixture evenly over the top of the fish. In a small bowl, combine the butter and the parsley. Melt the mixture in a microwave or over low heat in a small saucepan. Spoon the butter over the fish and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve the fish with the sauce spooned over the top.

1. Beat eggs and sugar. Add salt and vanilla. Add margarine. Beat. Add cinnamon. Spread in a 9x13x2 inch glass dish. 2. Core and slice apples and place in the dish. 3. Lay wide egg noodles over the apples and cover with the cinnamon mixture. 4. Bake in a 325 degree oven for about 1 hour and 10 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 8.

In a large saucepan heat the butter. Stir in the rice and sauté over medium heat for 4 minutes. Stir in the onion and garlic and continue to sauté for 1 minute. Stir in the tomato paste and continue to sauté for 1 minute. Stir in the broth and chiliesbring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cover. Simmer until all the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the cilantro and olives. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Bring water to a boil in a 4 quart sauce pan. Add pasta. Cook until al dente. Drain pasta in a colander. Put pasta in a large bowl. In the pan the pasta was cooked in over medium high heat, melt butter. Add onion. Cook for 2 minutes until onion is lightly browned. Add tomatoes. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add pasta to mixture in bowl. Sprinkle with pecorino romano cheese. Serve immediately. Serves 4 to 6.
Place tamales in crock pot. Cover with onion, corn, tomato sauce and chili powder. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Cover and cook on low 4 - 5 hours. Sprinkle with olives just before serving.
In heavy sauce pan combine honey and water. Add oatmeal and mix well. Bring mixture to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in whiskey. Serve with raspberries on top.

Heat oil in a saucepan. Add the jalapenos and chilies. Saute until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and continue cooking for 1 more minute. Stir in the milk, cream cheese, onion flakes and cayenne. Cook until smooth. In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta until al dente. Drain the pasta. Stir in the milk mixture. Transfer to a baking dish. Top with the monterey jack cheese. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro.
Mix sauce together. Rub salmon with some sauce. Let stand for 15 minutes. Grill or bake salmon over medium heat for about 15 minutes per side. Serve with more sauce.

Place potatoes in 2-quart casserole sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake 35 minutes. Remove from ovenstir in soup, cheese, sour cream, onion, pimentos. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake 15 minutes longer. Sprinkle with french-fried onions. Bake 5 minutes more.

In large bowl beat shortening and cream of tartar until crumbly. Beat in vanilla, then gradually beat in powdered sugar alternating with milk until well blended. Beat in additional 3 cups powdered sugar and vanilla until of spreading consistency. Use immediately or refrigerate. If refrigerated bring to room temperature and beat until spreading consistency before using.

Season chicken with salt and pepper. Dip in flour, shake off excess. Heat oil in a skillet. Add chicken. Cook 3 to 4 minutes per side until golden brown. Add butter to pan. Cook 1 minute. Add broth and lemon juice. Cover tightly. Cook 5 minutes. Uncover. Add lemon slices. Cook 2 minutes. Serve immediately. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 375. Spray a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray or grease with butter. Mix together bran and 1/2 cup of the flour. In a medium bowl combine the egg whites and 1 cup of the flour. Add the bran mixture and beat well. Add yogurt and continue beating. Stir in the next 3 ingredients. Spoon into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 12 muffins.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add fusilli and cook for 10 minutes or until al dente. Meanwhile, heat a large sauté pan over medium-high heat and add oil. When oil is hot add garlic and stir for 1 minute. Add spinach and cook for about 1 minute or until spinach is wilted. Add diced tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes or until tomatoes have broken down. Add crushed red pepper flakes and season with salt and pepper. Remove pan from heat and drain fusilli. Add fusilli to pan with spinach and tomatoes and toss well. Add prosciutto and cook for 1 minute or until prosciutto is crispy. Serve with parmigiano-reggiano cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly coat 8 x 8-inch pan with cooking spray. Toss potatoes with garlic cloves. In a medium bowl combine olive oil, parsley and 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Toss potatoes with oil mixture. Place potatoes into prepared pan. Roast for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Bake for 15 minutes more. Stir potatoes. Bake for 10 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender.

Melt butter in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Add corn and thyme and saute until corn is just beginning to soften, about 2 minutes. Sprinkle with 1/2 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper. Add milk and increase heat to high. Bring milk just to simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until thick enough to coat back of spoon, stirring occasionally and mashing occasionally with spoon. Transfer mixture to large bowl. Stir in eggs with wooden spoon until incorporated. Return mixture to saucepan and cook over medium heat until mixture is thick enough to form soft mounds with spoon and pulls away from sides of pan, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes. Transfer to large bowl and stir in 1 tbsp melted butter and 1/4 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper. Let cool 5 minutes. Spoon batter into 8-cup souffle dish or 8 individual ramekins. Bake until spoon bread is golden and firm to touch, about 30 minutes. Serve warm with butter.

Slice the red onion into 1/4 inch rounds. Put the red onion into a small ovenproof dish. Scatter the vinegar and wine over the onion. Sprinkle with a little sugar. Cover with foil and bake at 325f for 40 minutes. Remove the foil from the dish and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Serve with meat or cheese.

In a frying pan, heat olive oil over medium heat and saute onion until soft. Add pancetta. Continue to saute until crispy. Add canned tomatoes and bocconcini cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add pasta to pan and toss until well combined. Serve with fresh green onion garnish.
Heat oil, add onion and garlic and saute till tender. Add chickpeas and cook till tender. Add ketchup and season with salt and pepper and hot pepper sauce, if desired. Serve with chapatis.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 8 inch square baking dish. In a saucepan, over medium heat, combine butter, eggs, sour cream, sugar and cream cheese. Stir constantly with a wooden spoon until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and beat in vanilla. Pour into prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with fruit preserves. Bake uncovered 25-30 minutes or until set. Cool slightly. Serve topped with whipped cream.

Place rice in cooker, add water, broth, salt and pepper. Cook on high pressure for 5 minutes, then turn cooker off and let sit for another 10 minutes. Meanwhile, brown chicken breast in a skillet with oil over medium heat. Add cabbage, bok choy, green onions, salt and pepper and cook until done. Put rice in a bowl and pour the chicken, cabbage mixture over the rice. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat melt butter and add flour and stir until smooth. Add broth and stir until thickened. Add hot water and heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Stir in cheez wiz and guinness stout and stir until well combined and heated through. Add worcestershire sauce and garlic powder and stir until well combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh chives before serving.

In the bowl of a food processor, combine basil and garlic. Pulse until coarsely chopped. Add pine nuts and pulse until very finely chopped. Add the water and cheese and pulse until well combined. With the machine running, drizzle in the olive oil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add crushed red pepper flakes to taste. Transfer to an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to a week. Serve with pasta.

Cream shortening and sugar. Add egg yolks. Add milk and vanilla. Combine flour and baking powder. Add to creamed mixture and blend well. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut with 1 1/2-inch round cutter. Sprinkle with pecans and cinnamon. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 10 minutes or until edges are golden.

Spray a 9x9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl mix squash and onion. In another bowl mix soup and sour cream. Add stuffing mix and butter. In a small bowl combine sage and onion powder. Add to squash mixture. Add soup mixture and cheddar cheese. Pour into baking dish. Bake uncovered at 375 degrees for 40 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Yields 6 servings.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add the carrot, celery, onion, and tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.

Heat broth to a boil. Add orzo. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes or so, stirring occasionally. Stir in eggscook and stir until eggs are set. Stir in lemon juice. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.

Slice squash 1/4-inch thick. In a large bowl combine squash with onion. Pour milk over squashcover and marinate in refrigerator 1 hour. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine soup, breadcrumbs, cheese and Cajun seasoning in a bowl. Drain squash from milk. Place in a shallow baking dishtop with cheese mixture. Bake, uncovered 30 minutes or until golden brown and heated through.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease muffin pan. Blend baking mix, skim milk and sugar until well blended. Beat in egg substitute and applesauce. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Sprinkle with blueberries. Bake 20 minutes. Cool 5 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 12 muffins.

Prepare eggplant and peppers for grilling by cutting them into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Drizzle with olive oil. Grill on both sides until charred and soft. In a medium bowl combine goat cheese with mustard. Spread some of the cheese mixture onto 6 slices of bread. Top with eggplant and peppers. Top with remaining cheese mixture. Cover with remaining bread slices. Cut into 4 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray 8-inch square glass or ceramic baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, soymilk, sugar, yogurt, and vanilla. In another bowl, beat eggs with a whisk. Add egg mixture to flour mixture, beating until just combined. Pour batter into prepared dish. Arrange sliced fruit on top of batter. Bake 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F. Bake 15 to 20 minutes longer or until center is just set. Cool 5 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion until softened, add garlic, cook 1 minute. Add chopped tomatoes. Season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon hot pepper sauce. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, cook 10 to 15 minutes until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in basil. Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Arrange chicken breast halves on a baking sheet and bake until no longer pink, about 20 minutes. Cut chicken into bite sized pieces. Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain well. Toss hot pasta with sauce, chicken and cheese until well blended. Garnish with more parmesan cheese if desired. Serves 4 to 6.

Combine tomato and cucumber in a small bowl. Add spinach and feta cheese. In a separate bowl combine vinegar and oil. Season with pepper and stir. Spoon over salad. Spread pita with veggie burger and top with salad. Serve with more veggie burger.

Beat eggs with a fork until smooth. Melt butter over medium heat in a nonstick skillet. Add eggs and stir constantly until the eggs start to set. Lower the heat and cook until eggs are completely set but still moist (10 to 12 minutes). Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with your favorite toast or rolls.

Heat the oil in a 6 quart heavy pot over medium high heat. Add the sausage and cook until browned. Add the onion and garlic and saute until the onion is tender and translucent. Add the beans and broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover the pot, reduce the heat to medium low and simmer the soup until the beans are tender and the flavors have blended, about 45 minutes. Stir in the tomato and oregano. Bring the soup back to a boil and add the kale. Cover and simmer until the kale is wilted, about 5 minutes more. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine 1/2 cup blueberries, sugar, ginger, lemon zest and juice, cinnamon in a small bowl. Set aside. In another small bowl, combine remaining 1/2 cup blueberries, baking mix and milk. Mix well. Pour blueberry mixture into bottom of an 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Spread blueberry batter over top. Bake for 40 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl, mix together the sugar, shortening and pumpkin until well blended. Beat in the egg until smooth. Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and saltstir into pumpkin mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool for 1 minute before removing from baking sheets to wire racks. Cool completely. Makes about 4 dozen.

Place chicken breasts in the bottom of the slow cooker. In a bowl combine the mushroom soup, dry onion soup mix and cream cheese. Spread over the chicken breasts. In a skillet cook the onions and mushrooms in butter until tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour over the chicken breasts. Pour chicken broth over all. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours. Remove chicken breasts and shred with two forks. Mix back with the other ingredients and serve over rice.

Mix ketchup and hot sauce in a small bowl. Add sour cream and stir well. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add chicken and cook, turning once, until cooked through. Transfer chicken to a plate. Add honey, paprika, and cumin to the skillet. Stir for 30 seconds or until thickened. Spoon sauce over chicken.
cook beef. drain. add onion. add salt. add cheese. add milk. add bisquick mix. add eggs. put in oven.

Combine cereal, tortilla chips, and popcorn in large container. In a saucepan, combine butter and sugar. Stir until melted. Add light corn syrup and stir until well blended. Add chili powder, cinnamon and red pepper flakes. Pour over cereal mixture. Stir well to coat. Allow to cool. Store in an air tight container. Makes about 20 servings.

Cook pasta according to directions on package. Drain. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add shrimp. Cook until pink. Add garlic. Cook 2 minutes. Add carrots, snap peas and red pepper. Cook 5 minutes. Add alfredo sauce. Cook 1 minute. Toss with pasta. Garnish with parsley.

Place carrots in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil then cover and simmer until tender. Drain carrots and place in a large bowl. Combine honey, gingerroot and juices and pour over the carrots. Stir until well coated. Add the tapioca starch and stir. Heat over medium heat until glaze thickens. Sprinkle with white pepper and serve hot.

Cut celery hearts into 1-inch slices. In bowl combine soy sauce, salt, sesame oil, sugar, and hot sauce. Place celery slices in bowl. Toss until celery is coated. Serve on lettuce leaves or in lettuce cups.

Warm a skillet over medium heat. Add the light olive oil and the lamb cutlets. Cook for about 3 to 4 minutes on each side, or until just cooked through. Place the cutlets on a serving plate. In a small bowl mix the grainy mustard and the rosemary. Spread this mixture over each cutlet. Drizzle the cutlets with a little more light olive oil. Sprinkle with sea salt and cracked pepper. Serve at once with roasted vegetables or salad.
Combine all ingredients and mix well. Form into meatballs and bake at 350 degrees until done.

Cook the chicken stock and pour in a pot. Whisk in the eggs and salt and black pepper to taste. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 1 minute. Add the parmigiano-reggiano cheese, nutmeg and parsley. Stir until the cheese has completely melted. Serve immediately. Serves 2.

Whisk together vinegar, honey and oil until well blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add almonds and arugula, toss well. Divide among plates. Top with sliced tomatoes and shaved cheese. Garnish with additional almonds.

Cut the bacon into small pieces and cook it with the leek, garlic, red pepper and zucchini in a little olive oil. Season with black pepper. Put a little of this mixture into the cup of each individual serving dish and top each with a basil leaf. Break the egg into the cup and top with some tasty cheese. Cook under the grill until the egg is done to your liking. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Saute onions for about 10 minutes, or until they turn golden brown and begin to caramelize. Add ketchup and vinegar and cook until reduced and thickened. Add the rest of the spices and cook for about a minute more, until the mixture is aromatic and seasoned to taste. Serve over hot dogs and enjoy.

Cream together cream cheese and sugar. Gradually add the fruit juice concentrate. Chop up the strawberries and mix into the cream cheese mixture. Put 2-4 chocolate chip cookies into the bottom of a small bowl. Cover the cookies with the cream cheese mixture. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Top with a dollop of Cool Whip and a fresh strawberry before serving.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a 9x13-inch baking dish, layer 3 hash brown patties. Top with 1/2 cup cheese and 1/4 cup butter. Repeat layers once. Top with remaining 1/2 cup cheese and 1/4 cup butter. In a small bowl, combine remaining 1/2 cup cheese with half-and-half, paprika, salt and pepper. Pour over top. Bake until heated through.

Using an electric mixer, beat creamy peanut butter, butter, and cream cheese until well blended. Add vanilla extract and powdered sugar. Beat until well combined. Stir in oreo cookies. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to use.

Mix together the sauce ingredients. In a large mixing bowl combine ground beef, egg, Worcestershire Sauce, and sauce mixture. Add bread crumbs, salt and pepper. Form into loaf shape and place in a greased baking dish. Cover with bacon and then cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 10 minutes. Uncover and top with cheddar cheese. Bake until brown and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Toss cherry tomatoes with oil and seasonings in an 8 by 8 by 2 inch baking dishbake until tomatoes are softened and begin to brown, about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly. In a blender or food processor, puree garlic and 1/2 cup tomatoes until smooth. Set aside. Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In a bowl, whisk eggs until well combinedgradually whisk in milk and flour until smooth and well blended. Pour custard over reserved cherry tomatoessprinkle with Italian seasoning, Parmesan, and pepperbake until custard is set and center is slightly wobbly, about 25 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with provolonelet stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with pesto, if desired.

Cook the cauliflower in boiling salted water until crisp-tender, about 4 minutes. Drain cauliflower, reserving 1 cup cooking liquid. Let cool, then place cauliflower in a large bowl. Heat the chili in a small saucepan until almost softened. Add garlic and cook until tender. Add the chili and garlic to the cauliflower along with the green onions. Beat the mayonnaise with the garam masala, paprika, lemon juice, and reserved cauliflower cooking liquid. Add the shrimp along with the mayonnaise mixture to the cauliflower mixture. Add the lettuce. Garnish with the fresh cilantro leaves. Serve immediately.

Put the potatoes and carrots in the blender. Blend until smooth and liquidy. Add the nutritional yeast. Blend for 30 seconds. Add the flour, onion flakes and spices. Blend for 30 seconds or until flour is completely incorporated. Cook on a skillet or griddle like hash browns. Sprinkle with dried onion.

To make the crust: combine the flour, salt and nutmeg in a bowl. Stir in the butter until it forms fine crumbs. Sprinkle in the ice water and stir until the dough comes together. Shape the dough into two disks, flatten each slightly with your hands, wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. To make the filling: place the sour cream in a mixing bowl. Add the brown sugar, nutmeg and egg yolks. Whisk together until well blended. Stir in the brandy. Heat the oven to 350f. Put one pie shell on a baking sheet. Pour in the filling and top with the dates. Lay the remaining pie shell on top. Bake until the edges are golden brown and the center is set, about 45 minutes. If the crust gets too dark, cover loosely with foil. Cool on a wire rack. To make the topping: combine the confectioners' sugar, nutmeg and salt in a bowl. Stir in the melted butter and then the brandy. Spo
Slowly melt the chocolate and the milk together in the microwave or on the stove. Add the sugar and the cinnamon. Serve hot.

In a large saute pan over medium heat add oil and saute the onions until translucent. Add the rice and water and stir to combine. Add the lentils and stir. Cover the pan and cook on low heat for about 25 minutes or until all the water has been absorbed and the rice and lentils are soft. Season with salt. Serve as a main dish or as a side dish.
In a bowl combine meat, ricotta and cayenne. Add carrot and stir. Stuff into each of 16 roma tomatoes. Place in baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve warm.

Beat butter and sugar in large bowl with electric mixer until fluffy. Beat in flour, salt and vanilla. Shape dough into 20 balls. Roll balls in powdered sugar. Place balls on ungreased baking sheets. Flatten balls with bottom of glass dipped in powdered sugar. Bake 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on baking sheets. Store in airtight containers. Makes about 36 cookies.

Combine oil, gingerroot, and garlic in small bowl. Stir in mushrooms and green onions and cook until crisp-tender. Stir in soy sauce, cooking sherry, and sesame oil. Add ramen noodles and toss until heated through and coated with sauce. Cook beef in small skillet until done (about 3 minutes per side for medium-rare)cut into thin strips. Toss with ramen mixture and sprinkle with sesame seeds and scallions. Serve with rice or crispbreads.

In a large bowl combine the teriyaki sauce with the chinese five spice powder. Add the chicken pieces and toss until evenly coated. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least one hour or overnight. Remove the chicken from the marinade and reserve the marinade. Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat until smoking. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Remove the chicken from the pan. Add the marinade. Bring to a boil. Return the chicken to the pan and add the cornstarch mixture. Continue cooking until the sauce is thickened. Serve the chicken with the sauce drizzled over the top. Sprinkle with the green onions and cilantro.

Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the onion and saute over medium heat. Cook until soft. Add the ginger, pepper, cinnamon and sugar. Stir well. Cover the saucepan and simmer gently for 4-6 minutes until soft. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Mix flour, sugar, cinnamon, and butter together until crumbly and press into a buttered 13-inch by 11-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered in a 400-degree oven for 10 minutes. In a large bowl combine cranberry sauce and yams and mix well. Spoon yam mixture over crumbs and bake uncovered for about 1 hour or until yams are tender and topping is crisp and golden. Let cool slightly and sprinkle with marshmallowsreturn to oven for 10 minutes or until the marshmallows are golden. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 350. In an 8x8 pan mix cream cheese and butter. In a skillet cook corn and diced jalapenos. Once cool add to mixture. In a bowl combine flour and milk. Pour over mixture. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. In a small bowl, combine the blackberries and sugarset aside. In a small bowl, combine the balsamic vinegar, salt and pepperset aside. Brush the cut sides of the bread with olive oil. Divide the sage and cheese between the slices. Grill the bread for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until grill marks appear. Spread the blackberry mixture on one side of each slice. Top each slice with the smoked turkey and top with the cheese. Serve immediately.

Combine yeast and warm water and let stand until bubbles form on top of the mixture about 10 minutes. Combine honey and olive oil and set aside. Combine wheat and flax seed meals and mix well. Combine water and yeast mixture and add flours and honey-oil mixture. Beat well and knead for 10 minutes on medium speed or until smooth and elastic. Place dough in greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap and let rise for 1 hour or until double in size. Punch down and shape into 2 loaves and place in greased loaf pan(s). Let rise 45 minutes or until double. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until done. Cool slightly before slicing and serving.
Combine the watermelon, raspberries, sugar, and orange juice in a blenderpuree until smooth. Chill 3 hours or overnight. Freeze in ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions.

In a large bowl, combine the pecans, sugar, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne pepper and oilmix well. Spread the pecan mixture in a single layer onto a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 250 for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutescool completely. In a small bowl, combine the honey and water until smoothdrizzle over the pecans and stir gently until coated. Chill until ready to serve. Yields 6 servings (1/4 cup each).

Heat oil in a large dutch oven over medium high heat. Add onions and garlic and saute for 2 minutes or until onions are soft. Add beans and rice, stir together with the liquid from the bean package. Add coconut milk, water or stock and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer until thickened, about 20 minutes. Stir in cilantro before serving. Serve with lime wedges for extra flavor.

Melt butter in medium saucepan. Add graham crackers and stir until well combined. Pour mixture into greased 9x9x2-inch pan. Bake 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Beat sugar and egg in small bowl. Combine with pineapple. Spread over graham cracker mixture. Top with bananas. Spoon whipped cream over bananas and spread. Sprinkle with nuts and cherry.

Wash the lettuce leaves, cut them in quarters. Heat the margarine in a pan, add carrot and zucchini. Saut until they are soft, add the marjoram. Add the fish fillets and saut a little more. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Lay a lettuce leaf on a plate, put the fish on it. Wrap up like a package and serve.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add banana slicescook 1 minute on each side or until bananas are lightly browned and crisp-tender. Add eggscook 1 minute or until set. Top eggs with cinnamon and salt. Serve immediately.
Combine tomato sauce and brown sugar. Add pork chops. Cover and cook on high for 5 to 6 hours. Drain off excess liquid. Add lemon juice and stir to mix.

Trim off the bottoms of the asparagus spears. Place an asparagus spear in the center of each piece of prosciutto. Wrap each spear with prosciutto. Place asparagus bundles in a shallow baking dish. Combine olive oil, salt and black pepper. Pour over asparagus bundles. Bake in the oven at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Spoon roasted red peppers over the bundles. Top with goat cheese. Place under broiler for 1-2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Peel the potatoes and slice into thin slices. Boil the potatoes in salted water for about 10 minutes or until they are soft. Drain the potatoes. Melt the butter in a small saucepan on the stove top. In a large bowl combine the potatoes, sugar, eggs, salt and the melted butter. Add enough of the flour to form a soft dough. Knead the dough for about 3 minutes on a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough into 12 equal balls. Place 1 plum into each of the balls of dough. Wrap the dough around the plums to form dumplings. Heat the butter in a frying pan. Add the dumplings to the pan and fry for 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. While the dumplings are frying make the sauce by mixing the sugar cube with the water to make syrup. Add the breadcrumbs and cinnamon to the syrup and heat to dissolve the breadcrumbs. Serve the dumplings hot with the sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine applesauce, brown sugar, eggs, Crisco, lemon juice, lemon rind, salt, nutmeg and cinnamon in a large bowl. Pour into pie crust. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes.

Season steak with oil and lime juice. Let sit for 1 hour. Grill until desired doneness. When done. Cut across the grain into thin slices. Add the oil, garlic, cumin, chili powder and jalapeno pepper. Saute until the garlic and jalapeno are softened. Add the cilantro and serve with steak. Serves 4.

Cook ground beef in a skillet with taco seasoning mix. Drain and reserve 2 cups of the broth. Heat soup over medium heat. Stir in milk and add beef and broth. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 3 minutes or until soup is heated through. Remove from heat and stir in chilies. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve with toppings of your choice. Top with tortilla chips.

Slice the squid rings and place in a bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and add the garlic. Add the red wine and the crushed tomatoes and stir to coat well. Let marinade for an hour. Heat the olive oil in a saute pan and add the calamari rings. Cook over medium high heat for about 5 minutes or until the squid is just done. Sprinkle with the chopped parsley and serve with crusty italian bread.

Spoon yogurt in parfait glasses or other tall glasses or cups. Add granola and berries to the yogurt and add more if you like it more full. Add the banana slices on top and drizzle honey over the top if desired. Enjoy!

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, sage, salt, and pepper. Cook until onion is golden. Add noodles. Cook until noodles are tender. Stir in parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a baking pan with foil. Sprinkle red snapper with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine olive oil with cilantro, parsley, mint leaves and lemon juice. Spread this mixture all over red snapper. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve.

Peel and chop onions. Boil until tender. Drain and mash. Add water, flour, seasonings. Add potatoes mashed with milk. Stir well and form into patties. Heat oil in frying pan over medium heat until hot. Brown patties 4-5 minutes on each side. Serve with mustard or ketchup if desired.

In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Add bacon and cook 6 minutes or until browned. Stir in onions and cook 2 minutes. Stir in broth and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in brussels sprouts and cook 10 minutes or until sprouts are tender. Stir in vinegar and cook 2 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and mushrooms. Saute 3 minutes. Add sage. Stir in potatoes. Add water. Bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat. Simmer until potatoes are tender and liquid is evaporated. Stir in cream. Simmer 2 minutes. Transfer potatoes and mushrooms to shallow dish. Add sage. Stir in breadcrumbs. Combine potatoes mixture with pork chops in shallow dish. Arrange 6 pork chops in single layer in large shallow baking dish. Spoon potatoes mixture over pork chops. Bake at 375 degrees 50 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine 2 eggs in a large bowl. Beat lightly. Add corn syrup, tart apples, butter, vanilla extract, salt, and ground cinnamon. Stir well. Add 2 macadamia nutsstir to distribute evenly. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake for 45 minutes. Sprinkle top with macadamia nuts. Bake 10 minutes more or until crust is golden brown. Cool on rack for 30 minutes. Melt 2 cups chocolate chips in microwave oven. Drizzle chocolate over top. Cool until chocolate is set. Store at room temperature.

Whisk together the eggs, milk, flour, sugar, vanilla, salt and cinnamon in a bowl. Heat a griddle sprayed with cooking spray over medium heat until hot. Drop batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto the griddle. Cook until bubbles form on the top of the pancakes, turn and continue cooking until the other side is golden brown. Repeat with remaining batter to make 12 pancakes. Stack the pancakes on a plate. Sprinkle with cinnamon and brown sugar. Top with peaches. Makes about 12 pancakes.

combine chocolate liqueur and vodka in shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Pour into chilled martini glass. Drizzle with raspberry preserves. Sprinkle with chocolate shavings. Garnish with fresh raspberries.

Bring rice and 3 cups of water to boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Drain off excess water. In a separate pan, saute onion and garlic powder. Add tomato sauce and bouillon. Heat through. Add to rice. Serve warm.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain pasta. In large mixing bowl combine pasta, mayonnaise, buttermilk, dill, garlic powder and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Place cucumbers into medium bowl. Add sweet red pepper and scallion. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Stir the cucumber mixture into the pasta mixture.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook 3 minutes. Add beef, ketchup, sugar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder and salt and pepper to taste. Cook, stirring occasionally until thoroughly cooked and no longer pink in centerdrain. Serve on hamburger buns.

Slice onion thinly and saute with butter until soft. Stir in rice until it begins to turn opaque. Add chicken stock 2 cups at a time. Add salt and pepper as needed. Cook until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and let sit 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork or spoon.

Heat a medium pot over medium heat. Add the butter and let it melt. Add the whole cumin seed, mustard seeds, and let them crackle for a few seconds. Add the basmati rice and stir the seeds into the rice, letting them cook for a minute or two. Add the butternut squash and let it cook for a minute or two more, until the squash is a bit softened and the seeds are toasted. Add the water and bring it all up to a boil. Once boiling, cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid, turn the heat down to medium-low, and let it cook for about 15 minutes, or until the rice is tender. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for about five minutes with the lid on. Fluff with a fork before serving.

Cream together margarine and sugar until light. Beat in egg and vanilla. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Add to creamed mixture and mix well. Press into an ungreased 15 x 10 inch pan. Bake in a 375f oven for 20 minutes. Meanwhile combine coconut and raspberry jam. Spread over baked crust. Bake in 375f oven for 5 minutes more. Let cool. Cut into squares.

Toss shrimp in soy sauce, set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add green onions, red pepper flakes, pineapple, and cook for 5-6 minutes. Add the shrimp to the skillet and toss. Heat for 2-3 minutes or until shrimp are cooked through. Serve immediately.

Pre-heat the oven to 200 degrees C. Place the onions on a baking tray and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Season and place in the oven for 10 minutes. Mix the honey with the remaining olive oil and 1 tablespoon of sweet chili sauce. Season the chicken with a little salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add the honey mixture and coat the chicken evenly. Place the chicken in the oven for 15 minutes. Slice the onions. Turn the chicken and add the red onion rings. Bake for a further 5 minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven and serve with the onions, lime wedges and sweet chili sauce.

Heat half-and-half, add bouillon cubes. Stir until dissolved. Add pepper, sugar and corn. Cook until hot and thickened. Melt butter in small saucepan. Stir flour into butter until smooth. Gradually add half-and-half mixture, stirring constantly until thickened. Stir in parsley. Pour over corn mixture. Serve immediately.

Boil macaroni in salted water until done. Drain and toss with butter. Whisk together egg and milk. Add to macaroni and toss. Add cottage cheese and sour cream and toss well. Add salt and pepper and basil to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place bread cubes in a bowl. Add milk and stir to mix. Let stand for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until liquid is absorbed. Add sausage, parsley, nutmeg, salt and pepper to mixture. Mix well. Form into 8 patties. Place in baking dish or baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes in oven. Meanwhile cook bacon until crisp. Cut each bacon slice into quarters. Cut each hard boiled egg in half lengthwise. Take each patty out of oven when done and place an egg half on top of each patty. Sprinkle each patty with a quarter slice of bacon. Return to oven for 5 minutes longer or until bacon is crisp. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut off the stems of the chilies, then cut them lengthwise into quarters. Arrange onions and chilies in baking dish. Melt butter in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saute until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in cumin. Continue cooking until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add chicken stock and stir until simmering. Reduce heat to medium-low and continue cooking until stock is reduced to half its original volume, about 15 minutes. Transfer to food processor or blender. Add heavy cream and puree until very smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Pour cream mixture over chilies. Roast until chilies are tender and beginning to brown on edges, about 45 minutes. Remove from oven, sprinkle with lime, then serve.
