In a medium bowl mix the flour with the anise. Cream the butter in an electric mixer. Beat the butter for about 2 minutes. Add the sugar. Beat until light and fluffy. Blend in the flour mixture. Stir in the anise. Wrap in wax paper. Chill for at least 2 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Roll teaspoonfuls of dough into 1-inch balls. Place 1 inch apart on lightly greased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from baking sheets to cool completely. Makes 36 cookies.

Line a 9x5 inch pan with parchment paper. Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir in the sugar until dissolved. Add the evaporated milk and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add the vanilla extract. Pour into pan. Sprinkle the top with the Irish cream and icing sugar. Chill for 3 hours. Cut into squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, combine the sour cream and mustard and spread on the bottom of a shallow 2-quart casserole. Arrange the fish in the casserole. Top each fish with an equal amount of the onions. Sprinkle each fish with an equal amount of the remaining ingredients. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the fish is opaque and flakes easily. Serve hot. Makes four servings.

Cook ground beef until no longer pink. Drain. Add spaghetti sauce and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered for 10 minutes. Stir in macaroni and cheese mix. Cook according to package directions. Add cheese. Top with diced tomatoes.

Preheat oven to 350 degree celsius. Lightly grease and flour a 10 inch spring form pan. Sift together the flour, cocoa, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, one at a time. Beat in the vanilla and water. Add the dry ingredients, beating just until combined. Spread in the prepared pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Allow to cool completely in the pan before removing. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve with ice cream.
Combine all the above in a clean and dry container. Store in an air-tight container.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Season chicken breasts with garlic salt and pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion and saute until tender, about 3 minutes. Add green chilies and saute for an additional 2 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese and Monterey jack cheese until well blended. Add the saut ed vegetables and chicken and mix thoroughly. Stir in the chicken broth and flour. Spoon about 2 tablespoons of mixture into the center of each tortilla and roll up tightly. Place seam side down in a greased 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Spread cream over the top and sprinkle with the remaining Monterey jack cheese. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until hot and bubbly and the cheese is golden brown. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Dissolve jello in boiling water. Mix in lemon juice. Add mayonnaise. Chill until jello is firm. Cut into cubes. Drain corned beef. Remove fat. Chop into cubes. Add to jello mixture. Add celery, green peppers, onions and salt. Toss lightly. Chill overnight. Makes 10 servings.

Drain feta and pat it dry. Coarsely chop it. Heat the oven to 350 degrees. Place feta in a shallow baking dish or casserole and sprinkle with the thyme. Drizzle with the olive oil. Bake for 20 minutes or so, until the cheese is bubbly and golden. Serve at room temperature or warm.

Cook the pasta in boiling water until done. Drain the pasta and cool in ice water. Drain the pasta again. In a bowl combine the pasta with the carrots and green pepper. Toss with the salad dressing. Garnish with the parsley and chives.

In a large stockpot heat oil over medium heat. Cook leeks and cauliflower until tender. Stir in the onion and cook until tender. Add bouillon granules and stir until dissolved. Add cream and simmer until heated through. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm, garnished with parsley.

In a heavy wok, heat oil and add garlic. Add salt, chili powder and coriander. When garlic begins to turn color, add mushrooms and fry for a couple of minutes. Add a little water and cover with a lid. Cook until mushrooms are tender. Remove from heat. In a bowl, mix besan flour with a little water to form a paste. Add lemon juice and stir well. Pour over mushrooms and mix well. Serve hot with rice or chapatti.
Bring water to boil. Add tea bags and sugar. Remove from heat. Stir in pineapple-orange juice concentrate and lemonade concentrate. Serve over ice cubes.

Sprinkle the oysters with rock salt and leave to stand for 5 minutes. Drain and discard the water. Peel the tamarind pulp from the seeds. Place the seeds in a pan with enough water to cover them and bring to the boil. Simmer for 1 minute. Drain the seeds and discard the water. Crush the seeds with a mortar and pestle or a food processor to a fine paste. Blend the honey and sesame oil in a bowl until smooth. Add the tamarind paste and the crushed seeds and blend until smooth. Stir in the lime juice. Serve the sauce with the oysters.

Place mint and ginger in a teapot and cover with boiling water. Steep for 10 minutes. Strain and discard leaves and ginger. Add lemon juice and honey and stir until honey is dissolved. Add water and serve over ice in tall glasses with lemon slices. Garnish with mint if desired.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Peel, mash and return to the pot. Add kielbasa and onion. Add remaining ingredients except sour cream. Cook until vegetables are tender. Thicken with flour mixed with water. Add sour cream. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the red bell pepper and cooked chicken with the salsa until the pepper is tender and the mixture is well blended. Pour into a shallow 11x7 inch baking dish. Cut each tortilla into quarters and arrange over the filling. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Top with sour cream and guacamole. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Butter a 9-inch square baking pan. In a large saucepan combine corn syrup, brown sugar, cocoa powder, and vanilla. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling, cook for 4 minutes, stirring constantly, then remove from heat. Stir in marshmallows and let sit for 3 minutes or until melted and combined. Fold in puffed wheat cereal until evenly coated and pour into prepared pan. Bake for about 15 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Remove from oven and cool to room temperature before cutting into squares.

Cook orecchiette as instructed on package. When pasta has cooled slightly, mix with spinach, olives and mozzarella cheese. Drizzle with red wine vinegar and season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve at room temperature or chilled.

Remove husk from corn, leaving 1/2 inch of husk at top. Soak husked corn in water in a large bowl for 20 minutes. Heat grill or fire pit until hot. Place corn on grill and cook 10 to 15 minutes or until corn is tender and kernels are dark brown. Remove corn from heat and wrap in foil. Serve with melted butter, salt and pepper.

Combine the cream cheese and sour cream. Add in the country ham. Spread into a pie pan. In a small bowl, mix the onion, garlic powder and butter. Spread over the top of the cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle the pecans over the top. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl mix together cinnamon and nutmeg. In a 2 quart casserole dish combine apple pie filling, brown sugar and spice mix. Cover the top of the pie filling with cubed yams. Sprinkle with additional brown sugar. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Mix potato flakes with parmesan cheese. Stir in garlic salt. Spray a 13x9x2 pan with non stick cooking spray. Add vegetables. Pour potato mixture over vegetables. Dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. In a bowl beat together eggs and milk. Pour over vegetables. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Serve hot.

In a wok or large saute pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until golden brown. Add the broccoli, red bell pepper and onion and cook until tender-crisp. Add the tofu and cook until lightly browned and heated through. In a small bowl, combine the cornstarch with the orange juice and stir until smooth. Pour into the wok and stir constantly until thickened. Stir in the mustard and season with salt and pepper if desired. Serve over rice.

Place chicken breast side down on bottom of crockpot. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Combine garlic powder, oregano, lemon juice, lemon rind, garlic and chicken stock and pour over chicken. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours. After 4 hours, turn chicken over and cook for another hour on high until chicken is done. Serve hot. This is so good!

Preheat the grill to medium high heat. Slice the onion and sautee until golden and translucent. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the green beans and sautee for 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Toss with the onions and green beans. Serve the green beans with the sun-dried tomatoes, hearts of palm, pine nuts and balsamic vinegar.

Bake potatoes in microwave for 6 to 7 minutes or bake in 350 degree oven for 45 minutes. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Scoop out insides and mash with remaining ingredients. Return to skins and serve.

Cook spaghetti in boiling water until done. Drain. Heat oleo over med-hi heat in a large skillet. Add onion and green pepper until softened, about 3 minutes. Add mushrooms and saute until they have cooked down. Add frozen broccoli cuts and saute until they are heated through. Sprinkle with oregano and garlic powder. Add cooked spaghetti and sausage and mix well. Top with Parmesan cheese before serving.

In a large saucepan, combine all the dry ingredients. In a small saucepan, combine the honey and vanilla. Heat over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is warm and the honey has melted. Pour the liquid mixture over the dry ingredients. Stir well to moisten. Press evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and cool in pan. Cut into bars. Store in an airtight container.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Add the onion and cook until tender. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tomatoes and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the parsley and cook until tender. Spread the mushroom mixture in a 9x13 inch baking pan. Top with the pierogies. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and the basil. Bake for 20 minutes or until the pierogies are heated through. Sprinkle with the mozzarella and bake for an additional 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper. In large bowl beat cake mix and oil with electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds or until crumbly. Beat in eggs one at a time until just mixed. Stir in flour until dough forms. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool for 1 minute before removing from cookie sheets to wire racks. Store in tightly covered containers.

Dredge each steak in flour and season with salt and pepper. In a skillet, saute onion, carrot and celery in oil until soft. Transfer steaks to crock pot. Add onion mixture, tomato sauce and seasonings. Cook on low heat for 6-8 hours or high heat for 4-5 hours. Serve on buns with coleslaw and potato wedges or fries.
In a small bowl, whisk together honey and sherry. Place spinach in a large bowl. Top with spinach with fruit mixture. Drizzle dressing over the top and sprinkle with mint.
Melt peppermint patties in milk over low heat. Spread onto crust. Top with frozen whipped topping. Chill overnight. Cut into 1-inch squares.

Cut the steak into thin strips about an inch wide by about 4 inches long. Slice up some onions into thin strips as well. Slice up some bell peppers and set them aside. Brown the steak in a little bit of oil in a wok or frying pan, over medium to medium-high heat, about a minute or so per side (less time for medium-rare). Cut up the ramen noodles (and any other noodles you have that will work in a stir fry), and add them to the pan as well. Continue frying them in the oil until they are heated through. Add about 2 or 3 tablespoons of soy sauce to the pan along with some salt and pepper (and any other seasonings you want to use). Mix it all together well to make sure everything is evenly coated in the sauce. Add in the frozen vegetables (make sure to squeeze out as much water as you can from them). Cook them all together for a few minutes until they are heated through.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a bowl stir together brown sugar and mustard. On each salmon fillet spread about 1/2 of the glaze mixture to cover surface of fillets. Sprinkle each fillet with 1/2 of the dill. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle salmon with remaining dill and serve immediately. Serve with wild rice.

Soak gelatin in water for several minutes until soft. Pour into blender and blend until smooth. Add orange juice and blend until well incorporated. Add sugar and blend until smooth. Add vanilla and blend until well incorporated. Pour into shallow pan and refrigerate for several hours until firm. Break into small pieces and roll into balls. Roll balls into powdered sugar to coat. Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the sesame seeds and cook over a medium heat for 1 minute or until they start to turn golden. Add the rice and stir well. Add the onion and stir for about 1 minute. Add the stock and bring it up to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer with the lid on for about 10 minutes or until all the liquid has been absorbed and the rice is tender. Fluff the rice with a fork and stir in the orange zest. Serve hot or cold.

Wash and chop the mushrooms. Slice the garlic cloves. Place them all in a large bowl. Add the oil and toss to coat. Place the mixture on a large baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Roast for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and toss with the rosemary and sage. Add the parsley and toss. Serve with balsamic vinegar.

I used tilapia for the fish fillets. They were frozen, so I had to let them thaw before I cooked them. I cooked them for about five minutes each side. I like the battered kind better. While the fish was cooking I chopped up a bag of coleslaw mix, added cilantro and lime juice. I also warmed up the tortillas. I took two tortillas at a time and spread the coleslaw mix down the middle of each one. I then added the cooked fish. I sprinkled on a little russian salad dressing. I had some avocado and pico de gallo so I added that too. I then rolled them up and added a little extra dressing. I took a couple of limes and cut them open so I could squeeze some lime juice onto each fish taco. They were really good. I would have liked more coleslaw mix, but I used all that I had. I think next time I will try them with a different kind of fish. I didn't have any tortillas left after making these fish tacos so I made some chicken enchiladas with

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the Ritz crackers into a food processor or blenderpulse until coarse crumbs form. Transfer to a shallow bowl, and stir in the parsley, all purpose greek seasoning, and pepper. Beat the egg whites and milk together in a separate shallow bowldip each tilapia fillet into the egg white mixture, then into the Ritz cracker mixture, coating completelyplace onto a baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Butter 8 popover tins. In a medium bowl, combine the butter, honey, lemon rind, flour and salt. Stir in the milk and eggs until smooth. Stir in the pecans. Spoon into prepared popover tins. Bake in the preheated oven until puffed.

Combine the butter, sugar, egg and vanilla. Add the bisquick and chocolate chips. Drop rounded teaspoonfuls onto a baking sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 375f for 12 minutes. Cool on the sheet for a couple minutes before removing to a wire rack to finish cooling.
Boil potatoes for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain water. Mash with garlic cloves, butter and buttermilk. Season with salt. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine Bisquick mix, soymilk, pumpkin, cinnamon, stevia and raisins in a large bowl. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Drop by level tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Remove from oven. Allow cookies to cool on cookie sheet 10 minutes. Transfer cookies to rack. Cool completely. Makes approximately 2 dozen cookies.

Grate the potato into a large bowl. Add the codfish roe (be sure to remove the bones first) and fresh lemon juice. With the back of a wooden spoon, mash the mixture together until it is very smooth. Add the onion, olive oil, and bread and mix together well. Check the seasoning. If it is too tart, add more lemon juice. Cover and refrigerate for a few hours. Serve with bread or crackers.

Brown hamburger and add onion and pepper. Drain excess grease. Add low sodium chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for approximately 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat and place in a crockpot. Makes approximately 7 cups. Serve with white bread and pickles. Serve with pickles.

Boil potatoes for approximately 10 minutes or until done. Drain and cool potatoes completely. Cube potatoes and place in large bowl. Combine remaining ingredients except bacon and pour over potatoes. Chill for at least two hours before serving. Crumble bacon and add to potatoes just before serving.
Peel potatoes and cut into chunks. Cook in boiling water until soft. Drain and mash with a potato masher. Add milk and butter and mash thoroughly. Stir in cheese. Serve immediately.

Peel the onions and cut them into quarters lengthwise. Cut the bell pepper into thin strips. In a large ziplock bag combine the onion pieces and bell pepper strips. In a small bowl combine the olive oil and seasonings. Add to the bag. Seal tightly. Marinate overnight or longer. Grill for approximately 5-10 minutes or until tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a 3 quart casserole dish combine the pasta, milk, cheese, mustard, turmeric, salt and pepper. Mix well. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake until golden brown.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the potatoes and cook until just fork tender -- about 12 to 15 minutes. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. Add the wine and boil for 1 minute more. Melt the butter in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Add the shallots and cook until golden brown -- about 2 minutes. Stir in the whipping cream and the basil. Cook, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens -- about 3 to 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the sauce over the potatoes and toss to coat. Serve immediately.
In 9 x 13 inch baking pan combine diced tomatoes, stuffing mix, water. Bring to a boilstir. Add chicken. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Cool 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Sprinkle scallops with salt. Butter a baking dish. Dredge scallops in seasoned bread crumbs. Lay scallops in baking dish. Dot scallops with butter. Bake for 10 minutes or until scallops are just done. Garnish with fresh parsley. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet, saute onion in butter until tender. Add mushrooms and cook until they are tender and most of their moisture has evaporated. Stir in paprika and cayenne pepper and cook for 1 minute. Add sour cream and dill and cook until thoroughly blended. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Cut baguette into 1/4 inch thick slices. Combine garlic, olive oil and salt in a small bowlset aside. Combine tomatoes, basil, vinegar and pepper in another small bowlset aside. Top each piece of baguette with tomato mixturesprinkle each with Parmigiano-Reggiano cheesedrizzle with olive oil mixture. Bake at 375 for 5 minutes or until the tomato mixture begins to bubble.

Whisk together the lemon juice, garlic, and oil until emulsified. Combine the lettuce with the tomatoes, cucumbers, green bell pepper, green onions, and mint in a large salad bowl and toss with the dressing. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

In a 2 cup glass measure combine butter and parsley flakes. Microwave on HIGH 30 seconds. Stir in lemon juice and garlic. Set aside. Arrange 12 jumbo shrimp in a 13x9 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with paprika. Pour butter mixture over the top. Microwave uncovered 4 to 5 minutes, turning once. Serve over cooked rice.

Cook noodles al dente and drain. Meanwhile, bring soup and milk to a boil, stirring constantly until well blended. Add onion flakes, seasoning salt, and tuna and mix well. Add peas and noodles and mix well. Pour into a baking dish. Top with onions. Bake at 325 for 30 minutes or until hot. Makes 6 servings.

Brown ground beef and drain. Add onions and garlic and cook til onions are tender. Add spaghetti sauce and simmer til thickened. Meanwhile prepare macaroni as directed on box, but use only 1/2 the water called for. Drain and return to pan. Add beef mixture and stir to combine well. Add cream cheese and milk and stir to blend well. Add sour cream and green pepper and heat through. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.

In a small bowl combine galangal root and lemongrass. Place in a soup pot with chicken stock and bring to a boil. Remove from heat, cover and let steep at least one hour. Strain stock into a large pot, discard solids. Place stock in a saucepan over medium heat, add chicken breast, coconut milk, fish sauce, lime juice, scallion and cilantro. Bring mixture to a simmer. Add a little hot stock as you reheat if necessary. Serve in bowls garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.

Mix margarine or butter and sugar. Beat until creamy. Add vanilla. Add eggs one at a time. Beat well. Add jello gelatin. Stir with wire whisk until blended. Add flour, baking powder and salt. Beat on medium speed for 1 minute. Chill dough until firm. Form into small balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes.

In skillet, fry bacon until crisp and remove from pan. Add onion and saute until tender. Add green pepper and saute until tender. Add tomatoes and saute until thickened. Add okra and corn and cook until tender. Add bacon and season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Peel bananas and mash them in a blender. Add the remaining ingredients. Chill. Serve over ice cream or frozen yogurt. Makes 1 cup.

Snap off and discard ends of beans. Cut beans into 1 inch pieces. Cook mushrooms with onion and garlic in olive oil in large skillet on medium heat 5 minutes or until tender. Add beanscook 5 minutes longer or until crisp-tender. Stir in water chestnutscook 2 minutes longer or until beans are tender-crisp. Sprinkle with Italian seasoningtoss gently. Serve warm. garnish with parmesan cheese if desired.

Skewer the shrimp and grill for 3 to 4 minutes or until cooked through. Cut the shrimp into pieces and place in a bowl. Mix in the lime juice and garlic. Cut the scotch bonnet pepper into small pieces and add to the shrimp. Add the butter and mix well. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Garnish with sliced scallions and serve.

Soak 4 cups almonds in 3 cups water overnight. Drain and reserve 1/4 cup liquid. Process almonds with 1/4 cup reserved liquid and 1/2 cup bread crumbs in food processor until finely ground. Place remaining 1/4 cup bread crumbs on plate. Rinse chickenpat dry with paper towel. Season with pepper. Dip chicken in bread crumbs and then almond mixture, pressing to adhere. Place on baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until juices run clear. Top each piece with 1 tbsp sour cream and 1 tsp barbecue sauce. Garnish with parsley and remaining almonds. Serve with brown rice or pasta. Makes 4 servings.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallots and cook until softened. Add the lettuce and stir to combine. Add the broth and thyme. Cover the pan, reduce heat to low and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Season with sugar, lemon zest, salt, and pepper. Stir in the frozen peas. Transfer the salad to a serving bowl. Add the remaining olive oil in a steady stream whisking until emulsified. Adjust the seasoning with lemon juice. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut the stems off the sprouts and set them aside for another use. Wash the sprouts and pat them dry with a paper towel. Cut them in half. In a large bowl toss the sprouts with the remaining ingredients. Spread the sprout mixture evenly on the baking sheet. Bake for 30-35 minutes, tossing halfway through the cooking process. Serve the brussels sprouts hot or warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring the milk to a simmer. In a mixing bowl, whisk the yolks until thickened. Slowly whisk in the hot milk, a little at a time, being careful not to scramble the yolks. Add the vanilla and brown sugar. Stir in the butter 1 tablespoon at a time, waiting for each to melt completely before adding the next. Pour the mixture into the pie shells. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the filling is set. Let the pies cool for at least 1 hour before serving.

Place the chicken legs in a large bowl and add the ketchup. Marinate overnight. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Drain the chicken and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 1 hour. After 1 hour, baste with ketchup. Baste every 10 minutes until done. In a small bowl combine brown sugar, dijon mustard and lemon juice. Brush on the chicken after every 10 minutes of baking.
Combine first 6 ingredients in a bowl. Toss to coat. Cover and chill 4 hours or overnight. Sprinkle with sugar and salt. Serve with chips or on top of grilled fish, chicken or pork.

Peel, core and thinly slice the apples. Mash lightly and add lemon juice. Preheat the oven to gas mark 4 (350f/180c). Grease and line a deep, 18cm (7in) round cake tin with parchment paper. Melt the margarine and brown sugar in a saucepan, then add the apples and sultanas and mix well. Set aside to cool, stirring occasionally. Sieve together the flour and baking powder and mix in the nuts. Stir in the vanilla and melted margarine mixture. Spoon into prepared tin and bake for about 40 minutes until golden and well risen. Remove and cool on a wire rack for a couple of minutes before removing from tin and cooling on rack completely.

Melt butter over medium heat until foaming subsides and it is just starting to turn brown. Turn off heat and add egg yolks all at once while whisking constantly. Return pan to heat. Whisk constantly until mixture reaches desired thickness (about 10 minutes). Remove from heat. Add lemon juice and salt. Serve immediately or keep warm in double boiler until ready to serve.

In a large bowl, mix together the broccoli florets, onion, sunflower seeds, raisins, mushrooms, mayonnaise, vinegar, and sugar until well-combined. Fold in the bacon. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serves 4 as a side dish or appetizer.

Mix together in saucepan pineapple preserves, prepared mustard, prepared horseradish, soy sauce and water until smooth. Brush over pork roast. Cook uncovered in convection microwave at high for about 2 hours or until pork is tender. Let stand for 5 minutes before carving. Serve with rice. Serve with pineapple rings on top as garnish.

Cut chicken thighs into 1-inch strips. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken strips. Stir in sherry. Cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink. Add soy sauce and brown sugar. Cook and stir until sauce thickens. Remove from heat. Add roasted garlic and thyme. Mix well. Serve on warm baguette slices or rice.

In your crock pot place 1/2 cup of water in the bottom of the crock pot. Place the chicken breasts on top of the water. Add half of the rotel tomatoes & chilies. Add 2 tsp of onion powder, 1 tsp of garlic powder, 1 tsp of flour. Mix well. Turn crock pot on low for 8 hours. After 8 hours take out chicken breasts. Shred chicken. Put back into crock pot. Add remaining rotel tomatoes & chilies. Add 1 can of light sour cream. Stir well. Serve hot over tortilla chips or crackers.

Boil potatoes until very tender, about 25 minutes. When cool enough to handle, peel and grate the potato on the large holes of a box grater. Squeeze out excess liquid. In a large bowl, mix the potato with the thyme, garlic clove and scallions. Season with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Scoop the potato mixture into the skillet using about 2 tablespoons for each cake. Flatten each scoop into a 3-inch circle. Cook for 4 minutes on each side or until nicely browned. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. Transfer the potato cakes to a plate. In a bowl, mix the goat cheese with the scallions. Season with salt and pepper. Top each potato cake with a generous mound of the cheese mixture. Serve immediately.

Pulse crackers in food processor until they are fine crumbs. Melt butter and sugar in a large saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth and mixture is foamy. Pour in crackers and stir until well blended. Pour into an ungreased jelly roll pan (11x15), smoothing top with a spatula or spoon. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 5 minutes in pan on a wire rack. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and let stand for 1 minute or until chips are melted. Cut into squares. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Crush chocolate chip cookies in a blender or food processor. Transfer 2 cups of the crumbs to a medium bowlset aside. Add remaining cookie crumbs to blender or food processor. Coverprocess until finely ground. Transfer ground crumbs to a medium bowladd melted butter. Stir until mixture forms coarse meal. Press meal evenly onto the bottom and 1 inch up the sides of 12 paper-lined muffin cups. Bake for 6 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Beat cream cheese in a large bowl with an electric mixer on low speed until fluffy. Add sugar and beat until smooth. Add vanillabeat just until blended. Add eggbeat until incorporated. Stir in sour cream. Pour filling into crusts. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until centers are almost set. Cool in pans for 10 minutes. Run a knife around inside edges of the cups. Cool completely. Top with maraschino cherry

In large bowl combine evaporated skim milk and water. Stir in splenda, brown sugar twin, apple pie spice and maple syrup. Coverrefrigerate until ready to use. Stir in oats. Transfer to crockpotcook on low 5 hours. Stir in apple, raisins and walnuts. Cook 30 minutes longer. Serve immediately. Makes 14 to 16 servings. Good housekeeping.
Slice onion. Heat oil in a wok. Add onions and stir fry. Add mushrooms, curry powder, potato flour. Add water and stir until thick. Add cream. Season with chili sauce. Serve with rice.

Heat 1 cup of cooking oil in a pot and fry the eggs. When the eggs are almost done frying, add the sugar. When the sugar has melted, add the tamarind paste. Mix the mixture well and cook for another 2-3 minutes until it has thickened. When it has thickened, turn off the heat. Stir in the sliced shallots. Pour into a serving dish and garnish with the leftover tamarind paste and shallot. Serve warm.

In a small bowl combine the teriyaki sauce, sesame oil, garlic and green onions. Marinate the beef in the teriyaki mixture for 1 hour. Pre-heat the grill over medium heat. Thread the beef cubes onto the skewers. Grill over medium heat for 6-8 minutes per side or until done to desired tenderness, turning occasionally. Serve with the teriyaki sauce for dipping.

Heat oven to 400. In small bowl, mix cornstarch and next 4 ingredients. Place chicken in single layer in shallow baking pan. Mix cornstarch mixture with enough water to make thin sauce. Stir in orange juice and marmaladespoon over chicken. Cover and bake 20 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 10 minutes. Drizzle with glaze.

Soak beans overnight. Drain. In a 6 quart dutch oven saute the pork in the oil. Add the onions and garlic. Season to taste with sage and parsley and saute for 5 minutes. Add the stock and beans. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the sauerkraut and cook for 5 minutes more. Serve in bowls topped with polenta crumbles.

In a pan add the milk powder. Add half of the water slowly, stirring continuously with a whisk until it thickens to a paste consistency. Add the remaining water, stirring to blend well. Add the rice flour slowly while continuing to stir until it thickens into a dough consistency. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Add the almonds and mix well. Add the ginger powder and mix well. Add the cardamom powder and sugar and mix well. Place in the refrigerator for an hour or until ready to serve. Cut into cubes or balls before serving.
Combine first 3 ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Add mayonnaisetoss to coat. Let stand 1 hour at room temperature. Serve in lettuce-lined bowls. Garnish with green onions.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium heat and add the bacon. Cook for approximately 15 minutes or until bacon is cooked and crispy. Drain the bacon and reserve the bacon grease in the pan. Chop the bacon and set aside for later use. In the same pan, add the onions and green beans and saute for approximately 5 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes and cook for another minute. Add the bacon and the reserved bacon grease and stir until the bacon and beans are well coated with the grease. Add the water and bring to a boil over medium high heat and cook for approximately 30 minutes or until the water has completely evaporated and the beans are tender. Stir occasionally while cooking to keep the bacon from burning. Serve hot and enjoy with cornbread or biscuits.

Chop eggs into small pieces. In a mixing bowl combine eggs, mayonnaise, and sour cream. Mix well. Fold in the tuna. Add chopped onion and garlic powder. Mix well. Serve on toast or bread. Garnish with lettuce and tomatoes.

Place chicken in 13 x 9 inch baking dish. In small bowl mix together mushroom soup & sour cream. Pour over chicken, sprinkle with onion soup mix and basil. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center & juices run clear when pierced with fork.

Place the chicken in a large skillet and cover with the juice. Add the lemon pepper seasoning and 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boil and simmer over medium heat until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. Remove from the heat and let the chicken cool in the pan. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. In a medium bowl combine the chicken with the almonds and 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder. Stir in the mayonnaise. Cover and chill at least 1 hour. Stir in the celery before serving.

Brown sausage and drain. Saute onion and green pepper in the sausage drippings until tender. Add zucchini and cook until tender. Add catsup, molasses and worcestershire sauce. Blend well. Combine with noodles and carrots. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Bake at 325 for one hour or until bubbly.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, red pepper, mustard, oregano, breadcrumbs and cook 2-3 minutes or until mixture is lightly browned. Place in a bowl with 1 cup breadcrumbsset aside. Cook broccoli and cauliflower in boiling water for 3 minutesremove from water and let cool in ice waterdrain well. Combine cauliflower and broccoli in a large bowl with mayonnaise, Cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese and remaining breadcrumbs. Spread in a shallow 2-quart baking dishsprinkle with remaining breadcrumbs and top with green onion. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Makes 4 servings.

Peel and slice potatoes thinly and place in a saucepan with enough water to cover them. Cook for about 15 minutes until tender. Drain and return potatoes to pan. In a small saucepan melt the butter with the onion and garlic clove for about 2 minutes. Pour over potatoes and stir gently. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Skewer shrimp and sprinkle each piece lightly with cayenne pepper sauce. Wrap a slice of avocado around the skewered shrimp, then wrap with a slice of lime and a few onion rings. Repeat process until all shrimp is prepared in this fashion. Place shrimp on a plate and cover tightly and refrigerate for several hours. Serve shrimp martini cocktails in a glass martini glass with some of the sauce from the shrimp martini cocktails on the rim of the glass. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and a lime slice. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare pizza as directed on package. Bake until lightly browned. Cool slightly before topping with sausage, bacon, hash brown, cheddar cheese, eggs and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Bake until eggs are set.

Line 9" x 13" baking pan with foil. In medium saucepan over medium heat, combine graham cracker crumbs, melted butter. Stir until crumbs are moistened. Press onto bottom of prepared pan. In small saucepan over low heat, combine sweetened condensed milk, chocolate chips, and maraschino cherries. Heat through, stirring occasionally until chips are melted. Spread over graham cracker crumbs. Sprinkle coconut over top of filling. Refrigerate for at least one hour or until set. Cut into bars. Makes 16 bars.

Heat 2-3 inches of vegetable oil in a large kettle to 350 degrees. Add 1/2 cup kernels. Cook and shake kettle constantly until popping slows to 2 to 3 seconds between pops. Pour out onto a baking sheet. Add 1 tablespoon sugar and 1 tablespoon coarse salt and toss. Let cool completely. Store in an airtight container. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Blend all the ingredients together until smooth. Season to taste with basil and black pepper. Bring 4 to 6 quarts of water to a rolling boil in a large pot over high heat. Season water with salt and add pasta. Stir gently to separate strands and cook until al dente about 8 minutes. Remove pot from heat and drain pasta through colander. Serve with pesto and grated parmesan cheese on top.

Bring 6 cups water to boil and pour over 6 tea bags. Steep tea for 30 minutes. Remove tea bags and add 12 ounces of lemonade concentrate. Stir in 6 cups ice cubes and 2 cups of rum. Serve with lemon and lime wedges.

Peel the potatoes and boil until tender. When potatoes are done cooking. Drain the water. Add the milk and butter, mash the potatoes until smooth. Add the garlic and crushed red pepper flakes. Mix well. Taste for seasoning. Serve immediately.

Heat oil and garlic over medium heat. Add the pumpkin. Cook over medium heat for a few minutes until the liquid from the pumpkin is gone. Add the flour and cook for another 2 minutes. Stir in the parmesan, parsley and sunflower seeds. Season with salt and serve hot. Serves 4.

Place shrimp in a bowl and pour olive oil over them. Mix in garlic, parsley, crushed red pepper flakes, oregano, salt and pepper. Let stand 15 minutes. Preheat broiler to high. Line a baking pan with foil and place wire rack on top of foil. Spread shrimp on rack. Broil shrimp 4 inches from heat 5 minutes turning once half way through cooking time. Spread shrimp with breadcrumbs and broil for an additional 2 minutes or until shrimp are done to your liking.

Melt the cream cheese and basil in a small saucepan over medium heat, stirring until smooth. Stir in the garlic and salt and white pepper to taste. Spread over the bottom of a medium baking dish. Top with the tomatoes and mushrooms. Sprinkle the green onions and cheese over the top. Bake until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown. Serve with crackers.
Put all ingredients into blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Heat olive oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Beat egg and milk in a small bowl with a fork until well blendeddip chops in egg mixture and dredge in seasoned flour. Saute chops in hot oil until golden brown on both sides, about 4 minutes per side. Place chops in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish. In a bowl, combine butter, sugar and cinnamondrizzle evenly over chops. Bake at 375 degrees f for 30 minutes or until chops are no longer pink in center and cinnamon glaze is bubbly.

Preheat grill or broiler. Cut poblano peppers into 1-inch piecesset aside. Place cheese in a resealable plastic bag and crumbleset aside. Coat pork tenderloins with the chili powder, onion powder, cumin, garlic powder, anise seed, cayenne pepper and saltset aside. Thread the pepper pieces onto 4 skewers. Thread pork pieces onto 4 skewers. Grill or broil 5 to 6 minutes on each side or until the internal temperature of the pork is 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). Serve with cheese. Serves 4.

Wash sweet potatoes, and cut them into small cubes. Put the rice and sake into a saucepan. When it boils, add the sweet potatoes and salt. Simmer it until the sweet potatoes are well cooked. Take the sweet potatoes out and mash them into a smooth paste. Put the sweet potato paste on top of the rice. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil or a silicone baking mat. Toss carrots and butter together in a medium bowl. Spread out onto baking sheet. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and lemon juice. Bake for 8 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in hot sauce and salt. Bake for an additional 2 minutes or until brown. Cool and store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Rub russet potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Sprinkle with kosher salt, garlic salt and seasoning salt. Bake for 1 1/4 hours or until potatoes are tender. Rub potatoes with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper. Bake for 15 minutes or until potatoes are crispy. Garnish with prepared horseradish. Serve with sour cream.

Combine cranberries and water in a large nonreactive saucepan or Dutch oven. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Lower heat to medium-low and cook 10 minutes. Add sugar, zinfandel, and spices. Cook until the cranberries pop and the liquid thickens to a jam-like consistency. Discard spices. Makes about 3 cups. Serve over poultry.

Season ground chuck with mustard powder and chili powder and brown in a skillet. Drain fat. Add stewed tomatoes and green pepper and cook until chuck is tender. Stir in cooked basmati rice. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a side salad.

Peel the peaches, cut the peaches in half. Add them to a large bowl with the sugar and toss. Let stand at room temperature for 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Add the flour to a medium bowl and mix with a fork. Add the butter cut into small pieces. Use a pastry blender to cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle the water over the mixture. Using your hands, press the mixture together until it comes together into a ball. Knead the dough a few times on a floured surface to bring the dough together. Roll the dough out to an 8-inch square. Place the dough in a 9-inch square baking dish. Spread the peaches over the dough. Fold over the edges of the dough. Bake for 45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl with an electric mixer, cream together butter and shortening. Beat in the sugar, then the vanilla and egg. Combine the flour and the cream of tartar. Add to the creamed mixture and mix well. Add the baking soda and salt and continue to mix. Chill dough for 2 hours. Roll dough into balls and roll each ball in cinnamon. Place on ungreased baking sheet 2 inches apart and bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In a small bowl combine honey, garlic, mustard, soy sauce, lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper. Place chicken in a shallow bowlpour honey mixture over top. Toss until chicken is evenly coated. Place chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes or until chicken is done. Remove chicken from oven and drizzle with additional honey mixture to coat. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat the oven to 350. Prepare a large baking sheet by lining with parchment paper. Peel the nectarines and slice them in half. Scrape out the seeds. Brush the cut sides of the nectarines with honey. Place the nectarines cut-side down on the baking sheet. Sprinkle with sugar and vanilla. Bake for 10 minutes. Flip the nectarines and bake for 10 more minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly. Serve with a dollop of greek yogurt.

Place the pasta in a large bowl and pour over 4 cups boiling water. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let stand for 10 minutes. Drain the pasta and transfer it to another bowl. While the pasta is standing, make the dressing by whisking together the olive oil, garlic, sea salt, and black pepper. Pour the dressing over the pasta, add the basil and toss. Add the cherry tomatoes to the salad. Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.

Cut pork fillets into 2-3 inch pieces. Mix together orange juice, ginger and brown sugar. Add pork fillets and marinate overnight. Grill pork fillets for 5 minutes per side and pour marinade over pork and cook for another 3 minutes. Garnish with orange peel.

Grease or line muffin cups with paper liners. In large bowl combine flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt. In separate bowl combine eggs, milk and oilstir with whisk until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla extractstir until well mixed. Stir wet ingredients into dry ingredients just until moistened (batter will be lumpy). Fold in marshmallows. Spoon batter evenly into prepared muffin cups. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center of muffins comes out clean. Cool 10 minutesremove from muffin cups and cool on wire rack. Frost if desired.

Heat oven to 450 degrees. Coat 2 pizza crusts with 1 tablespoon each olive oil and garlic. Place crusts in 2 12-inch pizza pans. Bake on a baking sheet until golden brown and edges are slightly crisp, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven and top each crust with 1 cup mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup each oregano and basil. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup each Parmesan cheese and 1 tablespoon each chopped basil and oregano. Bake on baking sheet until melted and bubbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes. Cut each pizza into 4 wedges. Makes 4 servings.

Add all the ingredients to the saucepan except the rice flour. Stir well with a whisk to combine everything. Add the rice flour to thicken the milk. Heat the mixture over low heat until it becomes thick. The milk is ready when it is thick enough to coat the back of the spoon with a thin film when you drag it across it. Pour the milk into glasses and sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a loaf pan with parchment paperset aside. Combine all-purpose flour, wheat bran, baking soda, and salt in a large bowlset aside. Combine butter and applesauce in a separate large bowl. Beat in the Splenda Brown Sugar Blend until smooth and creamy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in mashed bananas. Add the dry mixture in three additions to the wet mixturebeat just until blended after each addition. Stir in the chocolate chipsspoon into prepared loaf pan. Bake for about 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Cut into slices to serve.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. Cook penne according to directions. In the meantime saute onion and garlic in olive oil until light brown. Add eggplant and zucchini and stir until brown. Add tomatoes and oregano. Add basil leaves and mix. Add the pasta to the sauce. Add the tomatoes and basil. Toss and serve.

In a large skillet saute the vegetables in margarine or butter for 1-2 minutes. Add the mayonnaise and mustard and continue to saute 1-2 minutes longer. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Fold in the dill. Remove from heat. On a lightly floured surface roll each fillet to 1/4 inch thick. Place a tablespoon of the vegetable mixture on one half of each fillet. Fold the fillet and press edges together. Place on a greased baking sheet and repeat with remaining fillets. Spray with cooking spray. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Makes 8 servings. Serve with potato salad.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9-inch square pan. In a medium saucepan over low heat, melt margarine and chocolate chips until smooth. Remove from heat. Beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in the sugar, then the vanilla. Sift together the flour and the salt. Add to the chocolate mixture and beat until well combined. Pour into pan and spread evenly. Bake 20 minutes. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Cut into 16 pieces. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.

Slice leek in half lengthwise. Slice in half again. Cut crosswise into 1/4 inch slices. Chop enough of the green part to measure 1/4 cup. Peel and finely chop 1 clove of garlic. Melt butter in heavy 3 quart saucepan over low heat. Add leek and cook until it is softened about 5 minutes. Add chopped green leek. Add chopped garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add chicken broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered 20 minutes. Add potatoes. Simmer 20 minutes. Add spinach. Cook until it wilts about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Puree soup in batches in blender. Return to pan. Season with celery salt. Garnish with sour cream.

Line an 8 inch square baking pan with foil, allowing 2 inches to extend over sidesbutter foil. Melt chocolate and butter over low heat or in microwavecool slightly. Stir in eggs and vanilla until smoothadd salt. Beat in sugar until smooth and glossy. Stir in flour until blended. Fold in miniature peanut butter cupsspread in prepared pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree F oven until edges are set and center is still soft and gooey, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Cool in pan on rackcut into squarespeel off foil to serve.
Sweat the onions and celery in butter until soft, add mussels and parsley and stir. Add white wine and cover. Cook 3-4 minutes or until mussels open. Add cream. Serve hot with crusty bread.

Prepare the crusts according to package directions. Cool the crusts completely. In a large bowl beat the egg yolks with the margarita mix and the egg yolks until smooth. Pour into the crusts. Bake at 350 for 25 to 30 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned and the center is set. Top each pie with whipped cream and sprinkle with orange zest. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Heat oil in large skillet on med-high heat. Season chicken with pepper. Add chicken to skillet in a single layer. Cook 3 minutes per side or until no longer pink. Remove chicken from skillet. Add red pepper to skillet. Cook and stir 2-3 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl combine cornstarch and 1/4 cup cold water. Add to skillet. Stir constantly until thickened. Stir in asian vegetables. Spray a 9 x 13 baking dish with pam. Layer asian vegetables in dish. Arrange chicken on top. In a small bowl dissolve lemon jell-o in hot chicken broth. Add 1 tbsp italian salad dressing. Pour over chicken. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Combine 1 can of water, bouillon cubes and butter in a saucepan. Bring to boil. Add rice. Cover. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 45 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool. Add ground beef and remaining can of water. Stir well. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.

Combine flour and salt in a food processor. Add butter and shortening. Cut in until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. With processor running, add egg yolk and ice water. Mix until dough just forms a ball. Form into a disk. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes or overnight. On a lightly floured surface roll dough into a 12 inch circle. Fit into pie plate. Refrigerate while preparing filling. Makes enough for 2 double crust pies.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat and brown pork chops on both sides. Combine onion and garlic cloves and saute until onion is tender. Transfer onion/garlic mixture to slow cooker along with pork chops and brown juice, dried cherries and flour. Cover and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours or on high for 2 hours. Serve on toasted French bread with apple juice poured over pork chops and onions. Garnish with green onion or parsley. Serves 4.

In medium bowl beat cake mix and egg until blended. Stir in whipped topping and 1/3 cup powdered sugar until blended. Shape dough into 1 inch balls and roll in powdered sugar. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes until edges are lightly browned. Cool slightly and remove from cookie sheets. Store in covered container in refrigerator. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

In a large saute pan, heat oil and saute garlic and onion. Add cumin and cayenne pepper. Add turmeric and tomatoes. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Add pimientos and cook for a minute. Add chickpeas and cook for a few more minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice or flatbread.

Preheat oven to 400. Combine 1 cup flour, 1/4 cup cocoa, baking powder, cinnamon and salt in small bowl. Whisk to blend. In large bowl, combine remaining cup of flour and remaining 1/2 cup cocoa. Stir in brown sugar. In a measuring cup, combine milk and oil. Stir with a fork until well-blended. Add egg to milk mixturewhisk to blend. Stir milk mixture into flour mixture just until combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Fill each of 12 paper-lined muffin cups 2/3 full with batter. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 5 minutesremove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack.

Soak lima beans overnight. In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add lima beans. Cover and cook over medium heat for 30 minutes. Stir in sugar and cook 5 minutes. Add water or broth and cook 5 minutes. Add the sesame oil. Serve over rice.

Heat oven to 350. Peel the potatoes and slice thinly. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the sugar, onions, and potatoes. Cook until the onions are translucent. Sprinkle with the flour. Cook for 30 seconds. Add the milk and stir until thickened. Stir in the sour cream. Season with the salt. Pour into a 2 quart baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Meanwhile mix the vinegar with the sugar. Remove the potatoes from the oven. Pour the vinegar mixture over the potatoes. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Cream together cream cheese and Old English Spread. Add Kraft Roka Blue Spread. Blend. Add Worchestershire Sauce and Garlic Powder and blend well. Chill. Roll into ball shape. Dip pecans in melted butter. Roll into pecan shell. Store in refrigerator until ready to serve.
Rub chicken with dill. Cover with marinade, let marinate in refrigerator for 2-8 hours. Broil for approximately 7-10 minutes turning once half-way through broiling time.

Boil chicken thighs for 2 minutes. Rinse with water. Stir-fry garlic in oil until fragrant. Remove garlic. Stir-fry chicken with chili peppers until fragrant and cook until chicken is half done. Pour fish sauce into chicken and stir to combine. Stir-fry basil leaves until fragrant. Put chicken, peanuts and chili peppers into plate. Pour sweet soy sauce over chicken to coat well. Sprinkle with crispy fried garlic. Serve with boiled rice.

Heat oil and butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add onions and cook until lightly browned about 20 minutes. Transfer to mixing bowl. Add blue cheese, mayonnaise, cream cheese and sour cream. Stir until well blended. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with bread.
In a large bowl combine couscous, orange juice and salt. Cover bowl and refrigerate overnight. Stir in chickpeas, almonds, and raisins. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Serves 6-8.

In a large frying pan over medium high heat, heat the oil. Add the shallot and cook for 1 minute. Add the chorizo and cook until browned. Add the wine and reduce for 3 minutes. Add the mussels with the tomatoes. Cover the pan with the lid. Shake the pan occasionally until the mussels open, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat. Add the parsley and butter. Season with the salt. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Steam the cauliflower for about five minutes until soft and the florets are separate. Drain and cool slightly. In a bowl, combine cauliflower, eggs and Bisquick mix until well blended. Add garlic powder and cheese and blend again until smooth. Form into four equal patties about an inch thick. In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Place patties in pan and cook until golden brown on each side, about two to three minutes per side. Place patties on a cookie sheet and sprinkle with more cheese. Bake in oven for five minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve hot with ketchup or your choice of dipping sauce.
Heat oil in wok. Add beef and brown on all sides. Add green beans and mushrooms and cook 2 minutes. Add garlic sauce, beef stock and bean sprouts. Cook 2 minutes. Add noodles and serve.

In a large bowl, cream together 1 cup margarine, 3 cups sugar and 4 eggs until light and fluffy. Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 teaspoon orange juice. In a separate bowl, mix together 1 1/2 cups flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract. Add flour mixture to margarine mixture. Stir in enough additional flour to form a soft dough. Wrap dough in plastic wraprefrigerate until firm enough to roll out. Preheat oven to 375. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough to 1/8 thickness. Cut into shapes with a cookie cutter. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until edges are light brown. Cool completely on wire racks. Add lollipops for eyes. Melt 2 tablespoons margarine in a small pan over low

To prepare noodles, bring 4 cups water to boil. Add noodles and cook for 4 minutes. Drain. To prepare slaw, heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add onions and cook for another minute. Add sugar and cook for another minute. Add cabbage and cook for another minute. Add carrots and cook for another minute. Add chili sauce, soy sauce and vinegar. Cook for another minute. Add slaw mix and toss with noodles. Serve at once.

Combine peach pie filling and crushed butter in 2 qt. Baking dish. Combine flour and cinnamon in medium bowl. Using pastry blender or fork, cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over filling. Bake in 375f oven for 50 minutes or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbling. Serves 8-10.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Toss asparagus with 2 tablespoons oil and spread out on a baking sheet. Sprinkle the asparagus with the salt and pepper. Roast in the preheated oven until tender, about 10 minutes. In a large skillet, melt remaining 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add the asparagus and cook until heated through. Serve drizzled with lemon juice and sprinkled with cheese. Serve at once.
Combine all the above ingredients except the oil in a bowl, mix well, then add the oil slowly while continuing to mix. Serve in a lettuce leaf or on crackers.

Place pineapple juice in bread pan of machine. Add water. Add egg and butter and mix well. Measure flour and salt. Add to liquid mixture in bread pan. Add candied pineapple and mix well. Select dough cycle and press start. When cycle is finished remove bread pan to wire rack and allow to cool completely before slicing.

Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Stir in onions. Cook and stir until the onions begin to become translucent. Stir in the chili powder. Add the beans. Stir to coat with the spices. Add the salsa to the skillet. Cook for 10 more minutes. Serve the beans with brown rice. If desired, garnish with sour cream.

Cook pasta in boiling water according to package directions. Drain. Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in ham and onion. Cook and stir until ham is no longer pink. Stir in broth and chicken bouillon. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Cook for 5 minutes or until thickened. Combine egg yolks and parsley. Stir egg mixture into ham mixture. Drain pastaplace in a large bowl. Add ham mixture to pasta. Toss lightly. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. Yield: 4 servings.

In a 5- to 6-quart Dutch oven or stockpot, heat oil over medium-high heat. Cook onion and carrots 5 to 8 minutes or until vegetables are softened, stirring occasionally. Stir in beans. Add broth. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Stir in dried italian seasoning. Simmer uncovered 15 minutes longer or until beans are tender. Stir in baby spinachheat through. Season to taste with black pepper. Yield : 12 servings.

Slice shrimp in half lengthwise. Marinate in lime juice, olive oil and chili powder for 15 minutes. Preheat grill. Skewer shrimp alternately with vegetables. Grill 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Brush with marinade. Serve with rice.

In a small skillet or saucepan saute potatoes in vegetable oil, add garlic powder, onion powder, and salt to taste. Let potatoes cool slightly. Combine butter, garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper together. Add to potatoes. Form into balls. Wrap each ball with a slice of cheese. Wrap each ball in bacon. Place on grill over medium heat. Cook till bacon is done to your liking. Serve with ketchup or any kind of BBQ sauce.

In a small saucepan combine teriyaki sauce and 2 tablespoons water. Bring to a boil. In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat saute garlic and ginger for 30 seconds. Remove and set aside. In the same skillet add the chicken pieces and saute until lightly browned. Pour in teriyaki mixture and add the salt, pepper and ginger. Simmer covered for 20-30 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Serve over rice.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add mushrooms and garlic clove and cook for 2-3 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Add spinach leaves. Cook for about 2-3 minutes or until spinach is wilted. Season with balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately with pasta or rice or as a side dish.

Beat first 6 ingredients at medium speed with an electric mixer until smoothgradually add half-and-half and pepper, beating until well blended. Beat in mayonnaiseset aside 1/3 of dressing mixture for another use. Pour dressing over potatoes and toss well. Place in a serving bowl and cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Cover apricots with water in a large pot. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Drain apricots and reserve liquid. Combine apricots, water, sugar, orange peel, almond extract and brandy. Bring to a boil and cook over medium heat until thick. Pour into sterilized jars. Process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes. Makes 3-4 pints.

Wash okra pods well and dry them with a paper towel. Keep the tips intact and slice each pod into thin rings. Heat oil in a wok or flat non-stick skillet on medium heat. When it is hot add the okra rings in batches and fry until brown. Remove from wok with a slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towels. In a bowl, add yogurt, salt and spices and mix well. Once okra is done frying, return it to wok and add yogurt mixture to it and toss well. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve warm with roti or rice.
Mix mayonnaise with sweet pickles. Chop cabbage fine or shred with food chopper. Mix with sweet pickle mayonnaise and eggs. Serve on lettuce leaves.

In a medium nonstick skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic. Saut for 5 minutes. In a large bowl, mix eggs with herbs. Season with pepper. Stir in cheese. Add ham. Pour into skillet. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for 3 minutes, then sprinkle on parsley. Cook until set. Cut into wedges. Serve warm.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat butter and cook onions until tender. Add the flour and stir to combine with onions. Add the seasonings and pepper to the skillet and stir. Slowly add the chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Simmer until gravy thickens. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine ranch dressing mix with water. Add to gravy and stir. Add the chicken breasts to the gravy and simmer until cooked through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease 2-muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. In a medium bowl, mix together all muffin ingredients except apple and banana. In a separate bowl, mash apple and banana together and add to muffin mixture. Stir just until blended. Spoon into muffin cups and bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until muffins test done. Remove from oven and let stand in muffin cups for about 1 minute. Remove from cups and place on wire rack to cool. Makes 2 muffins.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil or parchment paper for easy cleanup. In a small bowl combine paprika, salt, ground coriander, white pepper, and cayenne pepperset aside.In a medium microwave-safe bowl combine microwave popcorn kernels with 1/4 cup butter and 1 1/4 teaspoon salt. Microwave on high 5 to 6 minutes, or until popping slows to 1 to 2 seconds between pops. Stir every minute or so.Immediately pour popcorn into a large mixing bowl lined with foil or parchment papertoss with the spice mixture, 1 tablespoon sugar and remaining 1 teaspoon butter. Spread popcorn onto prepared baking sheet, separating kernels evenly to allow for even toasting.Bake for 1 hour, or until popcorn is golden brown and crunchy, stirring occasionally to prevent burning.Cool completely.Melt remaining

Whisk together the flour, sugar, and salt in a medium bowl. Add the shortening and, using a pastry blender or two knives, cut the shortening into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle the cold water over the mixture and stir quickly with a fork until the dough just comes together. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Gather the dough into a ball. Flatten the ball into a disk. Wrap the disk tightly in plastic wrap. Chill for 30 minutes.

Beat together eggs, milk and flour until smooth. Stir in baking powder, salt, nutmeg and cheeses. Fold in broccoli and green onions. Pour batter into greased 9-inch square pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly. Cut into 9 squares. Makes 9 servings.

In a saucepan, combine cranberries and cranberry juice cocktail. Add dried apricot halves. Bring to a boil and cook for five minutes. Add sugar and ginger. Return to a boil and cook for two minutes. Remove from heat. Cool and serve.

Dip the chicken in flour until well coated and shake off excess. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil until hot. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown on both sides about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from heat. Stir in broth, mushrooms and garlic salt until well blended. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 2-3 minutes until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in the sour cream until well blended. Serve immediately over pasta or rice.

In large bowl combine beef, breadcrumbs, egg, onions, garlic, salt and pepper. Divide mixture into 1 1/2 inch balls, and place on baking sheet lined with waxed paper. Bake at 350f for 15 to 20 minutes or until done. Meanwhile in small saucepan combine hot pepper sauce, butter and honey. Bring to a boil. Place meatballs in the hot sauce mixture, turn to coat. Place on a platter top with blue cheese dressing. Serve with celery sticks.

Combine parmesan cheese, cayenne, salt, cumin, thyme, butter in a small bowl. Mix well. Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds. When seeds start to pop, add popping corn. Cook until lightly browned. Add cheese mixture. Toss to coat. Taste for seasoning. Sprinkle with chives for garnish. Serve immediately.

Peel potatoes and cut into 2 inch chunks. Cover with cold water in a large pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer 5 minutes. Drain. Return to pot. Add milk and butter. Mash with a potato masher or potato ricer. Stir in sugar and salt. Serve immediately.

Heat a saucepan with the oil over medium-high heat. Add the carrots, celery, shallots and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the chicken. Season with pepper. Pour the chicken stock over the vegetables. Add the chicken base. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce to low heat. Add the water. Simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the cornstarch mixture. Serve hot.
Combine chili powder, cumin, and crushed red pepper flakes. Rub on both sides of steak. Place in slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients. Stir well. Cover and cook on low heat setting for 8-9 hours.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Boil potatoes until done. Mash potatoes with butter and molasses. Add salt to taste. Serve.
Prepare rice according to directions on package. Drain soup and reserve juice. Add rice and juice and cook until rice is done. Add onion soup, butter, chestnuts and peas. Heat and serve.

Remove the peel from the peach. Cut the peach in half and remove the pit. Cut the peach into small chunks. Combine peach chunks with Dijon mustard and balsamic vinegar in a small bowl. Transfer the peach mixture into a large Ziploc freezer bag and add the chicken. Close the bag and turn the chicken a few times to coat. Marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or overnight. Heat the grill and brush the grate with olive oil. Grill the chicken for about 4 minutes on each side. Serve with the leftover marinade drizzled over the chicken.

In a heavy bottom saucepan add oil and garlic. Cook over medium heat until garlic is lightly browned. Add onions and saute until softened. Add potatoes and rice. Add broth and water. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes or until rice is cooked through. Stir in parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with a sprinkling of parmesan cheese.

Heat a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until it is softened. Add celery and cook another minute or two. Add zucchini and cook for about 5 minutes until it is tender. Add sugar, stirring constantly. Add tomatoes and water. Bring to a boil. Cover the pan and cook until zucchini is tender. Taste for seasonings. Remove from heat. Let stand for a minute or two. Serve in bowls garnished with fresh parsley.

Saute garlic and butter in a large skillet over low heat until butter is melted and garlic is golden brown. Add clams and white wine and cook over medium heat for about 4 minutes or until clams have opened. Remove clams from pan. Add half and half and stir until sauce is heated through and slightly thickened. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over linguini and sprinkle with parsley and parmesan cheese.
Combine ketchup, honey, onion and vinegar in a bowl. Mix well. Blend in remaining ingredients. Chill. Makes 1 cup. Serve with a side salad for a new twist on a classic dressing.

In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until creamy. Add cheddar cheese and beat until just blended. Add the taco seasoning and beat until smooth. In a medium bowl, mix together the sour cream and eggs. Stir into the cream cheese mixture and mix well. Pour into a greased and floured 9 inch springform pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for 1 hour. Cool completely. Sprinkle with chopped chilies and red bell pepper. Spoon guacamole over the top of the cake. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with salsa.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Spray a baking sheet with the cooking spray. In a small bowl, whisk the lemon juice, molasses, Worcestershire sauce and garlic together until blended. Place the thighs on the baking sheet and brush each with the sauce. Bake for 20 minutes or until the thighs are cooked through and golden brown. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cook chicken in boiling water for 15 minutes. Remove from water and cool. Chop chicken. Combine with celery. Add onion. Combine mayonnaise and lemon juice. Toss with chicken. Chill. Add cheese and pecans. Serve on lettuce leaves. Use potato chips for croutons.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, beat together buttermilk, vegetable oil, egg, vanilla and sugar until well blended. Sift together flour, cocoa, baking soda and saltstir into batter just until dry ingredients are moistened. Drop dough by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are firm and tops are set but not yet browned. Remove from oven, and cool for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Dust with confectioners sugar before serving.

Combine oranges, ice, water, milk, coffee creamer and sugar in blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into two tall glasses. Garnish with orange slices and/or whipped cream, if desired. Makes two 8-ounce servings.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook the onion until it is soft. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the string green beans and cook for 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes and tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Add the curry powder and sugar and mix well. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Coat a baking pan with cooking spray. Cut chops into 2 inch pieces. Heat oil over high heat in a large skilletbrown pork on both sides, 3 minutes per side. Add onion, garlic, mushrooms, chili flakes and sherry winecook 3 minutes. Pour over cream, parsley and salt and peppercook 5 minutes until sauce thickens. Pour over pork chopsbake 10 minutes.

Mix together sour cream, chili powder and salt until smooth. Slice chicken breast into strips. Spread sour cream mixture over chicken and sprinkle with garlic powder. Roll up chicken pieces. Wrap each roll in one slice of cheddar cheese and one slice of mozzarella cheese. Wrap rolls in plain doritos chips. Bake in 350 degree oven for 15 minutes or until chicken is done.

In a sauce pan saute bologna until browned on each side. Add oil and flour together until blended and cook about a minute or two. Slowly add milk and water, stirring until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour over bologna and serve.

Bring the stock to the boil and pour over the noodles and cook for 2 minutes or until al dente. Drain. Cut the chicken into strips and set aside. Heat a wok or large frying pan over high heat and add the oil and chicken until golden and cooked through. Remove the chicken and set aside. Add the capsicum and cook for 1 minute or until just softened. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds. Add the noodles and cook for a further minute before adding the sweet chilli sauce and stirring to combine. Add the chicken and stir through. Serve with coriander leaves to garnish and lime wedges to squeeze over.
Dice cucumber and tomatoes and place on pita bread. Grate feta cheese and place on top of vegetables. Drizzle with olive oil and serve.

Cut cactus in small pieces. Peel and dice tomato and white onion. Remove seeds and white pith from jalapeno. Chop cilantro. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a skillet and saute cactus and jalapeno for 5 minutes or until cactus is tender. Remove from heat and place in a bowl. Add remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to pan. Saute tomato and onion for 2-3 minutes or until onion is transparent. Add to cactus and jalapeno. Add cilantro and season with salt and pepper. Cook in a covered pan for 5 minutes or until mixture is thick. Spoon mixture over tortillas. Top with monterey jack. Roll up and serve.
Preheat your crockpot to low heat. Place pork roast in crockpot, then pour in apricot preserves. Now sprinkle in horseradish sauce. Top with chopped onion. Cover and cook for 8-9 hours.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Season salmon with lemon zest, dill and salt and pepper to taste. Wrap each fillet with a leek and secure with toothpicks. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium high heat. Add the salmon and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Transfer to oven and roast for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges and remaining oil for drizzling over the fish.

Soak unflavored gelatin in milk for 5 minutes. Add cream cheese and mix until smooth. Add yogurt and mix until smooth. Add fruit and mix until all is thoroughly blended. Refrigerate 3 hours or until set. Top with remaining milk or cream if desired. Makes 2 - 8 inch squares.

Soak the bread overnight in milk. Squeeze out the milk and then add sausage to the bread. Add onion. Mix well. In another bowl beat the egg and pour over the sausage mixture. Let stand for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, melt the margarine in a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Pour the sausage mixture into the pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

First prepare the crust by mixing the graham cracker crumbs and 2 tablespoons of melted butter together. Press the crumbs onto the bottom of a 9-inch pie dish. Chill for 30 minutes. Mash 2 bananas with a fork. Place the mashed bananas on the crust. Mix together the cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk. Add the lemon juice and the vanilla flavoring. Pour the mixture over the bananas. Arrange the sliced strawberries on top. Chill for at least 2 hours.

Mix mustard, honey, lemon juice, and salt in a large bowl, place halves in bowl, cover and marinate in the refrigerator at least 4 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). Mix together pecans, breadcrumbs, and butter in a medium bowl. Drain chicken halves and coat both sides with pecan mixture, pressing firmly to adhere to chicken. Place chicken in a single layer on a shallow baking sheet or cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until browned and cooked through, about 35 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a medium saucepan, combine chicken broth, stuffing cubes and onion. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 8-10 minutes or until stuffing is tender. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine apricot, jam and vinegar. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season pork with salt and pepper. Spread apricot mixture over pork roast. Spoon stuffing over apricot mixture. Roast pork in the preheated oven about 45 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted in center of roast reads at least 145 degrees f. Let roast stand about 5 minutes before slicing.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 12 cup muffin pan. Grate grapefruit rind into measuring cup. Combine 1/2 cup buttermilk, grapefruit rind, orange rind, sugar and salt in a large bowl. Beat in egg until well blended. Stir in butter. Sift flour, baking powder and baking soda together into measuring cup. Beat into batter just until moistened (batter may look lumpy). Fill muffin cups about 2/3 full. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan 5 minutes before removing.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Wash potato and pierce with a fork several times. Place potato directly on oven rack. Bake for 45 to 60 min. or until potato is fork tender. Slice potato lengthwise with a sharp knife. Place each potato half, skin side down, on a serving plate. Sprinkle with a generous portion of the sour cream mixture, followed by the cheese mixture. Garnish with crumbled bacon and the green onion tops.
