Cut lamb roast into 1/2 inch cubes. Combine lamb, oil, vegetable juice and curry powder in a large crockpot. Cook covered on low heat for 4 hours or until meat is tender and can be easily shredded with a fork. Stir in rice and carrots. Continue cooking for another hour or so until rice is cooked through. Serve with green pepper strips.

Mix the flour and water in a small bowl until smooth. Stir in the chicken broth, salt and pepper. Add the chicken and simmer uncovered for 1 hour or until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle the dumplings with the baking powder and stir in the milk. Drop the dumplings into the chicken broth and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes or until the dumplings are cooked through.

Dip the chicken breasts in the dressing (both sides). Set on wire rack on cookie sheet. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees. While the chicken is cooking, saut onion, sliced mushrooms, red pepper and tomatoes in olive oil. When the chicken is done, put the vegetables over the top of the chicken. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and put back in oven for 2-3 minutes until the cheese is bubbly.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add sausage and saute until evenly browned. Stir in fruit chutney and curry powder. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Unroll puff pastry on a lightly floured surface. Place one-fourth of the sausage mixture in a long strip down the center of the puff pastry. Fold the sides over the sausage, and press with a fork to seal. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Serve with ketchup.

In a heavy soup pot, saute the onion and garlic in the oil until softened. Add the bay leaf, broccoli, stock and wine. Simmer until the broccoli is crisp-tender. Add the water. Stir in the sunflower seeds. Simmer until the soup is creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Season steaks with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add 1 tbsp oil and half of garlic. Cook until fragrant and garlic is lightly browned about 1 minute. Add steaks and sear on both sides until browned and crusty 4 minutes total. Turn steaks over and transfer skillet to oven. Bake until steaks are medium rare 3-4 minutes. Transfer steaks to plates and cover with foil to keep warm. Add mushrooms and remaining 1 tbsp oil and 1 tsp garlic to skillet and saute until tender 2-3 minutes. Stir in flour and saute 1 minute. Stir in wine and broth and bring to boil over medium-high heat until sauce has thickened. Season with rosemary and remove from heat. Slice steaks and arrange on serving plates. Top steaks with Marsala sauce and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Mix ground beef with onions and teriyaki sauce. Form into 1-inch meatballs. Mix 1 egg with 1 tablespoon water. Dip each ball in egg wash and roll in bread crumbs to coat evenly. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Mix together graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press crumb mixture onto bottom of 9 x 13 pan. Mix together instant pudding and milk. Spread over crust. Cover with whipped topping. Refrigerate until set. To make frosting: Mix together powdered sugar, milk, and cocoa. Spread over top of torte. Sprinkle with coconut. Cut into squares.

Prepare cake as directed on box. Bake in 9 by 13 pan. Crush 20 club crackers. Combine them with melted butter. Press over baked cake. In a small saucepan combine the milk and cool whip. Stir over low heat until melted. Cut chocolate squares into squares. Stir into mixture. Spread over cake. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Let set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Prick yams with a fork and place yams on baking sheet. Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until yams are very soft to the touch. In a small bowl combine honey and ginger. Remove yams from oven and brush with the honey ginger mixture. Bake for another 30 minutes. Serve hot.

In a food processor, pulse blackberries until smooth. Set aside. In the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade, pulse almond meal with flour, salt and sugar until combined. Add butter pieces in batches and pulse until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add honey and pulse until dough just comes together. Dump dough onto a clean work surface. Gather into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350F. Roll out dough on a floured work surface to a 14-inch circle. Place in a tart pan with removable bottom. Trim edges. Press dough into pan and flute edges. Cover with parchment paper. Fill with blackberry mixture. Bake until golden, about 40-45 minutes. Let tart cool completely. Whip heavy cream until soft peaks form. Add honey and vanilla extract. Whip until firm peaks form. Spoon over tart. Let sit at room temperature at least 1 hour before serving. Store leftovers in refrigerator

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook carrots until just tender. Drain well. In a food processor or blender, puree carrots until smooth. Add remaining ingredients and process until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm. Makes 3-4 servings.

Beat butter until creamy. Add graham cracker crumbs and spices until well mixed. Press into a greased pie pan and bake at 350 for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from the oven and let cool. Beat the cream cheese until smooth and creamy. Add the pudding and milk and beat until just combined. Pour the mixture over the crust and refrigerate at least one hour or until set. Serve with low-fat whipped cream and additional nutmeg if desired.
Melt sugar, corn syrup and peanut butter in a pot over low heat. Stir in Rice Krispies. Spread mixture on wax paper and cut into shapes. Cool.

Combine first six ingredients in a small bowlrub over chickencoat lightly with cooking spray. Place chicken on a grill rack coated with cooking spraygrill 6 minutes on each side or until done. Cut into strips. Combine salsa and beans in a large bowltoss with chicken. Makes 4 servings.

Combine cake mix and canola oil in a bowl. Add eggs. Mix until smooth. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop batter by teaspoon on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Let cool for 2 minutes on baking sheet. Remove to wire rack to cool completely. Makes 2 dozen.

In a small bowl, combine shallots and wine. Cook in a small pan over medium heat until wine is reduced to a syrup. Add parmesan and mix until cheese is incorporated. Remove from heat. Combine breadcrumbs and parmesan mixture and set aside. In another small bowl, whisk together egg and water. Dip each cutlet in the egg mixture, then in the breadcrumb mixture. Shallow fry cutlets in a skillet over medium heat until crisp and cooked through. Serve immediately.

In a small sauce pan, combine the coconut milk and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook for 10 minutes. Allow to cool. In a large bowl combine jell-o with ice water. Stir until jell-o is dissolved. Add the coconut mixture and whipped topping. Fold in mango and bananas. Pour into 8″x8″ pan. Refrigerate until firm. Garnish with toasted coconut.

In a large skillet cook bacon until crisp. Drain and crumble. Meanwhile cook pasta in boiling water 4 minutes. Drain. In a bowl whisk together egg yolks and parsley. Add crumbled bacon and toss. Drain pasta and add to egg mixture. Toss well. Add Italian herb seasoning and pepper. Toss. Top with cheese. Serves 4.

Heat butter in a large skillet. Add chicken pieces. Brown chicken for 1 to 2 minutes. Add wine, maple syrup, salt and pepper. Reduce heat. Cover skillet and simmer 8 to 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Makes 4 servings.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside. Add peppers and onions to skillet and cook until tender. Add garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in lemon juice and zest. Add cooked chicken and heat through. Sprinkle with lemon pepper.
Spoon ice cream into crust. Stir lemonade concentrate into tequila and triple sec. Pour over ice cream. Garnish with graham cracker crumbs and whipped cream. Chill until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook sausage and green pepper in a skillet over medium heat until browned. Remove from heat and set aside. In a large bowl beat together eggs and milk. Add sausage, green pepper and hash browns to mixture. Add salt and cheese. Pour mixture into 9x13 glass dish. Bake uncovered for 35 minutes or until eggs are set. Let sit for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.

Mix flour and italian dressing. Dip tilapia in the mixture and saute in olive or vegetable oil. Add chicken broth and lemon juice. Simmer until sauce thickens. Add cream cheese and parsley. Cook until cheese melts. Serve over tilapia.

In a small skillet melt butter. Stir in sugar. Stir in almonds. Transfer to a small bowllet stand until cool. In a large bowl toss lettuce with mayonnaise. Fold in strawberriestop with almonds. Refrigerate until ready to serve. To serve, drizzle salad with vinegartop with dressing. Sprinkle with poppy seeds.

Preheat oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. Wash mushrooms and pat dry. Place mushrooms in a greased baking dish. In a medium bowl combine the butter, cream cheese, mustard powder and smoked salmon. Spoon into mushrooms. Bake for 10 minutes. Top each mushroom with a teaspoon of chopped chives.

Cut the pork roast into large chunks. Put the pork in a crock pot along with the sage and the water. Add the sweet onion and the apple and cover the crock pot and cook for 6-8 hours on high. In the last hour of cooking add the cranberries and the apple juice. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. On each crust, spread 1/2 cup pizza sauce and sprinkle with 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese and 1/3 cup monterey jack cheese. Top each crust with sliced mushrooms, sliced chicken breast and avocado. Bake for 12-14 minutes until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of oil. Add the onion and saute until golden brown. Add the zucchini and cook for another 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 10 minutes. Stir in the red pepper flakes and season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 2 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cream butter with sugar until fluffy. Beat in orange rind and vanilla. Add flour, baking powder and saltstir until well blended. Stir in dried cranberries. Roll into small balls. Roll balls in coconut. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Cool before storing. Makes about 4 dozen.

Spray pizza pan with nonstick cooking spray. Place crust in pan. Spread pizza sauce evenly over crust. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with italian cheese blend. Sprinkle with pepperoni. Layer with vegetables. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 375 for 18 minutes or until crust is crisp and cheese is melted.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil, add garlic and cook until it turns golden brown add the chicken and cook for a few minutes until both sides are golden brown add the red chilies and season with cracked pepper and salt cook for a few minutes until the chicken is done add the tomato purée and cook for a few minutes until the sauce thickens sprinkle with fresh basil and chives and serve with penne.

In a large frying pan, brown the ham in a butter and a little of the liquid from the mushrooms. Add onion and mushrooms and continue to cook for about 5 minutes. Add soup and cook for about 5 minutes or so. Add sour cream and mix well. Cook for a few more minutes. Add flour and cook until mixture thickens slightly and begins to boil. Add egg noodles and cook for 2 minutes or so or until heated through. Serve with a sprinkling of paprika on top. Serves 4 to 6.
Soak beans overnight. Drain. Combine with remaining ingredients in slow cooker. Cook covered for 7-8 hours on low. Serve with crackers and cheese.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease a baking dish large enough to hold all the pork and the vegetables. Layer the sweet potatoes and pears into the baking dish. Season with garlic salt and black pepper. In a small bowl combine the sage and olive oil. Brush the pork tenderloin all over with the herb and olive oil. Place the pork tenderloin on top of the vegetables. Bake the pork in the oven for 20 to 30 minutes. Let rest for 5 minutes. Serve the tenderloin and vegetables.

Preheat oven to 425. Place biscuits in a lightly greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish and brush with italian dressing. Bake for 10 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with cheeses and seeds. Bake for an additional 2 minutes or until cheese is melted and edges are golden brown. Serve warm.

Melt butter in skillet over low heat. Sprinkle in flour and cook for one minute until lightly browned. Gradually stir in heavy cream, salt and pepper to taste. Stir in sherry wine. Bring to a simmer. Stir in crabmeat. Continue to simmer for one minute until heated through. Top with cheddar cheese. Melt cheese under broiler until bubbly. Serve immediately.
Pour coffee into mug. Add molasses and rum. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with nutmeg.

Pour beer in a large pot and bring to a boil. Turn the heat down to low and add garlic powder, oregano and cumin. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Then add refried beans and salsa and stir. Taste and season with additional salt if necessary. Add Velveeta cheese and stir. When melted through, remove from heat and serve with tortilla chips. Garnish with fresh cilantro if desired.

Cook the tortellini according to the package directions. Drain. Rinse with cold water and drain well. In a large bowl combine the cooked tortellini, the broccoli florets and the roasted red peppers. In a small bowl whisk together the vinaigrette and the havarti cheese. Pour over the salad. Toss to coat. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease two 9 x 5 loaf pans or 4 mini loaf pans. Cream together white cake mix, flour, orange rind and egg whites until well combined. Add water, orange juice and applesauce. Beat for 2 minutes. Stir in cranberries. Spread batter into pans. Bake 30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Mix 3/4 cup white chocolate chips and 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon. Spread over top of cake. Let cool completely. Makes 4 loaves.

In a large saucepan cook elbow macaroni in salted boiling water until tender but firm to bite, about 8 minutesdrain. In a large skillet cook onion in butter until golden about 10 minutesadd hot dogscook and stir until heated through about 5 minutes. Stir in macaroni and cook until heated through about 5 minutes. Toss with salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings.
Place all ingredients in a food processor or blender and pulse until smooth. Serve with crackers or veggies.

Spread margarine in 10x10 baking dish. Saute onion, mushroom pieces, green pepper & celery in margarine until tender. Sprinkle with parsley and tomato paste. Stir in pizza sauce, cheese & pepper. Bake 30 minutes at 350f in 10x10 baking dish. Serve with tortilla chips or pita bread.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine lemon juice, molasses and worcestershire sauce in small bowl and pour into large zip top bag or casserole dish. Place thighs in bag or dish and seal bag or cover with foil. Bake 40 minutes. Meanwhile combine garlic and cooking spray and coat chicken well. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and place back in oven uncovered and bake 30 more minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with more salt and pepper and serve with lemon wedge.

In a large bowl combine flour and baking powder. Set aside. In another bowl combine egg beaters, cinnamon and salt. Add skim milk and applesaucestir well. Add to flour mixture just until moistened. Do not over mix. Grease waffle iron and cook waffles according to manufacturer s directions. Serve hot with whipped cream and fruit if desired.

Cut ham into small pieces. Saute ham in butter until crisp. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Add pepper, onion, salt and pepper, if desired. Beat eggs with milk and pour into skillet. Cook until eggs are set. Sprinkle with cheese.

Boil potatoes until fork tender. Meanwhile in frying pan, fry turkey bacon. Remove bacon to a plate. Add onions and cook until onions are translucent. Add eggs and cook until cooked through. Remove from frying pan. Add potatoes to bacon and onion mixture and season with salt and pepper. Fold the bacon and onion mixture into the eggs. Add bacon and onions to eggs and mix. Garnish with sour cream or ketchup. Serve hot. Serves 2.

In a small saucepan over medium heat whisk together milk and neufchatel cheese. Heat until the cheese is melted. Stir in the dried chives. Add garlic powder and lemon juice. Stir until well combined. Serve over the noodles.

Combine the tea, rum, pineapple juice, liqueur, lime juice and lemon juice with the simple syrup in a large pitcher. Add the bitters and ice cubes. Serve over crushed ice in a punchbowl. Garnish each serving with an apricot slice.

Prepare the pasta as directed. Drain. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the yellow pepper and asparagus spear. Saut for 5 minutes. Add the shrimp and saut for an additional 5 minutes or until the shrimp are pink. Remove the shrimp from the skillet. Add the green onions to the skillet. Saut for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add the pasta. Add the shrimp and lemon zest. Toss. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve.
Place the ground turkey in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the turkey and add the rice. Cook until the liquid is absorbed. Add the remaining ingredients and serve.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add fettuccine and cook until al dente, about 12 minutes. Drain and set aside. While fettuccine is cooking, brown the bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crispy. Using a slotted spoon, transfer bacon to a paper towel-lined plate. Add the chicken to the bacon fat and saute until browned on all sides, 6 to 7 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate. Add the chicken broth to the skillet. Whisk in the alfredo sauce, spinach, bacon bits and Italian seasoning. Cook until the sauce thickens slightly. Return the chicken to the skillet. Toss with the fettuccine until well coated. Divide between two large bowls. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Makes 2 servings.

Mix spices together in a small bowl and set aside. Heat oil in skillet over high heat until oil is hot and just smoking. Dip each chicken breast in spice mixture and place in skillet, one at a time. Turn each breast and cook on each side for about 4-5 minutes. Check with an instant read thermometer to make sure chicken is cooked to an internal temperature of at least 175-degrees f. Remove chicken from skillet and place on serving platter or plates. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and serve with rice and veggies of your choice.

Mix together ground pork and cooked wild rice. Add the remaining ingredients except for the egg and bread crumbs. Mix well. Shape into a loaf shape and place on a baking sheet. Beat egg and brush over pork loaf. Bake at 350 for an hour. Top with bread crumbs and bake another 15 minutes or until bread crumbs are lightly brown and pork loaf is done. Let rest for ten minutes before cutting and serving.

In a bowl combine cream cheese and stilton cheese until smooth. Add eggs one at a time and mix well after each addition. Add sugar and mix well. In another bowl combine sour cream and dry vermouth and mix well. Add this to the cream cheese mixture and mix well. Pour into a graham cracker or ginger snap crust and cook at 180C for about an hour or until the cheese is set. Refrigerate and serve with fresh fruit and ginger snaps.

Heat a medium saut pan over medium-high heat and add 2 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons of olive oil. When it is hot add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes on each side or until done. Remove shrimp from the pan and add the remaining butter and oil and add the lemon juice, worcestershire sauce and cajun and old bay seasonings and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the hot pepper sauce and pepper to taste and add the shrimp and toss in the pan and serve on top of rice or pasta.

Cook the beans in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain. Rinse with cold water. Drain again. Toss the spinach in the dressing. Add the beans, bell peppers, garlic powder and pepper. Add the cheese. Mix well. Serve immediately.

In small bowl combine soy sauce, olive oil, honey, garlic cloves, fresh rosemary, salt and coarse black pepper. Brush over both sides of flank steaks. Grill for 5 minutes on each side for medium. Let stand 5 minutes. Slice across grain. Serve with sliced roasted potatoes. Serves 4.

In a large bowl stir together the cereals, pretzels, peanuts and M&M'S candies. In a microwave-safe bowl melt white chocolate chips and oil uncovered on high for 1 minute. Stir until smooth. Add white chocolate mixture to cereal mixturestir to coat evenly. Spread onto wax paper to cool. Once cooled break up the mixture into clumps the size of a golf ball and place on wax paper. Makes about 24 treats.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Slice in half lengthwise. Add to sour cream and cheddar cheese. Mix. Stir in bacon bits and green onions. Serve warm.

Mix the butter with the sugar and the salt until creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla and mix well. Combine the flour and baking powder in another bowl and mix well. Add to the butter mixture alternately with the buttermilk. Fold in the blueberries. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 degrees Fahrenheit for 20 to 25 minutes or until the muffins are well risen and golden. Cool on wire racks.

Heat oil in large saucepan and fry onion for 5-7 minutes. Add curry paste and fry for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and 600ml water. Bring to the boil and simmer for 15 minutes. Add chicken and cook for 25-30 minutes or until tender. Stir in spinach and cook for a further 2-3 minutes. Spoon onto serving plates and sprinkle with coriander leaves. Serve with plain yogurt and rice or noodles.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, about 8 minutesdrain well. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat the oil until shimmering. Add the shrimp in a single layer and cook until opaque, about 3 minutesremove from the heat. Add the basil and capers and toss well with the pastaseason with salt. Add the spinach and tosstransfer the pasta to a serving platterdrizzle with the lemon juiceserve immediately.

Brown beef with onion and drain. Add olives. In a large mixing bowl combine the beef mixture with the soup and 1-1/2 cups cheese. Stir in the whole kernel corn. Transfer to a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Mix the noodles and remaining cheese in a separate bowl. Spoon on top of the beef mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Combine the cherries, sugar, flour, and cinnamon. Pour into a pie dish. Roll out the pastry. Crimp the edges together. Brush the top of the pastry with the beaten egg. Cut several slits into the top of the pastry to allow steam to escape. Bake for 30 minutes. Lower the heat to 350 degrees. Continue baking until the crust is golden brown, another 40 to 50 minutes. Cool before cutting.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Grease 2 loaf pans or spray with cooking spray. In a mixing bowl combine 1 cup squash (grated), 1 cup pecans (chopped), 2 teaspoons cinnamon, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir well. In another mixing bowl combine 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 2 teaspoons cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon salt. In another mixing bowl combine 2/3 cup vegetable oil, 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 2 eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir well. Make a well in center of flour mixture and add wet ingredients. Stir to combine. Stir squash mixture into wet mixture. Fold in remaining
In a blender or food processor place avocado, sour cream, hot sauce, imitation bacon bits, lemon juice, onion powder. Cover. Blend until smooth. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with crackers.

Blend the buttermilk, sour cream and salt in a food processor. Heat the buttermilk mixture in a saucepan over medium heat until it begins to simmer. Add the cayenne pepper and the masala. Heat for 2 minutes. Stir in the vegetables and cook for 2 minutes more. Serve in soup bowls.

For sauce combine all ingredients in food processor or blender until smooth and creamy. For each serving: thread 6 to 8 pineapple slices onto skewer. Alternate 2 to 3 pineapple slices with 4 to 5 shrimp. Brush with pineapple-mint sauce. Grill for 2 minutes or until pineapple is tender. Turn and grill 2 minutes more or until shrimp are cooked through and pineapple is slightly caramelized. Serve with rice or pasta.

Heat oil in frying pan. Coat both sides of chicken breast fillets with plain flour. Add to pan and fry until cooked. Remove chicken from pan and keep warm. Increase heat in pan to medium and add the garlic and thyme. Cook for 2 minutes. Add sherry and cook until reduced to a syrup. Remove from heat and add cream. Stir well and return to heat until sauce is thick and smooth. Pour sauce over chicken and serve immediately.
Combine beans, diced tomatoes, lime juice and cilantro in medium bowl. Gently mix together. Top with mexican cheese blend. Serve with chips. Garnish with more lime.

Preheat oven to 350. Combine applesauce, vanilla, egg whites, and sugar in a medium bowl. Mix until smooth. Sift flour, baking powder, cocoa powder, and espresso powder into a large bowl. Stir in the dry ingredients into the applesauce mixture. Divide batter evenly among 12 (1/2-cup) paper-lined muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with crumbs. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Remove from pan. Top with miniature semisweet chocolate chips.

In a large punch bowl or pitcher combine the water and sugar and stir until sugar dissolves. Add the pineapple juice and mix well. Add the orange and lemonade concentrates and mix well. Add the almond extract and mix well. Serve over ice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. In a medium bowl, beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla and flour mixture until combined. Cover and refrigerate the dough for 1 hour. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough 1/4 inch thick. Cut into desired shapes with a cookie cutter. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven, and while warm press a Hershey Chocolate Kiss into the center of each cookie. Let cool on wire racks.

Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add bacon and cook for 3 minutes. Add green onions, snow peas and garlic. Cook and stir 2 minutes. Add prawns and cook and stir 2 minutes. Stir in rice and soy sauce. Cook and stir until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat griddle to 350 degrees. In a bowl, combine dry mix, milk and sugar substitute. Beat until smooth. Fold in lemon juice and baking powder. Pour onto hot griddle in small 4-inch rounds. Flip when top is dry. Serve with syrup.

Hard boil eggs. Peel and cut in half. Remove yolks to a small bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Spoon the filling back into the egg whites. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve immediately or refrigerate. Makes 12 servings.
Combine first five ingredients in large bowl. Fold in ham and pineapple. Serve with crackers or bread cubes. Makes appetizer for 25.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Brown turkey in butter in ovenproof skillet. Add orange pieces and stir. Add cranberry sauce and stir. Add ground cloves, sugar and mix. Bake in oven for 30 minutes or until turkey is no longer pink inside. Serve hot.

Melt butter in skillet. Add green beans and garam masala and salt to taste and cook for a few minutes until beans are soft. Add tomatoes and cook for a further few minutes until tomatoes are mushy. Serve hot or cold.

In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes. Add the chicken and saute for 2 more minutes. Add the cumin and cook for another minute or two. Add the beer and simmer for about 5 minutes. Add the water and simmer for another minute or two. Add the onions and tomatoes. Simmer for a few more minutes. Serve over rice.

Cut eggplant in 1-inch rounds. Brush both sides of eggplant slices with olive oil. Place in a single layer on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Place in 8-inch square baking dish. Layer with sliced tomatoes. Sprinkle with seasoning. In a frying pan saute onion and mushrooms in olive oil for 5 minutes or until onion is translucent. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with eggplant tomato mixture.

Combine pineapple with juice in large bowl. Stir in carrot, celery, pear, raisins and yogurt. Stir in peanut butter until blended. Refrigerate. Just before serving, stir in ginger. Serve chilled or at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and orange zest. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and saltstir into the butter mixture until just combined. Stir in cranberries and chocolate chips. Drop the dough by the teaspoonful 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheets.Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Allow cookies to cool 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Bring chicken broth to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium high heat. Combine the cornmeal and water and add it to the boiling chicken broth and stir until a smooth paste forms. Turn off the heat and let the mixture cool to room temperature. Cut the pork into thin pieces and place the pieces in the bowl of a food processor along with the pepper and thyme. Pulse until finely ground. Add the cornmeal mixture and pulse until smooth. Transfer the scrapple mixture to a large bowl and mix in the all-purpose flour and salt. Heat the oil in a heavy skillet over medium high heat. Drop the scrapple mixture by rounded tablespoons into the hot oil and cook until browned and crispy on one side, about 2 minutes. Turn the scrapple and cook until the other side is browned, about another 2 minutes. Transfer the scrapple to paper towels to drain. Serve with a few drops of hot sauce, if desired, and mustard on the side.

In a medium size skillet melt butter over medium heat. Add squash and corn to skillet. Saut for about 10 minutes or until squash is lightly browned but not mushy and corn is soft. Season with salt and pepper. Serve at once.

Beat the egg white with the salt until frothy. Add the pecans and toss to coat evenly. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and cinnamon. Add the mixture to the coated nuts and toss to coat evenly. Spread the nuts in a single layer onto a large baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes, or until crisp. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. In a bowl combine asparagus and olive oil. Season asparagus with salt and pepper to taste. Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper (or foil sprayed with nonstick cooking spray). Roast for 20 minutes or until asparagus is tender. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over asparagus and sprinkle with chives. Serve immediately.

Heat the golden syrup and brown sugar together in a medium saucepan until the sugar has dissolved. In a bowl, whisk together the butter, flour and water. Stir in the golden syrup mixture. Drop the dough by spoonfuls onto a lightly oiled baking sheet. Bake in a preheated oven at 350f until golden brown.

Cook pasta shells according to package directionsdrain and set aside. In a large non-stick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until hot. Add shrimp and saute until pinkabout 2 minutes on each side. Add artichoke hearts, caesar dressing and peascook until hot. Stir in carrotsremove from heat. Stir in shellstoss gently to combinesprinkle with parsleyserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Brown turkey with onion until done. Stir in soup, mushrooms and black pepper. Mix well. Spread onto baking dish and top with melted mozzarella cheese. Bake 10 minutes until cheese is melted. In the meantime bring 2 quarts water to boil in large stock pot. Add salt to taste. Cook pasta until done. Drain well. Add to stroganoff mixture. Garnish with nonfat sour cream and parsley. Serve immediately.

Cut off the stems of the mushrooms and dice the stems into very small pieces. Place the mushroom pieces into a medium size bowl and add the onion pieces. Place the chopped bacon into a small skillet over medium heat. Fry the bacon, stirring frequently, until the bacon is completely crisp. Drain the bacon onto a paper towel lined plate and set aside for later use. Remove the skillet from the heat. Add the hot pepper sauce into the bacon drippings and stir well. Remove the bacon drippings and place into a small bowl, set aside for later use. Combine the cream cheese and mushrooms into the skillet containing the hot pepper sauce. Stir well and cook over medium heat for about five minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Remove the skillet from the heat and add the bacon pieces into the skillet. Stir well and set aside for later use. Roll out the crescent roll dough into a rectangle that is about 12 inches long by 10 inches wide. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly across the dough. Sprinkle the

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In the bowl of an electric mixer, cream together the butter, brown sugar, egg, vanilla extract and almond extract. In a medium bowl, mix together the pastry flour, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl, combine the buckwheat groats and watermicrowave the mixture for 4 minutes. Stir in the vanilla extract. Stir the buckwheat mixture into the butter mixture. Scoop the dough out by the tablespoonfulroll into balls and place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Melt the chocolate chips and shortening togetherdrizzle over the cookies and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a medium bowl, combine flour and salt. Beat butter and milk until creamy. Add to flour mixture. Stir until smooth. In a 12x12 baking pan, lay french fries. Pour ketchup over. Pour milk mixture over. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is golden brown. Serve immediately.

Peel potatoes and cut into halves. Boil for 5 minutes. Add sausages and boil for a further 5 minutes. Add onions and boil until onions are translucent. Add plain flour and beef stock and cook until well combined. Add green apples and boil until tender. Mash with butter and milk. Serve with sausages.
